text: Tasty but price. Not a cheap meal, but I did eat there twice in one day. I might stop by one more time before I leave Vegas.

wow what a little gem hidden in the mall. I do wish the lobster meat was served warm but it was still alot of meat and tasted fabulous. After a late night of drinking and dancing this will fix you right up!
Soooooo amazing. Lobster grilled cheese is awesome, tacos to die for and lobster Mary's are the best!!!

Just a quick observation by someone who does enjoy lobster and also someone who has some difficulty spending $50 on a lunch for two in a food court atmosphere. Yes it's lobster but just consider that the lobster rolls contains claw meat, not the premium tail meat that we are all familiar with and enjoy and the medium sandwich is relatively small and did not meet our expectations, my suggestion, go to Costco and buy a couple nice tails, a couple nice steaks, have a nice meal.

Say the word lobster and I'm sold! Lobster Me you had me at Lobster ice cream...I know it sounds kinda weird that lobster can be mixed with ice cream but the crazy part is that it tasted pretty good.   My cousins and I were walking the mall and I noticed the words Lobster ice cream free sample. So hey why not take a crazy chance and try something different. We ended up ordering it and we all shared. Of course it was $8.50 for a small ice cream but it was worth the try.   The second time I came was to try the food; my bf and I decided to get the Lobster Mac n Cheese and the Lobster Bisque. Yum! The Lobster Mac n Cheese was not bad it could use a little bit more sauce. The Lobster Bisque was delicious especially in a bread bowl.   I definitely want to come back here and try everything! Especially the lobster shooters, yes I said lobster shooters with Vodka!

Went there for lunch today. Expensive for what you get. I ordered the lobster and chips, there was only 4 extremely small lobster bites and a small handful of fries. The taste was good but for 14$, are you kidding me! My husband got the original lobster roll, they cut a small slice in the roll and put a small amount of lobster in it. So you get a mouthful of mostly bread. Don't think we will ever eat there again.
Just discovered this place on last Vegas trip. SO wish there was one in Philadelphia!!

Don't believe the pictures they have on the walls, actual lobster roll is much smaller than advertised. That being said, it wasn't horrible. Not a good deal for those from New England, but anyone will enjoy these!
Just become my favor sandwich here. I love lobsters. Although the portion is a bit small, but it's full of well cooked lobsters.

My husband and I were catching a show at the V Theater and decided to visit this eatery. I'd say it's higher end fast food -- you order at the counter and the food is delivered to your table. It's more expensive then your usual fast food but is much cheaper than a sit down restaurant on the Strip. I had a lobster roll for about $13 and a Lobster Mary for $14. We shared a lobster bisque for $9.   The lobster roll was so so, the bread seemed like a folded piece of Texas toast rather than an actual roll. The lobster meat also didn't have a lot of flavor. The Lobster Mary was fun because it's served with a piece of claw meat as garnish. The lobster bisque was blah. It was too salty and oily for my taste. If you don't want to spend $50 per person on your meal in Vegas, this is an okay place but just know the food quality is not that great.

First of all the lobster rolls are great here. Today at the recommendation of karina - I think that's her name I tried the one that is warm with old bay seasoning.  Yum!!! I can also honestly say that this young lady also gave some of the best customer service that I've experienced in Vegas. That girl "gets it" and is going places!!
Meh.  I didn't see what the hoopla is all about.  They say there's a pound of lobster in each roll; not sure what measurement scale they're using.   It was nothing to write home about.

Disgusted by the service and food. The Lobster Bisque had a hair in it and the manager said "none of our workers have hair that long" He refused to give me my money back or even an apology. I wanted to punch him so bad. His name is Dan. Take you appetite and money elsewhere. I've never been so furious in my life. Just typing this review makes my stomach turn.

Pleasantly surprise. While fast food seafood conjures a certain amount skepticism, the food here is of decent quality. Staff was welcoming and informative for 1st timers. Great flavor for a snack while shopping. Needs more tables and floor mopped more often. Will visit again.
Got the Connecticut. Smaller than what I expected. Tasteful but not worth $17. If I was really craving lobster and this was around, I would eat here again.

I was so excited to try my first lobster roll. Unfortunately I was underwhelmed. The lobster meat was fresh an plentiful but dry, definitely needed more mayo. The bread roll and fries were great. The prices were steep.
The lobster on a stick is great. Might as well try both grilled and fried. The service has been great every time I have gone. Sometimes they have specials if you check in. Just ask.

Got the Lobster ME Signature Roll and the Maryland Blue Crab (lettuce wrapped).   Lobster ME Signature Roll The bread they use is excellent for the lobster but there was a great lack of care when it came to how they cut the roll.  It was cut at a diagonal and nowhere near down the center.  Having the roll cut at a diagonal meant way too little lobster for the amount paid.  The table next to us in the open seating area had the same roll, but appeared to have a better hand dealt to them in terms of amount of lobster in the roll.  I've had about 15 different lobster po-boys in my life and this place takes last (in terms of price and amount of lobster).  Maryland Blue Crab  The mixture (similar to a tuna salad mix), was decent.  The Blue Crab was definitely present in the mix, but it has a strong fishy smell you get when crab has sat  for a while.   We came here after going to Jaburrito the night before and used the 10% off coupon they gave us.   Jaburrito was excellent compared to Lobster Me (different type of food but I'd expect the same quality as Jaburrito).
Delicious...the lobsicle is delicious and so is the lobster bisque soup.. the most delicious meal u have  eaten.

The taste of the food is awesome, and the prices are a little steep, but you are eating "Lobster" and you are in the "Venetian Hotel" so eat here if you want to not have to. Seating are limited but there's plenty as long as its not packed here.

Fantastic Lobster melts. This place was very busy. They could use more seating. Prices were very reasonable. Great Yelp check in offers. Had Lobster bisque very bland. Not much flavor. I also tried the chowder fries and loved them. My meal reminded me of down home comfort food. Besides my bisque everything had great flavor and fresh tasting. Thanks for a quick meal without the fast food feel, while walking the strip.

The classic lobster roll will set you back 17 dollars. There is no claw meat on the top as the photos show. I'm a big fan of lobster rolls and have had my share. The best is still at the Lobster Roll (Lunch) out in Amagansett, NY. Here the toasted roll is just barely brushed with mayo, there's some Old Bay seasoning and the lobster. The lobster itself was good, not great.They serve it with cole slaw on the side which it added to the roll. It needed something more with some crunch and the cole slaw helped. They really need to punch up their lobster roll, it's pretty bland. Fries were very good and the chowder was also good. It's going to set you back some bucks, but it was just ok.

Ok so the CT lobster roll turned out to be pretty good, but we sure waited ages for it. Probably better for how starved we were! They forgot to give us a number with our order, we asked them, they said it wouldn't be a problem, they'd call our name. So we watched them like hawks. Then when the huge group of drunk guys who'd come in after us got their food, we asked and they produced said roll, saying they'd called our name several times. Trust me, I was watching and they never called a name. Food was tasty but the fried lobster thing isn't worth it at all - it tasted like old oil in the fryer at the end of the day. If you're dying for lobster, check it out, but not the best service.
I LOVE this spot, food is amazing and service is nice. A must stop if you're in Vegas looking for a great eat

Went there tonight for dinner, ordered the traditional lobster roll which ran me $23, was filled with tasty lobster meat, my very first one so have nothing to compare it to, enjoyed it but it was kind of pricey, this place is located in the Miracle Mile Shops next to Planet Hollywood Casino, which is a pretty cool mall as malls go.
Lobster grilled cheese sandwich delicious.  The lobster and shrimp ceviche excellent with big chunks of lobster.  Yum

There is really no other word to explain this place, it's AMAZING! I always get the lobster fries and lobster grilled cheese and its like heaven! It's very flavorful! I was hesitant upon trying, now I make it a point to go after a few drinks from Fat Tuesday next door! Even the staff are nice and fast! You are missing out if you dont try!

The one in the miracle mile is better. A lobster Mary here is crushed ice filled to the top with a little bit of vodka and filled with tomato juice. It's disappointing because I live here and there is no bang for your buck. There used to be a lobster shooter which was a shot of vodka and lobster Mary which was excellent but without that this place is over priced and skimps every chance they can. Really suck because I used to love it.

In Miracle Mile, right next to Fat Tuesday.  Everything lobster. Great hangover food. Be daring and try the free lobster ice cream. It's surprisingly good.  Cost: ~$12-$25 depending what you get.  What's good: - lobster mac n cheese --- really heavy, and cheesy  - bread bowls looked delicious  No bueno: - lobster rolls were very good. filled with big pieces of lobster, but small.
Absolutely delicious! The lobster is actually fresh!!! The Cajun Fries are wonderful, too! Must try!

I absolutely love eating here. I come here whenever I'm at the Venetian. They have the most delicious lobster. It's a bit pricey, but it's sooo worth it. The seating is cramped near the register, but the bar to the left side of the stand is usually empty.
Yummy rolls.  Worth the $17?  Nope!! 1lb of lobster in every roll???  No freaking way!!

The menu looked really appealing and the prices seemed right for they type of food. The macaroni was pretty basic nothing special with a few pieces of diced lobster and the lobster roll was a joke. They should be ashamed the way they keep a smile when they serve you. So if you actually know what good food is i would stay away.

Service was 5 Star considering this is more of a take out kine joint.  I didn't expect such good service!  Staff was really friendly and helpful.  Their suggestions were right on!  The Lobster Roll Connecticut Style was good but kinda small for the price. (this is why I removed a star) Chowder Fries had me happily confused.  Who woulda thought of putting chowder on top of fries.  Tasted so darn good together!! The Lobsicle!!!  Let's just say Heaven on a Stick!!! Blueberry Lemonade was yummy but would be even better with blueberry chunks (just a suggestion)
10 stars service , good food and very clean place :) I love this place , clam chowder must try
The worst customer service i have ever encountered. The general manager Lucia is very unprofessional and clueless. I would really recommend to skip this location. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE.

The woman or young gal that was working at the cash register on Sunday evening was superb, excellent customer service. The food is fantastic. My only complaint is that they should have some green salsa for the lobster tacos. #LobsterMe rocks! Delicious, definitely will be back.

The service was great, food was even better. I had the shrimp roll, it was so juicy (shrimp) and bread was pretty good. I also had the lobster bisque which was excellent, My friend had the lobster roll which had huge piece of lobster meat. I tried it and it was really awesome. Will be back there for sure. You have to try the Lobster Ice Cream.

not worth the price for flash frozen meat. My friend and i work in the casino and wanted to try this out when we saw it open. -( Not a good idea because the food was not good, got the lobster roll and it was just meat on a roll, no flavor at all. yuck!

Craved lobster roll, and found this place in the Venetian food court. Place was packed; loud; and service was slow. But lobster roll was yummy. Buttery toasted roll housed lots of fresh-tasting lobster. Husband and I split lobster mac and cheese and a Connecticut roll and found them tasty. The lobster in the roll had a perfect texture too. Don't know whether it was the cheese sauce or the way it was heated that the lobster in that dish had a slightly less appetizing texture.  I enjoyed the lobster mac and cheese a great deal, and although I've had better, this was quite good for the $12 price tag. A good value for the money (and how often can you say that about an eatery in Las Vegas?)

I had the lobster grilled cheese and salt n vinegar fries. The grilled cheese is ok.  There is not enough "filling".  The outer 2 inches of the sandwich is all bread, the center where there is 'filling', is very good.  The fries had barely any seasoning. A light sprinkle of seasoning on top but 80% were just regular fries.  Overall disappointed.

When I get down to Miracle Mile, Lobster ME is my fave place to eat. If I'm not hungry yet, I'll even hang out at the mall longer until I know there's space in my belly. I've tried the lobster mac and cheese and the lobsicle, but it's truly the lobster roll that I come for. For under $20 bucks I leave full but not sickeningly stuffed. Expensive, especially for a counter in the mall, but it is fresh, made-to-order lobster in a Vegas tourist trap after all. Locals do get a 10% discount with ID. Go when you're hungry, as lobster doesn't travel well--although a cold lobster is just about better than any other sandwich anyway.

We had a Connecticut and an original Maine lobster roll.  Both were full of meat and sized about right.  Lobster bisque was good as were the fries.  Drink menus somewhat listed for Vegas, but it is somewhat of a fast food style restaurant. Took a little longer than I would have liked to get food, but I would definitely eat there again.

Would I pay for a lobster roll that's the size of a tiny chipmunk? YES.   Who knew you can have delicious $10 lobster rolls in a food court stand? A small sandwich, for sure, packed full of sweet and salty lobster, and guess what? I don't even like lobster. (crab legs for the win!) But this sandwich I love and I would eat it again in a heart beat (if I was rich).   Now as much as I promote their rolls (specially their Maine roll?) their lobster mac and cheese is left to be desired. Tasty and cheesy mac and cheese with the tiniest bits of lobster. It was kind of sad. Not worth the price. Go for the lobster roll instead.

I would give no stars if that was an option. Below average food. Tartar sauce in packages (ew) that don't open. Probably for the better. They don't have half of what is on the menu. Tables were dirty. Staff was not helpful and seemed to not really care. Save yourself and DON'T GO. You are better off with. McD's Filet O Fish...it's that bad.

I gave them 2 stars instead of 1 only because of their awesome customer service!! Other than that the food is super greasy and oily. Hubby ordered the lobster mac and cheese which was super bland and not much lobster on there , I got the lobster grilled cheese which is the best thing ordered and Cajun fries super duper oily.

Ended up gettin the Diablo....  Man ...!!!!!! It was bomb ,.... The chef told me to try Cajun style next time ,...  Lobster Mac n cheese was ok ,...   Cajun fries were to oily needed a more crisp to it ,,..   All in all was pretty coo just cuz I luv lobster an most deff going back for another roll ,....

I must say I came to yelp and checked reviews before I went to Lobster Me. Suffice to say, we all have a difference in opinion of what we like, so I thought I would share mine.   Honestly , the service was great. The guy who served us was informative and helpful in our selections. I wish I could give it more stars for service.  I spent $23 for lunch, but hell - it's Vegas!! I was excited that it was in the Palazzo, where I was staying anyway, so it all worked out, or not...  Truthfully it was just OK. I love lobster rolls and I have had them from Maine to Newport, RI to Long Island, but this was really just okay... I had the Connecticut and it was flavorless...  Really... I had to sprinkle salt on it. Also, it was in a hot dog bun. Really! A small hot dog bun, filled with lobster meat, but not a lot of lobster.  I mean, a 1 pound lobster really isn't that big anyway. It was just really bland, which is unfortunate because I love lobster and it just was really disappointing. My friend ordered Lobster Grilled Cheese (which, honestly, just sounds gross anyway) but it also looked gross (not sure what part of the lobster was used) and it she said it was vile tasting and she couldn't really finish it. Even the drinks were mediocre.  I had blueberry lemonade which tasted nothing like blueberries or lemons and my friend had the cider which she didn't finish and threw away. Everything lacked flavor and was bland, bland, bland...  If you are ever in Long Island, go to Jordan's Lobster in Long Beach, NY. That's what I was thinking of as I sadly choked down my dry Lobster Me roll. Lobster NOT FOR ME for sure!!

Expected more. Got the large original lobster roll and lobster grill cheese. Lobster roll was ok. Pricey for a hot dog bun stuffed with bland, recently frozen lobster. The grill cheese was really good, but the lobster didn't add much. Lobster Me is located in Planet Hollywood and there are a ton of interesting choices to try next.

Very nice change of pace. Light, flavorful and delicious. Had the classic lobster roll. Wife had the fish tacos. No complaints about either. Shared an amazing spicy lobster Mary. Would definitely eat here again.

Lobster "M E" = Manipulated Expectation. First off, I will say, I give this place 2 stars vs. 1 since the food was not of poor quality and the service was fine. The value however, was way off. Looking back I have only myself to blame, but I hope my post will dissuade other big hungry guys or perhaps their wife will read and warn them. DO NOT expect a sandwich from this. Despite the fact you are paying more than a filet minion, the sandwich is not a sandwich as many lobster roll joints have come to be known for providing over the past few years, but in fact an old school 5" bread roll.   Here is where you "Lobster-Lost Me" folks:   If you were charging $5 to $7 for a 4 to 5 inch old school lobster roll (or even $10 to $12 in Vegas), that would be OK. However, when you charge $27 bucks, you better damn well slap that sucker in a hoagie bun and fill it up as I and every real American man expects it!   The giant "sandwich" photos at the booth at first glance look like normal sandwich rolls (AKA Hoagie Rolls for our East Coast Friends). Here is where I goofed. If you look closely at one photo, you can see wedges of avocado on the top. If I were smart and not hungry, I would have realized the roll was only slightly larger than these wedges. What these are is in fact, a bread roll and not a sandwich roll. At the price charged, the roll needs to be at LEAST 8 inches long and still contain sufficient lobster to spill out of the edges to the point of being nearly impossible to consume. Alternatively, Lobster ME may cut their prices down to $6 per roll.   I am doubtful either will happen. As such, hungry men everywhere, unite! Demand value and say "NO!" with me to this cruel and unusual punishment of our wallets and our appetites!
be prepared for over seasoned and over cooked lobster..... Watery lobster bisque and flavorless bread. 40$ of nothing. Totally disappointed. Who puts oregano in a lobster roll?

I love this place, the lobsickle is my all time favorite, just a heads up, if you order the lobster and chips, make sure, you're not rung up separate, it will cost u more for the same amount of food!! The employees are always great and food is typically consistent..

Found this small joint ( mostly take out and limited seats) located in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. They have a small menu but it is unique and flavorful. We had the taco trio - lobster, fish and shrimp - each of them were cooked to perfection, wonderfully prepared and just right for a small bite to eat. We also got crab loaded waffle fries topped with bacon and green onions which was sinful and amazingly delicious ! A Must visit if in the area !

Its a good restaurant. I passed here yesterday but I was full. Next day I came here for food which is very delicious. Somehow, the price is a little bit high but it's lobster.  The sandwich are awesome. I ordered original Maine style lobster toll with chowder fries and drink. The meat of lobster makes me happy because it has a lot. This is my last restaurant in Vegas.
The lobster roll and lobster and chips are great! Happy to pay $17 and $13 for each of them

Connecticut Lobster Roll, yum. Toasted texas toast, warm buttered lobster, what more do you need? Oh yes, chips and coleslaw. I love that it comes with chips and coleslaw, some places it is just the roll for the same price.

Two Claws Up!  Okay, first of all...people who are complaining about the price and quantity need to get a grip. It's, uh, lobster. And lobster is expensive! So if you're looking for a cheaper thing, just go to Subway and get an imitation seafood sub.

When you see this place! Keep walking it's a TOURIST TRAP! The pictures will look enticing and you want something but trust me it's not worth your money! Go to a real lobster house to get some real lobster.

Very disappointed. Two of us had a lobster roll, a mac-n-cheese, and a soup to share and they were extremely greasy and bland that even with a help of hot sauce, we couldn't even finish one of them. Never ever going back to this place again.
Needed something fast and just happened to walk by at the Miracle Mile shopping center. The lobster bisque and lobster dog were excellent. I would go back for a quick bite anytime.
This pace has great lobster rolls, but be careful when you upgrade to a combo. They totally hosed us and didn't give us our fries. We paid $4 to add a 16oz soda to our lobster roll.
This is my first time to Vegas , my friend told me I have to try this restaurant . It's so good and delicious ! Me and my friend ordered lobster roll , great service and super friendly

Don't even waste your money on this disgusting food!! I got a lobsicle for $15 and the thing was not even 3 inches long!! Not even enough food for a child and the lobster had a funky taste to it. It left me in the end with less money, a nasty taste in my mouth and regrets that I didn't spend my money somewhere where I can actually feel full after a $15 meal. Don't do it. Run away from this place!!!!!

-Sunday afternoon (7/27), lunch time.  Having been born and raised on the coast of Connecticut, I can tell you that finding a good warm lobster roll there is a lot harder than you might think.  Most places only serve the cold version which tastes ok but there is something about warming it up that really brings out the flavor of the lobster.  I was pleasantly surprised when we came across Lobster Me, located right outside the Venetian's food court.  We had the Connecticut style lobster roll ($17) and the lobster and chips ($13).  The dishes came with a small side of coleslaw.  The roll is toasted and buttery and filled with chucks of fresh tasting lobster meat. The lobster and chips consisted of deep dried lobster chunks and beer battered fries.  I've had deep fried lobster once before as an appetizer at an overpriced steakhouse and the ones at Lobster Me were just as tasty.  The fries are crunchy and well-done.  The place has bottles of ketchup, Sriracha and malt vinegar on the tables for dressing up your food.  Perhaps I've been raised to like malt vinegar on fried seafood and chowder, but  I've often noted that seafood places here that know enough to offer malt vinegar (a ubiquitous condiment at seafood shacks throughout the northeast), usually know a thing or two about serving up authentic tasting seafood.  And this place is no exception.  Tip: Mix the ketchup and Sriracha together to make a spicy dipping sauce for the fries.  If I had to quibble about anything, it would be that the coleslaw doesn't have very much dressing on it and borders on being too dry.  I like my coleslaw creamier.  This however is a small thing compared to the taste of the lobster.  The place makes for a great lunch spot and I will definitely be back to sample more of their menu.
Great fresh succulent lobster that I will never get tired of! I'm going here all the time !

They should change their slogan to "World's smallest lobster roll" instead of world's best. I swear the portions get smaller by the day. The roll I had today probably 1/2 the size if not smaller than when they opened. I won't be back.

Yummy Yummy Yummy! We ate here 3 times during our week stay in Las Vegas. Top dish was the Lobster Grilled Cheese - sounds strange, but it was mighty tasty! Next we tried the Connecticut Lobster Roll - sweet buttery deliciousness! Lobster Mac & Cheese was pretty good followed by the Lobster Fries. I would not order the fries again - they were better without the toppings. Overall I am sure I will dream of Lobster ME until we visit again!

The food was amazing....but the service was even better!! Our son is on a very strict diet, and Jermel went out of his way to make sure he was getting what he wanted/needed. It might seem like a small gesture...but it made our sons day!! Thank you!!!!!

If you're looking for a kick ass Lobster Roll or Lobster Mac N Cheese... look no further than the Lobster ME... you won't be disappointed in the flavors that'll rock your taste buds... Lobster ME was recommended to me by a friend and I'm so glad I took him up on the suggestion. Daniela is the general manager but because of her passion for customer service, you'd think she was the owner of this place, she really cares about people.

The Lobsicle: a deep-fried lobster tail on a stick. You really can't go wrong with that. It's around $14 and it's good. Staff are great-- when I declined a beverage (I had a bottle of water in my purse), the girl at the register asked if I'd like a cup of water. The place is attractive and I like the concept. It's Vegas, and maybe you want luxury food, but you don't want to dress up and go out someplace with tablecloths and a wine list. Yes, it's a little expensive-- it's lobster. They aren't ripping you off, they're just serving you a specialty item. I've had McDonald's lobster rolls in New Hampshire (yes, they really have them there, in season) and those aren't the same price as a Big Mac either.

Awful awful awful service!! They were getting almost everyone's order wrong. I waited 30 min for a lobster roll order they couldn't find? What make it again I have the receipt! It's a Wednesday afternoon get your act together. I wish I spent $17 anywhere else.
Though the price was a little high for what you get, but it is lobster. I had the Maine and thought that was good. Not quite enough for a meal but a good light in between meal.
I ordered lobster roll and ordered a lobster Mac n cheese for my daughter. She loves it so much and finished it all by herself. The roll is kinda small but tastes good

Had the lobster mac&cheese and added bacon and chives. Hubby had soup sandwich combo. Portions seem small for the cost, It's definitely a bit pricey, which is the reason for 4 stars. However, everything was so delicious and we left with full tummies. We would definitely return and highly recommend.
Skip it. Both the Cajun Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac & Cheese were dry and lacked flavour.

The food was pretty good and the pricing was decent. It's nice to get a quick bite here and different from your typical food court joint. There was a wait for the lobster mac n cheese but I think we got it sooner than anticipated. I wouldn't mind coming back.

Lobster rolls are delicious and great in flavor. Environment is extremely clean thus making it an excellent place to eat. The  lobster grilled cheese is by far one of the best I've ever had definitely recommending Lobster me  !!!

Top notch food for a mall setting.  I had read reviews before our visit and I was looking forward to the lobster roll but couldn't order it because of an allergy.  But never fear we still had a great meal!  My husband had the clam chowder and the fish tacos and I had the Lobster and Fries.  I never imagined doing lobster tempura style, it was great, the meat was sweet and tender and the batter lite and krispy after the first bite I had forgotten about the lobster roll.  The fries were hot and crispy no grease and they served them with Malt vinegar, just the right touch.  My husband really liked the chowder served in a sourdough bread bowl (tasty bread), our adventure cost about $40. It was worth it!  We will be back!

First of all, when I came to the register I was not greeted with no smiles or any WORDS, Two Hispanic girls looked at me as if I were bothering into their conversation about what they did last night!!!! I am extremely upset, I felt ignored and unwelcomed, finally after me staring at them and when it was convenient for THEM to talk to me they asked me "what do you want" I ordered the lobster roll, I got it New England style and the meat was tasteless and had a texture like it came out of a CAN. They told me it was fresh and from Maine but I have been to Maine before and it is DISRESPECT that they even say it is FRESH when it is really FROZEN. Once I was done talking to the small Hispanic girl who was still extremely rude and did not give at least the minimum of guest service. I head over to the small space they consider a dining area which is compact and packed and they were even missing chairs! The tables were dirty and filled with leftover crumbs from previous guest. I observed that the cashiers did not wash their hands and just served food after handling money and being on their PHONES. THIS IS THE DIRTIEST AND WORST SERVICE PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN, I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE AND I HOPE NO ONE EXPERIENCES THIS AWFUL PLACE! P.S LOBSTER ME MANAGERS, YOU NEED NEW EMPLOYEES WHO ACTUALLY WORK AND GIVE GOOD SERVICE!

Over priced and not worth it. The chowder fries were better than the $19 lobster roll that's for sure. However, the fries hardly had chowder in my opinion. They should be called cheese fries with a drizzle of chowder. Don't let the line fool you. If you're hungry as we were you'll be royally disappointed.

It was $15 for a deep fried lobster tail which I think is a decent but not great price.  This is Vegas and this is the Venetian so expect higher prices.    It was really good but smaller than I'd anticipated for $15.

Best food in my life. When I tried one of the lobster rolls occasional style I believe but anywho it was so amazing the bun was buttered so good. The server was very sweet her name was Stephanie anywho it is so worth $20 for sure. I am definitely coming back again.

This place was absolutely fabulous!!! Being from the East Coast it is always surprising to see a true Lobster Roll in Las Vegas, and Lobster, Me nailed it! The celery salt on top of the Lobster Roll was the perfect final touch.  Can't wait to go back and try out other things on the menu!

Me and my husband ordered the Cajun roll with fries and a drink. It was a little pricey but totally worth it. The roll they put the lobster was perfect and the Cajun lobster wasn't hot just added extra flavor which is just how I like.
I love these guys. Quick, tastey, & not a burger! Vegas is full of great burgers but this is a stand out break from all of that.

A friend and I had the lobster tacos and lobster salad. The portions aren't big but it's enough for lunch. Everything was fresh and the lobster delicious. Locals get a discount. I'll definitely eat here again when I'm in the neighborhood.
No star! This is terrible! 1oz of lobster for $20.00. Combo for $25 you only get 5 fries I wint come here again....
The Cajun lobster roll was great. Lots of lobster and the bread was  excellent. Get the garlic fries with it. Very good too.

Had the cajun roll.  The flavor was delicious but I have to give it three stars due to the value.  Yes, I know lobster is expensive but... $25 for a small sandwich, fries and a drink was too much for me to want to come back.  Definitely glad to have a taste though and if you don't mind shelling out the funds!
Not bad but kinda pricy. We spent 70.00 for 2 lobster rolls, a lobsicle a clam chowder and 2 drinks.

Good quick eat in the Venetian. Everything tastes good, but the portion size is underwhelming. The lobster rolls are barely 6 inches, so don't expect a true Maine style roll. The chip portion with the roll is good, but they barely half fill the cole slaw cup. I mean, what is your cost on cole slaw? Give me a full cup.  I had the Beltway. The flavors are good...the lobster was a little over done, as you'd expect from pre cooked meat that is heated back up. The roll was fresh and the seasoning was good. The amount of meat for the roll size is pretty good.  If you want lobster, it's a good quick bite, but for $20, you'd do better to hit a happy hour at any of the other places. I'm glad I went, but I don't feel any urge to go back again this trip.

We ate there 4 times on our recent trip to Vegas. We were a party of four and enjoyed each meal every time. Although it is "not a cheap" fast food option, it is LOBSTER! Loved the lobster roll and chowder! Definitely would go again.
Not bad for a "fast food" lobster joint.  Got the Maine style combo.  Fries were very good.  Lobster roll was good.  It was a seasoning that was a little off. Service was good.

Stopped here 2 different days for lunch. 1st day we had conneticut lobster roll, lobster mac n cheese, chowder fries. It was amazing and friendly staff. 2nd day we had lobsicle, original roll, chowder fries, and grilled cheese w/lobster. It was delicious. The only complaint i have is that the seating wasn't the best. The food makes up for that.

GREAT!  Had the Connecticut and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. Outstanding! If you're a Lobster fan then this is the spot, especially for the price...for the sized portions you get it's surprisingly reasonable.

Yikes!  It's impossible to describe the abomination that these guys call a lobster roll.  Dry, absolutely tasteless, chewy little crumbles of lobster for nearly $30.  There was nothing on this bun that even remotely resembled lobster meat.  I would have complained on the spot, but had taken my order back to my hotel room.  A lobster roll is an incredibly simple product requiring just a few quality ingredients to yield a great result.  This thing was a horrible inedible disaster. Based on other positive reviews, perhaps this was a fluke....but I for sure won't try it again to find out.
Amazing food here. Had the original lobster roll and lobster tacos which blew me away. Hope they bring one too New York very soon. I would eat here everyday.

Good, good food. Of course it's a bit pricey. But the food is really good. I would recommend Lobster Me to anyone visiting Vegas. If you live there, lucky you, definitely visit this place. Not on a lunch break or anything though. Because the food takes a very long time before it's ready.

Wanted a quick bite to eat, so stopped by for a lobster roll. Seeing numerous places have these just decided to try it since it was next to Fat Tuesday. Ordered the Cajun Lobster roll. Came with fries. The lobster roll itself came with lobster meat, with cajun mayo and spices. It was better than expected, very good for the first lobster roll I had ever had. But Still just giving it 3 stars, since the price was so high. Not sure if it was because of the lobster, but still expensive to me for a quick bite, roughly $20 for my combo. Try it if you have never had it before though, really good! :)

This place was a rip off!!!! The lobster roll was about the size of a regular hot dog. We should have never come here, four bites and I'm done. We spent $50.00 on two rolls a two sodas. Looks nothing like the picture on their website. There is no way that was a pound of lobster. I don't know why people are willing to spend their hard earned money on this.

i had the truffle lobster roll and it was absolutely to die for.  I didn't see it mentioned in other reviews.  yes, it is expensive but duh it's lobster!  I thought the portions were okay.  Would have liked two of those lobster rolls but that would have been too much.  This place is pretty special and should be given a serious look by anyone in the mood for quick and easy lobster.  My friend had the lobster grilled cheese and didn't thrill over it the way i did the truffle lobster roll.
Give very small portion of food, definitely not enough to fill me up! Pricey and not many tables to sit, but good thing the food was good. Recommend the lobster and fries, or the lobster tacos!

Drunk date with lobster! We stopped at about 10 pm on Sunday night, pretty busy but they were organised and quick. Got the original lobster roll. Amazing. Good crisp chips and smooth coleslaw also! Friends got lobster mac and cheese and it was great! Will definitely be back to stuff my face again!

Clean cute space in the Venetian --- wasn't a planned stop but they had us at LOBSTER.  Ordered the original Maine lobster roll. It came with homemade chips and coleslaw. Everything was fresh and delicious.

Mediocre lobster roll place (good for Vegas considering ). I ordered the cajun roll. Good overall, decent amount of tender lobster, the  sauce was good, nice and spicy. They serve it with chips and cole slaw (nothing special).

We ordered lobster mac & cheese and the frenchy sandwich which totals $31 something with one drink. When you looked up their menu it is pretty pricey already and I could only say maybe because of the lobster that they're adding onto it. But, oh boy!!  nothing is so special about it. There's only 3 pieces of lobster in my macaroni and it was just plain boring. The frenchy sandwich with lobster is also boring...it just seems so typical kind of sandwich that we can make in our kitchen that we can just add lobster into it. The funny part was the fries tasted better than the sandwich.

Not the best lobster roll I've had but still pretty good. Lobster on the classic roll was fresh and full of flavor. Bread was fresh with a good texture. And the fries were crisp and tasty. Only knock was the price-it's Vegas but still, as somebody who knows what the same would sell for in New England I'm still getting over the sticker shock.    But definitely worth a visit if you have a hankering for lobster on the strip

I was so disappointed with the lobster roll. It was a complete waste of $25! Dry tasteless bread with maybe 2 ounces of dry lobster meat. I will never recommend nor eat here again. I was really looking forward to it. Unfortunately I got it "to-go" and was too far away to go back and complain. I was surprised because there is so much competition in Las Vegas so I assumed the lobster roll would be amazing. It was amazing all right - amazingly disappointing. We go to Las Vegas all the time, so we will seek a different place to eat on our next visit.
The worst customer service and unprofessional manager(Lucia) i ever seen in Las Vegas. I would recommend to skip this location and not to dine here. Awful, Ridicules and Unprofessional stuff.
I loved the product! Lobster was fresh and plentiful...and priced no more than any east coast outlet!

I just eat the grilled lobster deep-fried lobster on the stick the Diablo lobster roll lobster macaroni and cheese are the best you can get  I have no words to say but excellent the manager dan really is the best hot and fresh lobster
Awesome food we've been to Maine and this is Damn close. You can even get the lobster warm if you like. Quality food, quality service!

I ordered a Signature Roll on my way to the pool. I only had my room key and credit card on me. The cashier wouldn't take my Visa credit card without seeing my ID. I let her know that's not allowed. She stood her ground. I walked away. So many other restaurants to eat at. They had zero other customers and no line. Too bad for them.   The Visa merchant agreement says this: "When should you ask a cardholder for an official government ID? Although Visa Rules do not preclude merchants from asking for cardholder ID except in the specific circumstances discussed in this guide, merchants cannot make an ID a condition of acceptance. Therefore, merchants cannot as part of their regular card acceptance procedures refuse to complete a purchase transaction because a cardholder refuses to provide ID. It is important that merchants understand that the requesting of a cardholder ID does not change the merchant's liability for chargebacks. However, it can slow down a sale and annoy the customer. In some cases, it may even deter the use of the Visa card and result in the loss of a potential sale. Visa believes merchants should not ask for ID as part of their regular card acceptance procedures."
great food, the lobster is great. although, it's serving size may be too small, it is a great resteraut. recomand for people who want to eat a quick lobster meal.

Good variety in lobster roll menu. Rolls are 19 each plus another 4 for drink and fries. So pricey to me. However, substantial amount of lobster on roll. Atmosphere similar to fast food or quick eating. I would go back after trying other competition.
Always a pleasure eating at Lobster ME! From growing up in Maine and having lobster alot they do,a,great job! We go every time We are in Las Vegas! Yummy!

Great Maine lobster roll.  Don't go here if you don't want lobster or if you want ambience.  It's a no frills place to satisfy your lobster craving.  Price is reasonable.  My husband had the lobster BLT which he also enjoyed.

The lobster grilled cheese made me want to "smack my mama," as we'd say in the South.   The Lobster Ice Cream was...interesting, but I think it's a "love it or hate it" scenario and the people who were with me loved it.  The lobster roll was also really delicious.  I wish I lived in Las Vegas so I could eat here all the time.  Actually, maybe it's for the best that I don't.
The food is phenomenal!! I could eat this every single day. Staff is very friendly and great
I really like the idea of good lobster at a reasonable price. The staff is friendly and are ready to help make suggestions. The lobster and fries was good and clam chowder was nice and hot!

Came here for brunch after a nice night out in the city. Have to say the food was great, but not for the price. Bought myself a Lobster Mac and Cheese for $12 and gave the Bloody Mary, spicy, for $5.  Let's start with the Lobster Mac and Cheese, although it was a small portion, it was quite delicious. However, there was not that much lobster and it didn't really add to the food itself. For that price, I was hoping for a much larger portion of food, didn't really quench my appetite.  The Bloody Mary was great, if you're a fan of Bloody Marys. It wasn't a cocktail made from scratch as I expected, but rather made with store-bought Bloody Mary mix. But hey, it was great! Can't complain about that. For $5, that's a reasonably good price. Again, wish there was a larger portion of it.

We live in Connecticut and visit Maine quite often. But i must say this place in The Venetian is absolutely capable of bringing the flavor in. awesome lobster rolls and sliders. also the cajun fries is a good catch too.
We ordered the Cajun Lobster roll and it was good. The server forgot our drinks.

Used to love this place but now is overpriced ($24)... mediocre lobster roll as my lobster was not fresh tasting... and the counter staff was less than friendly. I will be heading over to Luke's from now on.

Best lobster we've had in a long time!  I think the key is to go there for breakfast and be the first ones in line. Everything you get is freshly cooked and it is definitely worth waking your ass up for even though you're hungover.   We got the lobster mac n cheese, lobsicle, lobster roll, and lobster ice cream. Each dish was better than the next. Amazing!  We are fans for life and we are already salivating just thinking of the next time we're in Vegas!

I am a New Englander.  I have cravings for lobster - especially a good lobster roll.  Good lobster rolls are hard to find even in New England - too much mayo, celery and other fillers and the lobster is drowned out.  I love the Maine Lobster Roll!  It is a real, honest to goodness, sit on the pier on the Atlantic and throw your shells into the sea, Maine lobster roll - done the way it should be done.  For all of you who think the price is high, have you ever bought lobster before?  Do you have any idea what it costs?  I go to the Lobster ME in San Francisco, and love it.  I go out of my way when shopping downtown to have lunch there.  Pure delight.

Seafood is one of my favorite foods and the food is always great here and service is good, it's always clean and organized. One of the employees there, I think her name is Yvonne, she's always energetic and helpful so try and order from her if you can catch her working there during your visit! Overall the atmosphere here is enjoyful! Make sure to try the lobster roll!

My daughter had the lobster mac and cheese which was good but didn't have as much lobster as I would have expected for a place named "Lobster Me." I had the grilled cheese and lobster sandwich which was soggy with too much cheese and not much lobster. Flavor was okay but it was over-priced. Fries were average.
Wonderful Lobster rolls and the tacos where excellent.  The best food court food I have ever had.

The lobster rolls are ok, the style is non traditional I'm told, still tastes fine to me. Bread was pretty deliciously seasoned and toasty.  It comes in two sizes, either large or extra large. The rolls are neither. Portions are small, could easily eat two. If you're going to call something large it better be freaking large. If they called it regular and large, I would of felt less ripped off. You're seated in the middle of a mall, so there's some decent people watching, if you're into that. They had some pretty fine females inside the bebe store. Highlight of the meal.   We ended up going to earl of sandwich immediately after because we were still hungry.
Are these guys still in business? Tried calling all of their locations. Bad customer service! Get some employees to answer your calls if you expect to grow your business! #FAIL

I recently went on a weekend trip to Vegas and heard good things about this place! While it was a little expensive, my lobster roll was absolutely delicious! I ordered The Original Maine Style (chilled lobster meat) and my friend ordered the Connecticut (warm lobster meat tossed in melted butter).   The bun was warm and toasted but not too crispy (and not burned!) and the lobster tasted fresh. The spices they used added to the roll, the perfect touch!   My only complaint would be the price, but I was expecting to be paying a little more because it is lobster after all!
The food here is bomb!  The lobster Mac n cheese was great and very filling.  We also shared the chowder fries.  This place is awesome and priced right! Check it out if you are in the area.

A native New Englander, I've wanted to try Lobster Me since it first opened, but rarely make Planet Hollywood a destination. Having won free tickets to the Beatleshow! (which is a really fun show btw) and with a half-hour to kill before we had to line up,  we found ourselves wandering the Miracle Mile and happened  upon Lobster Me. As we perused the menus, written on chalk blackboards (yes there is the obligatory nautical theme here, but you're ordering and picking up at a counter and eating at a random table set not quite in the pedestrian walkway so there's not much in the way of what I'd call "ambience" - hence the 4 not 5 stars) --- anyhow as we were standing there we were approached by a very friendly gentleman who explained the offerings and offered us samples - of which my husband gladly partook. Alas, they were out of lobster ice cream, but we promised to return to sample the cuisine after the show.  True to our word, we returned and ordered the lobster roll (save your money and do not order the extra large -- for 6 more dollars you're only getting about an inch more of roll and maybe one or two extra lobster pieces) and the lobster bisque in a bread bowl.  Aaaaaah the lobster bisque!!!  Served in a delicious sourdough bowl, it was piping hot - just the right temperature, with a lobster garnish and my oh my! it was so buttery and creamy and oh so chock full of lobster chunks!!! i really couldn't believe I was having this in Vegas!!!! And the lobster roll (for 3 more dollars you can get fries and a drink - it's worth it) -- was superb!! Yes I am a lobster roll purist - my benchmarks are Woods Seafood and Lobster Hut in Plymouth, MA -- and I never thought anything, especially out here, would come close. But OH!!! this succulent lobster was dressed perfectly and the roll was grilled just the way it would be back East!!  What a wonderful find!!  There's all kinds of trendy stuff here too -- lobster mac and cheese, lobster shooters, and the aforementioned lobster ice cream that we haven't tried yet,but suffice it to say that we might just make Planet Hollywood a destination, just to partake of the deliciousness that is Lobster Me!!!

Food here is overrated. Yeah its lobster but I guess I expected so much in taste. It was good but not great. I got the beltway/beltline (cant remember the exact name) lobster roll and upgraded to the fries and drink combo. That came out to $22. In my opinion thats a bit much being that this location has more of the fast food feel. My bf got the lobster cheese fries and they didnt even look good. They looked soggy and just not something I would have wanted. The lobster cheese fries were $14. If I return here on my next visit to Vegas, I'd try something else...although there is nothing that isnt pricey. I think its just the fact that its more of a fast food type spot that thows me off with the prices.

TINY sandwiches but at the same time they pile on the lobster!  If the roll was of normal size perhaps the amount of lobster meat would look as those they skimped.  Good quality but don't expect to fill up and DO expect to pay a lot.
I love lobster!!!!! Lobster roll and lobster mac n cheese are awesome! It's expensive, but locals get 20% off. Oh, and try the garlic fries! Yum!

I try the original maine style roller here, taste good. A lot of lobster and very fresh. But undeniable expensive for a sandwich. You may have a try if you love lobster. Their service is OK, and they are really hot. Many people are here, you may not get a seat.

El diablo lobster roll: Flavorless and small portion $18  Lobster mac & cheese: flavorless and dry (had to add ketchup to eat) $12  Chowder fries: pretty nice! Small portion for $6  Its no wonder people are flocking to chipotle right around the corner. For a fast food style restaurant the prices and portions are a downer even on the strip.
FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! All you can eat lobsicle!NOPE all you can buy! Prices high for little. Hope  this saves you from the false advertisement
Great Place! All items on menu are really good. Large chunks of Lobster. Only down fall is that it's in a mall. Highly recommended! The original main style is a must try.

I'm giving Lobster me 2 stars because although the customer service was good the $14 Endless summer salad was the worse salad I've had. There isn't very many healthy choices on the menu and the one thing that's the healthiest lacked taste from the dressing to the ingredients. I'm very disappointed that I had to pay $14 for it. Can you please use another recipe? I guess I was paying for the lobster!

Located in Planet Hollywood, Lobsterme serves (well you guess it) lobsters. Got original Maine Style Lobster Roll $17. It's chilled lobster with mayo and spices on a bun. You can also order it warm if you want it but it makes it weird. Flavor wise it's very simple and fresh, can still taste the lobster there. I'll definitely do the lobster popsicle next time. Couple friend tried it and they love it. 4 star due to limited seating area

Lobster on a stick! Really what more can I say to sum it up. My husband and I dined at Lobster Me after reading about it on Yelp. As others have said, it was a bit pricey but again we're talking about Lobster here folks! The place is located in the Mile of shops next to the Planet Hollywood hotel/casino. Suite #435.   I had the Lobsicle. Which was basically an amazing huge chunk of lobster fried on a stick. I also upgraded to the cajun fries, which honestly I don't remember how they were because I was in Lobster Heaven. The husband ordered the Maine Lobster Roll which was a toasted buttery roll with huge Maine Lobster claws in it. The lobster was cold, which was a bit unexpected, but who knows maybe that's how it's supposed to be? He also had the garlic fries but I believe he didn't eat them because that huge Maine Lobster roll filled him up! We also ordered a bucket of beer, because well, it's Las Vegas! All together our total was $56 and worth every cent.   I can't wait until our next annual trip back to Vegas. Lobster Me is going to be one of the first stops, perhaps before even checking in! Yeah, it's that good.

The original Maine lobster roll is good, real lobster meat, not flour covered/battered fried . It is small but I understand lobster is expensive . My only complaint is the side chips are hard, maybe out for too long
So yummy. The mac and cheese was the best. The sliders were ok and tasted a little like just tuna.
A nice little find in the back of planet Hollywood. Great lobster options for when you just want to grab and go and not worry about a long dinner.

Decided to give this place a try based of the recommendation of a friend, and now it is a definite go to every time we come to Vegas. We got the Lobster Mac N Cheese and the Lobster ME Sandwich Cali Style while lobstering up our fries. We easily shared both dishes and chatted it up with some friendly guest at our table. It is a order first and seat yourself place and the staff was super helpful and friendly. The manager made it a point to interact with the guest to ensure everything was to their satisfaction.

Ate here the other day with my family as we were walking the mall. Unfortunately we were starving when I decided to overlook prices. $18 for two lobster tacos and I think fish tacos were $12 or $14 with only a few chips. I was hoping to have the best lobster and fish tacos of my life at that price. Well, I was definitely disappointed. Go to Baja Fresh or rubios and get better quality,beans,and rice cheaper. Just way over priced for so so taste.

how can you make a lobster not good ?????..... lobster me has found out a way .... when we got there it was empty , i ask like 2 questions and the guy that was working there seem like he should of not been working there because he didn't know anything and he was very Rude !!..... i ordered 2 deep fryed lobster  tails .. and one lobster roll the warm one with butter ... the fryed lobster tails where  not season  at all !!.... learn how to salt and pepper your lobster ... i through i was going to eat sweet delish lobster... ..it needed SALT very badly !!!... i don't understand why is there chinease hot sause on the tables and not tobasco  ... if your not going to salt the lobster then at least put SALT AND PEPPER ON THE TABLE ... i was searching all over for salt it was no wear to be seen ...so i dipped it in butter to see if it will help . it made it worse . there butter must be some cheap fake stuff ... i had to ask for my drink 3 times ,,until i had to get up and ask for it again ... how can you forget a drink ,,keep in mine they was not bizy .... now on to the lobster roll.... yelpers there is only 1 size ,, there is not small or large .. only very small size lobster roll and also yelpers the pics on here are really old or fake because they don't put tthat much lobster on the rool and there is no giant claws in top on the sandwitch !!!.... i took about 2 bites and let me tell you this was not main lobster , or even lobster at all ... it had a very bad fake  taste   like imitation  !!!!!. pure bad tasteless seasonless ..even my wife said it taste like imitation crab meat no difference   i heard this place is good it was not , maybe the one at miracile mile shops are better , but this place was a waste of time not to mention money .. ...the only thing was good was the chowder frys that was it and it was a drizzle of chowder on them hardy any chowder on them  ,,.. i heard this place is good it was not , maybe the one at miracile mile shops are better , but this place was a waste of time not to mention money ..

Well this place was my first dinner in Vegas...I got here right before closing...I got the Conneticut...I asked for the lobster to be on the side so the bread didnt get mushy(that request was ignored) when I did taste my food...I was a little let down...I knew it was lobster...however it was too chewy almost like a hard boiled egg...I didnt get the "extra large" thing either...i ended up getting a 7$ sandwich at the gas station that had more taste and was around the same size as this "extra large" sandwich...maybe that applies to the meat and not this size of the bread...I dont know...I'd like to say I would come back but I feel like I was cheated out of 29$ in some ways...but I did try it and now I know...I like to concept of this place and the expanding menu...but I'd say try it for yourself but stick with a regular size and no soda or fries:-)

Not quite sure what's happened at Lobster ME. 9 months ago the lobster rolls were stacked to the brim with delicious lobster. I went for lunch today and there was hardly any lobster inside the roll. It looks like they increased the size of the roll, cut the amount of lobster, and then added greasy, fried potatoes. It used to be about the lobster. Now it's about cheap carb fillers. Better for the company's profits, I suppose. Don't recommend. Maybe try Luke's Lobster instead.
This place is such a scam, way overpriced for absolutely no lobster. I won't come back
Came across this spot because Buchon wasn't opened yet.  Ordered the lobster roll, fish and chips, and the clam chowder.  Food was ok, nothing special to come back to.

I heard a couple good things about this place so headed down to the strip and try it.  It's ok, just not worth going out of your way to get.  If you're already walking around planet Hollywood and get the itch, then try it.  It's rather pricey for a lobster roll, 18 bucks (not the combo) with housemade chips and coleslaw.  Small, more of an appetizer than a meal.  OK is best I can say.

Where else In Las Vegas could you eat the best tasting lobster roll without paying an arm and a leg for it.  I love this place.  I really think I am in Maine when I go here.  The portion of lobster on the roll is huge.  I also think their lobsticles are great too.  I take all my company to Lobster Me & they love it just as much as I do.  I only wish their seating arrangements were a little more comfortable.
Good lobster roll no filler all meat and cheaper then Ones in Maine $17 for a very good roll but $12 dollars for a 32 oz beer ?  Good staff very friendly

Ammmmaaazzning customer service! Alesia I think was the name of the cashier who suggested the Mac and Cheese. Loved it! Can get enough of this place! Will be back for more! Super friendly staff, even the manager! Overall great place! The lobster rolls are pretty good too!
The Connecticut lobster roll and fries are good. Tried the El Diablo too, which was not bad but still prefer the Connecticut.
Great people and lots of choices of food. I had the lobsters Mac and cheese which was filling and flavorful. Very fast and reasonable prices. Would go back again
Best lobster roll I had to date and this is saying something since I visited Cape Cod after this.  I went there 2 years ago and forgot about it.
I only tried the lobster Mac and cheese and garlic Cajun fries and it was pretty bomb! Will come again to try the other stuff :)
Had reservations about this place...fast food Lobster?  However my daughter highly recommended it so I went had the lobsycle and was hooked!  Both more to take to my roomies at the MGM!  Awesome!

Good but overpriced food. I got the Taco Trio which is one of each type of taco (fish, shrimp, lobster) served with chips and a cheese sauce. The tacos were good, my favorite was the shrimp. The chips were okay but the cheese served with it was not good at all. It had an odd texture and was very oily. The location has a shared seating are with Fat Tuesday.

I ordered lobster roll and lobster mac cheese.  Very delicious. The best mac cheese I ever had. Sitting area is crowd but I ordered to go and enjoyed the food at the food court which is only 50 feet away.

I think maybe my expectations were just too high. I have a high bar for lobster in general. I love seafood, and read some reviews before eating here. Must say the presentation looked delicious, and the staff was very friendly. I ordered the main lobster, the surf n' turf philly, and the lobster Mac and Cheese. All were just ok, but ended up spending over sixty five bucks. Quite pricey for food that I was not too crazy about.  Huge let down. Waffle fries were okay, but as soon as they get warm, it loses its crisp which is the best part. I also went late at night right before it closed which is convenient that it opens late on Saturdays (midnight), but again, totally not worth it. Maybe my expectations were too high. Brought it back to hotel to eat in the room. Walked about 8 minutes before I actually ate it. Maybe would've been better if I ate it there while hot. Can't say for sure.

Not even close. Being a lobster lover and had many rolls in Maine these lobster rolls are not even close. Very dry with a thick roll and not much lobster.  At $25 you would expect the best ever. The lobster Mac n cheese was very good.

My husband and I absolutely love this place. We discovered it walking around the mall and decided to give it a try. Its a great way to have delicious lobster in a fast food type setting. Their lobster bisque is amazing. I cannot wait until we go back to Las Vegas just so we can eat here again.

What a rip off!  Stingy with the lobster in the lobster roll and soggy chips.  The only reason I am not giving this one star is the clam chowder, while overpriced was very good.  What was I thinking paying $34 for fast food.  Never again,.

Went to Lobster Me, my husband and I went to get a lobster roll once we got there we realize they had the lobster Grill  cheese sandwich so we went with that. It took a little minute for us to get our food but the store manager Jeffrey went above and beyond he came to our table let us know that they just rolled out a new menu and he apologized for the wait, I asked him how much was a fountain drink he end up giving me a Pepsi for the wait. Jeffrey also came and checked on us after we ate our food to see if we liked it. I love the atmosphere and definitely love Jeffrey customer service we recommend this restaurant if you're in Las Vegas

Whenever I'm at Planet hollywood, either watching a show or just doing a bit of Gambling I always make sure to stop by Lobster Me in the miracle mile shops. Their Lobster roll is like being right back in the northeast and their lobster Mac n cheese always hits the spot for comfort food!

Whenever I'm at the Venetian, either watching a show or just doing a bit of Gambling I always make sure to stop by Lobster Me in the miracle mile shops. Their Lobster roll is like being right back in the northeast and their lobster Mac n cheese always hits the spot for comfort food!

Whenever I'm at Planet hollywood, either watching a show or just doing a bit of Gambling I always make sure to stop by Lobster Me in the miracle mile shops. Their Lobster roll is like being right back in the northeast and their lobster Mac n cheese always hits the spot for comfort food!
The Connecticut lobster roll, lobster Mac & cheese, and deep fried lobsicle are dangerous. Very, very delicious...man I wish there were a location in San Diego.
Good deal for vegas ordered original maine 4 oz lobster roll for 17$.  Came with chips/coleslaw.  Great for quick fast food lobster.  big chunks of Lobster!!! Convenient location!!

gf and I hit Lobster Me post-Meatloaf concert.  I was kinda surprised it was a "fast food" styled place where you order at a counter, sit in an open table area and then they bring the food to you.  We ordered the lobster roll ( medium - $18), Lobster Grilled cheese ( I believe it was $13 ) and lobster mac n cheese ( dang, I was tired - I forget the price but I'm guessing $15 )  Glad I bought a large can of Corona ( $10 )  - I just about killed the can before the food showed up.  The verdict - not bad.  The roll was very basic - grilled roll and chunks of lobster saturated in butter.  Decent serving size.  Lobster was tender.  Lobster mac n cheese - I liked it;  gf didn't.  She felt the lobster should have been cooked into the mac n cheese.  my response, " Why?"  I've commented on other reviews I question the combination of mac n cheese and lobster ( I feel the lobster gets " lost " in the cheese ) but I felt this serving was decent.  I do agree with the gf that the mac n cheese probably would have been better with a sharp cheese, but again, this will probably result in the lobster getting lost in the shuffle.  The lobster grilled cheese , well.... same principles as the lobster mac n cheese - too much cheese means less lobster flavor so why bother.  Still, not a bad sammie.  Not sure I will eat there again if so, i'll stick with the lobster roll.  pics included
I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE their lobster rolls!!  So fresh and very flavorful!! The customer service was awesome and service was very fast.

great idea but this place won't last. way overpriced, ridiculously small portions and not enough tables for their diners. You're telling me I just spent $40+ and there's nowhere to sit to eat it? It's gimmicky and I've been to similar places that are much better all around (see my review for Slapfish). lobster me once, shame on me, sorry, don't lobster me again peeps

I love lobster rolls and this place had such great reviews I had to try it.  It was pricey, but lobster is expensive, so I didn't mind as long as it was good quality.  The first bite was great, but upon subsequent bites, I bit down on shell twice.  No one wants to crunch on a shell when trying to enjoy lunch.  Would not return.

Was in Vegas July 20, and thought I stop in and try the Losbter Me, what a waste of monies, the pictures posted here on Yelp is nothing like the sandwich they give you, more like a Lobster spead instead of a Lobster sandwich, trust me when I say this save your monies so many better places to eat at and for $17.00 and its true the sandwich is not bigger than a cell phone. A mess if I was not in my room when I open the sandwich believe me it would have went back but I choose to trash it and take the lost.....

I should have known lobster and fast food does not mix, but obviously gave it a try and right away you can taste the old, flash frozen low quality lobster meat. Its an ok place but you are much better off eating at those infamous lobster trucks which actually have high quality fresh lobster!

Lobsicle is delicious, you  can either deep fried or grill! You can also add $3 more for fries & drink or add $4 for soup & drink, it's really a good deal since the soup itself already cost $9. Enjoy!!

Walking through Venice/Venetian is an experience in and of itself. Surrounded by the plethora of shops, the sweet artificial river and Gondolas, you actually feel like you are in Italy. Due to my craving for seafood, I expected a fantastic lobster meal but I was not satisfied. For the $20 for the meal, my hunger was not satiated. Normally, I am not dissatisfied, but that day was an exception. The lobster was dry and the wait was long... I don't recommend this place despite its seafood allure!

Our plan was go to Todd English in Aria for the lobster rolls.  I had been craving them since a previous LV trip.  When we walked by Lobster Me thought it was destiny for my craving. I got the deep fried clam chowder and it reminded of the croquettes in the Netherlands except not much flavor and pretty greasy.   The lobster roll was a very good lobster roll.  It was pricey but you got a decent amount of lobster.  It wasn't mind blowing good or culinarily fancy but a good lobster roll.

Awesome!!! I had excellent expirence with Lobster me. Food always is so fresh, healthy and so delicious! Staff is friendly and they work fast!  I love Clam Chowder and actually Lobster Cheese sandwich is creamy and so yummy!!! I'm so happy each time I eat there:) thank you guys!

Lobster ME is a food court stall located in the Venetian/Palazzo food court.  Just like everything on The Strip, it is overpriced and under seasoned.  I had a combo that was a traditional lobster roll, served with cole slaw, a drink, and a side of bisque.  With tax and tip, it was around $22 and not the best roll or soup I have ever had.  Normally, this sort of portion would be around $11 in Maine or even at a Brooklyn hipster joint.  But, compared to a sit-down restaurant on one of the upper levels, it is considered cheap because it is the food court.  I would probably not eat here again, since there are so many other options in the area.

Lobster me! Hubbys favorite! We always order the same thing, the lobsicle, grilled sandwich with lobster and lobster Mac and cheese! It's always good. Pricey but I think you get what you paid for. It's always fresh when ordering. Their cheese sauce for the waffle fries are really yummy! The only thing I that I will complain about and for the missing star is that there are not enough chairs and tables to sit down and eat. It was a little bit hard for us since we have 2 little kids and a stroller, we need some space to eat with kids and space for our food because the tables are really small and we usually order a lot, no place for our drinks  but overall and the food is really good. So worth trying their lobsters!
This place was so good been in Vegas for 4 days had it twice.. The Cajun lobster roll was the best I will be checking out where else there are lobster me

Quite expensive but what do you expect? Its lobster!! We ordered the lobster roll, the lobster mac n cheese, and the fish and chips. Everything was on point! Serving size is a little small for the price. My favorite was the mac and cheese!!

I don't know what kind of food these other reviewers are used to eating, but I found no substance to any of the claims being made about poor taste, quality, or quantity. My wife and I ordered the lobster mac 'n cheese, a traditional lobster roll, salt and vinegar fries, and a drink. With a $4 online coupon, we got all that for $32. And after a solid afternoon of dodging drunk idiots on the Strip, we found our previously empty stomachs delightfully filled.  Both the roll and the mac had a good amount of lobster chunks. Again, I say that these were CHUNKS. It was not flaky, or fakey. Straight up lobster chunks from a real lobster. The mac was not huge, but it would definitely satisfy your average hunger strike if supplemented with a small side (like fries) and a drink. The roll was smaller (as lobster rolls are supposed to be), but still on the larger side of ones I've eaten in the past. The roll itself was like a buttered and grilled Texas Toast. It was probably about 5" long and completely stuffed with lobster meat.  The fries were only lightly drizzled with vinegar to avoid an overpowering taste. The salt level was good.   Look, if you want lobster without the buffet price and/or pretentious ambience, go to this place. I think it's a worthy substitute for excavating a lobster's exoskeleton yourself while paying a very reasonable (at least by Vegas standards) price.

DROOOLS. this is to die for. Excellent lobster roll and very savory! I got the Cajun lobster roll combo and it was so delish I wanted more and more! Unfortunately, the portion is so little and the price is high. My roll was good but all I got was a big piece of lobster. Other than that, I didnt get like 2-3 big pieces as the other pictures but it was soo good! Portions are fairly small. The fries are yummmyyy! Very little portion as well. Great location since its like right around the corner from where I was staying at (The Palazzo) On the other hand, my friend got the lobster mac and cheese and that was okay. I thought it was very plain... not enough cheese!!!!! The lobster mac and cheese portion was okay! Enough for 1 person. I also got to try the clam chowder fries! It was gooooood!!  That was one of my favorite dish.

Food here was really good. I had the original Maine lobster roll and it satisfied my appetite really well. Customer service was excellent my lemonade was too. My take: food satisfies craving but not hungry, portions could have been a little bigger.

This place is in Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops by Fat Tuesdays. I decided to check it out and got some Lobster Mac n Cheese and a blueberry lemonade. She said it was the same price as the combo so I took the fries even though I wasn't that hungry. Came out to almost $20 after tax. It was like eating at a mall food court, but next to a long line of people looking to get really drunk.  I got the last portion of Lobster Mac around 11 pm on Saturday it seems, because people ordering after me said they were out. I thought about the lobster stick or a roll, but this seemed like the safer choice since I knew little about the place. The lemonade is much too small for the saltiness of the meal. The mac n cheese was alright, it was cheesy shell pasta with lobster chunks throughout. I'm not a big mac n cheese fan, but this wasn't bad.  The food was alright, I actually couldn't even finish it all. I ate most of it and the lobster chunks, but left a few bites left. I feel bad about wasting food, but I feel like finishing it would've made me more regretful.

always a refreshing and quick bite everytime in Vegas!! convenient location! and delicious lobster entrees!  It can be a a bit pricey considering it is 'fast food', but come on...still really good price for lobster!!!

From: ChefDan the FlavorKing  DISCLAIMER:  - If you only LIKE lobster, it's not going to blow your skirt up. On a budget? Don't do it.  - If you're from New England, you might be disappointed....dunno.  And ignore reviews about price...IT'S LOBSTER! This amount of lobster and potato costs $32.00 in restaurants, much less Vegas.  This is my favorite meal in Vegas! As a chef it's easy to overpower delicate items like crab and lobster, and New Englanders found a way around that.  Now I'm not giving these guys credit for anything original. I'm giving them credit for bringing this to Vegas. Do either the Original but ask for it warm, or the Connecticut. The Diablo seemed too overbearing so didn't try it.  Lobster Tacos I was told were good. Wish I tried the Chowder fries and Lobster Mac.  On the second round I double-downed on the lobster for $10 more. It went fast but holy crap. This is lobster-heroine.

They uniqueness about this place is what appealed to me.  I had the "El Diablo" roll and it was good but I think I rather have my lobster the traditional way with warm butter.  The lobster margarita was pretty good and it even had a lobster claw in it.  Overall, worth trying once just to check it out but I'm not sure I'll be craving this place anytime soon.

Awesome Lobster Roll ...It was the traditional  & it's now hot/warm it was delicious with some nice home made chip & a very light coleslaw. .very good but a tad pricy. ...a roll & a can beer was $27 bucks

Me and my mom went here and I enjoyed it! I had the lobster grilled cheese sandwich and it was good! If you're a lobster lover this place is worth a try. The seating was limited, but besides that I could see myself returning when I go back to Vegas.
Nothing special at all. Very disappointed. Lobster bisque was bland as were the truffle lobster and Connecticut lobster sandwiches.   Definitely not worth the $50 we spent on lunch for 2 people.

The food was. . .ok, could have used a little more seasoning. This place is also pretty pricey but that's what comes along with eating seafood on the Strip ($18 for a lobster BLT). The staff is really nice though!
Poor value for the quantity and quality of food. Save your money and eat at a decent sit down.

Lobsicle, a deep fried lobster tail on a stick with a slice of lemon and butter. Fatness and roughly 14 hot burning dollars in your mouth. Totally good and worth it if you're winning!   Fries were pretty generous for the price and they have free samples of their lobster ice cream! It was interesting but not my kind of thing.

What do they serve at Lobster Me?  LOBSTER!  This place is located in the Venetian on the second floor near the escalators near the floors 1-16 elevators.  Their menu consists of lobster rolls, lobster claws, lobster tacos, lobster mac and cheese, lobster grilled cheese, soups and hot dogs.  I ordered the lobster grilled cheese and it was quite tasty.  They added a good portion of lobster in the grilled cheese.  The prices are high and the size of the rolls are a little small but then again it's lobster.  You order your food, get a number, and find a table so this is more of a fast food theme restaurant.

This is one of my favorite places to get food fast on the strip. My favorite lobster roll is the cajun; it comes with cajun mayo and spices. It's like heaven after the first bite. The lobster mac n cheese is also very good. I wanted to try to the lobster bloody mary...don't do it. It was terrible, not worth it BUT the food is delicious. Worth trying if you like lobster and don't get the chance to get it very often.
Lobster roll The cajun was fantastic !!! the size of fish and chips was too little...but so fresh and tasty and fries are tasty too.  We recommand this place for lovers of lobster taste.

I had lobster roll & mac n cheese. Maybe I expect too much for the food.  Taste was ok. Service(cashier)was great.  Lobster roll is not worth to pay $19 Mac n cheese is better than lobster roll. Wish have more loster on it.
I was disappointed.  My $14 lobsicle was very small, and I am not a big eater.  The good news is the beer is cheap.  $20 buckets and $5 Sam Adams draft.  The lobster ice cream was very weird.

5 stars all day long. Brandon is a great chef. The band I run plays Planet H 4 to 5 days a week. I eat here every night we play on our first break, and have been doing so since Nov, 2011.
