Being from Northern Cali and a Bay Area junkie. There simply is no better lobster in LV for the money. I first met Lucile and developed "The Ray Jon Special" with her. Though she's on day shift now, the name stuck and it's an off menu recipe for the night shift. No bread, no butter, just spices, homemade cocktail sauce, and Lemon.  The entire staff is great. Always very clean.  Because they offer a wide variety of lobster fare, you'll want to go more than once to try everything. Unless your a creature of habit like me.

Travel is important.  And food is important.  Trying new and exciting food on your travels is of the utmost importance! And as for me, when travel allows me the opportunity to seek out and acquire a new spot for a lobster roll?  Now that makes me happy.  Happiness and lobster are very important!  Before departing on my recent trip to Vegas, a friend issued the comical challenge, knowing that I'm lobster roll obsessed, of finding "a lobster roll in the desert"!  Knowing Vegas is food mecca meant this likely wasn't a challenge at all, and a few seconds of searching on my Yelp app yielded not one but TWO Lobster ME locations on the Strip!  The Venetian location fit best into my plans for the day, so off I went!  Though located in what is described as The Canal Shoppes, if you're familiar with that stretch of stores, Lobster ME's location doesn't overlook the inner canal that the gondolas traverse, it's more tucked into a food-court-esque corner.  The employees are all SUPER friendly, and in a buttery mood I ordered up the Connecticut Roll combo, a roll of lobster tossed in warm butter, served up alongside steak fries and a drink. Yes this combo was $23, but anyone who squawks at that price needs reminding that lobster is a high end item despite being served in a food court. It's just a reality of the sammich!   After ordering, you're given a number and can head back to the table, and my food was brought to me about 5 minutes later with a smile. Overall the lobster roll and fries were tasty, and while everything could have been a tad warmer, I was very satisfied! Is this the best lobster roll you're ever gonna eat?  No, but that would be a pretty crazy expectation. The lobster was real (not langostino, some places try to pull that fast one, but not here!), and was a touch overcooked so a bit chewy, but the flavor was nice.  Overall I was satisfied if not dazzled.    If your next foray into the desert leaves you lusting for lobster too, Lobster ME is there to meet your needs! Just keep your expectations reasonable, and you'll walk away happy.

Very, very pricey for this place but the food is aright. Ordered the Cajun style but didn't taste very Cajun to me. I was able to finish this myself and I'm rarely do. Ordered as a combo so it comes with fries and a drink (free refills). I was still hungry that I even was able to finish up the yard long fat Tuesday's next door. Also ordered the Mac and cheese which my kids finished up quickly. I'm guessing it passed the Mac and cheese test and was up to their standards. It was ok for a first time try but I highly doubt I will return.

Well I realize these rolls are not for me. For a family of 4, I over ordered and we barely finished the food. The best item on the menu is the lobster tail on a stick. Don't waste your money on anything else.

I had a drink, chowder fries and lobster grilled cheese for 19$, which is a good deal.   Food was good, service not that fast but they were so busy.  It was crowded and not enough space.  Will definitely come back

I'll be brief.  It is okay.  For a food court lobster roll, it is as good as one would expect, or maybe slightly better.  All lobster rolls (especially Connecticut style) are subject to being compared to the gold standard of all Connecticut style lobster rolls...Neptune Oyster House in Boston's North End.    I visit Planet Hollywood a few times a year for work and/or fun.  I have stopped by Lobster Me for a hot lobster roll twice.  Service was fine.  The roll is a little small.  It is really more of a big snack versus a meal, but that is fair considering the price of lobster.   I'm sure I will stop by for a late afternoon snack or something again.  Just won't go out of my way for it.

Great location in the Canal shops of the Venetian. Great food but extremely over priced 17 bucks for a little lobster sandwich and 11 bucks for the lobsters grill cheese. If the price was slightly lowered it would almost intersect with value and taste for a 4  star value. But the service was casual and fast and the flavoring  was decent not memorable. Just fair. Your in Vegas so overspend and over splurge.

Located inside Miracle Mile, Lobster Me was a pit stop that was really interesting to try. The advertising for a free sample of lobster ice cream was very enticing also. Here we go:  Location: Such a good spot next to Fat Tuesday and right inside Miracle Mile. You can't miss it. There are lots of tables in front of the shop so you can sit there and eat or take it to-go.  Food: Had the lobster grilled cheese. It was pretty good and was pretty packed with lobster, but the only downside was that it was pricey. It's expected though because it's, well, lobster. And, couldn't resist the lobster ice cream sample.. free is always awesome (: The ice cream just tasted like vanilla ice cream though.

Lobster Me Las Vegas - Hey you're in Vegas Baby and whatever you want goes, right...So why not a Lobster Roll for lunch! As they say For The Love Of Lobster!   Lobster Me Las Vegas is For the Love of Lobster the best spot to get your fix in Las Vegas. Their motto - The Best Lobsters are from Maine, Caught only when the time is just right, and be it simply bathed in butter or something a little more daring, there is nothing better than GREAT lobster. I couldn't say it any better myself and Lobster Me lives up to it in EVERY BITE.  For me it's The Venetian. Located in the Canal Shoppes it's a perfect stop on the strip for some of the best Lobster in Vegas. It's also set up so you can eat and run, because you're in Vegas and there is some much to do! You might be thinking....Lobster in the foodcourt? All I can say is You are missing out if you don't try it. It is definitely fresh lobster from Maine and amazing!  The menu is easy on the eyes and mind.  You will have your choice of.... yep, you guessed it LOBSTER. Lobster Roll, Lobster Tacos, Lobster Mac & Cheese, Lobster Cheese fries, and yes I can go on and on! Have that one person in the group that doesn't want lobster...that's ok, as they also serve shrimp, fish tacos, grilled cheese and the kiddo's can even get a hot dog!

My boyfriend and I shared the Connecticut Roll with the lobster me fries it was delicious and fairly priced! The workers there were very friendly and helpful as I was unsure of how big the roll was. Will definitely come back when I'm in town again.

Came by here after a long flight out from NYC where we have great Lobster Rolls in various styles.  I was hungry and it was late but this outlet was around the corner in the Miracle Mile shopping center which is connected to the hotel where I am staying.  I had the Connecticut-Style Lobster Roll (lobster cooked in butter instead of mixed with mayonnaise, Maine-style, which they also offered) combo with Cole Slaw, a cup of the New England Clam Chowder and an Apple Cider with the bill coming to a couple of pennies under $25.  Quality was pretty good even if quantity was a little on the small side for the price, almost snort-able up a nostril now that I think of it in hindsight...but what the heck, this is Las Vegas where everything's more expensive for tourists than even New York City but if they give me the good stuff, at least it takes some of the sting out!

Me and my bf decided to try this place thinking anything with lobster has to be good ! Wrong lol by bf got their lobster roll and it was small plus the lobster didn't taste fresh. I had the lobster soup which was ok but it could've been way better the fact that it had lobster in it!  We won't be eating there again.
Lobster mac and cheese was cold. Small portion. They did not even give us cole slaw. Will not return or recommend.

Oh not a good place at all. Ordered our food and waited over 15 min. Everything came out cold. A lobster roll is $19.00 it was less than 6 inches long on a tiny bun. Huge disappointment. The food did not have a good flavor and believe me i am from FL and know good seafood. Not worth 36.00 for 2 sandwiches...insane

When in Vegas, I suggest you try this place. The Lobster roll & shrimp were impressive. Lobster chips are awesome. The service is very friendly & attentive girls, they asked us to ask questions....i like this lil place.  the Lobster shooter was amazing too.
I ordered a lobster taco and shrimp taco it was just okay. Not enough shrimp or lobster for the price.

I loved my Lobster roll! It was just perfect! The roll was nice and buttery, the lobster was fresh and tasty, served at just the right temperature, and the fries were to die for. The customer service was excellent. The gal even have us directions to our next destination.  While it's a bit pricey, it's lobster for crying out loud. I highly recommend it! You will love it!!

Popped in for lunch, got the taco trio thing, was actually really good. It was fish, lobster and shrimp. I liked that they didn't make them all the same, so rack one was really tasty in ours own right, and the chips it cane with were over seasoned, but in a great way and also had a tasty cheese dip too. I plan on coming back again next time I'm in the Venetian ^.^
Great seafood quick! Had the taco trio and preferred the shrimp taco over the lobster. But really, everything was good. Lobster mac__cheese was good and not 'heavy'.

I decided to try an item that was not lobster... so I was taking a chance when I ordered the crab cake sliders. I honestly had low expectations and was happily surprised at how well cooked they were and full of flavor. My boyfriend thought it was a bit dry but I liked it overall!  The waffle fries were good but some of them weren't fully cooked and half seasoned, so that was a let down. My boyfriend ordered the lobster roll.. I took a bite and didn't like that the lobster meat was cold.. I think that's weird and he didn't like it that much either... Lastly the side coleslaw was bland as eff.. bottom line, this place is okay.. there's so much more better options at the mall and in Vegas for sure. Definitely had better lobster rolls elsewhere.

Horrid service and ridiculous prices. I cannot believe I actually just spent money here. Next time I will go to literally any other place in this food court. I understand that living and working and Vegas must be difficult. But that doesn't excuse your cashiers acting like primadonnas and snapping at me simply for dating to ask them a question about my order.  The mac n cheese is $15 and is literally like a plate of velveta mac n cheese with a few pieces of lobster thrown on top.
Great to go option on the strip. Will visit again because the food was flavorful and definitely a better fast food option.

We were starving after a day at the pool and wanted something quick and easy. We happened upon Lobster Me under our hotel and decided we both wanted some lobster. I eat gluten free so I was hoping they would have a gluten free option with Lobster. They did in the form of the Lobster Salad. My partner got the lobster mac and cheese. Both were alright but not spectacular. The mac and cheese was oily. The salad had very little lobster for 15$. and an orange juice for 5$ was not very cheap. Cashier was very friendly.

THREE WORDS: Lobster. Grilled. Cheese. I remember watching a video on lobster grilled cheese (wasnt sure if it was from this place or not, but either way I was intrigued), so automatically I had to come here to try it out despite how full I was. My bf and I split a lobster grilled cheese and was so amazed by how great it was. The lobster was super tasty and the sandwich itself had a good amount of lobster in it. The cheese was so good and so perfectly cheesy. They had some scallions in it too, which added a great touch to the grilled cheese. I wish I had more of appetite when I came here so I could've tried more of their selection.
Excellent fast service. The chowder fries were to die for! Only for stars because it was a 28 dollar lunch for 1 person, but then again this is Vegas!

I'd been pining for a lobster roll since having one at Mary's Fish Camp in NYC, so it was exciting to see this place open. Around 10:30 at night they still had a line at the register but the staff is very nice and working as fast as they can. My lobster roll didn't use mayo and celery like Mary's, I think it may have been lemon and celery salt, but it was fresh and there was plenty of meat. He had a lobster BLT and wolfed it down without offering me a bite. The two sandwiches with one very small portion of fries, a water, a soda and a small draft was $50, so it's not cheap for something that wouldn't fill you up if you're really hungry, but it was delicious.

Finally made it here, o my goodness the food was great. The staff were polite & helpful. We had the o.g.lobster roll, cajun lobster roll & lobster grill cheese we got the sandwichs all mediums (they come medium & large) the size was perfect plus fries. The bread was perfectly toasted & buttered, so soft melted in your mouth, sandwichs were full of lobster claw meat. These were lobster rolls like ive never had before, we will definately b back (soon LOL)

I'm not a big fan of lobster rolls but if given the chance I would still try it especially when there is truffle oil included.  I came here with a bunch of friends and it's basically a fast food joint where you order and they bring you the food.  I had the lobster roll with truffle oil and a side order of clam chowder fries.  Lobster roll was probably one of the better ones I've had and for $19, the price was fair and portion was generous.  The clam chowder fries were tasty.  This is something you think of doing as a kid and as an adult and the chowder making the fries soggy with bites of clam is a winner.  I was a bit disappointed that my friend who ordered the same thing got more fries than me.  Other than that I'll be looking for Lobster Me wherever I go.

Loved it here! Sahar took care of us! Lobster lobsicle was wonderful. I had it both ways: grilled and battered. I think the grilled was my favorite. The drinks were wonderful! Really enjoyed my time here. Very friendly vibe.

I'm from Maine, live in Vegas and have eaten more lobster rolls than I can remember. This is the third lobster roll I have eaten outside of New England and the first time that I ever finished a lobster roll and said I'm full.  Mine was served with fries (and a beer). Now it was $23 for a large and for me it was cheaper than a plane ticket to Maine so I'm good.  The staff was great - very helpful !  I plan to try everything on the menu that has lobster in it.  One happy Maine girl !!!!

Had to stop by Lobster ME when I saw the sign for their well known lobsicles! I didn't order them since I was set on the Maine style which was recommended to me by a couple friends.  The Maine style roll comes with chives and mayo on a warm soft delicious roll.  The roll is loaded with a good amount of lobster for what you pay for in Vegas so that's a good deal.  The chips that come with the roll unfortunately are a different story... they don't have any flavor and they're very dry.  It honestly tasted like cardboard box! I had a couple bites and just couldn't with the chips.  If you're looking for a quick bite on the strip and something different from burgers and slices of pizza you can give Lobster ME a try.

We shared the Connecticut & Cajun Fries with a gigantic Sam Adams. The lobster was good & they boast a whole lobster in each sammie. Gotta love that. It was on par for other Lobster sammies we've had & good. Next time I'm totally getting my own. We usually share at new places because we seem to over order & are filled for the majority of the day other wise. But for this calorie laden yum I'm willing to bust at the seams a little.

I have to start by saying the portions are tiny.  My 4 year old hammered down the fish n chips in under 5 min, not bc they were delicious but because they were literally 3 strips the size of my thumb!  For $12 it is a horrible buy  The lobster sandwiches are also for the post bariatric surgery patient with a belly the size of a orange.  The lobster chunks were good but for $17 I would expect more than 3 bites folded in 1 slice of regular bread.  Pros Convenient location  Cons Size Portions Size Portions Cost Cost  Do NOT recommend. For $4 more might as well eat a full Planet Hollywood buffet!

If you're on vacation and in a rush, but want dine-in quality food, look no further. Its definitely the type of food I search for on holiday. I had a traditional lobster roll while my husband opted for the lobster mac n cheese. My roll was perfect: the bread was well toasted, there was plenty of succulent lobster, and the overall flavor was great. Of course I had to try my husbands, and his was delicious too. My only critique of the mac n cheese was the container it was in; it could've been in the same container as the other items to get a better bite of all of the ingredients together (if that makes any sense). Of course it's a couple dollars more than I would want to spend normally, but let's be real: it's The Strip. What do you expect? And for this quality of seafood it's honestly a good deal.

Underwhelming and disappointing. And costly.   I spent $30 for a lobster roll and lobster mac and cheese. The lobster roll mostly consisted of split top bun, which I guess is good if you're really into eating buns. The pictures of a lobster roll overflowing from top to bottom with lobster and giant claw meat on top isn't remotely close to what I received. There was a minimal amount of lobster in my sandwich, and 2 or 3 small pieces of claw meat that in no way covered the top. The flavor wasn't anything remarkable. I was so bummed when I received/tried my food.   The (lobster) mac and cheese was bland. I ate most of the lobster off the top and threw the rest of the dish in the trash. The dish is just mac and cheese with browned breadcrumbs and then lobster sprinkled on top after the mac and cheese has been cooked/heated up.  Kraft mac and cheese has more character and flavor.  I'm still surprised that they don't incorporate the lobster into the mac and cheese. I was expecting a creamy, savory concoction that featured or highlighted the lobster, and that is not what they have going on.   Save your money.
Great lobster rolls.  It was my first time ever having one.  I can only imagine how they would taste in New England

Fried lobsticle! Git it git it. Not over battered/fried and plenty of flavor, don't even need to dip it in the butter.   Their lobster mary was also good. Quite expensive, but also quite alcoholic, so that was A-OK in my book.

i feel very indifferent to this place.  the lobster roll did not look appetizing, so we ordered the lobster and chips, a lobsticle, and a lobster grilled cheese, on the recommendation of the people who worked there.  as lunch, this place was extremely heavy.  the lobster and chips were pretty good but it was so very deep fried that we feel a bit gross and greasy afterwards.  actually, it was so heavy that we felt a bit disgusting for the rest of the day. they really skimp on the lobster too...there were maybe five/six small lobster nuggets and the rest were their mediocre fries.    the only thing that i would recommend getting is the lobsticle!  it's a lobster tail that is smothered in tempura batter and fried (yes, FRIED, again!!!).  it was really good, although pretty small and still cost $12!  the lobster grilled cheese was GROSS to me.  i don't know what kind of white cheese they used but it did not taste good, it was too mayo-ish.  i mean, i love mayo just as much as the next person but really it was like smothered in this mayo cheese.  i would not order that again.

I'm torn between a 3 and 4 star with this place. Located in the Miracle Mile Shops, we had walked by this place numerous times since we were staying at the Elara. We decided to try to this place for lunch one day and the food was just ok in my opinion.  We got a couple platters of the taco trio which consisted of 1 lobster, 1 shrimp and 1 fish taco with a side of chips and cheese. The food was lukewarm at its best and didn't even taste fresh. I've had better fish and shrimp tacos for a fraction of what we paid here. The chips and cheese were ok too, nothing to write home about. Maybe we caught them in a off day.

The lobster mac is INCREDIBLE. Get it; you won't have any regrets.  The lobster roll was sub par (but then again I'm spoiled since I'm from the SF bay area), so I would recommend it only if you've never had one before.  You order your food at the counter and they bring the food to you at your table. Very casual place and relatively ample seating. This restaurant is in a food court so you can swing by the place next door for dessert (if you have space left).

Came here for an afternoon snack while on vacation in Vegas. I had the original lobster grilled cheese and it was delicious!   The bread was buttery and nicely toasted. There were also chunks of lobster and lots of gooey cheese oozing out of the sandwich. It was also really filling - i only ate half and saved the rest for breakfast the next day!

I was so excited to eat here, but so so disappointed.  I got a lobster roll for $23 and added $4 for tator-tots and a small soda. A little pricey but I wasn't too worried about it. However, when I got my lobster roll I was so disappointed. It was tiny! Definitely not worth the price, plus the lobster was over-cooked, chewy, and bland. The best part of the meal was the tots. I'm not impressed.

I love lobster. And I love Las Vegas, and really for me the Venetian is my fave hotel combining the fantasy architecture of Vegas in its heyday (gondola rides!) with elegance and great shopping. So what could be better than Lobster ME? It's like they knew I was coming and found a way to keep me coming back.  LOBSICLE!  My new love, my greatest love! Sweet gods of the sea, I needed this. Grilled lobster tail on a stick.  Totally reasonable price, amazingly tasty. Quick service, glitzy fun food, perfect for Vegas. Want to try everything on the menu.  Wish there was one home in LA!

So i was in Vegas or a few days and had already eaten at Lobster ME in the Venetian so as we were strolling through the Miracle Mile, and I saw this location, I thought...WHY NOT!?  This time instead of the Lobsicle (which was sooo good), I tried a lobster roll. I have had lobster rolls in Rhode Island, I have had them off of trucks in LA, and well, this was the best (sorry Rhode Island, sorry Cousins) ever.  Not too salty, tender lob meat, perfectly toasted bun.  And filling!

Located in the Venetian shoppes area. This place combines good food like lobster with casual dining which is perfect for me. They take your order and give you a number and bring the food to your table.   I had the lobster grilled cheese sandwich and it was good especially since I love crab more than lobster. The bisque soup was just ok. I also had the blueberry lemonade and it was to sour for my taste so I switched drinks with my husband and drank the apple cider and that was good. My husband said me about his lobster roll sandwich.   I think this place is one of those places where you have to know what to order. It's a hit or miss kind of place.
I got the Maine lobster roll. It was packed with a lot of lobster meat. Very flavorful, the chips n slaw were very good too! I wish there was a lobster me in LA!

Love this place!!!!  Great lobster rolls, when you consider you are in the desert.  Prices are fair, customer service was good, place was clean.  My only complaint is that there is not ample seating.  We have a family of 5, so it was difficult to find a table and when we did, we had to share seats.  Tables are also very close to one another, and you can hear conversations from your neighbors  Otherwise, not too shabby.  4 stars

Taste: The Original Maine Style lobster roll was good. The lobster meat tasted fresh, but didn't have huge chunks of claw meat like it does in the pictures. The Lobster Bisque was creamy and warming. I have to come back to try the Lobsicle (fried lobster tail...on a stick!).  Service: The cashier was very nice and helpful as he gave us some suggestions on which comedy shows are good in Vegas.  Value: I feel like the food was a little over priced. $17 for the roll and $9 for the soup. It's kind of what you expect with any food inside a casino on the strip though.   Ambiance: Seating area was a little dark, but I think that's on Miracle Mile Shops not Lobster Me. :)

Terrible service! They are so slow, the orders were piled up ready to be served and the employees were just walking around with no sense of urgency. I saw the "cook" grab fries with his hands and pass them between containers. I ordered the lobster mac n cheese, and I got it after 20 minutes waiting. It was cold, chewy, and not appetizing. Save your money and go elsewhere.
Just get your credit card out and go wild! Everything is awesome here, from the lobster roll to lobster mac-n-cheese. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu. DELICIOUS!!! You're welcome ; )

Which sewer are the using to farm raise the lobster they serve? If I could give zero stars I would. I was so excited to find out about a lobster roll place in Las Vegas. Spent $110 to try a few things with family. All the lobster was bland despite the butter and mayo. This is not Maine lobster. Tilapia would have been more flavorful. Order came out wrong and instead of making a fresh Connecticut roll they just poured butter on top of the Maine roll. Disgusting, expensive. I left there feeling nauseous.

Eat a lobster roll when in Vegas and you're broke with no money to spend on the buffet.  You'll come away satisfied with a taste of Maine but you're really in Nevada.  Pairing the roll on some Texas Toast was perfect as I was in a state of nirvana with crunchiness and soft seafood texture. After finishing my roll with fries, I left satisfied and full with energy to gamble and eventually buy another lobster roll.

I LOVE seafood so when I found out that there is a fast food place within the Venetian that's all about lobster I knew I had to check it out.  It's located in the food court but a little further down. Close to where the shops are. The menu is fairly limited but I guess there's so only so much you can do with lobster. The prices reflect standard seafood prices.  I had a new England lobster roll and requested it bunless since I eat low carb. The cashier suggested rolling it in lettuce instead and offered to replace French fries with soup. Very nice of her for going above and beyond for my dietary restrictions. Although my food came with buns tho... the food was good. Nothing mind blowing. But I was glad to have this option in the food court.  They also had several lobster drinks like bloody Mary's and micheladas.

If you enjoy Lobster, but doesn't want to spend $50-100 per person for it, then this is a place to get a quick fix.  They are located just in the middle of Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile shops.  The place operated like a fast food joint, but seats could run out quickly depending on the time you visit them.  We got the Cajun Lobster Roll and Diablo Lobster Roll.  Both were full of nice flavorful spices.  The Cajun one was slightly spicier.  Lobsters were served cold, but still delicious.  Drinks were refillable.  Price was about $15-20/person.  Lobster Me, lobster you?  The staff served us quite well and it did not feel like a fast food joint at all.  I look forward returning to explore other items on their menu.

The fish and chips and lobster tacos were the better items on the menu from what we ordered.  We even ordered a second order of the tacos.  The lobster roll is small and not a mix, the lobster mac and cheese lacks flavor so I would say it was overrated.  It had a steady stream of customers, but was extremely slow with only one register.
It's a food court experience with a sit down restaurant price. The foods good. The ambiance isn't. The price was high. Good in a pinch.

I tried lobster tail sandwich. First of all the lobster was dried and taste less , Secondly sandwich is way small to what they show in picture and it's over prized for the quantity they serve. Service was bad and the place was empty during rush hour which shows how bad they are. I would never return to this place.
Ridiculously overpriced for one slice of bread folded in half filled with lobster. The lobster fries had one piece of lobster.  They ran out of the chowder and need to update their menu online....
Lobster everything here is a good taste of veggies and lobster. Employees work very fast and the whole environment is nice around.

Fresh, fast, pretty good portions.  Gluten free options available.  Tacos are corn tortillas, not flour. Need to ask  questions to navigate the menu, and may need to ask twice, as the staff may not go into enough detail to communicate the items and there are not pictures of everything.   All in all, pretty good. Not cheap, but hey, it's lobster, right?

I would give this a rating of 2 Based in the lack-luster lobster mac & cheese; however my wife did enjoy the lobster roll & the old bay fries were good. Back to the Mac & cheese... It looks nothing like the picture. It was a boat of Mac & cheese with one claw that was ripped into 5 pieces and placed on top. No lobster mixed throughout! Not worth it. Pretty disappointing.
The food is good.  Food is pricey for fast food but good and fast. That's what I like, quick and fast so I can be on the move.

A generic as it sounds, I really love me some lobster! When I saw Lobster Me pop up on the Yelp app on my phone, I was plotting all of the ways to come eat here. I didn't manage it until the last meal of my trip, which wasn't a bad way to end a nice getaway.   As generic as it sounds, I really love me some bisque. (Omg deja vu!) I ordered the bisque in a bread bowl. I wish that they had toasted the top of the bread with some butter, but that's my wishful thinking. Cold bread, thick generic tasting bisque, no lobster in sight. Sadface. I would suggest you skip this. I wouldn't have known what I was eating if I had not ordered it off the menu myself.   The lobster roll was pretty satisfying. I liked the spice blend, and with a bit of added salt, the sandwich was quite tasty. I also wished that there was a ton of melted butter to pour over the top for maximum consumption value, but alas, you don't always get what you want.

Not bad for a lobster fast food chain, the food was good and reasonably priced.  Pros  Service: All the staff members were friendly and prompt with getting orders out as fast as they could.   Prices: Affordable prices for lobster sandwiches and tacos without having to dine in at a fancy seafood restaurant.  Cons  Miso Sesame Roll: The miso sesame dressing was a major fail since there was no taste of miso or sesame in the dressing. The chunks of lobster meat however was prepped and cooked just right so I'll go for the original Maine style roll with just plain butter on the next visit.   Lemonade: The lemonade was more sugar than lemon and it wasn't as fresh as it was advertised to be.
The Cajun lobster roll is sooooo good!

My sister took me here to eat after we watched the Britney Concert. We both had a breaded bowl of clam chowder and we shared a grilled cheese. The clam chowder was delish tasted fresh and did grilled cheese was good too! Yum Served fast as well.

Looking to try something different?  I suggest you gice this place a shot.  Been here twice over the last few days and have been satisfied.   First visit I asked for sugfestions from the employee and took went with the Cajun Lobste Roll with a side of their seasoned fries.  The lobster roll was delicious and seasoned to perfection. Served in a toasted roll it was good to the last bite.  The fries were a great companion to the meal and made for a very nice lunch.   The meal was so satisfying that I made a return visit the next day and order another Cajun lobster roll along with the Lobsicle.  The Lobsicle, a grilled lobster tail on a stick, served with drawn butter was awesome.  Overall I highly suggest you give this place a try, but be wary of portion opportunities.  I know it's lobster but a slightly larger portion may go a long way.  I may give it another try tomorrow.

While waiting in line, starving, I was drooling and debating over which sandwich to go with and ultimately went with the classic maine lobster roll.  I pretty much always either get way too much food or not enough food, and of course this time I opted not to get the fries and drink for $4 more (In Vegas I know that's a steal, so I was mad at myself after I saw the size of the sandwich).  As others said, the potion size is tiny.  It said each sandwich  is a full pound, I obviously didn't measure it but it seemed small.  I feel that after so many people have mentioned the size, perhaps a "real life" size sandwich should be on display so people know what they're getting.    Size aside, the meat was fantastic as was the coleslaw that came with it (BONUS)!  I have been debating between 3 and 4 stars since I had this, a week ago, but have decided on 3 stars (3.5 if I could) due to not only the size but due to the fact that there was only one girl getting the orders ready on the outside of the kitchen.  She was incredibly efficient, fast, friendly and you could tell she knew what she was doing...but it was BUSY. I watched her take off at least 20 orders at one time.  There really needed to be another person helping her...it was around 12:30 so it wasn't an unexpected rush.  Regardless, the food was great.  Next time around, I'd try a different sandwich (and hope it was as good as the Classic) and get fries and a drink so I could walk away full!

my friend and i got the same thing: the original lobster roll & apple cider. altogether a little pricey, but fine for a non-chain in vegas. there's not a lot of seating at all, and what is there is really close together. the apple cider was super good. lobster rolls were really good but way smaller than we expected for the price (and all the posters boasting how much lobster is in it....). the fries were not great; i thought they were really greasy.   overall the lobster rolls tasted great, but it was a little expensive.
Original Maine lobster style roll is awsome!! Lines could be faster and seating arrangements are horrible. Other than that food is great!

I've been dying to try this place after seeing the pictures. Well, presentation was awesome... Looked just as appetizing in person. I ordered the large Cajun roll. The gentlemen told me if I liked a kick to chose that one. There was no kick, and the seasoning lacked a little bit. I had to add hot sauce. Besides that, you can tell the lobster is good quality and fresh. Very meaty. I found the large a little small, I can't imagine how small the small is for the price they charge. Overall pretty good.
The foods are okay. Nothing special. A bit overpriced for the portions :/  If you're from the bay area, don't bother

This place is the bomb!!! My hubby and I love seafood and this place puts a little spin on it! The staff is wonderful and the gentleman that is usually taking orders is awesome! This is a must have when you are in Vegas! We are locals so we will be coming here more often!

If I could give this place a zero.I would.  I couldn't wait to try this spot.  We spent $60 for three people for fast food lobster that SUCKED.  The portions are small my lobster roll was a mini roll for $18.  My shoes have more personality than the unsympathetic manager. Needless to say these locals will not be returning.

My husband and I shared the Connecticut, which I don't recommend doing. They are very generous with their lobster, but 1 sandwich is definitely not enough for 2 grown people to share. A little on the pricy end ($17), but they do give you a lot of lobster.   I've tried both the Original Maine and the Connecticut, and I prefer the Connecticut. The reason being is that the Connecticut is prepared warm with warm melted butter drizzled inside. The Original Maine is also yummy, however, it is prepared with cold lobster inside toasted bread (tastes much better with lemon squeezed on it). So depending if you're a cold vs. warm seafood person, you may favor one over the other.   The Cajun fries are "okay." Nothing out of the ordinary, but not bad. This is place is not fancy, but a little more upscale/trendy fast food joint. Most likely will be coming back.

I've eaten here the last 2 times I was in Vegas.  I mean, really--where else can you find lobster on a stick?  I just LOVE the concept! (No bib, no shell cracker, just lobster meat, ready-to-eat!)  It's flavorful and juicy, served up with a nice hot container of melted butter.  I tried the lobster macaroni too. It was pretty good, but should have contained more chunks of lobster.  This is a storefront in the mall. There are a few stools and tables in the mall area. So, expect food court style dining.

I got the surf n turf philly cuz it said it's a "favorite" but it was a bit disappointing because it barely had any lobster in it. It's supposed to have lobster, crab, and steak but it turned out to be mostly steak. $16 for a steak philly and it wasn't even that good. We also got the crab fries and sadly it was too salty. The lobster bisque in a bowl was pretty good.

The Lobsicle was incredible, far exceeding expectations. It was the most flavorful lobster I have ever had and possibly one of the best things I have ever eaten in any category. We'll now be stopping by Lobster Me whenever we're in Vegas.

I was really excited to try this place out!  After attending a pool party and walking around the strip, my friend and I finally decided to stop by here for a quick bite before returning to the suite. It is conveniently located inside the Miracle Mile Shop next to the Fat Tuesday!   FOOD --------------------  - Cajun Lobster Roll (cajun spices, lemon, butter, and seasoned mayo) - I ordered this one because I wanted something spicy! I made a great  choice because I really liked the spice and the seasoned mayo, but the lobster meat was a bit dry... The size of the lobster roll isn't something to rave about!  - Original Lobster Roll (Mayo and lemon with their house spice blend) - My friend ordered this. I tried and it was just OKAY!  - Garlic Fries - VERY GOOD AND TASTY! It's really worth it!  - Lobster Bisque - We ordered this for our friend, and she said it was good!   Overall, Lobster ME is GOOD. I don't think it's worth $18/roll but I'm just glad I crossed it off my list. It's not something I'd eat every time I'm in Vegas! I must say though that the customer service is great here! The girl who helped us knew the menu very well! And she was very engaging with every customer! Kudos to her!
I've  been here a few times.  Im not a seafood person but i love their lobster Tacos. Its a small place so it may be hard to find a seat on a busy day.

I didn't have high hopes for this place since it looked like fast food but boy was I wrong!! I ordered the Old bay lobster roll combo. I have to say it was one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had. I haven't travelled to Maine or anything so maybe my experiences are somewhat limited. But who cares?!?? It was soo tasty. The lobster was served warm on a soft buttery bun. The lobster was topped with breadcrumbs which I thought was a nice touch. The lobster roll came with a side of old bay thick cut fries. They were good, pretty standard. I will definitely eat here again on my next trip to Vegas!

Not that great for the price. Small portion for the sandwich, lobster chowder was more like clam chowder, fish and chips was super dry it was like eating a wood chip! The only thing I liked was the chips the french fries and the water. Do not think I would be here again!  let me rephrase I won't be here again.
Amazing lobster rolls. I got the Connecticut. Almost as good as being in east coast. Good service but a little pricey. But what do you expect when in Las Vegas

Heavenly! The Cajun Lobster Roll I ordered was served on a warm, toasty, buttery Texas Toast bread that was shaped like a hit dog bun. It was overflowing with sweet lobster chunks and seasoned with a Cajun spice that was made from a unique blend of herbs that offered just the right amount of flavor but wasn't too spicy and didn't overpower the natural lobster flavor. The roll was served with homemade chips that were crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside - delicious. The service was great! I can't wait to go back.

It's food on the strip. When is food on the strip ever 5 star worthy? Never.   I got the lobster grilled cheese with cajun fries. The lobster grilled cheese was pretty good for what it was but it wasn't amazing. Like everyone else said, I wish there was more lobster meat in it. 2 stars for that.  Added an additional 1 star for their cajun fries. The best cajun fries I've ever had. It was actually SPICY. I'd probably just only get their cajun fries next time as a snack and nothing else.

My partner and I took our dear leader out to lunch for Boss's Day.  Lobster ME had been booked marked for a little bit and on this occasion it seemed proper to pay it a visit.  There were some concerns about attempting to negotiate the Venetian during lunch time.  As fate would have it after parking in the garage and getting off the elevator, and getting off the elevator we were able to locate LME in the area of the food court with ease.  The set up is straight forward.  You order and find a seat.  The service was friendly and offered up their knowledge of the menu, and individual favorites.  I went in on an "Original Lobster Melt."  I found it to be...of course cheesy but was not lacking in lobster pieces and flavor.  I also complemented by sandwich with an order of "Chowder Fries."  These are freaking awesome!  Fries smothered in clam chowder, cheese w/ bacon!    After eating our meal...we made or way out the area just as quickly as we found it.  While making our way out of the garage, I reflected on the meal and enjoyed it's rich and stuck to the ribs quality.  You can't eat like that every day but if you do or are thinking about it....give LME a shot!!

First of all, if you don't know how to smile shouldn't you be working in the back? No one needs negative rude people serving you while on vacation. Was really excited to try out the food cause it looks so delicious on pictures but it wasn't that great. Also, if there is a person in front of you, it would be nice to be acknowledged.

Very expensive - even for Vegas prices. The lobster grilled cheese is basically a crab grilled cheese - Underwhelming with a minimum amount of lobster. The CT lobster roll was also underwhelming, and tasted unusually fishy - not fresh. I wouldn't try this place again. The fries were good.

My first trip here was pretty disappointing. Tried the lobster roll and the lobster mac and cheese. The roll was light and not too rich, but it was bland overall. The fries were standard. The coleslaw was ok...not anything special. The lobster mac and cheese was really bad. The lobster was ok, but the Mac and cheese was dried out and gritty. I've had better lobster mac as appetizers at places that don't specialize in lobster. If lobster is your thing, all your lobster dishes should be stellar.

Being from New England, I have eaten many lobster rolls and have to say they ruined this one with the stripe of mayo in the bottom of the roll and the nasty Old Bay Seasoning smothering the top of it.  A traditional Maine Lobster roll should be lightly tossed in mayo with finely chopped celery on a buttered roll. That's all it should be. Mac & cheese was bland, tater tots greasy and the whole experience over priced. 2 lobster rolls, 2 drinks and mac & cheese over $60!! really.

I'm thankful that my friend brought me to this place or else I would've never discovered it. I ordered the Maine Style Lobster Roll. Melts in your mouth and makes you want seconds. Coming back the next time I'm in Vegas! *No longer limited to Earl's*

Ooof, yikes.  I was reallllllly excited to try this place when we came to Vegas, because I'm kind of obsessed with lobster.  But this place was really disappointing.  We ordered the lobster bisque and their lemonade, and both were just...bad.  The bisque was extremely bland, no flavor whatsoever.  It didn't even really have a lobster taste to it, it was just some sort of general "soup."  The lemonade, which I was also really excited about because I'm a lemonade freak, was wayyyyyy too sweet.  Like, made my tongue hurt sweet.  The employees here were very friendly however, and the service was pretty quick.  Maybe I'm an idiot and don't learn, but under the right circumstances I'd maybe come back to try their lobster mac and cheese or lobster roll, which seems to be their pride and joy.  But definitely stay away from the bisque, and don't drink the lemonade unless you like developing diabetes on the spot.

Came here last week for a late dinner. Ordered a lobster roll, lobsicle, and bisque. Cost quite a bit more than I was expecting for a food court style shop. But hey, it's lobster.  The lobster is definitely legit. You get decent sized portions considering it is lobster. The lobsicle which I got grilled looked tiny for $14 USD. But again, it's lobster, and relatively speaking it was a relatively decent size of meat. I guess I was a little deceived after seeing a picture of it on their menu. Nevertheless it was quite delicious.  The roll was not bad and had decent chunks of lobster meat. But I felt it was eerily similar to the lobster roll I get at the local hockey area for half the price.     The soup I could have done without.   Unless you absolutely craving lobster at some exact moment you walk by this place in Vegas, I personally would probably eat elsewhere.

This place is in one of the hotels in Vegas in a small food court. It has all things lobster. However, as a mid court place implies, it was not the greatest. Then again, what silly person has lobster in a food court. Our mistake. The only thing that was kind of good was the lobster bisque. The lobster sandwich was lame with a small amount of lobster in it and the croquet was soggy. If you want lobster, don't eat it at a food court. Lesson learned.
Favorite dish is the lobster mac. It's really good and super filling
So good. My first experience with a lobster grilled cheese and it was amazing. Will be going back for sure next time I'm in Vegas
Good amount of lobster on the roll and the bun was nicely toasted. Definitely a bit on the pricey side though ($17 for a large,$24 xl) which prevented us from ordering about five of them each
Very good lobster rolls in a couple of different options - cold or warm. Line is a bit long. Many things a la carte so even though you think its cheap... it isn't really.

I was looking for this and happened to just stumble across it, while waiting in line at Fat Tuesdays. I got the Lobster Grilled cheese and the lobster Mac & Cheese. The Mac & Cheese was awesome!!!  I would definitely go back just for that.. however the grilled cheese was more like shredded lobster salad with too much mayonnaise.... no bueno... I was expecting succulent chunks of lobster and creamy brie or something... oh well, its worth a try!
The food was great the service was great of course when you're by and lobster it's a little expensive but if you're on a lobster lover like me I would recommend it and I'm going back

What a total disappointment :( Located in the Miracle Miles of Planet Hollywood, this is definitely an overpriced food stand. It costs $17 for a lobster roll the size of my iPhone 5! Or possibly even smaller.. I understand lobster rolls are small and with the obvious lobster meat, but this one didn't even have the taste to back it up. Don't even bother with the clam chowder. It was seriously the worst clam chowder I have ever had!! I poured 4 packets of the pepper into it just to add a little flavor. Ughs. Friends did enjoy their lobster mac & cheese.

The Connecticut is amazing! I didn't think it was going to be so good, but I ate that thing so fast. I literally died after the first bite. The diablo is super spicy. I thought I could handle it but the level of spice is like 10 out of 10. Think of the spiciest Indian or Thai dish and times that by infinity. The first few bites aren't bad until you finish the roll and you suddenly realize that your mouth is a furnace and you need milk quick. Don't try the diablo unless your stomach is made of steel. You'll have crazy poops. Portions are small but the fries helped fill me up.

Located just before you reach the food court in the Venetian by the gondolas, Lobster ME is better than it needs to be. Rolls approaching the $20 mark are not huge but packed with meat instead of filler, and served with kettle chips and a side of coleslaw- a $4 upcharge will get you fries and a drink. If you don't want a roll, the fish and chips features haddock and is a generous portion.  Service was quick considering their steady business. I appreciated the sriracha and other hot sauces available on the table to kick up your seafood. Add a Maine Root root beer to complete your order. Seating is somewhat limited, mosey down the hall a hundred feet for additional seating if needed.  Note that they currently have a promotion to join their email list and get free fries with your purchase. Not bad.

Tried this place on my most recent trip to Vegas and so glad we did! We had the lobster philly, grilled lobsicle with garlic butter, and lobster Mary (Bloody Mary). All were delicious! I wish we had a Lobster ME in Illinois! Prices were a bit high, but it's Vegas and on the strip (inside Planet Hollywood) so I wasn't surprised! I would definitely come back again!

It's almost a public service to have a restaurant that includes lobster in most menu items, and this establishment for the most part delivers. The lobster sandwiches taste good, but I'm not a fan of how they serve it in a way that makes it impossible to eat like an adult. The lobster strips practically sit on top of the roll instead of actually inside of it. I also wish the portions were bigger. Not a fan of the waffle fries. Lobster mac n'cheese was "okay". Service was friendly and courteous, and didn't have to wait too long for my order. In town for a work conference and it helped hit the lobster spot.

The ravings are real. Stop by for your lobster roll craving. Its def worth trying out. I was hesitant after going to all the other raving joints in vegas but this one will be worth hitting up. Prepare your wallets. Get the classic lobster roll, dont get fancy n try to get other things. Thats all you need
I've always wanted to try a lobster roll. it was on something like a hot dog bun,  dry and bland. I can check this off the food bucket list with a meh. disappointing for $30!

I went here because a friend of mine posted some pics on Facebook and I wanted to check it out. This location is located inside the Planet Hollywood. We went on a friday night which was probably a bad idea. The place was pretty packed. We actually didn't have any place to sit when we first put in our order. We got lucky though and snagged two tables later on. Just so everyone is aware this place has very little seating. What is frustrating is you'll see one person sitting at a table not even eating and the only thing you're thinking about is where the fuck am I gonna eat this lol. I gave two stars for the food which isn't bad. I ordered the lobster and chips and I got the lobsicle. I didnt return the food because I was so hungry I just ate it. I was pretty disappointed that they screwed up my order. They don't give you many french fries so if you order anything with fries they really skimp on them. I ate my meal and I was still hungry. Luckily my sister inlaw gave me some of her lobster mac and cheese which was just ok. This place isn't cheap. The meal's dont come with drinks. I ordered a Sprite and they charged me $3.00 plus tax and it was a small cup. It's not a bad place if you happen to be at Planet Hollywood and you want to get your Lobster on but I would'nt make a special trip. One more thing, they're suppose to give you a 20% locals discount but this location didn't do that. I think it's fucking bullshit because I know they honor this at the other location at the Venetian.

I love this chain. Mainly because I have no access to anything like it when at home. But at least on the strip there are several accessible locations from one end to the other. Conveniently located in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood, Lobster ME has plenty of seating and quick service. There are several lobster roll options, soups, and more. I had the lobster grilled cheese. It has a nice amount of lobster on some gooey cheese and definitely hits the spot. I would eat here every day if I could afford it.

Located in the Miracle Mile Mall by Planet Hollywood. Free parking out back definitely worth trying items here are made to order and fresh. Friendly reminder staff spoke with the GM cool guy they have plans to do specials like the crab fries running currently. Very casual a little pricey but hey it's high quality and it's Maine lobster so get over it and give it a try!

Had CT lobster roll with Cajun fries!! Very yummy!! 17$ for roll and 4$ for fries and soda. Only downside is the seating! It's to small!! Need more room for the masses of people! I thought the food was really good. It's like fast food lobster!!

I don't know anything about the other items but avoid the lobster cheese fries! They don't give you a lot for $14. The fries were disappointing, the lobsters were disappointing and even the presentation was disappointed. I immediately regretted this. just trust me don't try this!
Tried lobster roll and fried shrimp were amazing.... would definitely eat here again....

My friend and I actually accidentally ran into this place after talking about it being in Miracle Mile Shops!  And boy was I glad we found it!   I'm def a crab type of girl when it comes to shellfish.. but Lobster Me got my friend and I with their Lobster Grilled Cheese and Lobster Mac N Cheese! Both filled with tons of lobster meat and different cheeses!  As to some dishes you get tired of the cheesiness.. These two, on the other hand, had us finishing every bite -- two cheesy dishes that didn't have the same cheeses and lobster def balanced it out!  Will definitely be back for the other items!

Dear lord, please avoid this place. I wasn't even hungry but the pictures looked pretty appetizing so I stopped to grab a lobster roll. Picked up the old bay flavor roll and it comes with home made chips and a side of coleslaw. The chips felt a little stale and the coleslaw just tasted rancid. As far as the roll, I couldn't have been more disappointed. The lobster pieces felt rubbery, kinda like they were previously frozen pieces and they recooked them before serving it. Totally not worth $20+ and I'm most definitely not going to give this place a 2nd try.

expensive but good. they actually give you lobster claw pieces in their lobster roll.  skip the lobster bisque.  Not worth it. just go to earl's and get a cup of chicken noodle instead.  i got the cajun garlic fries! amazing but didnt give enough.  I wouldnt go out of my way to get it since earl's is down the way for 1/4 of the price!
Went here on a Rec from an old friend and it didn't disappoint. The lobster roll was huge and so tasty and coupled with the fries it made a perfect lunch. Wish a place like this was in Chicago
My favorite lobster roll place. Any of the lobster rolls are great. Also add the combo and get the blueberry lemonade and lobster bisque. The cajun fries are delicious too.

My favorite lobster roll place. If I see this place I'm going to stop by and get a lobster roll. Any lobster roll is amazing. I also recommend the combo to get the blueberry lemonade and lobster bisque soup. Cajun fries are delicious too. Can't go wrong with anything here.

Again, hangover food at its best. Lobster bisque and lobster grilled cheese sandwich are AMAZEBALLS. It's so good that I would book a room at Planet Hollywood again just so I can roll out of bed the next morning and shovel food into my mouth.  One MINOR gripe though: they were slow on giving me and my roommate our morning tea. But who needs tea when you have alcohol in Vegas?

Located inside of a miracle mile shops connected to Planet Hollywood.  I tried their lobster mac and cheese for $12.  I have to say it had chunks of lobster (it better for $12) and mac and cheese flavor was pleasantly good.  One star down as I thought it was way too cheesy!

We got two sandwiches here with no  drinks, $45. My lobster roll did not have big claw pieces like the pictures, it was all very small meat and zero claws. Very dry and I had to ask for mayo. There was a lemon wedge includedbut it was underneath the waffle fries for some reason. Wife had the grilled cheese  lobster that had some small chunks of claw meat. Ok food, very friendly cashier, but not a cheap fast food option.

Some of the best lobster I've ever had! We got the lobster grilled cheese, Mac and cheese and lobster roll. Definitely coming back next time I'm in las Vegas. The manager Jeff was also very helpful with recommendations! Highly recommend!

I came here in August with a bunch of buddies for a bachelor party.  They normally rave about this place but honestly, I have had better.  The Lobster tastes good but the cashiers screwed up multiple orders in our group.  They just kept getting things wrong.  It should be something as simple as confirming they are pressing the correct button on the cash register as what the customer as saying and then confirming that what they are bringing to you matches what is on the receipt.  They shouldn't be leaving it up to the customers to show them a receipt and ask them why what they were given doesn't match what is on the register receipt.
Was so yummy!  I recommend Lobster me if you love lobster like I do. It's the real deal.
Small portion of lobster on toasted roll. Only a few tables to sit at and tables were not cleaned after each patron/patrons left. Service a little slow.

We stopped here after the Koi Yelp event since we were still a bit hungry. It is located inside of the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood.  It is an interesting location for a restaurant such as this, but whatever works. It was close to 10pm and I expected a moody employee who was done for the day, but when we got to the counter we got just the opposite. The girl working the counter was very friendly and sweet.; we joked, made small talk about Yelp and she offered some suggestions. Kudos for great service! We opted for the Lobster Bisque and a Lobster Roll to share. The bisque was served in a bread bowl and was nothing short of absolutely delicious. The lobster roll was very good as well - they did not skimp on lobster at all! The price with tip for those two items came to be around $31 which was not bad for the quality and quantity of the food there. but it is still relativley pricey. And of course, can't forget the great service.

My wife and I love this place. Best lobster sandwich we ever had.  We ordered the Connecticut and lobster was huge and very fresh. We got the combo with lemonade and chowder fries which were also pretty good. Would definitely come back and try other flavours.

Sooo good. We had the Connecticut at Venetian and we wandered all the way to planet Hollywood and tried the lobster tacos which was also very good. Lots of lobster and very yummy. We had the soup combo and had the lobster bisque but thought it was so so. My wife loves this place and I bet you will too :)

The lady taking orders was very rude. Took my order for the fried Mac and cheese balls then 10 mins told me that they were out but refused to refund my money. Then another waiter said they weren't out. Needless to say very confusing...all I know is I did not get my cheese balls and was charged.
I'm literally standing here waiting for my food watching an employee on crutches work harder than anyone else.  Bravo Brian, you are rare

I can't say I am the lobster roll expert, but this lobster roll was a tasty two bites that did not disappoint. I shared it with a friend and I had two bites. It is small...very small. I've had lobster rolls before and this was on the smaller side. The bread was buttered and greasy and the lobster was buttery. Who wouldn't enjoy that? $17 for a roll.   The lobster Mac and cheese wasn't my favorite. The cheese had a fake taste like instant Mac and cheese type taste. $12  I'm guessing if you're on the strip and drunk willing to blow some money or you just happen to be there and you were hungry, you would probably enjoy your meal. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.
The Crab Roll served Old Bay Style is amazing! My fiancé got the Lobster Roll served Maine Style and he loved it! We will definitely be back

My first lobster roll was at this location. I ate one of their rich and buttery sandwiches and I was hooked. They left me on a quest to discover other places that may be serving these decadent sandwiches.  About a pound of lobster goes into each roll and yes, the prices can be daunting for some. A meal is easily $45+ for 2, but it's so worth it IMO.   Look out for coupons if you are staying in surrounding hotels or coupon books u can pick up at the Miracle Miles guest services.  The venetian location had a 20 or 25% off a sandwich and the coupon at Miracle miles included a 16 oz beer with the purchase of a lobster roll ;)

For our second visit here, we ordered many things:  lobster and chips, lobster and waffles, lobster bisque, cajun fries and the original lobster roll.  The original lobster roll wasn't as memorable as the first time we ate it.  The lobster roll was overflowing with lobster.  I really liked the waffles and the lobster bisque though.  The waffles were soft and delicious.  The lobster bisque was superb also, served in a bread bowl.  We were beyond stuffed and will probably come back again.

The wait wasn't too bad considering its dinner on a Friday. I ordered the original Maine style lobster roll and I must say its a decent sandwich considering its not imitation crab meat it's the new thing. Probably the only place to eat a lobster in Las Vegas for $17 bucks. The meat is chewy and juicy. Nicely seasoned with the celery tho I forgot there was mayo in it. All in all a good sandwich roll. Servers are nice too. Might try next Vegas trip.

Located in the Grand Canal Shoppes this is a great place to get a quick bite to eat and still eat luxuriously. Lobster galore, prepared in a multitude of ways. Taco, grilled cheese, lobster on a stick, and lobster roll served cold with mayo or warm with melted butter. I chose the Connecticut which is served warm and melted butter, the lesser of the two evils. I enjoyed the roll and it's a great option if you are in a hurry and have serious shopping to do.

Lobster on a stick!?!?! Seriously all of my dreams have officially come true.   Great chunk of lobster grilled to perfection with butter on a stick. I cannot say anything more other than you should go try one immediately.
The staff is incredible, and the food is even better! The Connecticut was warm, buttery and amazing!
1st off i walked all the way around to find  the place and i order the signature lobster roll for 23 bucks and i get a baby roll with about $5 dollars worth of crab and lobster . What a rip off

i saw this place and told my brother this is your kind of place, not knowing really how good it was, just that he likes lobster, and i had gave up my room at planet hollywood so he could stay there so it was very accessible to him. when he finally did eat here, the following day, he ate here everyday and sometimes twice. and against my will he forced a lobster sandwich on me when i told him i was full ( i thought how good could it be?). so i took it back to the room and left it on the table. the next morning i knew i wouldn't have time to get a bite to eat, so i opened the bag took out the sandwich and took a bite and thought omg omg omg, cold and old this sandwich was still spectacular. i don't think it even had mayo in it, but rather crack, because it was so tasty and made you wanting more. mind you, if i went there, not knowing anything, i would have not ordered a 22 dollar sandwich, but man this sandwich was worth every penny. but if i go there i definitely will. when we left vegas my brother went online and ordered from here one more time. it's that good.

Really good fast food, but at a high price.  While on vacation, my sisters boyfriend was tasked with showing me some of the local eats, at least something that you can find during late hours. I haven't been to the Miracle Mile Shops, but essentially, it's a mall that includes night life and eating places.  After traveling towards the center of the place, you can find Lobster Me, located right next to a Fat Tuesday, if you want one of those big margarita drinks that everyone walks around with. The place itself is only a usual mall-foodcourt type of storefront, so it's a free-for-all on seating, which isn't much in the direct area. It might be hard to find seating, especially if you're with a group, because there are a lot of people bumbling around, especially at night.  There were a lot of things that I wanted to try on the menu, but there lies a small endeavor, everything is crazy expensive. I know that it's seafood, lobster to be specific, but it was a bit expensive in my opinion. Expect to spend around $8-15 for most stuff on the menu.  I had the Lobster & Chips (you know, fish and chips, but lobster). I also upgraded my fries to calamari fries. I originally was just aiming for the regular clam chowder fries as my only dish, but I had some leeway on my budget, so I spent a little more. The lobster nuggets were pretty good, and the cam chowder fries helped round off the meal. I've had calamari fries at other places, but this one is just as good.  Definitely worth a try, check it out, but I wouldn't come here that often, simply because of the price.

My wife and I decided to try this place out. I'm not much of a lobster person. We tried the lobster grilled cheese which was good. Not much lobster in it but I think I've decided I don't really like lobster. There wasn't anything wrong with it but just not my taste.   The clam chowder fries on the other hand was bomb! The chowder was really delicious. I think next time I'd order the chowder itself because it was so good. They smother it on the fries. This was a surprise that it was that good! Definitely will try this place again the next time I'm in Vegas!

walking ...tired... hey a lobster place? gotta try something!  it all looked awesome but couldnt go for an $18 lobster roll (damn blackjack tables) so i sprang for a cup of lobster ice cream and a lobster shooter...both  were quite impressive...good size chunks of lobster in the ice cream, rich and sweet enough to veil the lobsterness not cover it up...the shooter was tasty chunky but half the shooter glass and no black caviar on top as pictured. lobster on a stick looked good but $14..maybe 10 bucks, will try lobster mac next time...

So as my girls and I were waiting 4 our table @ burGR, we decided to walk around and we were hungry and looking for a snack.  We came upon this place. Lobster ice cream.  I'm a HUGE fan of lobster (thanks BOSTON!)  So we ordered a lobster and chips. . . it was over battered and fries were over cooked. The only good thing was the margaritas.   Service sucked.  Young girls with attitudes, rolling their eyes @ us.  This will never be as good as the ones in Boston.
Cold lobster meat thrown haphazardly into a slit on a roll. Not much going for it in taste or serving size. Served with fries for about $30? Will not be coming back.

Quality lobster rolls!  I have been to Lobster Me for a few times during my recent Vegas trip. The restaurant is located in a mall connected to Planet Hollywood hotel and it does not offer any table service. Customers order at the counter and then pick up at the registry when called.   The menu of lobster roll is simple but offers good varieties. My favorites are the Maine Lobster and Cajun lobster roll. There are generous portion of lobster meat inside each roll and the bun is super soft and served warm. Standard lobster rolls come with coleslaw as well.  As for prices, lobster roll is around $19 each, which is OK considering it is Vegas. I find one lobster roll may not be filling enough for dinner and you may need to supplement the meal with fruits/salad/soup to feel full.   Overall, a decent place for Lobster roll.
Disappointed with the size of lobster roll. Very small. Macaroni was ok. Will not eat there ever again.

I came here during one of my visits within past 6 months. I decided to bring hubby here since he is a sandwich lover. He fell in love. We came here the next day as well. We love the Beltway much better than regular lobster roll. If you check in on Yelp, there is usually some kind of chowder you get for free. I am just addicted to the cheese lobster fries. It is mandatory included in my order. The mac & cheese was good but doesn't beat the fries. This is definitely a place to stop by for us during our next Vegas visit

I found Lobster Me while wandering through the Miracle Mile shops. A fast food joint that specializes in lobster while in a casino mall in the middle of a desert? Yeah, it seems so weird that I had to try it. I got the lobster bisque in a bread bowl with a side of hash browns. The bisque was a nice creamy texture...but I didn't get too much lobster meat in it. Actually, I don't know that I found any lobster in it. The hash browns were crispy golden deliciousness though.
The lobster roll itself is actually almost 4.5 stars, the salad we got is aprox a 3-star but it is kinda pricey, yeah yeah I know its lobster but still; its a casual fast-food type service.

This was my first time eating at this location I ordered the deep fried lobster and the lobster on the stick and a lobster sandwich I informed the manager  the lobster lobster was ice cold in the middle the lobster sandwich they remade it but left it on the counter for 15 minutes the lobster macaroni and cheese was the worst thing I have a look that I would not recommend this location at all The only reason why I gave this a one star was looking over the sports bar other than that the manager at the time she was dizzy and confused she didn't even offer to remake my order or to correct it.

I was so disappointed coming back to this location the lobster had a fishy smell taste awful the lobster sandwich I literally spit it out of my mouth the deep fried lobster the better came right off it was not crunchy it was more like biting into oil lobster The grilled lobster was raw in the middle and it taste like it was spoiled The reason I went to this location was the corporate office asked me to redo my order she told me she'll have everything taken care of but when I got there they had no idea of what was going on I informed the corporate office that I was going back with my family and kids so she told me she'll take care of my order but it was more like give him the spoiled seafood I will not definitely ever tried this location or their other locations at all. KRISTEN Marketing manager YOU Ask me to come back just to make me sick  of you're seafood. After tasting your food it made me sick. To My stomach, you made me assume the second time the food would've been at least eatable if I could have given this my opinion they should close it down this food is unhealthy on safe to eat. The quality of their seafood is probably a very low-grade lobster you shouldn't even say your seafood comes from Maine I no what is good fresh seafood taste like but this was just not acceptable at all.
Long wait for food (when there was no line to order), pretty low quality on the sandwich -- had the lobster mcmuffin, pretty gross and not even assembled together

We were running a little late for a concert at the Venetian theater. The food court is in a super convenient location for the theater. It is just up the escalator from the entrance so it is ideal for a fast meal before the concert. I had seen the poster for Lobster Me on the walk into the venue and was excited about trying lobster as a fast food. This is a walk up counter where you place your order and then find the table. Then they bring your food to the table. They have a couple of different options for ordering the lobster. Since it was my first time here, the person behind the counter told us the most popular lobster roll is the Maine lobster roll. Decided to try that one. What you get is a small paper tray with the lobster roll, very small side of coleslaw, and about 10 homemade potato chips scattered on the bottom. in fairness the 4 or 5 forkfuls of coleslaw that made up the side of coleslaw was actually quite tasty. And the homemade potato chips were quite good. The lobster roll however, was not. The best way I could describe it was a little bit of shredded lobster in a sea of mayonnaise on what looked like a piece of toasted white bread that they called a roll. I am used to not getting a lot for my money when you eat on the strip, but 17 bucks for this I feel is a total rip off.

It's pricy but overall it is so so delicious ! I got the lobster mac & cheese ( warning : portions are small) . After I was done I decided to get lobsicle and Cajun fries. Cajun fries is delicious but the lobsicle not worth it for $14 bucks. Very small

Very fun new food court style restaurant.  I don't live on the east coast, but do love lobster.  We had lobster rolls and the lobster bisque.  I've had  better bisque, but the lobster roll was very darn tasty.   If you are looking for a change and something a little different, give it  try.   Yes, it's pricey, but the word lobster should equate with $$.  It's not artificial meat.

The Connecticut is fucken bomb, cooked lobster on buttered bread. It could be bigger for the price and it isn't so filling, but I'd still order it again. Their cajun fries taste a little too garlicky for me and the Mac n cheese was pretty good, not too cheesy/creamy but still tasty.

I had Lobster Me for brunch on our last day on the strip. I went with the Lobster & Eggs with Tater Tots.  The eggs were okay, the lobster in them didn't really taste like anything. So that was pretty disappointing. The tater tots were fantastic, but you can't go wrong with tater tots :D  What I did really enjoy was the Lobster Ice Cream! Maple Ice Cream with bits of Lobster? OMG! The sweetness of the maple and the salty of the lobster balanced each other out nicely.   I'm not downing this place just yet over one dish. I do plan on trying something else next time I'm in the area and I'll definitely be coming back for the ice cream!
So good!! Definitely worth your money. The lobster was warm and buttery and the bread was really soft. Highly recommend!

Food:  I ordered the original Maine lobster roll.  My fiancee ordered the clam chowder.  Both were pretty good meals.  Food rating:  4/5  Service  Service here is decent.    Service rating:  3.5/5  Price:  Expect to pay about $12+ per item  Overall:  Good late night place to snack on.

Just had a great lunch but more importantly watched the team of Susan and Yvonne. The two performed impeccably during the lunch rush. The interaction is flawless, a choreographer couldn't improve the system they have. A must for a great lunch and a must see in action.

This place is a ripoff! $20 for a lobster roll the size of a slider?? You have to eat standing up since they dont have enough tables, the tables are always dirty and the roll has just maybe 2 oz of lobster if much. Complete ripoff!

If you are really hungry and price conscious this place isn't for you. Way too over priced. Had lobster and chips, was ok but had 3 small pieces Of lobsters and a handful of fries which they could have added more since fries are the least expensive of the ingredients. If you want softdrink make sure you specify just a little ice or they will literally fill the cup with ice and refill are $2. One of their staff even  "agreed" with me that the lobster Mac and cheese tasted a bit bitter and dry. Instead of saying I'll pass your concern to the chef or the manager, he smiled and stated "I agree" it's like saying we have bad food but we serve it anyways!! Definitely not going back. If I want to spend that money on lunch, I rather go to Red Lobsters..
I had a Cajun lobster sub or whatever...amazing is an understatement. I could eat it every day!
Worst food on the face of this planet staff was very disorganized and sloppy. The manger Kelly was very rude and unprofessional. I wouldn't suggest my worst enemy to waste there money on this dump

This place gets an "eh" for effort. A friend and I ordered some things to go (we were staying at Planet Hollywood and were planning to eat in our room).  We waited around 15-20 minutes for our food, then went up to the rooms. When we got back, we realized they missed 2 lobsicle orders (worth half our order). So we had to go back down and ask for them. The comped is drinks, which was nice. What wasn't nice were the overlooked grilled lobster tails the size of my index finger, served with plain cabbage and what was undoubtedly imitation butter.  The rest of the food (signature lobster roll and loaded crab fries) were ok, if not a tad salty. There were also some crab shell fragments in the fries that was not pleasant to bite into.  The people working there were nice, but I still wouldn't return for the quality of food for the price (and in Vegas, you can definitely do a lot better).

I stumbled across this place whilst walking through the Miracle Mile during my vacation last year ... Frozen icy alcoholic beverage in one hand and an empty stomach meant there was no chance I would go past this place without buying something. After a little bit of alcohol, your body always craves something fried and greasy and what better way to sate this craving than to have fried lobster meat and fries ??  Granted this quite an expensive snack, it is still cheap if you're from Australia and used to paying with a pound of flesh when it comes to anything seafood ! I would come back here if I'm passing through Planet Hollywood and in need of a quick snack!

I had the lobster grilled cheese and my husband had the fish and chips. The grilled cheese was extremely rich. I got to a point where I just couldn't finish it. It cost $15 just for the grilled cheese and an additional $4 to get fries and a drink. My husband's fish and chips were "nothing special" and he said his fries were too salty. His meal cost $12 and an additional $3 to add on a drink. The table behind us got the Lobsticle, which is a lobster tail on a stick. It costs $15, comes with nothing, and is only as big as an index finger and middle finger put together. If I EVER went back I would try the lobster rolls. It seems like that was the decent way to go but still overpriced.
