Fried lobster on a stick.. awesomeness. I ordered that along with a lobster roll and lobster mac n cheese. The stick was by far the best. The Cajun lobster roll was very good. The mac n cheese was ok. Not much lobster in it and the flavor wasn't anything extraordinary. But i would definitely go back for that lobster roll.

A friend of mine recently moved to Maine and has been torturing me via social media with constant pictures of lobster rolls. Did you know, out by Bangor, they have vending machines that sell lobster dirt-cheap that are restocked daily?! That's crazy!  Lobster ME doesn't have vending machines, but they do have lobster rolls- stick to the classic Original Maine style with a touch of mayo and spices, or dare to try the new Beltway version with Old Bay, shallots, chives, and breadcrumbs. Anything else is blasphemous.   If you're really feeling daring, add on the chowder fries and a drink for an extra $6- they're like chili cheese fries, but with chowder instead of chili, plus green onions and bacon bits. They're downright intoxicating, if you have the calories to spare.  Bonus star for quick service and 20% off local discount- it's a smallish (hot-dog sized) but meaty roll for $17, which is actually on par with pricing in other landlocked states (so minimal Strip markup?), but the discount makes it especially nice. A $20 lunch, which is pretty much the minimum for the Strip, and the quality is actually really good for a food court-style setting.

Tried the Cajun Lobster Roll, Lobster Tacos, Lobster Mac & Cheese... My family and I enjoyed all of if! Fresh, good flavor and great service! And while we waited for our food, got ourselves a Fat Tuesday! Woohoo!

To be honest, I don't think I've had a better lobster roll, I just don't love them enough to justify giving them a 5*.  I had the lobster roll with a garlic butter and herb sauce. There was plenty of lobster and their fries were crispy and perfect as a side. The coleslaw was pretty average but that's not what I'm judging here.  The lobster bun was a good size and was perfectly golden brown. A nice, quick meal at a reasonable price considering its lobster and Las Vegas
The lobster roll is killer. Stars just for the roll.

First time diner/big time fan.  Got the Connecticut Roll (butter instead of mayo) Combo with fries and a drink.  Delicious and plenty to eat for lunch.  And all (including a little slaw) for under $25).  Counter service was friendly and efficient.  Seating is limited but not really a problem.

Decent lobster rolls. I've had better and bigger (that's what she said) but it isn't terrible, so if you've never had a lobster roll before ...you may think this is da bomb. But trust me.. There's better

I stopped in for a quick bite before heading back to the airport & I'm glad I did! I ordered the original lobster roll with fries & coleslaw. The bread was soft with a light crunch.....the lobster was well seasoned.....& the coleslaw was the best that I've had (next to my moms). The service was grade A & the food was even better. The atmosphere was rather lively & full of conversation. The employees were attentive & offered suggestions on local sights & shows. Overall my experience was good considering that this location is inside the hotel/food court.
Gimmicky...as far as the "Lobsicle" and bisque. Avoid. The lobsicle was tasty but was tiny..Not worth the $. The bisque was watered down. Ive had better bisque from costco.

I've been here before and tried the Connecticut lobster roll (I love lobster rolls) and knew I would go back to try the rest of their menu which we did this time. This time there was a few of us so we got a couple of items: The Frenchy (brie/lobster panini), the Lobster Grilled Cheese, the Beltway (lobster sandwich with old bay seasoning), the Lobster Cheese Fries and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. We went lobster crazy! The Frenchy (is the sandwich I had myself) is very light breading if you want something lighter than the grilled cheese. The grilled cheese was good too! All of it was good. Between the cheese fries and the mac and cheese, I preferred the mac and cheese. It just seemed like the lesser of two evils! Haha.  I believe our cashier/server was named Ronnie, she was super helpful! Definitely hit up this spot of you have a hankering for some lobster everything.

The pics look good but it's really just ok. Lobster was flavorless due to the fact that the lobster meat were previously frozen and not fresh. Nonexistent flavor. Freshness Would've made a world of difference. Considering it was more fast food and really pricey. $16 lobster roll, $12 lobster Mac n cheese (not baked or anything neat, just plain ol Mac n cheese with lobster meat thrown on top) eh. Eh.
I super love the grilled lobster tail here. It is so flavorful and yummy.  It is $14 without tax for 1 tail and I think it's worth the price. They also have clam chowder which is good too.

Came for a quick dinner with the family.  I had the Cajun Lobster Roll with fries , and my husband had The Beltway Lobster Roll.  Both were delicious!  Don't let the small size fool you; it's packed with sweet lobster meat and spices. They need a franchise in Atlanta.

Had lunch here today with my husband.  We ordered the Diablo lobster roll, lobster mac and cheese and a 24 oz can Corona beer.  The cost was $18, $12, and &10 plus tax.  My goodness, $10 for a can of beer???  The nice restaurants only charge $6-7.  The lobster roll was so small, it looks more like 1/2 a serving, it's ridiculous that they charge you $18.  The lobster mac and cheese was also very small with some bits of chopped up lobster bits.  There was no cheese in the mac and cheese that I could taste. The lobster roll tasted good but the portion is just crazy little.  Won't be coming back.

The staff was friendly but the lobster was waaaay over cooked. It literally felt like chewing rubber bands. If the name is LOBSTER Me..... There's really no room for error on a lobster roll seeing as it's the main attraction. I had chowder fries they were awesome. I wouldn't return due to the over cooked lobster. They got two stars because the staff was super nice.

It's $18 for a lobster, chips and a slaw - it's really good, but worth that price? If you really wanted lobster you can pay $6 more at some of the neighboring restaurants and get a whole lobster.... But if you are a fan of lobster rolls (like I am for philly cheese steaks) then it's worth getting one and then calling it done.
Very good lobster rolls. A bit pricey and the loster meat is cold. Baguettes are warm though. Worth the try but I have had similar quality for less price, but hey it's Vegas.

I ordered the 2 lobster tacos.  I would have like the lobster meat to be a little warmer but they were still enjoyable.  The kid's mac and cheese is great.  I also ordered a bread bowl with the cup of clam chowder to take home.  The clam chowder was very watery and not thick at all so I would check it out if you plan to order it.  Very friendly staff.

Good service! Fast food preparation! And amazing food. My first time here with my buddy and we got the lobster roll which was so amazing that we ordered the grilled cheese lobster to go for the road. I would definitely recommend this spot!

Why is lobster have to be so expensive!?  Anyways lobster roll here is pretty solid. Huge chunks of meat in a soft roll. Crappy fries accompanied in a meal, but you don't probably care about the fries...  Jello shots next door at fat Tuesday while you wait, mmmkay?

This was an accidentally find in Venetian/Palazzo (I never know which is which or where I'm at).   The sandwiches are ~$17 and are pretty small, about the length of my hand.  But they're filling and good so I don't have any issues. If you have a huge appetite though, it may not be enough for you! One of us got the combo for $4 (drinks + fries) and I didn't care for the fries. They say they're "beer battered" and it just makes the outer part so thick and crunchy, not my favorite.   It was a good one-time try and a nice sandwich but nothing I'd rush back for or crave.

Used a coupon I found in a booklet that was in my hotel room.  Get a free beer with a lobster roll.  They kindly substituted a large soda for a beer.  Thanks!  Good service all the way around.  The roll was super tasty, not filled with celery or such.  The lobstersicle was expensive, but tasty.  I felt that lobster didn't need to be deep fried, so my lobster tail was broiled and came with drawn butter.  Small but tasty.    Dine at tables in front of the food stand inside the Miracle Mile mall.

Loved it! My husband and I went to have lunch here twice during our recent visit to Vegas and its delish! We both got the lobster rolls (sandwiches) and loved them. The flavor is great and the amount of lobster on the sandwich is impressive. A must try.

As a lobster lover, I do love Lobster ME!!! Various flavor you can choose, I do suggest Connecticut lobster roll!!! And also clam chowder~~~ So if you visit Venetian, lobster ME is one of the best fast food  choices. The only con is the price is high.
The Lobster Roll & French Fries was delicious with generous portions.  Friends had the knuckle sandwich and they also said it was excellent. We were all disappointed with the Lobster Mac & Cheese.

Located at the main food court next to Houdini's magic shop  Really good lobster rolls, not great, but good especially for $18 for a small roll. Served 4 different styles, I tried the "original Maine" style which is served cold. I preferred it served hot but it was still good. The other styles I believe are served hot.  Lobster tasted really fresh and the garlic bun was really good. Only thing is that it needed more sauce, i believe it was a combo of mayo and something else but it was good, wish they put on more.  Way too pricey $18 for a tiny roll, it is really small and only enough for one person. It is good, but definitely not worth it in my opinion.

3 because the cashier was super cool and down to earth. Located downstairs 2nd floor from our suite in the Venetian, grand canal shops.   Rolls was ok. Seriously though 20$ for chips and sandwich. Also ordered fish and chips. Crappy! Lol fries was bomb though no lies....

Subpar when considering the price of this place. I've had far better for cheaper in Los Angeles, which is not a cheap place to dine. All in all its a good concept that was poorly executed. Food wasn't very flavorful and very dry. There are much better dining options in Vegas.

Stopped here for convenience since it was close to my hotel and on the way back. Ordered the lobster fish and chips, which came pretty fast and was a quick option. At 13 bucks...it's also not too bad of a price, especially for lobster!   Being in Vegas, I wouldn't expect good lobster/seafood at all due to the fact that the place is in the middle of the dessert, HOURS away from places to catch fish and fresh seafood. This lobster was pretty bomb though and there were pretty decently sized chunks of meat within the fried pieces of lobster.   The main thing I disliked was the location. You basically eat out on the tables in the middle of the walkways in miracle mile and there was no secluded seating area strictly for the restaurant.

I dream of the Lobsticle. Sounds gross, looks expensive, but if you LOVE lobster, and HATE cracking it open and digging it out, it's literally a RESTAURANT grade lobster piece you can just stick in your mouth. I thought for sure it'd be a junky grade seafood, but it was AMAZING. The lobster mac n cheese will surely make you die early from the oil and cholesterol but it was quiet tasty I must say.
Portions are a lot more than San Francisco! Coleslaw is a pass but comes with roll.  Some chips are soggy due to being placed with the roll. I am in love' lobsta me now! :)

Just had a lobster roll's from here the wife told me about it. This place is a little pricey  $ 20.00 + for a meal+ drink . Don't get me wrong the food was good but it ideal for a gr ok up of 4 or more people seating sucks  in the area at Planet Hollywood  in the Miracle mile shopping center

Small business located inside of Planet Hollywood and right next to Fat Tuesday!  FOOD:  Connecticut Style Lobster Roll $17 (warm lobster meat tossed in butter)  The lobster rolls here are AMAZING. Lobster tastes fresh and chunky. The bread is fat , soft on the inside, slightly crispy on the outside, and drenched in butter goodness. Only downfall is that all the lobster rolls here are very small. Even though it is served with a complimentary small salad on the side, do expect to still be hungry!  Original Maine Style Lobster Roll $17 (chilled lobster with mayo and spices)  This lobster roll equally had fresh chunky lobster. The flavorings tasted simply like lemon and pepper. Still good, but I prefer mines warm.  Clam Chowder +$4 The clam chowder was good. The soup was not gelatinous but was smooth. It had good chunks of potatoes and other good stuff.  Blueberry Lemonade $4 This drink was really good. Not too sour. Not too sweet. Just perfect.  Apple Cider $4 This drink is really unique. It doesn't have a strong apple flavor, but more of a orange spiced apple.   Overall, good places to go for quality lobster. But VERY expensive for such small portion sizes. Great place if you don't have a huge appetite!

Today I was at the Venetian and stopped in for a lobster roll. Fresh, tasty with plenty of lobster. Simply awesome. There's not much to say about the cole slaw. It has NO flavor. Service is helpful and friendly.
Fast food lobster - what could be better? I had the Lobster Mary for lunch...so perfect! Gotta love Vegas.

Little hidden gem. Worth finding. Friendly staff and good food. Next time will definitely try the grilled cheese lobster sandwich. The Cajun and original were awesome.  If you miss this one.  There is another in the mall next to planet Hollywood

The lobster roll was actually pretty good. The lobster was a little cold, which I wasn't expecting but still good. The Cajun lobster roll was a little spicy for me, but I ate most of it. It's a little pricy but they do offer a local discount.

Had the opportunity to eat here at both Vegas locations and both meals were the best I've had in a long time!  The concept here is simply amazing; simple dishes stuffed with a generous amount of lobster at a fair price. What else could you ask for?  The lobster itself tasted delicious. I tried the cajun lobster roll and the lobster grilled sandwich and they were both as good and both stuffed with lobster meat that was seasoned to perfection. The fries that I ordered with the cajun roll weren't anything special really but still good.  There's not really much else to say sbout this place. You simply have to try it if you are in Las Vegas and I promise that you won't regret it.

Love this place! Blueberry lemonade!!!   I am a fan of grilled cheese so I love the lobster melt. They have a variety of different flavors for their lobster roll too. They give you big chunks of lobsters in all their sandwiches. It is a bit pricey, given that it is lobster, but it is worth trying, especially if you cannot think of what to eat and you do not want to travel far (if you're in the Venetian or Palazzo hotel).   The clam chowder was also good. But I rather have the lobster melt that contains more lobster than the tiny clams that is in the soup.  They offer conbos too! So you can get a roll, fries (I recommend the chowder fries), and a drink for a certain amount. They also offer it for the lobster melt even though it is not listed, just ask them.

This place is overhyped. The lobster Mac and cheese is powdery and flavorless, the lobster roll needs salt and pepper and tastes strongly like rosemary, the lobster bisque is also not creamy enough and lacks that oomph that lobster bisque have. Not worth $10 for bisque and Mac & cheese, each. Also not worth $16 for the roll. The Lobsta Truck in LA is SO much better.... I am extemely disappointed...there weren't really sufficient seats in the area at Planet Hollywood. I gotta say, though, the service was really good and the staff was extra friendly. Two and a half stars. Didn't really do it for me.
lobster rolls, cajun fries , fish tacos, lobster fries. all highly recommended. very good and tastes awesome!!!!! you won't regret it. bit $$ but worth your $$

This place is ridiculous. Please don't waste your time and money.  Food 1/5 service 1/5 cleanliness 2/5 speed of service 1/5  Lobster rolls were blend, the lobster melts didn't have enough lobster in them. I couldn't taste any lobster but only cheese and butter. My family waited over 30 minutes to get our food. Lobster me did not offer appropriate apologies, even though it skipped our order and served other 3 tables first who ordered after us. .  I could find so much better food and service for same price in Vegas. It was the worst dining experience in Vegas.

Awesome Lobster Rolls, I ordered the "The Original Maine Style" and it was full of lobster and delish. Had it with a side of clam chowder which was also good. This place was amazing. I came here after the gondola ride at the Venetian.   Look forward to coming here again in my next Las Vegas trip.

I only had their lobster roll and cajun garlic fries. Some other people had received their food before us and were complaining that their bread was cold. As soon as our bread arrived I touched it and it was cold. We sent it back and got it toasted a little longer.   Overall not bad, if you've never had lobster roll in Boston before. But I've been spoiled. You get a lot of lobster but it just isn't the same. It's better than the lobster rolls in LA but definitely does not compare to Boston.   Sorry Vegas, I guess this is one of the few food items you can't replicate.   The cajun garlic fries were good. :) But not enough garlic. :(

I was in the area and saw the place, and decided to try it out as I was having a really bad seafood craving that I had to satisfy. I really had no idea what I wanted to order, but luckily for me the manager on duty at the time Jeff was extremely friendly and recommended me some of the more popular items. I decided on the loaded fries, and let me tell you that it was nothing short of spectacular! I wasn't expecting to see so much meat on the fries, so for the price it's definitely worth it. Jeff made sure to keep checking in on me, and it really made me felt cared for, which is something I really wasn't expecting when looking for a quick bite! I will definitely be coming back!

OMG. They serve lobster ice cream here? Why didn't I look at the menu closer? Darn! *face palms*   My friends and I were heading to Earl of Sandwich and then this place caught our eye. It distracted us enough to get us lost on the way to Earls. =P About 20 minutes later, with our sandwiches in hand, we come to Lobster Me to find something we can share. The menu is of course pricey. This is Vegas and can they ship fresh lobster to the desert?  The menu consists of your classic rolls, soups, fried lobster and even breakfast items. I was tempted to try the lobster waffles. Unfortunately it isn't baked in, but covering the top. I like my sweet and savory combos though. My friends and I decide on the lobster mac and cheese ($9). It comes out, relatively fresh, creamy and definitely very rich. The cheese taste sharp and not too salty. The lobster is lathered on top. And I do find little chunks of lobster spread into the pasta on the bottom. Verdict: okay. I wouldn't have it just by itself because it is way too rich. And I probably wouldn't order it again because I think the ice cream caught my eye. =)  Lobster Me is good to try once, or twice if you really like something. But it's definitely a lot of $$$ if you want to order a lot. Why not just go to a buffet and pay a little more for an unlimited amount of lobster? =P
Good food and good service for a mall-type restaurant. Five stars if there was more lobster on my frenchy lobster melt.
Lobster Mac N Cheese and a Lobster Grilled Cheese! Quick Easy and Fantastic!! this hidden little gem inside the Miracle Mile Shops in the Planet Hollywood is just that, a hidden gem.

This is my first review, nothing compelling that made me decide other than rhoji calling me out on being yelp thief. Alright, straight to business.. The food was good, it was good for food in general and as far as lobster rolls go it was the best and worst considering it was my first. I just remembered why I dont write reviews, so I apologize for wasting your time.  Pros:  Good food Entertaining atmosphere Dank mad nasty awesome seafood  Cons: Poor value Awkward seating I feel it would be better if it were hot lobster  All in all nothing special just the only place I know to get a delicious lobster roll
Lobster roll was terrific.lobster bisque came in a bread bowl and was delicious. ..all kinds of kobster dishes that u could think of here.everyone we saw looked good.

I am not going to lie, I was hesitant to get a lobster meal at a fast food place. But I was so wrong about that because the food is absolutely amazing! The food in my opinion was actually far greater than some of the sit down seafood restaurants I have been to. Husband and I ordered the Cajun Lobster Roll and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. I am drooling just thinking about it because it was that good! The place was really busy though, and seating was limited.
Here is a lobster world. I orded the lobsicle. It was just grill lobster. Lobsicle with butter and lemon. Price is little bit expensive but it so good. So delicious and chewy!!

My girlfriend's and I were walking around Planet Hollywood waiting for our table at BurGR, and we were starving, so we decided to grab a snack at this place. I loved that they had a lot of different lobster dishes, and so we decided to try the lobster & chips.   As I was waiting in line, the girl at the counter didn't call me over to tell me it was my turn, instead, just gave me a look, like, are you ready yet? Um, yeah, I'm waiting in line. The register tape ran out of paper, so she went to get some more, acting very obviously annoyed with it and slamming it down. We decided to wait at the bar adjacent to the register, since all the smaller tables were taken.   The bartender brought out my beer, with the cap on, placed it in front of me and walked away. Excuse me, the cap is still on. She says, oh, it's a twist cap. So I ask her for a napkin so I can twist the cap, and she says never mind, and proceeds to twist the cap for me with an attitude. I'm sorry, don't bartenders typically twist the cap off your beer for you when they serve it?   The lobster and chips was good. I liked the light batter around the lobster, but would have definitely liked more than 7 pieces for $13. We also sampled the lobster ice cream, not sure what to make of it, but I didn't really get it.   I was so disappointed with the service that I don't think I'll be back.

This place was SO good!  I had the lobster grilled cheese, my husband had the lobster mac n cheese, and we split some chowder fries. The fries were insanely good. They were beer batter and had a perfect crisp to them. Then there was a good amount of chowder, cheese sauce and then bacon put on top. The crisp fries became softer but not mushy which is always a plus. The lobster grilled cheese had a lot of strong cheeses in it so you must be into that in order to enjoy.... which I definitely did.  There was a good amount of lobster mixed in too, unlike a lot of other places.  The Mac and cheese looked pretty standard which was shell noodles, cheese, and lobster sprinkled on top. My husband was really full after wards though. Maybe the noodles are heavy?  My children got their own kids plain Mac and cheese. They definitely could have split one! We will definitely be back!
Great food (outstanding lobster). Manager Amber definitely cares about pleasing her customers. I will definitely come back. Great Vegas food spot.
Lobster roll had a lot of lobster. Great price fast service. Lobster chowder was alright not much lobster in it but the chowder fries were good. All in all a good place to eat

$14 for three bites of lobster is a scam. It tastes good but the portion size was the same length as one of the french fries so it's basically less of a meal than getting an ice cream cone.  Definitely not worth the money and no where near the size of the menu pictures. Either they lack decency to give all customers similar portion sizes or   it's insanely overcharging in comparison to other establishments.  Fries in the combo was less portion than Mcdonald Dollar Menu so don't  expect that to help.   Would not go back.

I like this place it's really good! 4 stars just cuz the space for this place is kinda small. I tried lobster and chips which for it was a lobster tail on a stick and fries. I thought it was suppose to be chopped up lobster pieces... Oh well still good! I took so pics of the menu cuz it seems some of the pics on here are a year old!

Came back this year and the lobster meat was a lil chewy and felt less succulent than lobster should.  Still love those lobster chowder fries though.. even better this time!  The tables all looked and felt a lil sticky..I wish they'd update the dining area to be less fast-foodie looking.

Not terrible.  It was the first night in Las Vegas fighting the jet lag and we got dinner here.  The food wasn't too heavy (it was the lobster and steak thing) with a beer.  Solid enough food if you are getting food in a food court setting.

Great servers!  The funky, skinny redhead gal was awesome. Great customer service. The lobster roll was okay. The bread overpowers the flavor & taste of the lobster. The taste of the bread was very good but I just couldn't taste the sweet, succulent lobster. $17.00 for great bread?  Fool me once; shame on you. Fool me twice; shame on me. (I won't be fooled twice).

Tried their $24 lobster roll traditional style and upgraded to crab fries and a soda. Cost over $32! I expect it to be absolutely amazing for that price.   The lobster roll was really bland and plain. No flavor at all. The crab fries has crab that looked pretty old even for canned crab. I don't think I can justify ever paying that much for what I got again.

Fast-food like joint i the middle of the Miracle Mile in Vegas. I was hoping to try the lobster ice-cream as weird as that sounds... It's intriguing. Unfortunately, they discontinued it... Sad  We had classic lobster rolls: on a cushy brioche bun they are quite good.  With fries: average. Crispy but not fresh.

So, after a so-so experience at Serendipity 3 and a walk up and down The Strip, we found ourselves at Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile shops and there before us was Lobster Me. So, instead of dessert we had one of their lobster rolls and this so delicious. The bun toasted perfectly with the right amount of butter, the lobster excellently prepared and just the right amount stuffed into the bun. and we liked it with the Angry Orchard Hard Cider - what a pairing!! Service was very nice also. Wish there was a So CA location.

Date & Time:  February 29, 2014 @ 1pm Location:  Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops Dining Companion:  The Husband Scene:  Shoppers Taking a Break in Flowy Tops, Leggings, Uggs Decor:  Order @ Counter & Seat Yourself Quick Bites Spot Service:  Fast & Efficient Imbibe:  Sodas Mediocre:  Maine Lobster Roll Total:  $30

Perfection!!!! Extraordinary!!! Words cannot adequately describe how delicious and flavorful the food is and how spectacular the service was. The entire experience was amazing!   I live in California and my mother lives in Las Vegas. I wanted to arrange to have a nice lobster dinner delivered to my mother for Mother's Day. Earlier in the week, I sent an email to Lobster Me to inquire about the options and obtain some recommendations. Kevin, the general manager was quick to respond and over the course of several days, he answered all of my numerous questions and made some excellent recommendations. I ordered the following:  Lobster Roll - Connecticut Style Lobsicle - Grilled Lobster Mac & Cheese Chowder Shrimp Cocktail Old Bay Fries  When I attempted to have the order delivered using the Postmates app, I encountered a problem. I was in panic mode and I immediately contacted Kevin. Not only did Kevin resolve the issue but he truly went above and beyond to personally make this delivery happen. The level of service that I received from Kevin was absolutely outstanding. He treated me like a Vegas VIP!!!  After my mother devoured her lobster meal she called me and she was so incredibly happy that she was almost speechless. She is a major foodie and she has impeccable taste and a very discerning palate. She told me the lobster roll was not only the most delicious lobster she has ever had, she further stated that it was one of the top two dishes she has had in her entire life!!! She said if there is food in heaven, the Lobster Me lobster roll would be there. My mom also loved the lobster mac and cheese and the seafood bacon chowder! She was too full to try the shrimp or the fries, however she indicated they looked very, very good.   Bottom line: The quality and flavor of the food was exceptional and the only thing better than the food was the outstanding level of service that Kevin provided. I have the highest praise you, Kevin. Thank you for making Mother's Day so special for my mom! You are awesome!!!

This is another one of those reviews where I'd like the ability to give a place a half a star rating.  For my money it would be a 3.5 rather than a three.  I'm taking off a half a star because while the food is very tasty, the portions are small and even for Las Vegas, I thought $17 for the size lobster roll was steep.  For an additional $4 you can have a drink and fries instead of home made chips.  The fries were good, obviously home made and not out of a package, but again, small portions.  Potatoes are cheap folks.  If you aren't going to fill the guest up with a huge sandwich and a very tiny portion of cole slaw, then at least pile on the fries.    It's very casual, in a food court in the Venetian which is fine when you just want a quick bite.  Young people waiting on the customers were very pleasant and plenty of tables around to sit or you can take the sandwich out.  Plenty of folks partaking of the sandwiches.  Didn't hear any conversation so have no idea what others thought.  Again, my only complaint, small portion and pretty expensive.

Whomever thought up the Lobsicle should be given an award for best use of a lobster tail ever. Fried lobster tail on a stick. Awesome. The lobster was tender, the breading was crispy but not over done. It was served with a lemon wedge and a small container of melted butter. Simply amazing.

As others have said, it's a food court experience with sit down restaurant prices. Yes it's lobster but I've had what was probably the best lobster roll I've ever eaten for less at the Plaza Hotel in NYC. If price was the only difference I would go four stars but the roll here was not the most flavorful and was surprisingly bland. The service was friendly and relatively fast. The crab loaded waffle fries were the highlight of the evening and my fiancée had the lobster grilled cheese which was also pretty good. Okay in a pinch.

I love lobster and the idea of a pound of fresh lobster was too tempting not to try. I got the Connecticut. This is the butter warm lobster roll in a classic Maine lobster bun.  I ordered mine as a combo with the fresh lemonaide. The roll itself had big pieces of lobster but not as amazing for the price as I expected the fries however were impressive. They were done perfectly and tasted the way fries should. The coleslaw was not remotely impressive.   If you enjoy a lobster roll I personally thought the one I had at the Todd English pub near the Aria far and away better and less expensive.

Tried the lobster roll Maine style! AMAZING! Lobster is so fresh and goes perfectly with the buttery roll! The pickle was a huge surprise... very flavorful and crispy! Very yummy.   I'm giving it a 4 start as the clam chowder wasn't very good... I expected more flavor.

Walking through the Miracle Mile Shops and found this spot next to Fat Tuesday.  A win win!!  We had dinner reservations but had to try them out so we shared an Old Bay Lobster Roll, Cajun Fries and Clam Chowder.  Wished the roll was a bit bigger but it was yummy.  Fries were perfectly cooked and the chowder was great too!  Definitely will come back.

If your brand has Lobster in its restaurant name, then the lobster better be the best of the best. Unfortunately, this is not the case at Lobster ME.   This location is located in the Miracle Mile area of the Planet Hollywood shops. Seating is limited, so make sure you grab a spot if you see one  The lobster roll here left much to be desired. For $18, you get a 3-4 inch bread roll stuffed with lobster. For one, I was expecting the bread to have a nice toast to it because it appeared to look that way. The semi soggy texture of the bread already killed it from the first bite. Maybe it was left sitting for awhile. Who knows... Although the lobster chunks were good in size, the lobster itself was bland.   If you are a lobster lover and have high expectations, fulfill your lobster craving elsewhere. You may be disappointed here as my husband and I were...
Yelp didn't give it a good rating but was willing to give it a try. The lobster sandwich was overpriced for the small size and the sandwich was bland and tasteless. Very disappointing

The LOBSTER shrimp ceviche had ZERO lobster. When I mentioned this to the manager she said "ok". Wow great customer  service. I'm giving 2 stars because the ceviche did taste good and so did the garlic fries but I can get those anywhere. Note to the manager who could barely take her eyes off her laptop to speak to me "Customer service and personality count"

This place is sooooo underrated. I was surprised how good the food was and not even expensive! I recommend all the lobster dishes! My favorite has Mac and cheese. I can't believe I haven't appreciated lobster this much before. It has a good variety of dishes so you can get just about anything and be happy with it.

Not what we expected at all....very disappointed. ...the prices were very high and the food was sub par. The lobster roll was so small compared to the photos and the grilled lobster sandwich only had a few pieces of lobster and barely even any cheese.  I wouldn't recommend. There are way better restaurants here for a lower price.
Amazing. Lobster roll was stuffed with lobster and the roll was perfectly soft and toasty!

Tasty tasty lobster! I had the Maine style lobster roll which I think was $16. That might seem like a pretty penny, but you get a lot of really good, tasty lobster meat in that. I'd rather spend $16 on a lobster roll than on a fancy burger. Super friendly and fast service. This was inside the Venetian and it felt a bit like a no frills food court. Not really a nice sit down experience but then again it's just supposed to be decadent fast food.

I felt like I was going to die after eating here.  Not good when it was my last meal before leaving to go back to san diego.  I usually have a stomach that can eat anything but that wasn't the case. My stomach made noises the entire time after I ate the meal here. Made noises for a full day! The next day wasn't pretty also. Sorry. TMI but it's the truth. Just stay away.  I was just so hungry so I ordered a couple of items.  I ordered the crab roll and the lobster mac & cheese.  I was so hungry and I usually love anything lobster or crab.  I preferred the crab roll. It is chilled and the bread is toasted. I was just used to it being served that way. My friend ordered a shrimp roll and it was chilled as well but looked completely raw. She asked them to heat it up. They said that's the way they serve it. Should be mentioned in the menu. I should've asked them to heat up mine also but I was starving. The lobster Mac and cheese looked pathetic. Lots of Mac and cheese and a few pieces of lobster on top. I've had better crab rolls and lobster mac and cheese elsewhere that's way better than the food here. Nothing special.  Not a fan and never going back again.

Located next to Fat Tuesday in the Miracle Mile I was excited to go lobster crazy. Everything on the menu looked delicious so I gave in and decided to give this place a try...eh...I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the lobster grilled cheese and the lobster wontons. I really envisioned the grilled cheese to be made with regular melted gooey cheese just filled with lobster chunks...not the case. It was cold, they used cream cheese and it was not melted. The wontons surprised me as well because all I tasted was curry, I didn't even finish half of them. I got to sample the lobster Mac and cheese and that was pretty good, I would definitely eat a bowl of that. I also sampled the lobster ice cream, a spoonful is enough. It was very rich and buttery with lobster chunks, not sure if I could handle an entire scoop.   Next time I would go with their breakfast items because the lobster eggs and lobster and waffles looked yummy...but then again so did that grilled cheese :/ Oh, they give free refills on drinks.

Always a little wary of these "fast food" places among malls... in this case, among the 'Miracle Mile' of shops at Planet Hollywood. But I knew I wasn't going to have time to visit the Seafood Buffet at the Rio (which is quite good), so grabbed a "Connecticut Lobster Roll" here.  Let me say, it was extremely underwhelming. The lobster seemed -- literally -- like they were scrapping the bottom of the barrel for lobster pieces. And it was dry, not moist & tender as it should be. I probably should be giving this place one star, not two, but am trying to be generous. And the woman who took my order was nice.  But for $17, I expect good tasting lobster. This was just incredibly meh. And I'd swear there were absolutely no pieces of lobster tail in this sandwich, it all seemed to be from the claws and elsewhere (if that's possible). Which leads me to think, this is one of those places that buys the dregs from restaurants that serve lobster tails and have no use for the other parts. I will never eat here again, I promise.

I'd have to agree with some of the other Yelpers. $24 Dollars for a combo is kind of outrageous. The sandwich has a lot of meat, so I guess I can see why that's $19 (debatable for sure). A $4 upcharge for a coke and a couple of fries is good evidence of being overpriced though. I'm wishing now I would've gotten The Melt or Cajun roll. The Connecticut kind of made me wish I just went and got an actual tail somewhere. I can dip the tail in butter at least. It's important to note, I've never actually had a lobster roll before. I've been wanting one since "Lobster Day" last year, and I'm seriously on a mission to find another place.... Hopefully, Atlanta will do it justice.

This is a hidden gem.... SERIOUSLY!!! EVERYTHING HERE IS GREAT. Super fresh and fast. I love the lobster fries!!!  You must try this place while in Vegas. They are in planet Hollywood and the Venetian.

I really enjoyed their lobster sandwiches. I would definitely come back to try different options but their home made chips are awesome as well! I would opt out on the cole slaw, nothing too unique. But their staff is great as well.
Bought the prince of Wales.  Lots of cheese lots of cucumbers was there lobster?? Couldn't taste it.  Overpriced and underwhelmed
Went for the lobster roll and was not disappointed.  Its in a mall type setting, but a great priced great tasting, big chunks and NOT to much mayo.  Ill be back.

This place is as good as you might expect for a lobster joint located in the middle of the desert. Meaning if you've ever set foot in the state of Maine, you won't confuse this for the real thing. But the lobster rolls are serviceable if you have a craving for lobster, like I did this afternoon. I got the "Beltway" (lobster, Old Bay seasoning, scallions, chives, drawn butter and Panko breadcrumbs on top) with fries. The lobster itself was just meh, a little chewy with none of the sweetness of fresh lobster. But the seasoning definitely made up for it. Being a Marylander, if Old Bay is an option, I'm gonna go with that. I've never seen this combo of flavors at another lobster roll place, and it's GOOD. That being said, if the lobster is fresh, all you really need is a little drawn butter on top. Fries are good too, crispy and well seasoned. Price point is about average - $18 for the sandwich, $4 more for fries and drink.

I was here in July, 2014, and I believe they were fairly new at that point. There was a long line to order and receive your food to eat there (food court) or take out. I ordered a lobster grilled cheese, and 45 minutes later, was still waiting for it! I watched others who were there way after me be brought their food and finish eating, and I was still waiting. I asked several people about my order who appeared flustered and clueless when I asked. Finally a girl stated, "the cook  is making it now." I think they had misplaced my order until then!  I got my sandwich after almost an hour wait. It was good but definitely not worth the headache of this highly disorganized place nor the unacceptably long wait!

This place totally rips you off and doesn't care. Do not expect to get lobster tail meat. Your sandwich is only filled with claw and some body meat. The sandwich is small. About 5 inches. The food is expensive. A combo cost $25. Their website describes the lobster rolls as these flavorful, buttered,  and seasoned with herds of different blends. LIARS!!! I've eaten here twice. Both times the lobster meat had no trace of seasoning or butter. It tastes like it was just boiled, taken out of the shell, and that's it! Don't waste your money here. It's a shame. It would've been nice to have a good lobster roll place even if it cost a little more.

I usually follow LOBSTER basically wherever they are sold. Eat em, love em. I happen to stumble upon this place a couple weeks ago and was surprised, their lobster roll was really good, huge chunks of lobster but the combo was a bit overpriced, around $21. Seasoned fries are great and w/unlimited drink refills but it's  still pretty pricey even for Vegas. The one thing I would change about their roll is they already put salt and pepper on the lobster with lime juice, I'd rather have that as a side to prepare for myself, other than that, great place for some seafood while you shop at the Miracle Mile.

Was glad to see the Yelp sticker posted. It reminded me to check in which resulted in a coupon for a free lemonade. That took $4.00 off my order. The beltway lobster roll was quite tasty. Flavorful and piled high with warmed lobster chunks. The rest of the plate was disappointing a few haphazardly thrown chips and a cup of coke slaw. I tried it, enjoyed the roll but probably will not repeat the dining experience.

It can be a maze to get here. It's in between the Palazzo and venetian in the shops . There's also a planet Hollywood miracle mile shops location I've been to. Eaten  here quite a bit it's just alright. Nothing really wows me but it's good enough. The prices are decent . They use claw meat which to me is hit and miss flavor wise . I've tried mostly the whole menu except the lobster roll lol if can believe it. My favorite is probably the lobster Mac. The macaroni is sort of like velveeta but it all works for some reason .

We were in town for 3 days and ate here 3 different times.  Ordered the lobster salad for me and a plain Mac n cheese for my 2 year old.  Both were delicious!  The girls working the front were very helpful and friendly.  The only thing is that the salad I ordered wasn't as big as I thought it should be for $14.  I do have to say that the salad was VERY fresh!  I'm usually skeptical about getting take out salads and ending up with old and wilted lettuce, but the lettuce was very crisp and had no signs of just sitting around in the back somewhere.  The lobster was great, too!  The lobscicles... Absolutely fabulous!  Seriously, my mouth is watering just writing about them!  I'll definitely stop by here next time I go to Vegas and want a quick bite!

So delicious!  They do not skimp on lobster!  What I order each time I go: -Cajun lobster roll ~$17 -lobster mac and cheese  What my friends like: -Lobster bisque -Lobster grilled cheese  What you can pass on: -lobster ice cream -the fries, unless you really want fries  Tips: -Grab a table before ordering! Seating is limited -It's a food stand located inside the Miracle Mile shops next to Fat Tuesdays -Be kind to the staff!  They are always friendly and generous with drink refills.

Given the mixed reviews about Lobster Me, I had low expectations, but I really liked it! Yes, it is a few dollars overpriced, but given that it is lobster, I wouldn't necessarily expect fast food prices.  I ordered the combo meal, which came with your choice of lobster roll (I got the Connecticut, so the lobster was warm, mmm), fries, cole slaw, and clam chowder, as well as a drink with free refills.   The lobster roll was delicious, lots of meat on a slice of buttery Texas toast. Wow, that was delicious! Yes, I wished it was bigger, but I savored every bite. The fries were good, nothing special, but I found it interesting that the chowder was served right in the same container as the fries, which made for a messy chowder sauce. I didn't mind it, I just found it odd. The chowder was good, but I didn't taste any meat in it. The cole slaw was unremarkable, but fine.  Lobster Me offers a locals' discount, so that took a few dollars off of the total. I would definitely return!

What's not to like about this place?!?! Nevada resident discounts, fresh lobster and a bunch of sides. Beer and wine plus soda to wash it down. Every time I'm in town I eat lunch here. Not cheap, but quality is great

At my visit Las Vegas last week, I had a chance to try here! I ordered Lobster grilled cheese and salt & vinegar fries. I picked and back to my hotel room. (Wanna eat with beer and relax) Lobster grilled cheese was so good! But my fries were not so good,,,, WAIT!!?? Where is vinegar?  Next time wanna try different one.

MUST.  TRY.  I had found this place a long time ago (being from New England I've been craving a good Lobster Roll for a long time) and hadn't tried it.  Was recently in the shops at PH and gave it a go - even though it is pricey, it's worth every single dollar.  I don't even know how many lobsters were used in the preparation of my roll (I'm thinking about 5?), but they were enjoyed SO MUCH.  The lobster mac and cheese was delicious as well, but not quite as good as the roll.  Just had the regular roll - will be back in the future to try the special ones and report on those.  I'm hungry just thinking about it...

Noms!!! My friend and I shared an order of Clam Chowder and the crab fries. We were expecting something good - but Oh Man! this took us by surprise!  We opted for the chowder to come in a bread bowl and we devoured every piece of it! I loved that it wasn't too salty, not too thick or too runny... it was just right! The Crab fries were on a special menu and we felt although this place screams 'lobster', we just had to try the crab! I'm very glad we did because it was probably better than the chowder! I honestly was full from the two but couldn't stop shoving these fries in my mouth! I was addicted!   The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the lack of seating and how overpriced the food was. But I still enjoyed our meal here!

Lobster Heaven! If your in the mood for Lobster mixed with a lot of creativity this is a great find.   My very spoiled when it comes to my expectations of a Lobster roll. I'm used to the rolls in the Boston and Maine area. I was very surprised to find such an amazing Lobster roll right here in Vegas. Starting with the bread it was warm, not too toasted and buttery. They give you a good amount of lobster on your roll and it is very fresh. I usually order the original or cajun lobster roll. The lobster mac and cheese is to die for!  The price doesn't bother me at all I'm used to paying sometimes up to $30 for a decent lobster roll back east. So around $17 for a roll here was worth it.   If your in Vegas and a Lobster fan this the place for you.

came here to try their classic lobster sandwich with the hubs. though i love the fact that they lobster wasnt drenched in mayo (there was no mayo at all) the lobster was pretty cold. i was taken back by it. i thought it wouldve been buttery/garlicy and at the very least luke warm. thats the only off putting thing for me personally. maybe its the way lobster rolls are supposed to be? ive had one at sams chowder mobile and it was great!. probably wont stop by here again anytime soon unless a friend wants to.

Hands down as good or better than any lobster roll I've had, and I've had some of the most renowned in the country.  Wife and I had the large lobster roll, large Cajun lobster roll (spicy good) and tots.  Ton of pieces under 3 good sized pieces of claw meat, the rolls were soft and tasty.  Tots were perfection.    A lot for a fast food type of place, but if you love lobster or lobster rolls, highly recommend.

A great option if you're hungry as long as the line isn't too long.  I just wish they had more seats to enjoy their food.   Their lobster poor boys are damn good.   If you're happen to be staying at Planet Hollywood or Paris, I'd suggest just taking your food to go.

My friend wanted a grilled cheese, I wanted a lobster roll. So we decided to come here for both of those treats!  My friend got a lobster grilled cheese which was $12, which in my opinion is pretty good, considering the amount of lobster I saw in her sandwich. My boyfriend and I each got our own lobster roll; I forgot which style but it was with mayo I think. They were good, but not amazing. The size was a little larger than I expected, but still not enough to get us super full. I was a little disappointed with the fries, considering it wasn't like the good East Coast style fries; they were like regular fries.  Staff was nice and the service was fast. It's a nice and quick place for fast food, but it is pricey, because of the lobster of course :)

First time I've heard of this place and so glad we stopped in. My comfort food is Mac & Cheese and I'm obsessed with Lobster so I thought why not? It was soooooo good. Def recommend this place and thought the portions were just enough!

had a late-night splurge while in vegas recently....wanted to try to lobsicles (lobster pops) as they sounded sooo good. we had lobster pop (fried & grilled) combo as well as lobster mac n cheese. lobster was fresh and delish! tho a little pricey it was a fun treat. we would do again ..... on a whim! ;-)

There is nothing more annoying than when a place changes the menu for the worse, that what these geniuses did. Looks like they also made the rolls smaller. Not sure why they would eliminate the chips instead of the crappy cole slaw, time to cross this regular stop off of the list

Lobster me is located in miracle mile's food court. Right next to FAT TUESDAY !! There's usually no line at any hour. Lol...   What I ordered:  Fish taco: the fish wasn't crispy and the tortilla tasted bleh :(  Chowder fries: delicious !! Good mix fries and clam chowder !   Pricing: $$ $10-20/plate Parking: miracle mile at PH , structure parking Portion: 1 : 1  Service: kind of slow; probably waited at least 25 minutes for our food. There was only 2-3 customers too.   I only come here for convenience...
Great spot at the food court. Surprised at the size of the lobsicle though. Great service. The server came over to refill my soda.
Get two of the small lobster rolls rather than 1 large delicious , but expensive, YUM!

Food was good, though not generous. The coleslaw cup was only half full, so maybe a quarter of a cup of slaw.  More bread than lobster.  I was disappointed that they didn't honor the yelp add for free bisque.

First timer here. I love clam chowder and I love fries! So I thought, why not order the chowder fries! I was a bit confused on where to go to pick up my food. I felt awkward standing there so I went to sit down at a table. (I was lucky enough to snatch one because all the tables were taken.) As I sat there waiting for my order, I noticed how busy the place was. It must be very popular and I hope very delicious, I thought. I'm sure there was a line for Lobster Me, but it looked more like a blob than anything. There were people standing around, I wasn't sure if they were in line to order, to pick up their food, or just indecisively looking at the menu. Apparently, they called my name a few times. But I swear, I did not hear them clear enough! I heard an announcing voice, but nothing familiar enough to get my attention. I noticed the person who ordered before me already started eating his food, so I thought I would get up to see if my order was called. I think I waited another 2 minutes to find out that the bag I was staring at, sitting on the back counter, was in fact mines.  Overall taste, I thought it was alright. Wished they were a bit more generous on the clam chowder, but that's just my opinion. Looks like there were more greens (cilantro and green onions) than the Chowder. I don't know if I would revisit. If I do, I'd like to try something different that is more worth the time.  UPDATE: Going through the photos that others had posted, my order of Chowder Fries looked super sad compared to the Chowder Fries from 2 years ago. I'm definitely disappointed now. I knew something wasn't right. What happened?

Not bad!  Got the Original xl and shared with bf for a snack.  The chunks of lobster were better than I thought.  However, putting it into perspective, it was $24 (if I remember correctly) which is more than the price of a dinner buffet at the M resort.  However, it was a nice snack.  It had a very buttered toasted bun, butter and mayo, with a hint of lemon in it.  Like I mentioned, big chunks of lobster.  I thought the meat would be warm but it was cold.    If it were cheaper or bigger I'd give it 5 stars.  This is like a lobster roll I would make at home.
I got the crab burger and wife had the philly steak, good but pricey for what you get

i like that everything here has lobster in it.  I was disappointed by the lobster roll though.  Sure it had tons of seasoned lobster on it, but that was the only positive.  It was rather bland and pretty dry.  The bread was boring.  It had a bit of spread on there (mayo I believe).  Then the cold and pretty drab lobster chunks on top.  Def. not my favorite.  Luckily, I also tried the lobster mac and cheese.  While it didn't have much lobster chunks in it, it was still a solid, solid mac n cheese.  I'd probably come back for this and maybe get one of those lobster tails on-a-stick next time.  Lastly, I tried the lobster ceviche.  Not much lobster, but a decent ceviche overall.  A bit sweet from the fruits in it, but the main complaint here is they only gave me 3 chips with it.  Kinda skimpy for a tiny $10 ceviche.  Meh overall.

Lobster mac and cheese was so cold .  19 dollars for some shells with cheese wiz ??? Not good! Obiusly was empty!. Avoid!  I thought that they were good after seeing the reviews ,I had much better lobster mac and cheese at the plane on my way to vegas... oh lord...

I've never had a lobster roll before so this was my first time eating one. I've seen them on the food network so I've been wanting to try one. so when i came across lobster me i had to try it. at first i thought to my self it too expensive for a snack but once you try it, its like a little piece of heaven when you eat it. if your trying to get full off it your wasting your time. their $17 each.

Good lobster roll, bread is buttery and good size portion of lobster.  However, not the best I have had here in Vegas.  While good, not worth a trip to the strip for me personally.  Money we'll spent though I went during restaurant week 20 bucks for a roll, fries and a brownie, but I probably wouldn't pay more than that for what it is especially the size of it is pretty small.  I'd have to say I prefer Todd English's or Double Helix Lobster rolls for the price and a bit more flavor.
Convince location.  The food is good but a bit salty for me.  Lobster Mary is something different and worth a try.

I came here 6/5/17, and I ordered the fried Lobsicle. It was a lightly breaded lobster tail on a stick. It was so good, not greasy whatsoever. I waited until I got back to my hotel room about 20 minutes later to eat it, and it still had a refreshing taste to it. I will definitely come back here on future trips to try other menu items.

Being from New England I was very excited to try this place. I'm so disappointed. First off he standard Maine lobster roll doesn't have anything in it except lobster and mayo. Maybe some salt and pepper. The lobster chowder had clams in it.  Another thing that doesn't normally happen. Too bad. This place had such promise.

Lobster sandwich NE style is / was very good - big chunks of lobster.  Sandwich comes with waffle fries :)  & slaw :(  Order at the register, pay, grab your #, find a table & they will bring you your food.

Omg sooooooo good.  Perfect meal for a drunk day.  Lobster Mac n cheese, excellent.   Lobster roll awesome.  Lobster Mary, amazing intro to bloody Mary's.   Great food but kind of hard to find.  Oh, and the old bay fries were amazing to.  Definitely check it out if you're in the Venetian!

Stopped by for something unique to eat on our way into the crazy girls show in Planet Hollywood. 5 different lobster sandwiches, lobster tacos, love lobster Mac n cheese, lobster grilled cheese, clam chowder or lobster-n-cheese fries and lobster salad. They even have a lobster Bloody Mary! All very quick, fresh and delicious. A great place when you're sick of the ordinary. Fat Tuesday is right next door for big crazy drinks. Just needs more seating.

Ordered the lobster me signature roll. The food was very bland and the lobster had absolutely no taste. The bun was big and the lobster meat was very little.i paid 24 dollars for this, I don't think it's worth even 10 bucks

Delicious Lobster rolls here , my husband loved the clam chowder and he is so picky . Prices were fantastic and I don't know how they get such fresh seafood here. Located right in the Miracle Mile shops perfect meal after long day shopping .

It always bothers me when people give a place less stars just based on the price.   First of all you're in Las Vegas. They don't call it Lost Wages for nothing. Second of all it's $&@?ing lobster, in what world is lobster ever cheap? Please tell me. I'd like to live in that world.   Rant over. Now let's get to the nitty gritty. Lobster me's food. I had the lobsicle and the lobster bisque. The jury is still out on battered and fried lobster tail on a stick. Maybe I'm partial to grilled or broiled lobster but it was just ok. Nothing to write home about. The bisque however hit the spot. The flavor was great and there were nice little chunks of lobster throughout and it came in a bread bowl. I love bowls you can eat. Who doesn't? The only bad thing about this place is there's not enough seating. Even though it was very mall-food-esque the service was incredible. The people that work there are grade A, I don't think I had better service my entire trip. You go Lobster Me, you go!
There food is so delicious and mouth watering. There employees and manger were super friendly and helpful

Must-go place for Lobster lovers, we tried the signature lobster sandwich and lobster tacos, the lobster meats was offered in generous amount, accompanied with extra pickle cucumber and coleslaw, served separately in a fresh manner.

Wayyyy overpriced.  I know its vegas, but I just can't justify spending $30 on a mediocre lobster roll.  Yes, they are generous with the amount of lobster inside the roll, but my local lobster roll join is equally as generous at $13 a roll and it tastes much fresher.  hmmm.  I think i'd rather spend that $30 at the slots or on a buffet.

Although we ate here at 10 pm, their still lobster tasted fresh...lobster tacos were flavorful esp with the Sriracha aoili...mmm...the lobster mac n cheese was ok...big chunks of lobster on top but the macaroni was overcooked. About their lobster roll, really packed with lobster only $17...cheaper than most I've tried but just as good. I got the original, cold with old bay seasoning...it wss too plain for me...i realized I prefer my lobster roll with some kind of dressing so I asked for the Sriracha sauce they put on their tacos...much better after that. The guy at the counter was very pleasant and helpful. Always with a smile.
Great lobster roll and they even had a few other options now. We had the lobster roll and chcoken sandwich both of which were excellent and will go back tomorrow.
Great lobster sandwich. Lobster was perfect and the bread was excellent. Fast service and great hospitality

So nestled deep within the Miracle Mile is LobsterME and bust my barnacles if it wasn't good yet as the 3 stars proves not something I'm clawing for as I type this either  As I have SlapFish here a big difference in LobsterMe is the quantity of the lobster given and the overall taste of the meat as well..For the prices charged for some items you should reward your guests rather then essentially punish them for wanting some great lobster at a great price..The portion size was not well proportioned in my view and the meat itself could've had a little more fresher feeling to it..I guess you can say I know by now what great lobster is and why lower the bar if I'm left feeling like I ran into the bar instead?  I decided on the lobster mac and cheese partnered with the chowder fries..As I did like the mac and cheese with both tender pasta and delectable cheese sauce the lobster was scarce overall (hence the comments above)..The chowder fries were a roller coaster for me..I did find the fries the perfect consistency (not too hard not too soft), but the tomatoes that were partnered with the chowder I felt caused it to be soggy overall  All in all it was a good find, but not a great find..I will most likely give it another shot as there was their lobsicle which was calling my name, but trial and error has shown me what to omit for sure from my palette.

I am always down to find a good lobster roll place. Since I'm here in Vegas why not explore what Vegas has to offer. Lobster Me is located inside the Venetian Hotel and structured like a food court. They have a variety choice of lobster to choose from. If you don't want lobster they also have some shrimp, etc. Some of the food items I find appealing are:  Lobster roll  Lobster slider Shrimp slider Lobster mac and cheese  Lobsicle  I ordered the Connecticut style lobster roll and clam chowder. The lobster roll was okay nothing special. I feel like it lacked lots of seasoning or something that would make the lobster stands out. The clam chowder was overly salty. It was just too salty that after 2 spoons I had to throw it away and clam chowder is my favorite soup. Pretty disappointed that this place isn't as good as the Lobsta Truck in California.  The one thing I don't like is the limited seating. You basically have to wait until someone get up on the table to get a seat. Plus there isn't anyone there to wipe down the table leaving crumbs and whatever mess left on the table for the next person.

We came here twice during our vacation and ordered the lobster roll, lobster bisque, and Lobsicle. The menu is a bit pricey, but that's because there aren't Maine lobsters in the desert.  Lobster roll (about $23)- chocked full of large pieces of lobster. Very flavorful and filling.   Lobster bisque ($10) - Generous 12 ounce bowl of flavorful soup with chunks of lobster in it and served with a bit of shredded lobster on top.    Lobsicle ($14)- It's a lobster tail on a stick. Can be ordered grilled or deep-fried. We ordered it grilled. Arrived on a small bed of cabbage with a slice of lemon and a little plastic container of butter on the side. Great flavor, but not very big. More of snack than a meal.

Came for the first time for international lobster day today and it will be the last. Quality was not necessarily bad but cashier was slow and not paying attention. I ordered a roll plus soup and drink. When she asked my order, I said, Cajun with bisque and Dr pepper. I had to repeat myself 3 times and it wasn't because I wasn't clear or loud enough. Not to mention that only 2 customers in front of me took an agonizingly long time to stand in line while people are weaving in and out around me. Annoying and then to have the cashier not even able to take an order. Then the roll was only about 3 bites. Half of it was bread. For $25, I could've sat down at a restaurant. Soda had so much ice that a few long sips and it was gone. Soup is advertised being in a bread bowl but upon getting my soup, I asked and the girl said they changed the menu just today. Lucky me. Not really. Quality was ok but portion ratio to price was ridiculous and added that employees are not the brightest bulb on the tree, will not be back.  I also found out that being a local, I'm supposed to get 20% off plus I checked in and I'm supposed to get free combo upgrade. I believe that's what the hold up was with the guy in front. They didn't know how to use the yelp coupon which seems to me to be an easy cop out because so many places do the same thing.   Ugh...nothing worse than being over charged for poor service and small portions.

Loved the concept of a lobster grilled cheese. Had bacon, lobster chunks, choice, cheese sauce and bread (of course!) accompanied with a soda and old bay fries. Food seemed okay.. noting special. Right up there with my homemade grilled cheeses. Actually I think my bacon and spinach grilled cheese is better. Anyway, I won't be back for this but maybe next time I will order the lobster fries since the fries were delicious .
Good quick lunch. Tasted good,had the cajun and cajun fries. Roll was on the small side.

All I have to say is... Amazing! My family and I ordered a little bit of everything to sample and share. Lobster Mac and Cheese, Lobster Roll, Lobster and Chips, Lobsicle and yes, even Lobster Ice Cream. Everything was delicious and so different. The atmosphere was simple and cute and the service was great. I would def recommend Lobster ME to anyone!

Wow...What a disappointment . Entering the casino you will see large billboards advertising lobster rolls filled to the brim with lobster. In reality, what you get is folded bread around a small amount of lobster. We ordered two of these sandwiches, one of which we made into a 'combo'. So for 4 dollars extra they gave you very small amount of french fries.  We paid $ 40 +  and left hungry.  Way over priced. Never again!!!!!

Lobster me is the shiz...the people are great and super friendly, a couple of names to mention is Rosa, and Carolina. Jeff deserves manager of the year, I've never seen a manager that works in the food that handles his employees and customers so well, this is my second time and I will be back as long as he is manager.

I was excited to try this... and quite disappointed to say the least.  False advertisement of saying that this place had the "best" lobster rolls. I should of known... self-compliment is never good. Lobster Me, you are far from being the best, so stop saying you are!   My friend and I got the Maine Lobster Roll and the Cajun Lobster Roll. Split it so we could taste both flavors. Unanimous decision that the Cajun tasted better since it was more flavorful.  Everything about the roll was just meh to okay. Also, the rolls were really greasy, enough to be cringe worthy. I hate the feeling of excess grease on my finger tips, gahhh. I took a gamble and I guess I lost --this place is not worthy of your dollars my friend, on to the next.

I was trying to be "good" on my trip to Vegas this time...trying to eat well and not go overboard...exercise daily...all that went out the window when at 10pm I turned the corner in the Miracle Mile and like a shining beacon from Heaven saw the words "LOBSTER ME" (I do believe I heard angels singing...)  I wanted it all...I wanted to try EVERYTHING...my head was spinning with Lobster combinations that I had never had before...but I settled for a single Lobsicle.  After all, I was trying to be "good" wasn't I?  I figured a Lobsicle's portability could assist in my noble attempt to stay on my "diet" since I could easily eat it while walking the mall for 3 miles...I'd just call it a "push."  Riiiiiiiiight...  I walked around gnawing that thing and must have been stopped by 10 people asking me "what IS that?" - I pointed behind me in the direction of the pearly gates and said "Lobster Me!" - run, run while it's still open!!!  Needless to say...I gave in to temptation, which is not hard to do in Vegas.  I went back in the morning for the Lobster & Waffles...and the Lobster Wontons, and the Grilled Cheese, and the bisque, and the ice cream...and another Lobsicle.  Ok, ok, I admit it...I have a problem.  A serious lobster problem.  The only thing that could have made any of this any better would have been bacon...  Seriously, the people who DIDN'T give this 5 stars are all on crack...yes, it's expensive people...it's REAL LOBSTER!!!!  It's not langoustines, not crawfish, not any other stupid thing cheap restaurants try to pass off as real lobster...this is the REAL THING!!!  It is from New England and sweet and succulent and AWESOME!!!!  This food could easily be served in a fancy restaurant for more money!!  Lobster rolls - no filler, just a soft, sweet brioche-type bun with delicious seasoned lobster and more lobster...we could all argue until the cows come home over what makes a good roll, a bunch of mayo & celery or just seasoned lobster on a roll, but this roll is for purists...not people looking for a hot dog bun with lobster salad plopped in it.  Lobster Wontons - the filling is some kind of curried lobster mix and delicious, served with a side of sweet chili sauce.  Lobster Grilled Cheese - almost like a creamy cheese & lobster panini but softly toasted bread and creamy yummy cheese inside.  To die for!!!  Lobster Mac & Cheese - yes, it's on the "drier" side of the Mac & Cheese gamut, but that's what makes it so perfect.  Just lobster, cheese, breadcrumbs and YUM!  This is NOT your Kraft Mac & Cheese, it is not your mom's ooey-gooey runny cheese type Mac & Cheese.  It is like the kind you get in an upscale restaurant that only needs a few ingredients to make it good.  I have tried every Lobster Mac & Cheese I have ever seen, and this one is definitely one of the best!  Lobster on a stick (called a "Lobsicle") - ok, who is the friggin' GENIUS who invented THIS???  Let's put a Lobster Tail on a stick, deep fat fry it, and serve it with a slice of lemon and a bucket of butter...this is so much better than the crap-on-a-stick you get at the fair!!!  I picture this to be the fair food of the Rich & Famous...like there is a little Lobster stand at the Beach near the Hamptons where Muffy & Biff can stop and pick up a few Lobsicles to eat as they stroll the beach in their white tennis outfits?  Lobster Bisque - not the best I've ever had (that was the Clubhouse at South Coast Plaza - RIP) but it is a really REALLY good knock-off!!!  I am a HUGE Lobster Bisque snob...I like my bisque more on the creamy sherry side & not the tomato fishy side.  This was a perfect creamy sherry laced tasting bisque with a huge dollop of chopped lobster bits thrown in - all served hot & fresh in a yummy sourdough bowl.  I could have eaten 3 more of these...  Lobster Ice Cream - I know, it sounds gross...but it is AWESOME!!!!  Vanilla-based ice cream with chunks of lobster throughout.  Not sure if they soak the lobster in sugar or if it really is just that sweet to begin with, but this is one special taste you need to try!!!  They will let you have a small taste if you ask for it- try it!!!  Lobster Waffles - Now, let me preface this by saying that I am a HUGE fan of bacon & syrup together...I went ape-sh*t when Denny's had "Baconalia" and made the maple syrup bacon sundae.  If you like sweet & salty things, you will LOVE these Lobster Waffles.  Like in the Lobster ice cream, the lobster they use is the sweet New England kind, so it blends perfectly with the Belgian-style waffle & maple syrup.  The chunks of Lobster are tempura-battered and tossed on top of the waffle.  I cut mine up so I could savor a bite of everything each time...and used the extra side of syrup provided (of course!)  I will be back...again and again and again...LOBSTER ME BAY BAY!!!!

First off -- the staff at Lobster Me were awesome!! There aren't many tables available for sitting but they were able to find us another chair for our one-chair table while we were waiting for our food to arrive. Now onto the food -- I had the Original Maine Style and my husband had the Connecticut -- when they came out, the sandwiches looked so tiny BUT man, did they fill those buns up with tasty lobster!! Maybe our eyes were bigger than our stomachs because we both left full! I had the lobster bisque for my side and my husband had the lobster fries. The bisque was good but not the best and the lobster fries were kind of sad. I think we enjoyed our sandwiches the most but next time, we'll pass on the sides. And remember, this is located in the Miracle Mile Shops so don't expect fancy-ness, guys.
Mmmmm LOBSTER grilled cheese!!! I am in lobster heaven right now ! The best part is that its right next to FAT TUESDAYS ....who doesn't like lobster and a frozen margaritas! DELICIOUS !

I just got back from Las Vegas. The family decided to get lunch at Miracle Mile. I told them I didn't care where to eat, all I know I needed to do was get a lobster roll. TO my amusement, None of them had ever had one and they all decided to tag along. Two trays and about $200 later we were all full and ALL 7 people loved the food. YES this place is expensive, but it's Vegas. Have YOU ever tried to get fresh lobster shipped to you in the middle of the desert?   I was finally going to try the lobster ice cream, sadly, they were out  ***NOTE TO OWNER**** My lobster roll had a channel of mayo on the bottom which was kinda too much "goo" in a bite, If possible please have the cook SPREAD it on the bread. THANKS! Be Back in a month for CES 2013

The lobsicle was awesome.  Juicy, grilled with lemon and butter topping.  Pretty much a peeled lobster tail so easy to eat.  Cost $15.  In the back right side of planet Hollywood miracle mile.  Next to Fat Tuesday.  Lucky got there with no line.  I shoulda had another one

If you're a fan of lobster, you're gonna love this place. Must try the lobsicle (lobster tail on a stick) and the chowder fries. The rolls are a about $17, a bit pricier than most rolls, but nonetheless delicious and well-worth it!

Lobster ME: First I have to say, this place is very pricey, yes I know it's lobster, but for the price you pay, I would have expected a little more, either in taste or quantity. For a Lobster Roll and combo, which includes fries and drink, was $25.00.   I ordered the lobster roll with panko or bread crumbs on it. I was expecting chunks of lobster and a couple of claws as stated by other Yelp reviewers.   My lobster roll consisted of shredded lobster than didn't even fill the ends. It could of used a little more mayo on it, it just seemed lacking a little. The meat was tasty, but for the price, it wasn't quite there.   I've had some pretty good lobster rolls at other restaurants, this one came up short. My friend had the same sediments as me. He also got the chowder and said it was really runny.   If the price was less, then what we got for our buck would had been great, but for the price, it needs to stand out more.   I probably won't be going back, since the price and quantity and quality wasn't worth it to me.   But I might try the lobster macaroni one of these days there.

I was there this past weekend and I didn't know what to order but this Asian blonde girl helped me out. She was super sweet and very energetic. It was a little busy but she worked well with me and didn't rush me when I didn't know what to get. She recommended me the New England Lobster Roll (delicious) Most food workers usually rush me especially when I eat on the strip when there's a high volume of customers. I could actually enjoy the food because of the service I was given. The price was a little high but worth it. Definitely would recommend to others and hopefully that cashier is there to assist others as well. People make the work place.

Meh, I was disappointed. My husbands roll was ok. Expensive for what it was, but he said it was quite tasty. My lobster grilled cheese had very few pieces of lobster. I actually could not taste anything except cheese so I looked inside. This is ridiculous and not what they show on their own photos. I should have told a manager who was nearby asking customers how much they were enjoying their food, but I did not feel like arguing, I just wanted to leave at that point.

It's located in the Planet Hollywood, close to Fat Tuesday! I'm a big lobster fan, and when I stayed at PH I ate here 3 times! My favorites are  the Lobster Roll and Lobster Grilled Cheese. The Lobster Bisque is good, but too salty for me.   Recommendations: Lobster Roll Clam Chowder Lobster Bisque Lobster Grilled Cheese
They act like you get a nice meal but you get one piece of lobster and a whole lot of filler. Screw this restaurant and their crappy service.

Not the best lobster rolls, but it was a lobster roll none the less.  It's super expensive (I know, it's because it's on the strip) and it's a decent roll so if you're craving one (like I was at the time) then just go for it.

All lobster!!!  Youu get a lot of lobster!  Cajun style was delicious. Its in a mall so the atmosphere is really casual.  Fries are OK.  Drinks are small but otherwise service was great and food was delicious!!! Too pricey in my opinion though

Okay so I postmates'd food from here. It took over an hour for it to be delivered when it was an estimated 10-25 wait time!! I was so upset, but that's mostly a problem with postmates. But, the food sucked. I ordered lobster mac n cheese and it was SO DRY. There was BARELY any sauce and it had no flavor. I'm emphasizing on the so dry and barely any sauce because it was ridiculously dry. I got the lobster bisque as well. Not bad. But, the clam chowder was good! I just wish it didn't take so long to get my food, they had more flavor for their lobster mac n cheese, and improved their sauce.

I've had Lobster Mac and Cheese twice in my life and this was definitely better of the 2. Located in the Miracle Mile of Planet Hollywood it turned out pretty convenient from where we were staying to bring back to our hotel. It was also reasonably priced at $13 for the entree item, I was feeling so full from eating out all weekend I didn't want to order any side items. I'd definitely come back and try something else here though.

I got the lobster grilled cheese which barely had any lobster in it. It wasn't worth the 11 dollars.  My friend got a lobster salad and she said it's just like a side salad with lobster in it.  She said she was expecting more than just a side salad with lobster in it.
