Every time my friends and I see this place we have to stop and get something even if we had it earlier.   It is that good, if you are a seafood lover.      It's all about their Maine roll with a toasted bun, YUM!!!   I wasn't really into lobster until this place.   Hands down, a must in Vegas!

Every time my friends and I see this place we have to stop and get something even if we had it earlier.   It is that good, if you are a seafood lover.      It's all about their Maine roll with a toasted bun, YUM!!!   I wasn't really into lobster until this place.   Hands down, a must in Vegas!

After a swim and some sun, it's time for some lobster! Lobster roll, lobster Mac cheese and lobster grilled cheese sandwich. The lobster tasted fresh and meaty, but the grilled cheese came out burned on one side, leaving a very bitter taste. Mac and cheese was meh, a bit too dry for me since I like more sauce on my pastas. Overall, not worth the money.

This restaurant is good, but it has declined since my last visit a few years ago.  They increased the price of the lobster rolls and decreased the amount of lobster that is served with them.  If you want a roll like they used to make them, you now have to pay an extra $10.  It's a little ridiculous.  If I'm going to pay $29 for 1 sandwich, I'd rather pay a little more and just eat at a buffet that includes lobster.
Decent portion of tasty lobster on a nice buttery roll, I'll be back!

Check in and upgrade to a fry combo for free ($4 savings). I had the Cajun lobster roll and it was delicious!!! Great seasoning and the roll was just right. Plenty of lobster. Fries were good as well.

Firstly I would like to start out by apologizing to the lobsters that have died an unworthy death in vain for this place. The lobster meat here just does NO justice at all. God where do I start? The meat is dry and tastes like it has been frozen for months, and i dont mean the good frozen with Idina Menzel, the only thing this place "let go" of is their quality.. And for their stingy portions, I would rather get better quality at a fine dining restaurant for cheaper. We ordered the Connecticut lobster roll which was $17 and 5" long.. Roll was dry and stale, not buttery fluffy or light like it should be. Soup was average and served cold instead of warm not like it was supposed to be, and the bread bowl?...yes you guessed it, stale and hard! I understand escalation for being near the strip but $17 for 5" of trash given in worse portions than the meals handed out during the holocaust is just cold.. Sorry, was that joke in bad taste? Not as bad taste as lobsterme. This was the most expensive lobster roll and at the same time the worst I ever had, I'm heart broken at this. Dont be fooled by the yelp pictures, most are a year or older before portions were $6 for costco free sample sizes (literally that is the equivalency if you size it down). I wish i could give 0 stars.. RIP lobsters who died in vain for lobsterme, may heaven grant you a better roll with fresh ingredients to rest upon..

The Maine lobster roll is a long time favorite of ours You can add a side of fries or Mac n Cheese for an extra dollar or two. What can I say, I'm addicted to Lobster.  They make a awesome Bloody Mary here, as well.
I should have read the reviews first, so I can't be mad. Small portions, expensive, crap service and watered down drinks. That's it in a nut

The lobster roll was pretty good but the meat is very cold and a little too seasoned with old bay.  The roll is buttered toast, yum. Skip the grilled cheese, the lobster is so chopped up you can barely taste it.  Cheap beer is a plus.

This will be the smallest most expensive sandwich you'll ever buy.  I ordered the Maine Style Lobster "roll": for $18 this is a small hot dog bun, sliced at the top, and filled with lobster:mayo mix that is quite tasty. You get a tiny cup of coleslaw and about 10 homemade potato chips with the sandwich (I'm not kidding, check photo I posted).  It all tasted good though. Real good.

Last time we were here we had the Lobster Roll and Absolutely loved it ! so this was our first stop when we arrived. Terribly disappointed! Lobster Roll was very expensive for what you got,  half the Lobster was Luke warm and the other half cold and very fishy tasting not very good at all! Roll had been toasted and a little burnt. Unfortunately the best part of this meal were the fries,husband had the chips and they were mostly soft and stale.definitely will not be back!

Just the best! If you love lobster you have to try the offerings here. FRESH! I got a Conn. roll as I am not a huge mayo fan. The drawn butter on the lobster was perfect as was the roll - done how it should be, crispy yet soft on the inside.I normally do not like coleslaw but this one was amazing. The dish also included potato chips that were nicely seasoned and crunchy. My friend got the lobster mac, enjoyed every bite and was so full at the end. She gave it a 4. (she wished it had been a tad cheesier but that could be personal taste) That said, she would get it again. Staff could not have been nicer and we were really appreciative of the samples of clam chowder and lobster bisque. (you have to ask!) So many things I am excited to try the next time I am in town!

I went to Florida for the first time this year and fell in love with Lobster rolls. When I heard that Lobster Me claimed to have the best Lobster roll in the world, I immediately knew I had to try it.   I was accompanied by four other people on my first visit and we each ordered something different off the menu--The lobster roll, lobster bisque, lobsicle, and lobster ice cream. The lobster roll was good, I love how they put huge pieces of lobster meat in it, but it wasn't "the best in the world." The lobster bisque was average. The lobsicle was small considering the price, but then again it IS lobster. The lobster ice cream was surprisingly not bad, but I have absolutely nothing to compare it to.   I'd say it's a place you have got to try at least once to be a true judge.
It was fairly pricy and the food we ordered seemed to be too cheesy or too creamy with too much mayonnaise.   We ordered the ME roll with Sriracha, fried Mac and cheese, and crab French fries.

I was in the mood for some seafood, lobster so I decided on this spot.  I ordered the Maine Lobster roll which comes with waffle fries, pickles & Cole slaw for $24.  Not bad.  The order taker Carolina was nice, friendly.  I also ordered a tequila sunset cocktail which came first = delicious, refreshing.  Gonna order another one.  Then the food came. The roll was good, still nothing tops the one I had in Boston.  The pickles and coke slaw and fries were all good too.  $34.64 for all of that for 1 person....hmmmm.  Not a budget eater's restaurant.  The spot was clean, good music, digital menu.

I think the lobster tasted great! Fries were okay. But the price was too much in my opinion. The size of the lobster roll is about a 6 in. Inside the roll isn't much lobster, but does have tons of bread for $25 each roll. Which we needed 2 so for $50 some thing bucks i feel like we could have got something else much more filling for same price.

Came in for lunch and was disappointed. I got the 50/50 lobster/crab roll and the seafood tasted pretty good and fresh, but the roll was about 85% roll. The roll itself was a little over toasted, over buttered, and over seasoned and tended to overpower the seafood. Lobster was not very well deveined since i pulled out a poop tube from my roll. Waffle fries were tasty and incredibly hot when they arrived. Coleslaw was bland/lackluster and tasted just of mayo mixed with water. Pickle was boring. If there was a more reasonable filling/roll ratio (ie more filling), I'd try again, but now I'm wondering what to get as an after lunch snack after spending $24 after tip.

Hi!  My husband and I visited Las Vegas for the first time as attendees for The GameStop Convention. Since both my husband and I were craving seafood, we happen to come across LobsterMe. Being that it was our first time visiting, I have to say that Ms. Rosa made us feel very comfortable by sharing with us the specifics of the items on the menu. Even though there were a couple guests behind us, we have to admit it we loved her patience and caring attitude about our interest.   How amazing to see a colleague of hers, Ms. Susan, who greeted us with a smile and immediately assisted the guests behind us.  When we sat at our table, within minutes a lovely lady, Ms. Carolina carefully rushed to our table to make sure it was clean and offered us beverages. How accommodating of her to acknowledge our presence during a busy day. Thankfully she was the one that brought the food to our table and again was attentive to our needs.   Ladies, what a true example of extraordinary customer service. We will definitely come back to try the other items on your menu. Thank you!

I ordered the Lobster Rolls, Connecticut style with a side of clam chowder. The lobster is surprisedly fresh and the bread taste like it's been dipped into a big pot of sweet butter, yummy!! Clam chowder is puuuurfect for me because it is not salty. For those that may need more taste there's salt and pepper packet you can add in your soup. The drinks are refillable. Seats are very limited so prepare to stand to eat or bring it home.

I was so excited to try this place!  We ordered the lobster roll and expected it to be outstanding but ended up being pretty disappointed.  $19 is normal for a lobster roll, but these ones were so not worth the price.  It's a pretty small roll so sides are definitely a must if you want to be full.  Ours came with one or two chunks of lobster surrounded by a lot of minced chunks.  Not at all what I've seen in pictures!  There really isn't any taste to them either.  The lobster isn't sweet, it's not buttery, not much seasoning to accompany the overall blandness. But, that's what I should've expected from a fast food type shop.

Got the lobster roll.  Was really good but a little skimpy on the meat.  Fries really good.  Would come again seeing how we are locals.  Not as good as Maine Lobster Roll but not bad.  LOCALS GET 20% OFF. YOU HAVE TO ASK FOR IT.

Visiting Vegas from AZ & we went here on the last day for a quick dinner.  Oh my god!  If I had gone there earlier I would have ate every meal there.  I see others thought it was over priced but I thought it was perfect.  I had the traditional roll with mayo & it was packed with lobster.  The roll isn't huge, but that's fine, because the lobster is what you want, not bread.  $22 for lobster roll & a water.  Try getting that much lobster anywhere else on the strip.  You'd pay 5x that much.  Please open one of these in AZ!

Service is always lacking at Vegas strip centers, but not at Lobster Me.  Cathy at the register had great recommendations and also let my crazy wife make all of her "necessary" changes and requests.  My wife just said "I wish I could put Cathy in my suitcase and take her home for our business" but that might be the Fat Tuesday drinks talking.
Original lobster on a stick-delicious. Fresh and flavorful with a dip of oil. Tastes better than the lobster I have had in Boston, although it's small.

On our search to eat at places we don't have in Orange County, my boyfriend and I stumbled across this place. We ordered the Lobster Mac n Cheese and the Crabcake Burger with Lobster Bisque and OMG it was heavenly. The bf is hard to please and he loved the lobster bisque. Would definitely try this again. And the service was great, the cashier was very attentive and gladly explained certain entrees we were thinking about ordering.

Have been waiting years to come here and it was not quite the perfection I had imagined.  Lobster roll was decent.  The bun was great and grilled on both sides.  The lobster meat was big and chunky but lacked flavor and seasoning.  There also was not enough butter so it basically was plain lobster on bread.  Too dry especially combined with fries.  We also shared the crab meat fries. That was a tasty combo with real bacon and a creamy sauce on top.  A little too much sauce for my liking though.  My expectations were too high but I would still eat here if no other lobster roll options.  I've had better lobster rolls from food trucks.

We ordered the "L" Lobster Roll, that they claim is the best in the world. I beg to differ.  For $17, we thought we were going to get something extraordinary.  C'mon, it's lobster!? But...FAIL! It was tiny and the ingredients were easy to figure out. Really?: Old bay, mayo, butter, and pepper...all in a bun. Wow...big whoop de doo. UGH Very disappointed.
The Lobsicle is a great invention. Lobster on a stick. Yummy. Fairly quick, we tried both the grilled and the deep fried

Fantastic and worth the price. Walked for about an hour to get to the seafood shack and was horribly disappointed. Came over here and got our food within 5 minutes and it's delicious. This place is awesome!

Though I personally couldn't see myself paying 18 bucks to eat a lobster roll, I tried the grilled cheese and it was pretty solid after doing some drinking earlier. My brother got the BLT lobster roll and left satisfied.

Food is always great! Service is great as well. They always make sure everything is what you expect. The lobster taste fresh and the chowder fries are just too good not to try! I stay and play in Venetian just because Lobster Me is here!

My favorite lobster roll place so far. Prices are pretty fair amongst some other similar places. The bread here is really soft and tasty. Service has always been pretty good here. I usually get the beltway (fave one). The lobster grilled cheese and lobster bisque is really good. Lobster mac and cheese was just alright tho. I will stop by everytime I'm in vegas.

Two contextual pieces of info are critical: everything in Vegas is more expensive than it feels like it should be, and lobster is usually expensive anywhere. That aside, we ordered the Old Bay lobster roll and it was really, really good. Just as you might think, it tasted like a deconstructed crab cake (made with lobster). The chunks of lobster were a good size. The bread isn't a bun as you may think, but rather (very, very) buttered toast.   It came with a couple forkfuls of coleslaw, which like the roll itself, didn't contain an excess of mayo (win!). We did wish the coleslaw were a bigger portion, as it complemented the lobster roll flavors nicely. It also came with very crispy housemade chips.   Service was fast, food was good and the menu was clear: the rolls were all the same prices (no having to pick one over the other because of pricing differences) and the menu was easy to understand. We would come back.

I am a New Englander by birth. You tell me there is a joint, landlocked in this Valley of Las Vegas, that will make me a fresh and delicious lobster roll? Until today I would call you a liar and probably spit on your shoe!  It's real. The unicorn that is a freshly made, legitimate lobster roll in Vegas has been found! My fiancee chose the Cajun style and I chose Classic Maine style.. I didn't get to try his (by the time I thought to ask he was finished) but mine hearkened back to camping near Bar Harbor as a little girl. So freaking good. Perfect amount of mayo, fresh lemon wedge, just a tiny bit of salt pepper and minced parsley. OMG. It even came on a toasty buttered split top bun!  The only thing I was not so jazzed about was the price. We had the two medium sized rolls and two fountain Cokes.. it came to $43. That is just insane, but I am a sucker for snacks!

Lobster Ice Cream...say what? Yes I tried it and yes it was good. Sweet ice cream with chunks of lobster.  This place is pretty easy to find, its in the Miracle Mile next to Fat Tuesday.  I think its reasonably priced considering its the strip. We got the mac n' cheese, the grilled cheese, and the shrimp tacos.  The shrimp tacos were not good - too spicy with little pieces of shrimp. Serves me right for eating shrimp at a lobster place. The tacos are the reason I couldn't give it 5 stars.  The mac and the grilled cheese were right on the money. So good. I wanted to lick the mac and cheese container clean but then I'd just look like a pig. =P  The line is hit or miss meaning it could be short or long depending if all the partiers are awake.  Next time we're in Vegas this is one of the places I will be hitting up again.

Full disclosure I was born and raised in New England so my standard for lobster in general is pretty high. Ordered the lobster roll (Cajun style) and a side of fries. Pretty expensive lunch (about 23$) which in some cases I am okay with. However the portion and quality of lobster are just okay. Smaller watery chunks of meat and Cajun style means they just sprinkle Cajun spices on top. Fries and chips are both very well done though for what it's worth. Not extremely mad I made this my first lunch in Vegas, just not sure I would repeat it.

It was a long long day and we didn'tt feel like dining out anywhere, just wanted to get some food to go and go back to the hotel. since our hotel was literally inside/right by the mall, we decided to try Lobster ME! everything seem to be a little price but then again, we're in vegas and on the strip, inside of a popular mall. everyone should try the Mac and cheese lobster! It's seriously the best! it's very rich and creamy! so good but so expensive, only a few lobster chunks. Lobster and chips were ok. I thought it was a bit pricy $30 for both and the portions was small. Only 5 pieces of lobster in each entree.

Who knew you could get great fresh Maine Lobster in Las Vegas without paying tons of money? We ordered the lobster Mac and cheese, and a Connecticut lobster roll meal. We got our number from the young girl who was helpful in assisting us since it was our first time ordering.  A few minutes later our food arrived. The  man who served it was nice but, you could tell was overwhelmed. The lobster Mac and cheese had huge chunks of lobster on top of what looked like boxed Mac and cheese with toasted bread crumbs thrown on top. It was good for the first two or three bites....after that I ate just the lobster, which was delicious! My husband's lobster roll, well he ordered the Connecticut and received the Original. I took the first bite and noticed it was cold, since both can come cold we didn't think much of it. He thought maybe they mistaking gave him the cold Connecticut. After bite two, he realised it was not the Connecticut but, the Original. By then a line had formed , I was almost done, and he had eaten a 1/3 of the sandwich. So, since it was good also he enjoyed the rest of it!  Overall the food is good and I think staff just needs to slow down a bit or hire more.

Fresh lobster, from a guy that grew up in Boston and knows his lobster. Don't get the Cajun or anything that will screw up quality seafood, just get the 'original'. Pros: they don't hide good stuff in mayonnaise. Clam chowda' is surprisingly good but thin for the people looking for mainstream soupy. Cashier was awesome and knew how to make food court like dolce gabana ;hope you get Dierdre). A lot for small servings l, but if you want the good stuff I junk these guys have the right idea. 20% off for locals.

I used to love this place, sandwich was nice lobster tail was awesome, now they serve you a bite of a sandwich for the same price and a lobster tail the size of a tootsie roll tootsie pop for the same price, unless you want to spend $100 to get half full from an empty stomach i would suggest sandwich of earl for a fraction of the cost. This place WAS awesome.

Absolutely the best lobster roll I've ever had  Nice casual walk up environment.  It's pricy, but not for Vegas.    Easy to find in the miracle mile.    Get the fries - they were great too.    I'm coming back to try the chowder

Was curious to try this place after having seen a friend post pictures of it on a couple of her visits to Vegas.  Finally got to try it and must say it was disappointing.  Perhaps it's this location.  I only recall having seen it in the Miracle Mile shops near Planet Hollywood, but now there's one in the Canal Shops at Venetian as well.  Was just looking for a quick snack in between lunch and late dinner, so shared the Connecticut lobster roll and added clam chowder soup.  The lobster roll tasted alright, but not really worth the $17 you pay for it.  At that price, it should come with fries included.  The clam chowder soup was pretty horrible.  It was really watered down and I think there was maybe one piece of clam in the entire bowl.  Definitely not impressive and probably won't be back again.

Ok food- definitely over priced for what you get. Lobster roll is about 4"long. Mac n' cheese was rather blah...clam chowder and lobster bisque was horrible. Grill cheese was the best thing I ate there...

The crab roll is better than the lobster roll.  The lobster doesn't taste fresh at all.  Overall, disappointing.  Ate here twice in one week as I was staying at Planet Hollywood for work and LobsterMe was a short and convenient walk. After an underwhelming experience on Day One, I figured I'd give it another try later in the week.  I ordered the crab roll the 2nd time around and it was "okay."  At least it didn't taste like old seafood.  The one thing I did enjoy from here was the fries. So, they've got that working in their favor, right?  Also, employees are nice so that counts for something.

The quality of the 6 inch lobster roll was good but I felt that it did not deserve the exorbitant price. ($30.00 with tip ....for a 6 inch lobster roll, small fries and ice tea...served in a paper basket with a plastic fork)  The lobster was seasoned perfectly and the meat was tender. The bread was a bit thick for the amount of lobster so I had to pull some off to balance the taste.

I recently stayed at the Palazzo and the Grand Canal Shops food court was my life saver during that weekend. Both the Venetian and Palazzo have big signs advertising the lobster roll so after seeing all the posters, I had to have one! I ordered the Connecticut style roll for $17 and made it a combo for an extra $4. I'm not sure if there was actually a pound of lobster meat in it but it was decent. The fries are pretty good but I was expecting a larger portion. The roll is overpriced for how it tastes because it's pretty bland. However, I was starving and it satisfied my craving. In retrospect, was the meal worth $23? Absolutely not.  Probably won't come back here based on how bland the roll is and how much it costs!

I got the classic lobster roll for $17. The lobster salad inside the roll was made up primarily of claw meat that was not to try. The roll itself was a thick piece of soft, buttery toast. Just the right amount of mayo.   There's a reason this place has stuck around. If you love lobster you need to visit this place.

The grilled cheese lobster is a must have. A little gem inside the Miracle Mile Shopping center next to Planet Hollywood. Definitely recommend the lobster bisque too while you are there. I wish they had more seating area.

This is probably my favorite place to grab a bite to eat in Las Vegas. Not only in the food amazing ( I mean it is all lobster and crab so duh), the service is quick and pleasant. Jeff, the GM, always goes out of his way to greet us by name whenever we stop by. Will be returning for the signature lobster roll and the amazing craft beer selection (only $6! What!). A must try when you are in Vegas.
Solid 2 stars for me. Pretty mediocre. The lobster quality isn't great and the mac and cheese is made with fake velveeta-ish cheese. Wouldn't recommend it.

Should have went to Luke's Lobster instead for a lobster roll.  The lobster taste rubbery and was lacking any flavor for $18.  The coleslaw was only have a container and the chips were very few and tasted stale.  If I had the option of coming back here I probably wouldn't.

Disappointing ! to say the least. The bisque was watery with no lobster pieces and the lobster salad was small with a vinegarette salad dressing that ruined what was poor to begin with. I usually try to give places the benefit of the doubt but I was truly disappointed in this spot as a former New Englander.

If you're looking for something fast and fulfilling, this place will do the trick. The food comes out fairly fast and fresh. We had ordered the lobster roll combo with a side of lobster mac. I love sriracha so we put that on my Mac n cheese, it was great! Eat it with the house made chips and it's a mouthgasm.

Lobster Mac and Cheese. It's cheesy, it has lobster bits in it. Some tasty stuff. It's pretty much in the food court at the mall in the Planet Hollywood but it was good. I wouldn't go for the other stuff. It's either a gimmick or not that good. This was a nice little snack right next to Fat Tuesday.

I've been to this location twice now, my last visit being this past weekend. The shop is located in the Miracle Mile Shops, just a little bit up from Earl of Sandwich and right next to Fat Tuesday. My friend and I came here right after a show which ended around 11:30PM on Saturday night. The place is opened until 12. The cashier was a pretty chill and enthusiastic dude, not something I was expecting near store closing. My friend and I both ordered the plain lobster roll. I didn't even read the note on top, but it comes with a side of criss cross fries, small cup of cole slaw and half a pickle. It is sort of pricey for fast food, but it's lobster we're talking about. Presentation of the lobster was very nice, and it came with a small piece of lemon. It's not the freshest or tastiest lobster I've had, but it satisfied my craving. Next time I'm going to give the crab roll a try!

To say I'm disappointed might be an understatement. Being from the east coast and having quite the affinity for shellfish when I heard and saw pics about this place I was excited. Who wouldn't want a XL lobster roll called "El Diablo" that's warmed with spicy sauce? Or a lobster roll with Vietnamese ginger sauce on it? Sounds good right? Well being a local that doesn't work on the strip I make it a mission to avoid it at all costs, unless the occasionally family member visits and we do the tourist thing.   So after about 20 minutes, the time it takes to get into the Venetian parking garage and walk to the spot I glanced up and saw a sign by the queue, it read 1 pound of lobster meat in every roll. Score! A pound doesn't seem like a lot but when it's lobster meat as my boy el guapo would say it is quite the plethora. Then came the oh crap moment, I glanced up and the lobster I wanted to try wasn't available. I wanted a "El Diablo" and to my dismay they had no XL sizes available on any of their rolls.  But the pictures from fellow yelpers look oh so good and filling!  My wife held me as I choked back my tears and ordered a CT roll. When I tell you this thing was small I mean it was small! Not what I expected based on their advertising and pictures from fellow yelpers. No where near a pound of meat in this, I attached a picture to show how tiny this was compared to a plastic fork. I scarfed it down in about 5 minutes and had to order the grilled cheese because I was not satisfied. So not only did they not have the type of roll I wanted but they also skimped me on the lobster meat!! Maybe it's a different size with the locals 20% discount? Or perhaps they are trying to cut corners by getting rid of their XL size and different flavors.    On a good note the little I did get tasted awesome! The staff was super friendly and helpful and thank god for the 20% discount otherwise it would have killed us based on my second meal. IMO it's not worth it. So when you come here don't expect to get full and check out my pics compared to old pics and their advertising. I was legitimately disappointed :-(

Lobster Me advertised a deal where you get the lobster melt, you would get a cup of lobster bisque for free! I love freebies! I don't know if Lobster Me was using this promotional deal to get people to try their $12 lobster melt sandwich... but I took the plunge and did just that. My lobster bisque did not have any lobster in it. It was literally just seafood flavor cream soup. My lobster melt and all of the ooey gooey goodness of a melt with maybe an ounce of lobster meat in it. While the melt tasted good, it lacked the meaty lobster the pictures on the menu and website promised. The Lobster Mary, total delicious. You get a whole lobster claw in your bloody mary, but it was a weak drink. Overall, if you want an expensive 2 star quick meal, this is the place. I'd say save your $30 and pay the extra $20 and go to a buffet where you get all you can eat seafood.
Ordered the lobster maine roll and you get large chunks of lobster meat.  Very tasty and definitely worth the price.  Unlimited drink refills.  Service was friendly and prompt.

I had the crab fries and it was a great portion and very filling.  I was really impressed as these types of chains have not come to Canada yet (at least that I am aware of).  Food was cooked to order - my fries were nice and crisp and not soggy at all.  The lobster sauce was to die for.  For sure a great treat if you are looking to fill up!

One of the less expensive dining options at the Venetian. Small portions of seafood are served on bread or fries. Tasty but very salty. Very overpriced. It wasn't terrible though. The Bloody Mary was 4 and was served in a small plastic cup with tons of crushed ice. It was VERY strong, so I enjoyed it more as the ice melted. I'm all about delicious Bloody Mary's and this was not my favorite. In my opinion, there are better places to eat and drink on the strip.
Jeff, the general manager is super cool and the food is amazing.  We are foodies and business people.  This guy / place knows how to create repeat business and loyalty.

I checked this place out in between work one time for lunch with a coworker. I couldn't believe there was an actual place with lobster rolls. I am a harsh critic because I frequent Boston, my original place of birth quite a bit and have had it fresh there. I ordered their Original Maine Lobster Roll with fries. I liked the presentation when the roll came out with the claws on the top of the toasted bun. The roll tasted great! It wasn't too seasoned, not too garlicy. The lobster meat was fresh and I will definitely go back to this establishment.

Prepared by one chef (it seems) so we waited about 14mins for our snack (yes, snack; ONE street taco since we had dinner reservations for an hour later).   Me: not worth $8 The Man: worth $8  Gonna still come back and try something different. We'll see!

Well, I can check this off my list!! Great experience, loved the Lobster roll - Maine/Cajun-Style!! My wife had this on our list of stops while in Vegas this weekend and it was amazing!! Drinks were kickin too!! Loved it, killed it!! Thank you Liza!! You Rock!!

Took home a lobster roll and clam chowder...lobster roll was full of lobster and seasoned perfectly ( it's all lobster and small amount of mayo- the perfect way to have a lobster roll) it's a little pricey ($19 for lobster roll) but you pretty much get a whole lobster on that roll so it's worth it. The bread was also good, not too buttery, a little sweet, and not too thick.    The clam chowder was very good, almost as good as SAN FRAN WHARF (says a lot).  Not sure why all the semi-ok reviews I LOVE SEAFOOD and am very picky/ almost snobby about my seafood and this place was actually pretty good!    Give it a try!

I ordered a surf & turf with no onions & told the Mgr and the cashier I could NOT eat onions or I get sick . Well halfway into the sandwich I bite into an onion and see 4 pretty good pieces of onion in my sandwich . I take it back to counter and the mgr acts mad at me for the onions . I don't want a new one since I feel sick from eating the onions so he says he will take off my sandwich . Not only did he NOT refund me my sandwich but he charged me for another beverage . Not going back there again .

I'm a big foodie and when I go to Vegas, I search out good restaurants and this happened to be one of my favorite meals of the trip! I had the classic lobster roll and my daughter had the the lobsicle and both were fantastic!! Like some of the other viewers stated a little spendy and I certainly could have eaten more so the portions are not big but the quality is there!! I would recommend this place and I would go back!!

Located on the corner next door to Fat Tuesday, this restaurant is good for something different.  Lobster rolls come in two sizes - Large ($17) and XL.  They are served on a paper slip, similar to how a large hot dog might be served.  Sandwiches are cold, and I tasted most of the special seasoning only on the lobster claw that is laid across the side of the sandwich (see pictures I posted of the menu and large sandwich).  There are other flavors, but I had "The Original."  My husband had the Lobster Grilled Cheese ($10).  He said it was pretty good.  It didn't look particularly big - about the same size as a regular grilled cheese sandwich - maybe a little thicker since the cheese inside was mixed with lobster.  It was good, and while I understand the price a little since we're talking lobster, but it was still pricey in general.  I wouldn't say this sandwich would necessarily be a future craving for me.

First off, the owner (I think he is) is a dick.  The food?  Overpriced and low quality.  If you ever had a decent lobster roll, you would never eat it here.  What a waste of space!  Don't waste your stomach here!  Too many awesome places to eat in Vegas for this crap.  Highlights *None!  Lowlights *Overpriced *Dumbass owner with an attitude *Claims to serve lobster bisque in bread bowl. NOPE.

The taste is soooo amazing!!! The chowder fries were surprisingly amazing. My husband and I both had the warm Cajun Lobster roll. The only this that kept it from a five was the roll was pretty small for the price you pay. Besides that we would come back again

Let me preface by saying I grew up in Maine, currently live in LA, and am VERY picky about lobster, especially lobster rolls. Is it the best lobster roll in the world as proclaimed on the sign? No, for that you need to literally pull a lobster out of the frigid Maine ocean and cook it immediately. Is it pretty outstanding considering it's in a mall in Vegas? Absolutely.   I've had the lobster roll and the lobster grilled cheese and both are just wonderful. In my opinion, there's too much lemon and spices on the roll, but otherwise it's perfect-big chunks of lobster tossed in mayonnaise on a hot buttered bun. The lobster grilled cheese is also excellent-hot, steamy lobster in gooey melted cheese between two buttery, toasty slices of white bread. Yum!  Food in Vegas isn't cheap, period, but if you want something relatively inexpensive that is different and not fast-food, I highly suggest you check out Lobster, ME.

Save your money and go to a different place. The register girl (I'm talking to you miss Asian with the fake, long blonde hair and fake lashes without a name tag to reference who was seen arguing with her manager) was rude and didn't bother to explain despite my questions regarding the items. She then didn't give me a number so my food wasn't delivered until I noticed 5 other people behind me had already received their food and I was still waiting. It's way overpriced and the quality of the lobster roll is mediocre. I had the traditional and it was barely lukewarm when it should have been served warm--as they indicate on their menu. You also get scraps of lobster instead of lobster chunks. BTW, I've had my fair share of Cousin's Maine lobster trucks and those are so much better and cheaper than LobsterMe. Pass if you can.

I wanted to see what all the rave was about the Lobsticle, hell might as well call it a Shrimpsticle, the thing was so small I busted out my binoculars.  For the price it is not worth it, yes its Lobster but come on.  And not to mention the $7 dollar Hot Dog with NO fries for my kid (he really wanted one) that was also outrageous.  Mac and cheese was also flavorless.  2 stars for the free refills.

Great customer service, nice location with eye candy.  My only grip was the amount of lobster in the sandwich. They said it was a 1 pound lobster, then deconstructed to extract the meat that goes in.  my question is why dont they just weight out 1lb of lobster meat then put that into the sandwich!   The side of fries i ordered tasted alot better than the roll. Again, if the price was appropriated with the amount of lobster i might be a return customer.

Not bad, but not the best lobster-themed place I've been to. I got the Lobster frenchie but was kind of disappointed because it didn't have much cheese and didn't have much lobster. The seasoning was good though, and the lobster bisque (free with Yelp checkin) was delicious! I dunked my sandwich in the soup for more lobster flavor. The chowder fries weren't really special, not much sauce was on it. I had a bite of my friend's miso lobster roll and it was quite unique and yummy though.

After my initial review, management reached out to me to address my concerns, asking me to give the location another shot. I did not think much of it at the time, but, fast forward to a year later, my husband and I were going to be in town again and I decided to take them up on the offer. Why not?   Okay, so I think the new menu is awesome and the changes that they have made in the past year are great! The prices have increased, however the rolls are slightly larger, a little more toasted (yum), and there is more lobster !!! The potato chips are gone and the standard fries have been replaced with seasoned waffle fries and they are delicious.   The lobster mac and cheese was very decadent.  You can probably check my reviews on Yelp and OpenTable to verify that I don't really hand out five star reviews lightly, but not for nothing, I was super impressed with our meal at Lobster Me today.   My only suggestion would be to serve the lobster mac and cheese in a more shallow dish as the current serving dish is a little deep and makes it a little awkward to effectively eat the dish, although we easily solved this by pouring it all out into the larger boxy serving container that the mac and cheese came in.   I often wonder if reviews left on review sites or blogs even make a difference to the companies or if they even bother to read them. I thought it was pretty awesome to see that some of the things that I initially griped about were fixed over the past year and management actually seemed to care that a guest that spent money at their establishment was unhappy and reached out to discuss concerns. That pretty much never happens, anymore. Great to see a company with an open ear for criticism and feedback.   The changes to the menu are great and I look forward to coming back here next time we are in Vegas!!

It's 10AM on a Friday morning and you're already drunk. SInce my friends decided to get Fat Tuesdays, we also decided to get this next door.  Prices are really expensive though but it was really good. Everything had lobster in it in some way. I got the tater tots for 2-3.50 while others had lobster mac and cheese for 9.50.   It only tastes good if you're drunk. I wouldn't have ordered anything here if I was sober.

Overpriced for the quality and amount of food you get. For a combo, you get like 15 french fries and a roll by itself is already $19! At least they offer you a refill on your drink but overall pretty underwhelming for almost totaling $30. Save your money for a fat tuesday and eat somewhere else.

Yes, it's lobster.  Yes, it's Vegas. Yes, things are going to be overpriced.  Then at least have better service, man.  I was super annoyed bc the place was literally empty--no customers. The guy working the front was chit chatting with his friend. Sees me waiting, keeps chit chatting.  WOW.  It was long enough that I was contemplating if I should just leave.    ANYWAY.  Got the Old Bay lobster roll and the lobster bloody.  A-OK.  Got more bread than loster in the roll and the chips were stale.  The lobster bloody was really good. Of course they had the lobster claw as garnish (that's how they justify the hefty price tag) and I did have someone stop me as I was walking through the mall asking about it.  It had good spice and was pretty good sized.  I tried a bit of my boyfriend's chowder--really good.  This has always been a spot that I've walked by and thought--I really need to try this place out--and I finally have.  I probably won't ever buy the lobster bloody again (it was good for the gram, though!), but I will def try other things on the menu.   Eyeing that lobster mac n cheese or grilled chZ.  Not sure.  Til next time.
Great place to visit if you love lobster. The lobsicle is the best. It's lightly breaded on a stick served with lemon and butter right next to Fat Tuesday

Lobster in casino shops equal a great snack and tourist stop.  Lobster me is located in the planet hollywood casino million mile mall. A great little shop in one of the center spots. Quick service is always great when entertaining with little ones. Lobster tots n fries is a good value and big portion for two to snack on when walking the "mile". If you have more time order the bisque in a breadbowl or the lobster mac for a good heaping lobster portion. Will be back.
Had the Beltway Lobster roll and LOVED it. We'll definitely be back! Wish we had one in Austin!!!

Our first time here and the lobster meat you get is worth it . I got the Signature Lobster Roll New England style and my husband got the lobster mac n cheese . Mines came with coleslaw but it was bland in flavor so I didn't even eat that and the mac n cheese was more like a soup. Service was great and the gal that helped us was very friendly. I would still go back for the roll.
Great lobster rolls and the clam chowder is awesome.  It's a very casual place that offers big tables to share, picnic style so you meet people you don't know
This place was not too bad.  This place is decent when you are busy running around and need food.  Overpriced and decent tasting but not the best.
Great food! My husband and I both ordered the xl lobster roll. Excellent!!  A little pricey, but I will definitely return. A good amount of fresh tasting lobster on a perfectly toasted roll.

What a nice break.  If you're not eating at another buffet or dropping serious money on a $$$$ foodie restaurant then you might be tempted to just eat a quick bite at some junk food place.  But why would you do that if you can get a lobster roll that is pretty damn good for a 10 minute wait.  We really enjoyed the Original and the Cajun.  The lobster Mac & cheese and fish tacos were also pretty decent.  The staff there pushed this from a 4-star to a 5-star.  Genuinely nice and friendly.  I would stop here anytime I'm back in Vegas and looking for a good quick bite.

The food was very good and the staff provided friendly service. However, this is still a food court, fast food-esque spot, and the prices were just too much. My boyfriend and myself each ordered the connecticut roll and lobsicle and were happy with it; I just wasn't happy with the price for the amount of food that is served.

Good place for Lobster Lovers. I personally really like lobster but I feel this place could be a bit better with certain dishes. I had the lobsicle, lobster mac and cheese, lobster bisque, Conneticut lobster roll and some tea. The Mac and cheese needed more lobster and cheese as the shells were left dry. The roll was good. The lobsicle's batter coulda used more flavor. All in all not too bad

I went here during the Mayweather vs Pacquiao fight weekend and this place is good. I had the cajun style lobster roll and I loved it. It was very tasty and had a ton of lobster meat inside. The bread was toasted slightly covered with butter. I was totally surprised with the quality and taste. I recommend this place with you are looking for a quick bite to eat while on the strip or shopping.

Lobster Me is a tradition every time we go to Vegas. It isn't cheap @$19 / lobster roll, but it IS cheap for the Vegas strip.  Price aside, the lobster rolls are to die for. I'd rather eat a lobster roll than go to a $50 Vegas buffet. Quality over quantity.

This was my first time at Lobster Me. To start my experience, I was greeted right away by cashier. The young lady went through the menu with me as therw was so many interesting choices. When I finally decided to the lobster trio. The flovors of the tacos were amazing. They are so different it would be hard to pick a favorite. There was a shrimp, fish, and lobster taco. It was a great price for what you got. The food arrived very fast. While eating the manager actually was walking around conversating checking on everyone.  Overall my experience was wonderful. I would highly recommend it!

I missed my chance to try Lobster Me at the Grand Canal Shoppes (Venetian) on my last Vegas trip, but was given another opportunity at the Miracle Mile Shops (Planet Hollywood).  I ordered the batter fried Lobsicle- lobster tail on a stick ($14). When it came out, I was disappointed by how small it was. Lobster is expensive, but still. Aside from that, I enjoyed it. It was lightly battered and tender. I also tried my friend's Cajun lobster roll. It was small and bland. I wouldn't come here again, but am glad I tried them.

Lobster, lobster, lobster.  What can I say? Succulent, juicy, delicate meat. Better than fish meat.  Check.  Better than steak? Maybe not by too much.  One of my favorite spots for a quick lobster roll in Vegas.  Tuckered inside Planet Hollywood's indoor shopping center. The lobster meat are a bit cold on the rolls.  Which dives it down a star.  I like my meat temperature warm or slightly hotter than room temperature so I would know they're pretty fresh from the steamer.  I'm pretty sure they keep it refrigerated after peeling it off the lobster.  I had lobster mac and cheese, 2 lobster rolls and 2 lobster popsicles.  The lobster roll wins hands down. The mac and cheese was good but with very little lobster meat.  The other downside is the quantity of meat.  It's around 5 ounces for a small.  But what I enjoy about it must be the soft buttery bread that encases it.  So good.  My plans in Vegas was to eat mostly Steak and Lobster.  And this does not disappoint on my seafood scale.  Make sure you wash it down with a hefeweizen which they also have on tap.

I tried the lobster tacos and chowder fries and the tacos were one of the best I've ever had! They definitely did not skimp on the lobster! But I guess for the price they charge, they better not! I agree with the reviews that say their prices are a bit steep but the lobster tasted really fresh and not rubbery and the flavors were amazing! As for the chowder fries, it's more of a loaded fries with bacon, cheese, green onions, etc than a chowder on top but it was still good. I would recommend this place if you want something quick and delicious and have money to blow!

Ordered the infamous LOBSICLE and lobster bisque. If you're thinking of only ordering the LOBSICLE, make sure you order another one (don't order the lobster bisque.. Lol). The LOBSICLE is super small.. Tastes good but for the price... Umm.. And the bisque..there's definitely a hint of lobster taste there. More like lobster water..
Pricey- but delicious. The lobster bisque was ok. Portions were small. The lobster roll was good but again portions were small. expensive for food court type atmosphere and food.

4/5, Location: In Vegas and planning to drink? Fat Tuesday in Planet Hollywood is one of the locations to stop by. I'm sure you'll find that place easily meaning Lobster ME is easy too (unless you're too drunk already) because it's right next to it!  4/5, Service: The ordering process is quick and easy.  3/5, Food: Coming from Hawaii where everything's already expensive, the price at Lobster ME wasn't intimidating. The quality of food was relatively the same but I realized the portion of food was just roughly the size of a fist. It tasted great but I'm not sure if it was really worth it for the amount of food you got.  If you're ever craving lobster to-go as a sandwich, I'd stop by Lobster ME. If not, it's a good place to visit once, but other than that, you'd best give some other places a try on the strip.

Im a fan but I won't come back every time I'm in Vegas. The bread was yummy, the lobster was too but I didn't like the claw part, it was yucky.   I got the XL cajun and my bf got the original XL, meat was a bit cold. XL for $23. I thought it was a bit pricey but I assume they sell it by weight, so idk..   Everything came out totaling $68 for lunch. (2 XL, fries, large drink and lobster mac & cheese - which was overrated.) And again, I thought it was pricey for lunch for just sandwiches.   Will I be back?   Maybe when lobster ice cream is available. For this trip, it wasn't.

Great quality (for being nowhere near the ocean) lobster rolls!! Definitely coming back! Good big chunks of lobster, not too buttery toasty bread, crisp tater tots, what's not to love?!! Located at planet hollywood's indoor mall.
Rolls are great perfect amount of meat. the toast is perfect. Service is friendly and fast. Love coming here. Great staff

I was expecting more bang for my buck, but left kind of disappointed. Since I was a first timer, I took up the recommendations of the cashier and got the lobster mac & cheese and lobster Maine-style sandwich with fries to share. Unfortunately, it was alright and did not satisfy my starving belly.   The lobster mac and cheese definitely needed a lot more lobster and the mac and cheese was too greasy and the cheese was too watery. There weren't even enough macaroni noodles to compensate for the cheese-like soup that was in the bowl. I would not recommend getting it.  The lobster Maine-style sandwich tasted like the ocean...enough said. I did enjoy the fries though! Would I come back? Maybe- but definitely not to get these two dishes.

Lobster Me is the perfect place for someone like me who is OBSESSED with seafood. I dream about anything and everything with lobster in it so stopping by here was a must on my last trip to Vegas.   Too bad this place definitely didn't live up to my high expectations. It seemed extremely overpriced for what we got. And we were still hungry after.. So I somehow paid $28 for a small amount of food and I got to go back to my hotel hungry.   I'll come back to try the lobster ice cream though. That sounds super interesting..

Lobster ice cream?  WTF?!  I sampled the lobster ice cream and it was definitely interesting.  Tasted like butter cream with bits of lobster.  Not bad, but the texture is unexpected.  We ended up ordering a lobster grilled cheese sandwich and a lobster roll (photos are included).  The lobster roll was small but was very good.  The grilled cheese sandwich was also good but was a little bland.  They had tapatio sauce to help spice it up.  Over all for a lobster roll, and lobster grilled cheese, and 1 drink, the total was a little over $30.  It was a good place to munch while you are shopping.  Other items on the menu included lobster mac n cheese and lobster soup in a bread bowl.  What I did not like about this place was the wait literally took forever.  I also did not like that it did not provide enough places to sit down.  This was a good place to grab something good and go.

I love the concept. The ice cream was mostly vanilla tasting with an interesting texture of lobster, which WAS plentiful in it.  The mac and cheese with lobster on top was delicious and a huge portion for $11.  The service was polite and friendly, but the preparation time was a little slow, and I had to fight for a seat in this mall atrium. They could use a few more tables if the mall will let them have it. Especially since people buy buckets of beer there and sit in place for a few hours.  I'd say though, spring for the lobster roll. It is worth the extra 5 bucks over the other things on the menu.   I just like saying the word lobsicle. Can you blame me?
Gotta go for the Original Lobster Sandwich Large. Best lobster in Vegas hands down. Lobster Mac and Cheese was OK, kinda bland.

It's taken me a year to write this review (don't judge)... So Lobster ME had me as soon as I read their name. Everything was super yummy...fresh, sweet, and delicious. My issues with them, however, were that the Lobster Roll was small and needed more lobster on it, esp considering how much everything on the menu COST. It is not a cheap place to eat, which also was a turn off. I get it; lobster, Vegas, sure. But damn. That said, everything we ordered (and we ordered a lot lol) was really good. I have no doubt I'll be back. And will still be complaining about the prices. :)

Decent lobster roll joint in vegas. I would come here anytime I'm in vegas and craving some lobster. I am from the bay area so there are definitely way better lobster rolls out there, but for vegas this place will do. I got the original lobster roll which I thought was pretty good along with the combo of chowder fries, coleslaw and a drink (~$26, for this price I'm not sure it's worth to get the combo unless you really want to try the fries and sandwich), and someone else in my group ordered the grilled cheese w/ Lobster (~$11) which debateably is the better thing to order.

I tried the lobsicle with the lobster deep fried (the other option was to have the lobster grilled) and it was great!  Juicy, tender and flavorful.  Unfortunately Im leaving Vegas today so I'll have to get lunch here the next time I return

Got a coupon from the Miracle Mile Shopping center for free beer with any lobster roll.  We tried the regular lobster roll. With $17 bucks, the lobster roll indeed comes with full packed lobster. The taste is good. However, it will be much better if less greasy. You can also upgrade to XL size with additional $5 bucks

Worst service ever! They will ignore you if you are in line. Just walk right up cause you will be service first. Then when you let the minimum wage guys know there was a line, they will just laugh at you and tell you it will be just a minute. Sorry, you just lost a $30 sale, yup for a lobster "roll", for a $3 bottle of water sell.

Coming from the East Coast, I generally don't eat Seafood when there is no ocean around. That being said, the portions are def more expensive than what they would be back home, but the lobster was good and seasoned well. The bisque was very plain. This time around I had the lobsicle and bisque. Next time, I will go for a lobster roll.

For fried food the fish and chips arrived hot and tasty.  Service was nice and even cooks came out to counter to deliver food especially if there was a customer return.  I would have appreciated a healthier option but could not discern from the menu.  Seating is first come, mall seating.  Perfect for grab and go or take to your hotel room or poolside snack at the Elara.

I was treated to Lobster Me by my friend who is a chef that I trust very much. I have never cared for lobster rolls but he kept talking about the one here. We had Old Bay style. I am now a lobster roll lover. No mayo or celery, just garlic butter and Old Bay. I think I'm in love. The Old Bay fries are also very yummy. The draw back? Customer service and employees always eating. The one who brought our food out was not only eating but speaking to us with her mouth crammed full. GROSS!!! Not only that, she always had a scowl on her face and acted like she would rather be anywhere else. Plus, a prep cook who we could see from our table through the pass through was also eating and doing so WHILE WEARING GLOVES AND PREPPING ORDERS!!  I really almost left but  my friend convinced me to stay. That grossness needs to be fixed. Also, he said the Venetian location is better all around. We will go there from now on.

Stick with the Cajun. It has the right amount of butter mayo and peppers. The flavor is enjoyable. My second time here. Ordered the Connecticut as well not bad but preferred the Cajun. Overall if you love lobster this is a must. Enjoy it

The Beltway roll and lobster bisque were delicious. I would definitely get them both again.  The lemonades were a disappointment. There is a sign that says they're freshly made, but the lemonade definitely tasted like a powder mix. I tried both the regular lemonade and the blueberry lemonade. They both taste stupid. Some of the worst lemonade I have ever had.  Hence, they lost a star from me.  Stick with their specialty.... the lobster rolls, and you should be satisfied.   And as far as the price, I think they are pretty average for a lobster roll so I'm not sure what everyone is complaining about.

After seeing so many sign on the strip and in the mall about lobster rolls it made me very hungry and craving it. I finally found this place and I wished I never did. The image of the lobster roll looks better and bigger than it actually is.   You pay $20+ for a small lobster roll with probably half the meat. It looks like a price of toast folded in half with half of a lobster on it. When the menu said "Maine lobster" I thought the rolls would look like one you get in Maine as well. Well it isn't....it's just tiny. The taste of the Cajun roll I got was good. But let's be honest...it's kind hard to mess up a taste esp if the lobster is fresh enough.   The side of potato chips that it came with also taste burnt. I think I only ate one and threw the rest away. The side of salad was good. I think that could have been the only thing that met my expectation.   Totally not worth grabbing a bite here if you have other choices. But if this is your old choice I do recommend getting the Maine original roll. The Cajun isn't spicy at all so it won't satisfy your spice cravings.

We were looking for a quick and inexpensive lunch. I was really craving a lobster roll - but most of the ones in Vegas are over $30! Lobster ME is located inside the planet Hollywood shopping plaza near the Fat Tuesday drink stand.   They sell lobster rolls, other seafood rolls, lobster mac, and many other lobster dishes. For the rolls, you can customize your "style" like New England or siraccha. We got the signature lobster roll New England style for $24. Good thing is that each sandwich comes with fries, coleslaw, and a pickle. The pictures on yelp and their stand are definitely deceiving! For $24, you would think it would be overflowing with lobster....  I would give the sandwich a 3.5/5 for taste - I've had better lobster rolls that were very juicy and buttery. This one was okay....the lobster was good but not amazing and for $24 not worth the large price tag! I would opt for chipotle or some other fast food joint for a more filling meal. However, if you are in the mood for lobster rolls, I would try this place out because it is probably cheaper than other nicer restaurants on the strip. It's also fast so you can grab and go without worrying about time constraints.

I know folks have been assuming this place is trying to be clever by naming themselves Lobster ME since ME is supposedly abbreviated for Maine, home of the world's best lobsters.  Their choice of price point and marketing strategy to serve their food in the style of your neighborhood galleria is questionable (when was the last time you purchased a single item in a food court over 15 bucks, including airports?)   My latest theory is that the name was originally supposed to be Lobster MEH and even their shoddy construction of the sign resulted in the H falling off.     In terms of quality, this place strikes me as the byproduct of a marginal Iron Chef contestant presented with the secret ingredient of succulent Maine Lobster and concocting 4-5 mediocre dishes (including the fatal death blow of using a savory ingredient for ice cream)  The judges have spoken: Iron Chef Meh, your cuisine does not reign supreme.  Save your money to purchase two amazing lobster rolls caught right off of Cape Cod for the price of one "world's best lobster roll" (picture me taking two lobster claws and making air quotes) that you could be purchasing here.

Walking around miracle mile shops I had this feeling in the pit of my stomach that Lobster Me was located here but yelp was acting slower than a snail at this time. When I saw that gold sign I swear I squealed like a little piglet!    lobster grilled cheese $11- so damn good. Right amount of cheese with the right around of lobster! It had different cheeses inside & not just american.   Lobster Mac & Cheese $12- this was the highlight of my day! I've been wanting to try lobster Mac & Cheese forever. It was so delicious with so much lobster meat. It wasn't dry or overcooked which was perfect! It is a little portion but I think it was a good amount to be shared by 2 little girls like us.   I want to come back and try everything on the menu. So, see you soon lobster me!

I still love this place but it looks like the price increased and they took the option of a large lobster roll. Cajun fries are also a dollar more now. We usually come twice the weekend we go to Vegas but we're probably going to have to cut down now.

I just had the lobster roll here by recommendation from a friend. He was a few hundred bucks up and really wanted me to try their rolls here, so he bought me one. I just finished eating a crazyass lunch at Mon Ami Gabi, but what the heck...it can't be that big...  It was HUGE! Not only that, you can taste the freshness of the lobster meat...and rest assured, they give you A LOT of lobster.   Does it match up to Luke's in NY? Nope, but pretty close. Better portions for the price here, that's for sure.

I so wanted to like this place and was excited to try it. The lobster roll was overpriced, tiny and didn't taste very fresh. The lobster Bloody Mary was OK, really spicy and the lobster was decent. I should've stuck with just the drink.

This was the worst food I have ever had in Las Vegas.  I was really looking forward to trying this place.  We had the lobster roll.  It had no flavor and was only mildly warm, the fries where stale.  My BF had the lobster grilled cheese and it tasted very fishy.  Had to send it all back.  Total waste of money.  Barf... oh and I had an allergic reaction.  I'm not allergic to anything but had a sore throat from this?

Tried someone's the lobster mac&cheese... Too little lobster, noodles swimming in cheese and grease.  Bought a lobster grilled cheese... Way too much cream cheese and again too little lobster for the price.  Overall, it's not the best but it'll do.

so not sure if its because i was hungry but this place was really good. what took it from 4.4 to 4.5 was the service. service was fantastic and they were slammed due to the convention in town.  lobster roll is second best i had. very fair portion. fries were fantastic too. not sure if they were hand cut. actually i dont think they were but still great. lobster mac and cheese was fine.  very pricey though FYI  jeans: OK by far ORDER: at counter

I've gone here everyday while out in Vegas. Food is fast and service is courteous.  I saw a billboard ad for this place and could only hope the pictures of the lobster mac and cheese was as appealing on the advert. It lived to it's expectations on all accounts.  This is not your college staple mac and cheese!  There's lobster complementing it and it's delicious noodles in a cheddar sauce.  I can't imagine life before eating here, maybe everything was dark, drab and tasteless. The lobster rolls definitely hit the spot.  I tried the lobster tacos today and I'd like to think I have a new favorite here.  The fresh lobster and cabbage slaw on the corn tortillas are heavenly. I cannot recommend this place enough. Pricing is the norm for a casual fast food eatery on the Strip.  I wouldn't  call it cheap by any means, but value for dollar, it's a good eat here!

I'm a lobster fan, just lobster in general.  When I had found out that this place existed, I knew it was over.  Could there be a little more lobster ?! Yes, but then again, I want it all.  It's at a good price point for what is offered on the strip.  Staying on the Strip or eating on the Strip, it will cost a few nickels more as opposed as to eating from some location elsewhere.   I'll admit, I have been going here everyday since I've arrived.  The lobster is fresh and service is pretty decent.  There's a little wait depending on the time of day, but it's well worth it.  Their fries are deliciously twice cooked so you get that extra crunch in each bite.  I liked the lobster rolls, but since there are many-few options on the menu, I'm trying to try them all.  It's a small feat indeed.  Their lobster mac and cheese is simply delectably delicious as well as their lobster mac and cheese fries!  Service is friendly, great product.  If you're on the Strip, stop in for a bite.  It hasn't failed to please.
Wow excellent Mac n cheese. Wobbly tables tho. Definately coming again. Yelp is bothering me to continue to write. I'd rather eat

I guess not too many people have lived on the East Coast based on the reviews. Small portion, over cooked, lacking flavor is what I experienced. A major disappointment after a very long day at work. I would be an idiot if I ever wasted my hard earned dollars on this place again.

Walking through the Venetian you stumble upon this place in a food court.  It was a bit of a surprise to me.  Food court of the rich & famous!  I only wish they had a Mickydees there too so I could complain about having lobster in my teeth next to a dollar menu-nair..  Never would have though that something so pricey would compete for space in such an absurd location?  So yeah the lobster rolls are 17 bucks.  They essentially are a small 1lb lobster crammed into a single piece of Texas toast folded in half.  Your options are Maine style(cold) Connecticut (warm with butter & lemon) or spicy/Cajun versions of the two.    What did I choose?  That's a no brainer.  Connecticut style of course.  There's just not a lot of meat on a 1lb lobster so it disappeared before I could remember to take a pic for you guys.  Oh man was it good!  The bread was toasty & soft.  The lobster was warm & buttery.  For being so small it was mighty dee-lish.  That's what she said.  No really, I split it with my girl & she did say that.  3.5/5 only because of the size.  You could double the lobsty for another 10$, but I would have to score it lower due to the price raising to 27$.  To offset the little L-Roll.  We also got the Lobster & Chips for 13$.  Chunks of tail battered and fried.  There was a decent amount in there.  Now the "chips" basically fries.  These were crispy and great.  Greasy as all Hell though.  For the value and novelty I'd say 4/5 solid  Service was satisfactory and generally nice for food court standards.  Price doesn't scare me, if I have a hankering.   I'll be back.

A great place to stop for a lobster roll.  On one of my many weekday business trips to Vegas, where I usually stay at Elara (formerly PH Westgate), I was searching for someplace close to get some dinner to take back to my hotel room (where yes, I would be working, picking up where I left off when I left the client office). While wandering around the Miracle Mile, I found Lobster ME and tried their Original Maine Style lobster roll to go. OMG, so filling and so good. Definitely a nice change from the sandwiches and other quick style food to go. A little pricey at $22, but luckily it came reasonably close to my per diem for dinner. =D

In a city dominated by corporate chain restaurants and celebrity-starred restaurants, restaurants like Lobster Me are a dying breed. With no Gordon Ramsay or Joel Robuchon advertising for it, its only star is... The Lobster!  Lobster Me's entire menu revolved around the wonderful crustacean that is the Lobster.  Spanning from the original Lobster Rolls to the Lobster Banh Me Sandwich to the Lobster Mac & Cheese, you can't avoid the main star of the restaurant.  My friend and I found Lobster Me after coming tru the parking garage @ Planet Hollywood. Being the Lobster lover I am, I begged my friend to try Lobster Me as well. I ordered the Lobster Mac & Cheese with the french fries (covered with lobster seasoning powder) and a fresh lemonade. My buddy tried the Lobsicle (a stick of grilled lobster meat) with the homemade potato chips.  There was plenty of lobster in my Mac & Cheese. Even though the mac & cheese wasn't one of those gourmet mac & cheeses you would usually expect at a high end restaurant, it gets the job done. I loved it, even though I would probably not get the fries in the future because it wasn't that good. My buddy raved about the Lobsicle, deeming it a masterpiece and the lobster flesh succulent.   Service was good. The employees consistently came around our tables to ask if we needed anything and offered us refills on our sodas. (no refills on that delicious lemonade). The only negative thing I could say about Lobster Me are the high prices of their food fare, considering it's "fast food". A meal per guest will come out to average almost $20 for lobster entree + drink + fries/chips.  You could definitely spend more money at a worse place ( I am talking to you, Serependity 3). But hey, leasing a place inside the Miracle Mile Shops doesn't come cheap!

This is a nice place to stop for a quick bite to eat. I would never have expected to get such a good tasting lobster roll in such a short amount of time. I had the Beltway with the house made chips and coleslaw. The downside is that the sandwich is small and pricey.

We'd just arrived in Vegas and were walking around the Miracle Mile shops when we realized we should find some food.  Lobster Me is in the food court area.  The menu sounded intriguing so we decided to eat here.  I'm so glad we did.  We had the Cajun lobster roll with Cajun mayo and spices (request warm lobster meat), the batter fried Lobsicle, and a Wicked lemonade.  I'm impressed.  The Lobsicle is fried lobster on a stick...who doesn't want that?!?!  Everything was good.  I would have liked to return here for a quick bite to eat, but there are so many places to try in Vegas that I had to bypass a second stop.

Meh. Not at all what I was expecting.  It's in the Miracle Mile shopping center.  So expect a mall food court atmosphere, which means lots of Vegas tourists, strolling by slack-jawed, making noise and being obnoxious.  Your food comes on plastic plates with packaged plastic ware, fountain drinks in styrofoam cups or bottles.  Food was good, but it's location leaves a lot to be desired.  I am unsure if this is a chain restaurant but it sure feels like it.  I thought Bubba's Shrimp Company had better food, and lobster bisque.  If you are doing Vegas and eating on the run, this place is right up your alley.  If you are looking for a good sit down eatery, keep looking.

This location is much much busier than the location inside the Miracle Mile shops.  I love Lobster ME but I felt like there was slightly a lacking in the flavor profile compared to the other location. Ordered Cajun lobster rolls and lobster Mac and cheese.  Lobster Mac was good but the rolls needed a little more Cajun seasoning.  Be prepared to awkwardly wait for a long time to get the orders. It gets pretty congested since there isn't much space to stand and wait for the order.

Gave this place a try for a quick bite while slotting away my money. Being from Maryland I had to try the old bay lobster roll. Ugh terrible there is no old bay on that sandwich. It was SUPER BLAND!  One thing old bay is not. Also I think it would have been better if there was more mayo on it and cold rather than warm. For $20 it was very disappointing. Staff was very nice. Put some more old bay on that roll!

It's a little fast food lobster place that is in the Venetian Casino.  It's good but I think the put a bit too much butter.  That's my preference though.  I'm sure others think is just fine. Good price for lobster though.

Lobster ME is good, but expensive "food court" food. I have been to the Venitian Shoppe location a few times as well as the one at Miracle Mile.  There really isn't too much to say about the food. Its Lobster done a few ways. I have tried the Conneticutt Lobster Roll, the Lobsicle and Lobster Mac & Cheese. This was my favorite of all the menu items I have tried. CT style is my favorite because it is a warm protein as opposed to cold protein with mayo in the Maine version. Butter and chives round out the seasoning. very, very yummy.  What is a Lobsicle you ask? its basically a lobster tail on a stick. You can order it deep fried or grilled. Neither was as appetizing as it sounded. Think greasy vs bland.  The Mac & Cheese I had a few bits of lobster and a soupy consistency of cheese to mushy mac. I always prefer a more al dente noodle and cheesier and drier with a nice crust. This wasn't it.  Staff, for the most part the cashiers and expediters have been very pleasant and reassuring when ordering. They will recommend things if you are undecided.  Location ambiance, well...its a food court. So,that says it all. If you are looking for upscale fast dining, this is it.

I really enjoyed the Connecticut lobster roll with fries and a drink. Service was fast, friendly and helpful. Total was $22.40 for the combo which was a bit steep in my opinion.   I am from CT and it's hard to find CT style lobster rolls. This one didn't disappoint. I just wish it was bigger like the footlongs in CT. The fries were hot and very tasty and were a food compliment to the roll. I will definitely eat there again.

We had the lobsicles and were disappointed as they did not have much flavor.  Granted we are from Maine and are used to fresh seafood right from the boat.  We were hoping for a more flavorful experience.  Would not try again.

Mehh I am thoroughly disappointed. I got the cajun lobster roll and expected a little kick out of the cajun mayo that was supposedly in the bun... Nope, didn't get that. I think the roll would have been much better if it had mayo, or butter, or something! Mac and cheese was flavorless, we had to add ketchup to it. Honestly, mac and cheese is a fail if I ever have to add anything other than black pepper to it. Grilled lobster cheese sandwich barely had any lobster in it, my friend had to stick in extra lobster from the mac and cheese lol.

Our first stop in Vegas! even waited for it to open ;) Its just delioucous lobster. A little expensvie but worth the indulgence. My favorites include the lobster mac and cheese and lobster bisque . YUMM! the only thing is that it takes some time to get the food out. I dont think its freshly made, so couldnt understand why it took so long. Overall this will be a must go everytime I visit vegas!
I'm Very sad.  I bought the lobster melt and literally only had 3 pieces of lobster.  Very disappointed

Pretty good place to grab a quick lobster snack but can be a little pricey when it comes to the lobster rolls.  This restaurant could be hit or miss depending on what you order. The lobster roll itself was a bit dry due to the amount of bread given in contrast to the lobster but had a great taste. The item I enjoyed the most was the lobstercicle. That deep fried lobster was awesome with the butter to dip on the side.   I'd give three and a half stars but until yelp allows the half, this gets three from me.   Lunch 7/13/2014

We went to Lobster ME in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.  Quite possibly the best lobster roll that I've ever had! I like the concept of a Connecticut roll because it is warm, but always want the mayo.  Lobster ME allows you to have both--warm rolls with mayo bases.  Definitely add the fries instead of the chips and spring for a lemonade.

Amazed by how incredible the miracle mile was we decided to try this spot. Going to graduate school in the New England area I fell in love with Lobster Rolls so I immediately gravitated to this spot. My GF had the Lobster Tacos and I had Lobster Roll Conn. style. They loaded the roll with lobster and the bread was extremely buttery. How could they go wrong with that combo? That's right they didn't- they hit a homerun!  If you are in Vegas hit this spot in PH!

Ughhhhhh, I can't believe I ate here...    First of all, this is NOT what a lobster roll is supposed to taste like.  They put so much crap on the lobster that it made the taste of lobster go away.  I literally rubbed the crap off of my meat so that I could eat my sandwich.    The lobster mac & cheese was watery and lacked any real flavor.  I didn't like any of the flavors here.  The lobster was super tiny and didn't add much to the dish.  The only saving grace was the lobster shooter, which wasn't horrible.  It consisted of a chunk of lobster meat, some ketal one, and some pepper sauce or something (lol, I don't know the exacts... it tasted like a bloody mary to me).  I thought that was pretty good (and not too pricey at about $8/shot).    Over all, not the best lobster roll, but whatever is clever.

no bueno guys. $19 each for the Connecticut and Beltaway that's small and under seasoned. Gordon Ramsey tells u the biggest offense is lack of seasoning in a dish. please taste before serving clients underwhelming food. and the size is for kids.

Do:  - get a lobster roll. My friend had the Connecticut, and I had the Cajun with warm lobster. We both really enjoyed them, but beware... like other things at times, it's not as big as you thought it would be. I would say it was a 6-inch piece of Texas toast slit open and stuffed with lobster meat? - get the fries AND drink combo. Fries are the same price with or without the drink, $3.  Don't: - get the lobster mac and cheese. We ordered this a different day, and it's not tasty. The shells were overcooked, and the cheese sauce doesn't taste very real... it does the lobster part a disservice. Two of us shared it, and we didn't want to finish it. - eat the coleslaw. Bleh. Go get fat on something else.  This place doesn't get 4 stars because the lobster had the taste that it was on the downhill and starting to turn. While we all know that it's frozen and defrosted, I don't think it was defrosted properly or used as quickly as needed since it starts to take on just the slightest bit of funk.

Uhhh hello! AMAZING. I always want to try something new but I can't resist The buttery toast bread with the flavorful lobster meat. I've heard of people getting skimped on their meat but mine is always overflowing ! They're salted chips and fries are always a nice side too, oh and they give you Cole slaw.   Always get lost in the mall trying to find this place but it's a tradition every time I go to Vegas.

The lobster sandwich was the best sandwich I have ever had really good not to mention the lobster Mac and cheese was really delicious I will definitely come here again it was tasty a bit pricey 54 for a lobster roll and Mac and cheese but had another place same price for lunch and much rather have that

Oh wow, I should have eaten here a long time ago, it's that good!  This lobster joint is located in the Venetian food court.   So if you've read any of my other reviews, you'll know that I'm a sampler; I like to sample many different items bcs tons of things sound so good to eat and I can't really make up my mind.  With that being said, I ordered the lobster roll (which comes with waffle fries, coleslaw and a pickle.  The lobster mac and cheese, clam chowder, lobster bisque (that one was for my sister) and a pineapple juice that they make in-house.
