They jammed pack that sucker with lots of nice pieces of lobster, and filled the box with lots of fries.  No cheap-o's here!  I also liked how they include the fries and coleslaw and I don't have to pay extra for it.  Then the mac... divine!  I don't like heavy cheeses and their cheese sauce is just nice, smooth and mild; perfect for me!  Again with lots of nice pieces of lobster!  The chowder however was a little disappointing, there was just too much potatoes... the clams were chopped really fine and I think I got 1 - 1/4 of a clam.  I had to savor that little sucker (no pun intended).  The oyster crackers were really good though.   My picky sister actually enjoyed her bisque so that was cool.  And finally, the pineapple drink was quite refreshing.    It took me 2 days to finish half of the meal (I had given the other half to my sis), there was that much food and I have a tiny stomach.    Then for the bonus, employees of the Venetian receives 20% off!  Ding ding, now enters my mom!! Score!  Heehee

This is my newfound love in Vegas (besides the buffets of course). Located in PH next to Fat Tuesdays, this place has everything lobster possible! Of course it's pricey, but what do you expect for lobster..  I've had the lobster grilled cheese, lobster mac n' cheese, cajun fries, and garlic fries. I've always wanted to try the lobster roll, but I don't think it's worth the price for a little sandwich. Everything I've tried is delicious and makes great drunchie food too ;) The cajun fries have a kick to it, but are flavorful! I'd get everything again in a heartbeat. I'll be back for you soon enough lobstaaa!

We love lobster. It is a little over cooked here. I really like my tiny lobster roll but it's really expensive here. We ordered the fish and chips, lobstersicle, and a Maine lobster roll. Hubby loved the fish, shrimp, and fries. But the lobstersicle was chewy and over cooked. For the $50 we paid it should melt in your mouth.
Line long but that was a good thing. Sitting terrible but hot tip go next door and sit at the bar. You must order a drink. Lobster roll Connecticut was outstanding. Would recommend for sure.

A lobster on a stick...probably the best thing I ate while in Vegas for in my short time there.   At first I was hesitant to pay almost $10 for a lobster tail, but it was so worth it. It was a little bigger than a Twinkie and deep fried. It came with a side of butter and a slice of lemon. As soon as I bit into it, I was in heaven. The lobster was so juicy and moist! I would eat a dozen more if I could afford it!   When I visit Vegas again, i'll be sure to return and get another heaven on a stick!  P.s...don't eat it while in the car. The butter can get a bit messy.

I am down to about one animal meal a week so I decided to "treat" myself to Lobster ME while I was at the Venetian. Wow, the line at lunch was crazy. It took 15 minutes to get my order and then there was no place to sit. It was very loud and the employees had to yell out your name. Maybe a microphone would be a good investment. I know it is located at a high end casino but ouch for 2 tacos for $17. The taste and consistency of the tacos were good and flavorful. The thing that creeped me out what that the taco was made mostly of lobster claws. I would have been satisfied with other parts of the lobster in my meal. Biting into a big lobster claw was a bit weird for me. Service was average you could see that they were feeling the heat of the lunch crowd. A friend asked me today how my experience was and I couldn't really give her a strong reason to go--

When in Vegas this place is a must! Seriously it's worth every penny. I look forward to getting a Lobsicle every time. I would like to show recognition to Jermel! He had excellent service and was very kind, from taking our order to making sure everything was fine when we finished our food. Employee of the month? I think YES ;) but seriously he's a hard working employee and deserves to be recognized.

Honestly-   I tried this place last year and haven't shut up about it since.  Was in Vegas last weekend for my birthday and, not gonna lie, totally ate here twice within 24 hours, haha.  I was saving the lobster mac and cheese for my actual birthday, but I had to eat something the night before and since I was staying at the Elara (which is attached) I thought, "Well, I can have the lobster grilled cheese instead, so it's totally not cheating." The lady serving was super nice and we chatted for a couple of minutes, then my order was ready so I grabbed the container and headed up to my room to get ready for Chippendales (if you haven't been, GO.)  I sprawl all of my crap all over my room and jump up on the bed and open the container- IT WAS LOBSTER EFFING MAC AND CHEESE BY MISTAKE.  Best. Mistake. Ever. I wasn't even mad- trust.  I inhaled it. And then I went back and got it again the next day on my actual birthday and inhaled it all over again.  No regrets.  It's a little bit pricey - $13 or $14+ per entre, but DAMN, I'm still thinking about it. None of the others I have tried have even compared, honestly.  Thank you thank you thank you.
Very good rolls here! The breading is light so it doesn't make you feel too stuffed and the fries topped with crab is amazing!
Worst lobster place I had, lobster Mac and cheese was very dry. The lobster roll was okay..Clam chowder from a can taste better then there's!  That's about it. The end

I don't know. Passing by this place on the way to Planet Hollywood, I thought that this place sounded pretty bomb. We decided to stop by this place to order some food to take back to our hotel, and I didn't really feel like getting a sandwich or anything, so I ordered the cevice and chips, and also their lobster bisque. I spent $20, which I suppose I expected for ordering lobster, but the quality of the food was sub-par. I kinda chuckled when I opened the container for the cevice, and there was the cevice in a small soup container with a few lonesome chips. I probably can safely say this was my least favorite cevice I've ever had... Didn't taste that great, the chunks were too big to pick up with their flaky chip, and it just looked un-appetizing.   Oh, and I tried a sample of their lobster ice cream.. Just tastes like vanilla icecream with random chunks in it. Probably wouldn't actually purchase it ever.

Like the others have mentioned here, prices are pretty steep for a stand inside the mall, but hey it's Vegas, so kind of expected.  I ordered the 50/50 sea dawg that was recommended, they give you the options to switch sides, with addition $$ of course, so I got the lobster bisque for an extra $2. The portion size of the combo is alright, might not be enough for a guy.  The sandwich was fresh and delicious! The lobster bisque is not the best. If I go next time, will just get the sandwich.

It's okay.  I tried it in Vegas with my sorority friends because the place literally just opened an hour ago...  The menu is very limited and the prices are ~$10 for everything.  I ordered the grilled cheese... it took much longer than it should in my opinion.  My friends got all their food before me, and I ordered first.... does that make sense?  Grilled cheese for $10 is not worth it.. even if there is lobster in it.  It didn't satisfy me and the combination of fishy + cheesey did not work here.  I tried a little of my friend's lobster mac and cheese... it did not work in any favor.  It was an interesting concept, but I'd rather walk a little further to Earl's.

Tried it for the 1st time today and gotta say we enjoyed it.  Portions are kind of on the small size hence the 4 stars.  Luckily we were only looking for a snack and not a meal so the Connecticut lobster roll was able to hit the spot.  The bun roll was pipping hot and grilled to perfection.  The lobster meat was sweat and the butter really added to the overall taste of the roll.  We also ordered the chowder fries but that was a bit too salty for our taste.  Overall, a good place to get a snack especially if you are craving for lobster.

This place is right by Fat Tuesdays in the miracle mile shop attached to planet Hollywood.  It is sort of in a good court area.  We wanted to check this place out because we were craving lobster rolls, and there aren't that many places in Vegas that serves them. Unfortunately it didnt quite live up to the hype.   My friend remembered having a much better lobster roll on a food truck a year ago.. the rolls here are a lot smaller and the chunks are not as big.  Also the food didn't come out very hot, almost cold.   The $15 grilled cheese tasted better than the $24 lobster roll. Also we ordered the lobster roll Baja style .. but the order didn't come out with Baja style. I do have to say their waffle fries were delicious !    For $24 it could be a lot better quality, not worth $24 in my opinion.

Located in the Miracle Mile Shops, this lobster joint is a nice stop for some casual lobster dining. We got the Cajun Lobster Roll sandwich (Medium size $17/Large $23), Original Maine Lobster Roll, Lobster Mac n cheese, & Cajun fries with fountain drinks (all w/free refills).  All filled with chunks of lobster and the flavor was good. The lobster mac n cheese was just ok. Excellent, friendly, and attentive service from all the staff!

I had a very dissatisfied experience from lobster me at the Venetian Las Vegas. I spent close to $60 worth of take away food. I ordered 2 lobster salads that had hardly and lobster in it and all green leaves. No dressing, and hardly any items to even call it a salad. Each cost $14 which I believe is a rip off to have received what I did. I have been there before so I had asked the staff before placing my order to put extra lobster and still nothing.  We also ordered 2 lobster Mac and cheese that also had hardly any lobster in it, very disappointed. If your hungry I wouldn't recommend going to Lobster Me. Defiantly not waisting my money there again.

I had a traditional Maine, New England- style lobster roll. It was just "ok," but what can you expect from a mall- based lobster shack? I've tried it, but it wasn't good enough for me to ever want to go back. The lobster was chewy,  but I can say it was real because I got at least 3 shells in my roll.

Love love LOVE LOBSTERRRR!!! So walking by, I see this place... The signs drew me in, I didn't know what to order-- like a kid in a candy store!!! Lobsicle it is!!! You have the option to order grilled or DEEP FRIED!!! I gotta try it deep fried!!!! I WILL be returning!!! It was delicious!! I played it safe with the grilled!!! Thinking about it now has me booking my flight back to Vegas!!! Haha! Nice staff, good lobster! Can't wait!!!
Get the chowder fries and get the warm lobster tastes better than the cold in my opinion. Pricey but hey I'm on vacation!

Lobster ME is one of the better options in this food court. The quality, price, and size of the lobster roll were about the same as the Cousins Maine Lobster food truck. Everything tasted fresh, and I felt like I was eating less salt than I would have at Panda or Chipotle. Would go back.

i love lobster me so i decided to get a lobster roll. i got the conneticut which was supposed to have butter. it was the size of a quarter and very dry. i payed $19 for this? came with a tiny amount of coleslaw which was tasteless. the chips were good. very upsetting.

amazing!!! got the lobsicle but its $14 and a tiny little piece but its amazing. everything here is soo goid and they are always busy. they have kids meals which are great cuz soo many people come to vegas with kids. you will spend average $20 here but its vegas! i highly reccomend it ive been comming here for years

I checked this place out the last time I was out in Las Vegas with high hopes that it would be similar to Luke's Lobster on the east coast.  Unfortunately, I must have ordered the wrong thing because their basic lobster roll was just not up to par.  The split roll contained lots of lobster meat piled high but the flavor was just salt water from frozen lobster meat being quickly dethawed.  The lobster roll didn't taste fresh and didn't justify the price.  I may have to check out the lobster fries and the lobster on a stick the next time I'm around, but if you are ever on the east coast, try Luke's Lobster - they do lobster rolls right!
You actually get alot of lobster for the money; very little filler unlike most places. I think all in all a good value and a must if you're into lobster, good rub on the "classic" roll.

I've never had an authentic Boston Lobster Roll, but this lobster sandwich they had was amazing!  large pieces of lobster.  I am very tempted to stop by the planet hollywood casino everytime I am in vegas JUST to go to this place!  Taste: 5 stars  Service: 5 stars  fast, friendly  cost: 3.5 stars $25 ish dollars for a lobster sandwich.  not a great price, but I guess it's not a bad one either

Great food, flavor and not unreasonable in price. I mean, yes it is 19 bucks for a drink and a lobsicle but 1) its freakin lobster people! And 2) you're in Vegas, everything is expensive here. Friendly staff, less than 10 minute wait time, great locations. Hoping they expand to California at some point!!!

As someone from New England, I know good lobster and this misses the mark. $20 for a tiny lobster roll with no sides is ridiculous, and it's not very fresh or seasoned well at all. Also very rude service. Not worth the money, don't go here, there are several better food places in Venetian!!
The people who work here are the nicest and the food is amazing too!  Definitely glad I chose to try this out. It's amazing!  Anyone who likes lobster should come here.

Hubby found this place on Yelp and suggested we check it out as we both love lobster. Finally found it in the mall... kind of food court style. Ordered the lobster and chips... 4oz grilled lobster was delicious... chips were cold and greasy. Hubby ordered the lobster melt... said it was great. Yelp offer of free bisque with the melt was expired but they honored it anyway... classy... except they were out of bisque so we go Clam chowder for free. Clam chowder was ok. Old fashioned lemonade was delicious. Over all, under whelming. Probably won't be back but giving high score for the honoring of the Yelp deal.

It's alright.  Ordered the Lobster roll maine style ($17) add $6 for chowder fries and drink .  Lobsters cold, bun is warm.  For the size and price I should of just went to a buffet. Chower fries could use more chowder. It was pretty good.  I highly doubt I'm going to eat it again.

The smell stopped me in my tracks! The meal overall was just okay to me though for the price and fast food type service. Wasn't too long to place and get my order but can see how they could get behind at times. Seating was lacking, got told to slide over, wasn't my fault she said the table was in the bar beside them. The bar gets packed and make seating and eating unpleasant. I might try them again if walking by hungry and bar isn't busy. Give them a try at least.

I decided to stop by again but this time with my mother for her birthday week since we were in Vegas. This time I got a mago juice, crab  cake sliders, and a lobster roll. My mom loved it which is good! She also said the portions are perfect to get full but not overstuffed. I did feel like the lobster roll was filled properly with enough lobster unlike last time. I also saw other customers with a perfect ratio of bread and lobster.   The mango juice was delicious and I liked the crab cake sliders best. Next time I will try the lobster roll Cajun style.   Update: so my mom is still talking to me about how much she loved my lobster roll much more than her crab sliders. Haha  for next time I know.
Undeniably delicious but if you are extra hungry it probably won't fill your belly. The Portions are small and the menu is a bit pricey. All in all it is a great place to eat.
Lobster roll was so yummy. And the roll bread was soft and delicious. Highly recommended, though pretty expensive for a mall lunch.

The Cajun: This lobster roll was made with Cajun mayo and secret spices, and served with house chips. At first glance I was unhappy with how small the roll was, but all that seemed to go away after my first bite. The spice and flavor hits you right away and all you realize is that you just took a bite of heaven. The buttery roll just made each bite flavorful and juicy.  Lobster Cheese Fries: Fries covered in lobster bisque, then topped with lobster meat and cheese curds. The bisque wasn't as flavorful as the roll. The lobster meat was limited, and the cheese curds didn't have much taste. However, it's quite a unique dish and I'm still happy I got it. If you really want some good fries, go and get the Chowder Fries. My friend ordered them and I would definitely order that next time.

Lobster Me is delicious. The price was well worth it. I was a little skeptical at first about the price but it was really good. I had the Cajun and fries. The Cajun is a little spicy but I loved it. The fries are really good but they should put more on the plate. If you are in Vegas and love lobster, try this place.

Enjoyed the diablo lobster roll and the clam chowder fries! We also ordered the Connecticut roll but it was mediocre. The staff was really friendly. It's a good place to come if want to go to a casual place and you're craving lobster rolls.

This place is bomb. If you want lobster displayed as a tiny portion at some fancy schmansy restaurant, do just that. This is the perfect meal to share after a night of insanity, it hits the spot. I've read other reviews that there isn't enough lobster on the roll, but I must have gotten lucky because this was loaded with lobster and delish sauce. Definitely will be coming back for a carb-load hangover fix
Lobsicle and lobster Mac n cheese is quick, easy and delicious! The lobster Mac n cheese though.. Is really really good!

Come here for.. Of course the lobster rolls. Everything else is ok. They give you a generous amount of lobster meat. Pretty pricy, but it's lobster! I've tried the Maine and Connecticut I liked those the best. It's Simple; a little mayo, melted butter, special seasonings, and a squeeze of lemon. The truffle roll is good, but the truffle aioli overpowers all that lobster goodness. Lobster grilled cheese had too much cream cheese. The soups here are ok, doesn't really taste fresh, but it comes with a bread bowl and its the cheapest thing here ($7), they have clam chowder and lobster bisque. Place gets pretty pack and there are only a few tables so get it to go.

I love anything with lobster!! This place was located in planet Hollywood next to Fat Tuesday. Its like a food court style but there are tables and chairs to sit.  They had all sorts of lobster! Mac n cheese lobster, grilled cheese lobster, lobster roll, lobster bisque. Love all the selections! The Mac n cheese is good but I kind of got sick of eating it after a while. However, the lobster roll was really good! For $20, it included a large size lobster roll, fries and a drink. The lobster roll did not look big at all, but it was enough for 2 people to share.   Anyway, I can't wait to go back again!
Food was great and presentation was well. The lobster rolls was definitely better than the tacos.
#nom  $14 for a lobster roll and $19 for a lobstertail on a stick. A little spendy but it is Vegas. One of the better meals I had during my trip. Will gladly eat at again on my next visit. So good.

So good.  A little expensive for the food court, but seriously the best lobster sandwich I've ever had.  People rave about the Lobsicle as well but it was really late when we got there and they were all out.  I would say you must try it if you are in the Venetian.

This place! Is so good! I love it! First time in Vegas and this was pretty dank!  The smell of their food was so mouth watering, the employees were really friendly and it was quick service. It's a bit pricy, then to what i usually eat but it was worth it.  * Their lobster bisque!  * Their lobster and fries! * Even my girlfriend loved their LOBSTER ICECREAM! (Free samples) * Their Bloody Mary was pretty good too!!  I'm craving it SOOO bad right now and I'm not sure if they have this in California haha (:   YUUUUUUUMMMY!

The star of the show at this counter-service seafood place -- which is a completely mind-blowing concept to this Midwesterner -- is the LOBSTER ROLL.  The lobster grilled cheese is also good.  And so is the lobster mac-n-cheese.    While lobster is not my favorite type of seafood, it's pretty darn good in roll form.

Lobster Me totally rocks. The food is fantastic. They sure are not cheap with the lobster. We had the Cajun Lobster roll, it had the right amount of spice, but too much to over power the great tasting lobster. They say it's over 1 pound of lobster per roll. It was fantastic. Just as good were the sliders, great taste packed between great bread. We also tried there signature LOBSICLE, it was a whole lobster tail on a stick, with a light batter, cooked to perfection. The lobster tacos were good, it had great flavor. Top it off with lobster Mary ,there version of a Bloody Mary with lobster. I wish they open a location close to my house. I can't wait to eat there great food again. Lobster is not cheap but there prices are not that bad.

Surprising it the best way to describe Lobster Me. Not sure but this seems to be a food truck concept that is now brick and mortar ? This walk up mall location offers a wide variety of all things Lobster indulgent.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lobster-me-miracle-mile-shops-las-vegas#JDyPbRNg_ctDq6kfOnkx5g  It's like Forrest Gump for Lobster. Lobster Rolls,Lobster Mac'n cheese, Lobster grilled cheese sammie,   Lobster Bisque, Lobster Tacos, Lobster deep fried, Lobster salad and what ?  Lobster ice cream( oh yes that too).    To be clear even though it's a walk up order counter, don't expect cheap prices. The 2 Lobster taco combo will set you back $17 but the are well worth the splurge for fast casual dining. Large and fluffy chunks of freshly steamed lobster meat fill the taco.  These are not "langostinos" or left over rubbery stuff often passed off as lobster, this is bona fide lobby goodness. Squeeze that lime onto the sweet spot of the taco with the cabbage, pico, and some of their chipotle cream sauce and oh my.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lobster-me-miracle-mile-shops-las-vegas#XGE7RtVxumyCtrmgyAxwhw http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lobster-me-miracle-mile-shops-las-vegas#9yhob1WCQSRGkIa5x2RWjg  Surprising to say the least. I wish I had a bigger appetite when I was there but this was mid afternoon, pre-dinner snack that two of us shared and it was perfect.   I will go back and try the other goodies next time I am in town. Wonder when these are gonna make their Cali debut?

Five stars because this was my first ever lobster roll so I have nothing to compare to.  I tried the Original Main Style and it was delicious.  Huge chunks of lobster on a toasted roll.  Lobster was amazing.  Came with a side of coleslaw and house made potato chips. Service was friendly and fast.  What more can I say?  I'll be back!

Don't waste any of your money on this place! It's overpriced, underseasoned, and just plain terrible.   The food looks good when you first get it. Their presentation is pretty nice, but all the food had something wrong with it.   My family and I each ordered something different and nothing came out good. The lobster bisque was too runny and flavorless. The truffle lobster roll was overwhelmed with herbs. It tasted bitter. The lobster Mac and cheese lack any flavor outside of cheese.   We all tried some of each dish and in the end, we were left with a lot of left over food. No one wanted to finish anything.   Please don't buy any of their food. This place is horrible and you'll regret it after the first bite.
Treat yourself. Treat yourself. Treat yourself. Yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaas

Really disappointing when you think you're going to have the best meal after seeing an amazing show in Planet Hollywood. The Lobster Mac n Cheese was good, however the best part of it was the Mac n cheese. The lobster tacos I ordered without tortillas were just so-so. I think the downfall of this place is that the lobster is just not that fresh.  If it's over 100 degrees outside, it's going to be hard to keep seafood super fresh. When in doubt, stick to non-seafood items in the summer on the strip! The presentation looked great and service was very good here - I think if I visited here in the fall, winter, or spring, I would have felt differently about the product.
Horrible service, partial order was 45 min late, general manager or the staff were very unprofessional, got the order wrong for THREE times. Did not even apologize . Will NEVER BE BACK.

We got sucked in by the photo of a lobster on a stick. My sister loves lobster and had to try it. She said it was incredible. I had the lobster salad. It cost $12 but was more the size if a side salad rather than an entree. Despite that it tasted great. I would recommend this place the next time you are in the area.

It all started with a heartwarming greeting from Rebecca, she was wonderful, how she honored my dad's wishes when he ordered and made it a joy to order. As she was helping my dad her smile radiated to everyone else in line, and comforted and served them like melted butter!! Next, the food came. We're from New England and I was raised on lobster, and used to what lobster rolls should be, and believe me! This one is just like it! Loaded with lobster and sides toasted to perfection JUST LIKE IT SHOULD BE, believe it when you order from Rebecca you'll be taken care of. Great experience, perfection!

Stopped by and gave this place a try. I like lobster so figured I'd like anything this place had for sale. I was wrong. Apparently I"m not a fan of cold lobster on a bread roll.   The meal was well over 20 dollars for a small cold sandwhich which I actually found barely edible. Some fries and a coke...no refills.  There isn't much room to sit here and the staff could have been friendlier.  I won't be back.

Let me start by saying the roll is good. Bummer is that it used to be great. I've gone to this place a couple times a year for the last few years and I've always thought, until now, that it was pretty amazing. This last time... not so much. There was still a good amount of meat and the fries were pretty tasty, but my favorite part of the roll used to be the butter sauce... and this time it tasted like nothing.  Combine that with the ridiculously high price (over $20 after tax) of that roll and you get... a seriously overpriced but decent lobster sandwich. If you have money to burn, it's ok, but if you don't, try something else.

Had a convention in Vegas and stumbled (literally) into this gem!  Ashton the bartender kept our party going, and the food was amazing!  My friend got the oysters and would not stop about them!  I got the special and was not disapointed.   Crab cakes, calamari,  and shrimp cocktail was fresh and succulent.   Will be back next time I'm here in sin city!

A new star at Venetian, and at a food court nonetheless! They had a 2/1 offering on today only, mentioning "off the hook" so I went. Small eating area which was crammed with people so I took my order to go. Pricey but worth it for the ultra-clean taste. Lots of peeps due to promotion so short line. I enjoyed the Connecticut sandwich, their standard  sammich. It comes with a side of cabbage with just enough mayo to hold it.  The bread is cut from the top and grilled with the grilling on the outside. Easy mayo holds the lobster together and you taste Lobster and more Lobster. Very clean flavors. Squeeze a bit of lemon and you've got it.  Can't wait to go back!

In the Miracle Mile shops.. doesn't get much better than this! Buttered rolls, lotsa LOBSTER and mixed with mayo only.. delish.. squeeze some lemon. Healthy portion, about a LB. I get my Garrett's Popcorn fix (cheese corn!!) while I am there.. Can't wait to go back.
The best lobster rolls, especially the Connecticut.  It is definitely worth the price.
I discovered this place from a friend. It was great. The food, price and knowledgable staff all great. I have recommended this place to friends and will return.

i do get that most lobster rolls are expensive because lobsters arent cheap!! but for the price youre getting, i dont think im getting my moneys worth. the size of the roll is decent but there arent that many lobster pieces to satisfy me. i also got the tater tots, and they were bomb! these satisfied my hunger more than the roll...WTF?! lol.  However, i WILL be back to try their lobst mac & cheese.
$23 traditional New England Maine lobster roll - lobster didn't come with mayo, very dry.  Not a good lobster roll.

I have never not liked lobster until I ate here.   Over priced sandwich which I didn't even finish because it was just meh. Maybe I ordered the wrong combination?  I ordered the Maine lobster with Cali. I was expecting some warm and juicy/buttery flavors of the lobster and everything and it was disappointment at first bite. Fries were good though..

For the price of the food we pay it not worth it.   The bread was more tasty then the lobster itself.  there were chuck of lobster in the bread but the flavor was blan 6" lobster roll w/meal- $28  The Mac and cheese taste good but the bits of lobster didn't add much to this dish.  Mac and cheese w/lobster- 14
Cajun lobster roll is decently seasoned not spicy but good. Hoping it was a little bigger.

My boys saw the poster for their lobster mac and cheese and after going around in circles for an hour or so we finally found it.  we ordered two lobster mac and cheese and a Maine lobster roll.  The poor girl at the register had to tell us that they were out of the lobster mac and cheese after already taking our order. Then we changed it to one hot dog then paid, only to find out they were out of hot dogs too. The girl was embarrassed - and I can tell frustrated - that most of the things we ordered were not available.  So I just told her to get me an extra order of the lobster me fries, which she said she would give to us for free since they were out of everything that we wanted to order.    The Maine lobster roll was pretty good. I still would have loved to try the lobster mac and cheese. So only 3 stars cause they were out of everything, otherwise it might have been 5 stars.

Kind of slow service, no refills and it's not near as good as Luke's Lobster down the strip. The lobster was a bit chewy & it lacked enough mayo to bring the flavored together on the Maine style lobster roll. Plus when you get the fries & drink combo only expect like 15 fries. Not bad for lobster in a Nevada, but there is better for the same price in Vegas.

So the lobsters on sticks were very tasty (we tried the fried and the grilled) and people there will us were really enjoying their lobster rolls. Also they had this delicious apple cider which I tried and thoroughly enjoyed. Next time though, I think I'll opt out of the regular fries for more protein as they were kind of dry but just my opinion because Hubby loved them.

DELICIOUS Maine Lobster!! Quick service style next to the Fat Tuesday inside PH! Im a really picky eater but I am able to customize my order to my liking and have made a point to go back every time I am in Vegas ever since my first time there.  The only con is limited seating if you go during a busy time, but we all just squeezed together and it was fine. Another time i just got it to go and ate a couple minutes away where there were more tables.  def recommend it to friends and will go back!

Overpriced! And it looks nothing like the picture on their screen. My friends and I all ordered the lobster mac and cheese. It tasted pretty decent but the portion was small and we got sick of the Mac and cheese taste pretty quickly so we needed to go to chipotle afterwards to satisfy our appetite :(

Though it's fast food, and it's very pricey, I enjoyed my meal very much! I got the lobster Mac and cheese and it was perfect. There was a generous serving of lobster on top of yummy macaroni and cheese. The portions were adequate. I personally can't each that much so I was able to get full off half of the mac and cheese. Some might say it's a small serving, but it was enough for me. I also got the fries to go along with it. Get the combo meal, you pretty much just get the drink for free. They share seating with Fat Tuesday and other places, so we kind of had to wait around to get a table. Also the tables were dirty... But I expect nothing less from a mall restaurant in Vegas haha. I'd come back if I was craving it. Not really a must if you're in Vegas, but it's a good place to try if you've never had it before!

Mall lobster at Planet Hollywood. Its pricey bit every damn thing in Las Vegas costs a butt-load of money. But the lobster rolls with a soup and drink combo is delicious. I like the clam chowder and fresh squeezed lemonade along with the melted butter lobster roll. Hits the spot every time.

Compared to all the other food court options, this place stands above the rest.  Price is just slightly more than the steak and shake burger combo, or the Nathan's hotdog combo, but....it's lobster!!!!     I had an awesome lobster roll, the fries were great too.  Fresh squeezed lemonade, it was a great meal.

Great concept! I tried the Connecticut, and was not impressed. Every other flavor that my friends ordered, and unfortunately I only got one bite of the Cajun, Beltway, and the Miso sesame. Dangggggg. I missed out. The regular and the Connecticut are so so. But the rest are great for lobster lovers. The fries are top notch. Chowder fries, whoa.

We had the fish and chips for $12. Overall food taste and quality was very average, and the portion size was small. For the price, only three small pieces of fish and a side of fries were not worth it.

I always make it a point to stop at Lobster Me when I roll to Vegas for the Usual Suspects Show.  I always order a Lobsicle , Cajun Lobster Roll, Chowder Fries and Lobster Mac and Cheese.  I wish that they had Lobster Me in California.  My favorite is the Lobsicle . Its a Lobster Tail on a Stick Deep Fried . Yummy.  The Cajun Lobster Roll is quite tasty too.  Portion sizes used to be Bigger but have gotten smaller over the years.

Lobster Me Yes!!! I Love it. 1st visit - XL Cajun Roll , Fries and a Drink. The Cajun roll was Devine.Stuffed Full Of Lobster and Packed full of Flavor.  2nd visit - Lobster Mac and Cheese , Lobster Bisque in a Sourdough Bowl., 2 Lobsticles.  Lobster Mac and Cheese good but could use more Lobster meat. Lobster Bisque yummy Yes .Lobsticles Heavenly - Lobster Tail on a Popsicle stick deep fried with a butter dipping sauce. Yummy.  I'm a Fan wish we had one locally.

Been here before and I enjoy the food. It's $24 for the lobster roll, so it's gone up in price a couple of bucks the past few years.  The guy working the counter was nice. We ordered two Maine rolls, one with clam chowder and one with fries.  They give you a number to take to your table and they bring it out to you. It took about 15 mins to get our food.   The rolls were good, bread was butterred and browned nicely, the lobster was cooked well and not chewy, nice mix of salad dressing and greens to lobster. The fries are waffle type and were cooked great and not to salty.  The clam chowder had a good flavor but not a lot of clams but hey, it's a mall food court and it was good for where it's located. We don't really expect 4 star food at a food court do we? ((:

If you love shellfish, this is the place to go. WOW! I cannot believe it took me three days to find it. I got the lobster grilled cheese and it was amazing! If you like a little spice, ask for some sirracha on the side. I promise you, you will not be disappointed.
First lobster roll ever and this place didn't disappoint. Had the Maine lobster roll with loaded crab fries. Food heaven!

This place is pretty good for whats presented as kinda food court fast food.  In any other city in American the price would make the fast food comparison laughed but in Vegas its not bad.  I wish it stayed open later but I dig the idea.  They have a couple of different styles of lobster rolls.  It comes down to what you get it tossed in.  I got the cajun so it was tossed with some cayenne/lawryish type dust and was really good.  I know with seafood the closer to the coast the fresher and all that but as a semi late night snack after gambling, this did the trick.

SOOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!! 4 and a half stars all day long!!!! The only thing holding this place back is its limited size and seating. It is kind on in a food court area at the Venetian/Palazzo and there is not a lot of places to sit.  The classic Maine Lobster Roll was fantastic. I had the combo which was $21, but came with fries, coleslaw, a pound of lobster in the role, and a drink. Tasted great and was worth the price. Oh, and the fries were well above average.  My wife had the lobster tacos and they must have been great because they were gone before I could even ask to try a bite.    It was something different, a little pricy but I feel it was worth it.

I really don't know why the Venetian hides their food court so far in the depths of the place that you almost give up looking for it. I've stayed in the Palazzo several time and even when you ask somebody who works there, you get wrong directions. I say all this to preface this message: DON'T GIVE UP LOOKING FOR THIS PLACE. It's totally worth wandering around for an hour trying to find it.    Both my friend and I had the (Yelp checkin) special which is a lobster roll and a cup of clam chowder. Are they like what I grew up eating on the Cape every summer? No, but they definitely scratch that itch and for a pretty reasonable price, IMHO. It is Vegas after all and there's a ton of lobster in that wonderfully toasted bun.  Yum.
The best ever, well honestly I ate it so fast I don't remember. I wasn't drunk or staving... it was jus that good!  They are not shy with the lobster either! Get sum!
Best people, best lobster, and best TACOS!!! I love eating here every chance I get. Also need to try the beltway lobster roll with chowder fries and lemonade. Very worth it!

Lobster me please.  Lobster me good but please don't steal my wallet once I drift off into a coma.  It's my favorite crustacean and always more expensive than my Casio watch.  Even when I do find lobster rolls, they are without an abundance of lovely lobster meat. This place gives you a nice heaping of lobster meat at a great price, ~$12.  The quality of the lobster meat is questionable though, but it's enough for me to eat and not barf.  The lobster rolls come with a bit of coleslaw and potato chips too, so you don't need to order fries unless you really want to soak up some giggle water.  The roll is buttery and delicious by itself.  I'm sure it will be a good enough to devour in-between Fat Tuesday sips.  My only lobster-y wish is that the lobster mac and cheese had more meat in it.  Am I asking too much?!  How can you give me an awesome lobster roll and then send me a lazy lobster mac and cheese?  Okay, I'm a brat, but I still recommend this place when it comes to snorting anything with lobster in it.

They changed their menu but it's still delicious.  You pick your sandwich and then the flavor.  Try to lobsticle grilled with butter.  It's 4 oz of deliciousness...wish it was maybe 6oz but still so so good.

The review is solely based off the lobster bisque soup. After seeing pictures of the lobster rolls and different lobster menu items I'm convinced that this place has the right idea. The rolls look filled with lobster and nicely garnished with butter and other sauce toppings of your choice. No one wants a dry roll. My lobster bisque was very delicious and had a great amount of lobster mixed in. The only thing I can't understand is why soup is so expensive in Vegas. Literally everywhere you go. The lobster bisque from Cousins Maine is $6 for a cup and $8 for a bowl. I paid $10 for a cup and it was $12 for the bread bowl.   My friend did get a lobster roll and said she enjoyed it more than the roll from cousins Maine. They are a little pricer with the option to style up the lobster roll. But I wouldn't be opposed to paying a little more knowing there are more options. The Cajun, Sriracha and Baja options are free, but you do have to pay $2 more if you want the Cali and BLT option. I also loved that they have the lobster Mac and cheese on the menu! This place is quick and easy if you are shopping your way through the miracle mile shops.
The Lobster roll is fantastic. The bread was perfect, and a very fair amount of lobster. The style with avocado and tomato was a winner.

I spotted this place while buying my big ass drink at Fat Tuesday in the Miracle Mile shopping at Planet Hollywood.  Everything on the menu looked tasty, so I was excited when my friends and I came back the next day to grab food.  I ordered the lobster grilled cheese, expecting a regular grilled cheese with lobster in it.  Instead, I got slightly toasted bread with 1 slice of not melted cheese, and a lobster/cream cheese mix.  I was not impressed.  I did have a taste of the lobster mac and cheese, which was good.  I would get that if I ever end up at this place again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.   Bonus: they give free refills on soda  Tip: get your free sample of lobster ice cream

Sooo this place has everything lobster. Like I went back to the hotel and had to tell my friends how many things they had. BUT I wasn't too pleased with it.   I got the fish and chips so maybe my experience wasn't that great because I didn't stick with their lobster. It really wasn't anything special. What really made me give it a 3 was the poor costumer service. When I went up to get the food I just asked if there was lemon and the guy handing it over had such a bad attitude about it. He then listed off everything he put inside the bag. It was a simple question that didn't need to rude remark.  Really though if you want decent priced food I guess this is an ok place to go to.
The meal was disappointing and expensive.   The best part was the phenomenal french fries.   At least they have that going for them!

i don't think the english language has a word that adequately describes how ridiculously overpriced the food is. $26 got me a lobster roll about the size of a slice of wonder bread folded in half and fifteen fries. $14 merits unsliced lettuce petals with about 3 oz of lobster on top.  a sign here proclaims that this place has the world's best lobster, which is a big fat lie. they should be ashamed to serve this garbage at a north korean prison camp. overcooked, and overseasoned to cover up the poor flavor.  service is slow and the tables are sticky.  the diet coke tasted okay.  if you are hankering for lobster, do yourself a favor, skip this place and go to red lobster.

Lobster on a roll? - Yes please!!  I came to the food court looking for Earl of Sandwich, but my hunger didn't allow me to make it around the corner and I decided to eat here. I'm a fan of lobster, especially when I don't have to crack the shell and get messy eating it. This place is pricey for a quick lunch, but it was delicious nonetheless. You'll spend about $20 bucks plus for lunch for one. I don't regret my purchase, I only regret eating it so fast because it was soo good.  I ordered the Cajun Lobster roll, fries, and a drink. The roll comes toasty/grilled and buttery with good chucks of lobster meat stuffed on hotdog style. I could eat 4 of these easily because each bite was so juicy, buttery with a hint of crisp from the roll. The lobster had a nice cajun spice to it which added another dimension to the flavor.   Punch line: Come here for delicious hassle free lobster!

Don't you dare come here! I know lobster is expensive but come on, I expect to be full after having a lobster roll and bisque.   My girl was dissapointed as hell. REALLY! The bisque was blah, the bread was stale and the roll was done in two bites. There goes $33  Plus there is no real seating area, just small tables next to the noisy Fat Tuesday's bar!    Their customer service looked like they were lost and didn't care!   SKIP IT PLEASE!

Holy shit! LOL!!! This is the first time, in my life, that I have ever spent that much money in a food court! LOL!!! It was some of the best lobster I have ever tasted. We got two different lobster rolls, lobster mac n cheese and the lobsicle. The Lobsicle was, hands down, the best thing! All of it was fantastic....but the lobsicle was quite the treat!

OK, we all know everyone mac and cheese isnt good. Not only is theirs good the lobster was off the chain. Too bad i had to throw  away my leftovers bc this expensive hotel didnt have a fridge.  Well not that they didn't have one it's if you wanted to use it you had to pay for all the things inside it. Boy I tell ya Vegas has legal crooks. The Venetian Hotel is one of them

Diabetic boyfriend needed something to help his blood sugar. The guy at the front (feel horrible for not catching his name) let me cut in line and gave us a soda for free. Amazing! Of course I paid for the soda, but so pleased that they were so gracious and expected nothing. Kudos!!

fries were soggy and the lobster roll was mediocre at best.  for almost $25, i was expecting a lot more.  the amount of lobster served was on the generous side, but the quality was so so.  overkill with the sauces imo and the bread was soggy.  please toast the bread to a crisp on the outside at least.  didn't seem fresh baked to me.    seating and decor left a lot to be desired as well.  lobsterme is pretty much fast food at nice restaurant prices.  i rather spend the $50 bucks and have a decent dinner somewhere else.  probably won't be back anytime soonn

This location is conveniently located inside the Venetian. The concept of the place where it serves real lobster in most of their dishes is really awesome. I personally love lobster so I was excited to give this place a try.   I went with my brother and mom and we all love lobster. We loved how they had a good variety of different rolls to choose from and other kinds of lobster dishes. We ending up each getting a different roll and to say the least, they were all delicious! We got one original roll, the beltway, and we got one that was more Asian styled with nori on it, but the name escapes me. I recommend the chips over the fries if I had to choose, and the fries are more expensive, so why need to pay more? The chips were very crispy and is everything I look for in a chip. I can't say the same thing for the fries, they were average at best. The rolls are kind of pricy, but with something like this, it's a treat that you should experience once in a while. I don't have the money to indulge on this every week, but it definitely is worth the experience!

We got the lobster roll, lobster grilled cheese, lobster bisque, and fish and chips. The roll was standard, it lacked a little flavor and was a tad dry for my liking. The grilled cheese was disappointing. The cheese was still solid (one of my biggest pet peeves when you order a "grilled" so-and-so or a "melt"). As for the flavor, the sauce they lather on gave it a little too much richness. Now that I think of it, I should have ate the roll together with the grilled cheese to counter balance each other. The bisque was nice and creamy, but lacked the lobster element. The fish and chips, surprisingly, was our favorite dish. It was meaty and crispy, and was the only thing that we finished. An extra star was given because of the service. It was a nice surprise to see workers come out to the table to make sure everything was to our liking.

Hands down best lobster roll! Service was really friendly! I wished there were more seats, that's mostly why it got deducted one star. They had many different lobster rolls to choose from but we got the original. There was def a good amount of lobster and not much fillers which I loved!   I wanted to feel healthy so opted for a side of lobster salad. It seemed a bit plain to me, but made me feel less guilty about wanting to try everything on the menu.   Also tried Lobster bisque and clam chowder-lobster bisque was not good, it seemed too runny for me. However the clam chowder was really good!  I really want to go back and try the Mac n cheese and grilled cheese sandwich. Aghhhh..but Lobster Me got the thumbs up from the hubby, so that's always a good sign, and that's coming from a really hard to please kinda guy!
Had the Lobsicle... It's lobster on a stick, grilled or fried, can't get much better than that. Wife had a lobster roll. We loved it. Will eat here again!

Since I'm a lover for lobster rolls, I decided to come here for lunch.  My husband and I decided to split a combo.  The lobster roll was ok.  I didn't like that the meat was chopped in tiny pieces (reminds me of canned tuna).  I also didn't like how the slit of the bun was just barely half way through the bread.  It makes me feel like they're trying to save on lobster meat.  With each bite we made, the meat fell out of the bun.  The chowder fries were ok.  Nothing to rave about.  For over $20, I was pretty dissatisfied with the portions I was given.
Wonderful service, quick but excellent food.  Definitely get the crab add on to the fries.  If you are looking for a low key place this is it.  New England chowder was amazing.

The lobster here is amazing and taste fresh. We ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and it was delicious, it was slightly soupy but the flavors were still present. I am not sure why have received low reviews they clearly deliver quality food and suffer negative comments from being a walk up counter restaurant.

This is located in the Miracle Mile Shopping mall in Vegas.  It's in a mini-food court section.  I found the food to be relatively bland and overpriced. Despite the potential, this is typical food-court faire.

Had the 50/50 Sea Dawg meal with the loaded fries Mac and cheese crab balls  and it wasn't a disappointment!!. The lobster and crab meat taste fresh , the Mac and cheese balls were nice and crispy , it comes with slaw not a fan of that tho. But overall definitely wasn't a disappointment I left full and happy!! Oh! And they have vodka lemonade

First time here, had the 50/50 roll: lobster/crab meat. It was fresh & tasty but a bit on the dry side. It came with coke slaw, again very dry but I do live in South Carolina& I'm used to it a different way, and clam chowder versus fries, Clam chowder was very tasty. With the 20% off coupon that was in the mall  coupon book, My total was right under $20. It was tasty and when I visit again, I may try the lobster Mac & cheese.
Awesome!!! Fast servise , the lobster tacos are jummy!!! Annisa the server is so sweet an kind!!

My friend had told me to come here for the longest. So I finally came with a group of friends that were down! And they did not regret it one bit!!   I shared the lobster roll and ceviche with my friend . The roll was nice and buttery with huge chunks of lobster.... i finished it to quick :( . ... I wanted more!!!. The ceviche came in a mango salsa thing with shrimp . And these crispy flour tortilla chips. Soooooo good!! It is a bit sweet so if you do not like sweet mango salsa dont get it...  But honestly everything was epic in my book.   Ooo and of coarse I had to have a lobster shooter. Imagine a little shooter with bloody mary Mix.  Little bit of lobster and vodka for 5 dollars!!!! Uhhhh so good!. That I did not share ;).   I recommend this place 100 %
I had never had a Lobster Roll and man was it good.  I will definitely be back.  Prices were average considering its Vegas.

Fast forward to 2018. My last visit was in 2016, and alas... although they improved on the serving portion of the lobster roll, it's a little bit bigger now, the quality is still questionable. The lobster was underseasoned, rubbery, and didn't taste like anything. It had no flavor. It didn't even taste like lobster. I got the "BLT".. very minimal bacon crumbles. It was just so lacking all around. The lobster bisque on the other hand.. Overly salty! It was just another disappointing experience. I'll definitely won't visit for a 3rd time.

Can't resist anything lobster.  The food was excellent, but not excellent enough to be over priced.    All the specialty lobster rolls come with chips for $19.  They're not big portions either.    I had the lobster and chips, which came with a "Lobsicle" or lobster on a stick, a side of butter, and fries for $15.  The Lobsicle was so small.  This meal was probably 85% fries, and 15% lobster.  Tastes excellent, but I was still hungry in the end.  $15 and still hungry.    Good flavor, but expensively priced.

Stopped by again today, because it's so friggin awesome! Being from Maine I know me fresh lobster and this place is the bomb!!! Everything on the menu is great and service with a smile always!! Prices very fair to get fresh lobster in Vegas!! We'll be back again and again!!!

Stopped by again today to have brunch and a lobster Mary!! The food (all) is so darn fresh and delicious  Never fails and service with a smile every time!  Prices are great for fresh lobster on the Las Vegas strip!! We'll be back again and again!!!!
I really like the lobster melts cost 10 bucks but the Connecticut lobster row 19 I felt it needed a sauce. I felt for the price you can put it in a bigger French bread.

What a pleasant surprise! I was staying at the Venetian and had an awkward span of time before dinner and a massive appetite that needed to be quelled. I got the loaded fries and expected very little crab meat on them, but WOW- they were loaded in every sense of the word. It was a good deal, just a few dollars more than the regular fries, and well worth it for the big chunks of meat, bacon, and decadent lobster cheese sauce.

This place fucking sucks. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Ridiculously wayyyy over priced, and it looks nothing like they advertised. Worst part is how excited I was to try this join out and boyyyy let me tell you I wish I hadn't. Never. Again. In. Life. Doesn't even deserve 1 star.

Don't. Just don't. Came here because Luke's is closed for renovations. $19 lobster roll that was terrible. The lobster looked greasy and it tasted like it had been sitting at the bottom of a freezer for a month. I only took one bite and that was more than enough. Lobster shouldn't chew like gum. The Old Bay fries looked and tasted like the fryer oil hadn't been changed recently. The "chowder" nothing more than milky water with a few sad potato chunks. One star for the crushed ice in my Pepsi. As I mentioned above, I only took one bite and pushed it away. Had been by myself, I wouldn't asked for a refund. But, my husband is much nicer than me, so he ate it. I hope I don't have to sit with him in the ER later on tonight :(

Well, I ate here 4 times in 3 days, so I can't in good conscience give anything but 5 stars. I got the Connecticut roll every time...soaked in butter and completely satisfying. Got the fries one night as well, which were fantastic. Stay out of SLC please.

Lobster.. yummmmmmmmmmm. 3 stars for the food, but would round up to 3.5 if possible due to their awesome staff. Also, if you check in on FourSquare they will give you a discount on your tab! Since I forgot to show them my check-in until after we had paid, they offered to give us something for free, which is how we ended up with the bisque. We tried-  -Lobster Mac n Cheese- Really creamy and rich tasting, but could have used more salt. The lobster pieces are on the smaller side and are sprinkled on top of the mac n cheese. -Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche- Good, but not the best ceviche you'll have. A decent amount of lobster was in the ceviche, overall the dish is very pricey. -Lobster Bisque- The best dish that we ordered! The bisque was creamy and delicious, and you can taste the buttery goodness. -Lobster Ice Cream- We just tried a free sample but wow! It wasn't delicious.. but way better than I expected. The person working there explained that it was a Butter Maple based ice cream (or was it Vanilla Maple.. something along those lines) and they added chunks of lobster to the ice cream. I don't think I would order this, but it was definitely worth trying!  Overall, come to Lobster Me if you're craving lobster. I think we would have been more satisfied if we went with the standard lobster roll. However, this place is on the pricey side for what you get, and there are plenty of other places to eat at in Sin City.

Holy crab this place has the best lobster roll I ever had. It was so good. The roll was buttered and toasted warm. The lobster was gushing out because they were generous with it. And their fries were delicious. It's a must try! I saw it a few times when I was in Vegas and finally got it a few days before my flight back home and wish I had ate this sooner.*-*
A good choice for a fast lunch on the strip.   The lobster has a lot of flavor. The roll is toasted perfectly with  butter .  Over all - good,fast and fair price.

I really really loved this place.  It was a little bit more expensive than I had anticipated but totally worth it.  The best part is that it is right besides Fat Tuesday so while they are making your food you can grab a drink.  I visited here twice during my weekend trip, it was that food.  The lobster roll is really amazing.  For $16 its a small portion, but its delicious, and generally lobster rolls are not cheap!  The lobster mac n cheese was my least favorite.  The cheese they use is way too sharp.  It completely contrasts the delicate flavor of the lobster.  I was really disappointed in that.  I also tried the lobster grilled cheese which was good as well.  Their lobster bisque is extremely rich.  I would recommend taking a sample before buying, it was not for everyone.  They also had some fun things on the menu like lobster and waffles, lobster lollipops, lobster and tator tots...all kinds of stuff.  I will definitely be back the next time I am in Vegas!
Expensive, but good. I had the lobster roll. I've had better, but this was pretty good. But $14 for a lobster roll???
Best Bloody Mary I've ever had.  Old Bay seasoned rim and a big hunk of Lobster in it.  I went 3 separate times for the Bloody and the Lobster Bisque.  Amazing
Paid $62 for two Lobster rolls and drink with a nice tip and the rolls had no flavor and were dry. Very disappointed. Visited 4 years ago and it was much better.

Thank you management for your response...just for that you get 4 stars...I know it's months later but I certainly will give it another try but your attentiveness to customer service is exceptional and means a lot more than the food. ..I love lobster...it's my favorite food...one of them. Thanks again.
It's an ok place to eat. Lobster roll was good, but the bread was too buttery. Also was not worth $16 for such a small sandwich. Nothing beats Luke's Lobster in NYC!!!

Like much of Vegas this place is a lot of hype without much substance.  The lobster roll is smaller than you expect for $19. Some of the meat on my roll was a little stringy and could have used more butter.   Pay for the upgrade to the fries.  They are excellent.  The Cole slaw is the worst I have ever had.  It is quick and easy and just a little bit off the strip.

This is a great place to eat if you don't want to go to another Las Vegas restaurant that is far too loud and crowded.  In the food court tucked around a corner.  I always go with the lobster roll with butter but this time around I added the crab fries.  Holy crab, they were amazing and a absolutely worth the $2 upcharge.  It still isn't cheap because nothing in Vegas is but it is quick.

Ugh, TALK about Las Vegas' best drunk comfort food. I could rave about everything here from the super friendly and hilarious staff behind the counters, to the scrumptious lobster-filled foodies on the menu.  I simply saw the name of this place and knew THIS is where I wanted to splurge for "fast food" so to say. Get ready to open your wallets up wide because it's not exactly cheap, but hey, you get what you pay for. Seafood isn't exactly inexpensive, after all!  I was in awe when I saw the menu because everything made my mouth water. My fiancé couldn't talk at the time because he had lost his voice, so he went simple and got the lobster bisque ($10 for 12 oz). He loved it and when I tried it (first time EVER having lobster bisque by the way) I fell in love. So creamy and delicious. I ordered a lobster roll, Cajun style ($23) which meant there was Cajun aioli, green onions and lemon. YUM. I made that a combo and got crab loaded waffle cut fries with it.  Best choice I ever made in Vegas, and best choice you'll ever make too!

Quick place for fast food! Bit pricy. Overall, food was ok. Service was quick and staff were friendly. I had me the Lobsicle and it was pretty small - cost $14 for lobster on the stick. I wouldn't get it again.
Best lobster roll I've ever had!!!!!!! Tender, juicy ,and not rubbery at all. AMAZING !!!! I just wish I would have had the lobster bisque too!!!!!

I bought the miso lobster roll and the beltway lobster roll for my parents to try. This was their first ever lobster roll, and it kind of blew their minds! They couldn't stop raving about it and how something like this could exist for so long without them knowing about it. Brought total joy to my heart to see them munching away happily on this. They liked the toasty, but soft in the middle, buttered bread, and the generous amounts of lobster meat in the center. It's not cheap -- about $18 per roll with a side of chips and cole slaw, but honestly you could probably find a lot of places charging this much for a regular sandwich WITHOUT lobster. Will definitely come back here when we take another family trip! Total hit with the fam!

What a huge disappointment.  We split a lobster roll and got 'The Connecticut' with fries combo.  The fries were very good, for sure and the reason for what stars I did give them.  The lobster however was the most over cooked lobster I have ever eaten.  It was so rubbery that it was tough to pull apart.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, very nice and respectful even.  They get a star too!

We decided to have a quick lunch and saw this place as we were walking.  We got a lobster roll, and fish and chips.  The fish and chips were flavorful, but the lobster roll was pretty disappointing. I saw someone with the crab roll, and thay definitely looked more appetizing.

Extremely tasty with a variety of lobster rolls. The lobster chowder was also very good. Huge chunks of lobster in the lobster mac and cheese too.   The atmosphere is normal for a new England lobster shop. Very casual with the food being the draw. I had a co-worker who passed on this place because he expected a sit down restaurant with table service... this isn't that.

My hubby is obsessed with lobster and we wanted to introduce to my son , well for a kid at least he tried it.But they do have a kids menu which I loved . The lobster subs are delicious.  The have a rasberry lemonade which is very refreshing. They have lobster tacos . The service is very good.I am very happy to have found another place to eat. For the place and price it was worth it.

This is a fantastic idea for fast food, I wish we had this in Australia/New Zealand.  At Lobster ME they will offer you the choice of grilled or fried lobster. Your lobster comes in a roll ($19), or with fries, or my personal favourite, the lobsticle (lobster tail on a stick). The lobsticle is small but there's deceptively quite a lot of meat on the stick.  This is my new favourite takeaways!

The Maine Lobster Roll was on point! Delish for a quick lunch option. The lobster melt was the best grilled cheese I've ever had and I recommend the blueberry lemonade with a little water in it to dilute. Try it!

Good lobster roll but it's EXPENSIVE! My fiancé and I decided to share everything so make sure you get the large roll. It comes with a side of fries and a drink, but we also got the mac-n-cheese and clam chowder. All of which was over $40!!!   We couldn't finish it all, it's heavy in the stomach! Ohhhh, FYI: one thing that sucks is you have to fight for a spot to sit at cause it's in the middle of the miracle mile and they don't have enough tables and chairs for all their customers.

I was so excited to eat here! I love seafood and thought this was a great addition!   I had the lobster tacos and I was sooooo disappointed. The amount of lobster meat was pathetic. It is soooooooooooooo ridiculously overpriced! Like crazy over priced for the amount you get. The tortillas where on the stale side.   I'd rather cough up more $$ and go to a nice restaurant where you pay for what you get for! Almost $20 for tacos and stale chips! No presentation just average! The sauce is drowning the tacos that doesn't make them good! It's the quality of Del Tacos Shrimp or Fish tacos   So disappointed, unless they fix it I don't see this place lasting sadly

So i was walking down to the casino and this lobster me caught my eye, so i decided to treat myself before losing all my money gambling. I ordered the large lobster roll, it was really good! Tons of lobster meat on the bottom and 4! lobster claws on top. Just squeeze a little lime on top and dig right in. It was well worth $17 dollars.

A little pricey but it is seafood! It's an affordable option if you just want a quick bite but still want lobster. I recommend the lobster mac and cheese!  You probably have to order to go since the seating area is pretty small.

I have been dying to try this place for years. I go to Vegas once a year and everytime I walk by im always full or we are heading to a fancier place to eat. I am so glad I stopped at this place. I have had some really expensive fancy lobster mac n cheese but this place tops it. It was absolutely amazing, The lobster was perfect. The cheese that they picked to go with it was fantastic. I will defiantly be going back next time I am in Vegas. If you love Lobster check this place out. It looks cheap but, it's way better than what you expect.

This place is located inside the Planet Hollywood Hotel/Casino in the mall area. I saw it last time i was there so this time decided to try it ok for one it's lobster so prices are going to on the expensive side. I opted for the maine lobster roll combo which is the lobster roll, fries and a drink total came out to about 21 bucks for the small size the larger size was like 25 bucks not including the combo I got the small which was 17 w/o the combo which is not worth it in my opinion but again it's lobster lol next time i'll try the lobster mac & cheese or the lobster bisque bread bowl those prices were a little better. Oh they also were advertising lobster ice cream but i didnt want to try it even though it was ice cream lol.

After trying both the Planet Hollywood location and this one in the Venetian Grand Canal shops I would definitely make more of an effort to come here. The Planet Hollywood location did not offer the lobster melt and when I ordered it here along with the Connecticut lobster roll it was easily my favorite food item.  The cheesy melt and the buttery lobster are pure indulgence, but coming in a close second is the Connecticut lobster roll. It may be a basic roll but you really can't go wrong with buttery lobster on a toasted roll. I had tried the lobster mac and cheese at the other location which was just ok compared to the roll and melt. However compared to the lobster mac and cheese my mom ordered here on her last trip to Vegas it appeared that the lobster to mac ratio was higher then what I got at the Planet Hollywood location. My husband also got us the Wicked Lemonade and Blueberry margarita which were so refreshing and tart with the warm, buttery food.  It may be pricey but I would easily come here on every Vegas trip, even if it is a bit of a walk from our hotel.

A friend on facebook posted pictures of her meal her and it was then I knew we needed to make this a priority on our Vegas trip.  This location is in the shops of the Planet Hollywood hotel right across from where we stayed at the Bellagio. My husband was still full from lunch and, frankly, so was I but I was craving the lobster mac and cheese. The cheese is quality because it's not watery and has great texture and flavor. The lobster is so yummy, warm, and buttery but I could've used more mac and lobster.   Two observations about this location: 1) My mom ate at the Venetian location on her trip and their mac and cheese seemed to have more lobster in the picture. And 2) they didn't have the lobster melt here which they had at the Venetian location and, as noted in my other review, was my instant favorite item from this stand. Definitely hit this place up, but maybe consider a different location.
Food sucks in general but if u like lobster get the lobsicle four oz tail meat on a stick.  Safest thing to get.

We just wanted some snacks nefore a show and in turned out to be the best food we've had in the 2 days we'be stayed so far. Had a lobster taco and the kids had lobster roll and Philly roll. Everyone loved it!

The lobster & chips was magically delicious.  I'm usually the person to ask for extra butter to drown my lobster in but there was no need here. The lobster was lightly breaded and perfectly tender. It was amazing amazing amazing. I'm kind of a fry snob but I loved the fries also.   Have a feeling I'll be eating here on my birthday because I'm also addicted to lobster.  Eat here!!
Don't waste your time or money.  Lobster had very little flavor and lobster roll and minimal amount. Of  meat in it

Went back to Lobster Me to have the Lobster bisque and was very happy with it. It was rich and creamy and more than I expected from a place in the middle of the miracle mile :-) will definitely be for more when I'm on the strip!
DO NOT GET LOBSTER CHIPS. $13 for little bit of fried lobster and some fries. RIP OFF. If you decide to come here. Order something.

Ordered a shrimp taco and a 50/50 sea dog! The presentation of it was very nice, but it took extremely long to get. When we ordered we were the only ones there and it took us about 15 mins to get a simple shrimp taco and Hot Dog. In my opinion I thought it was going to be a lot bigger then it was for the price $16.  The 50/50 dog was a pretty decent size for $19. Yet still the wait took a long time.

Pretty darn good for a food court meal. Be warned, it's expensive! I mean, lobster is expensive (somewhat) so of course it's going to be pricey when it's prepared for you. We ordered the lobster bisque, served in a bread bowl, and the diablo lobster sandwich. The total was $30!!! WOW, for a SMALL sandwich and soup, that's freakin expensive (at least in my opinion). BUT, the bisque was very tasty (could have had more lobster though) and the sandwich was very tasty as well. For a food court meal, this is pretty damn good, except for a food court meal, very pricey!!!!

Fried Lobster! What more can I say?  3 stars because it was expensive! and the portions are small! But let me tell you, where can you walk around, get a Fat Tuesday and walk 10 feet and get a lobster on a stick! Such a good combo!   Lobsicle- $14 but worth a try. Not super large, but it was fried to perfection. Their batter is crispy and not too bready. Very good! Pretty greasy though, especially if they already give you a side of butter.   Cajun Fries- Absolutely the best Cajun fries I've ever had in my life. I will come back here next time and skip the lobster and order the fries. Soo good!  Lobster and Chips - not worth it. in total, there was probably like 4 bite sized pieces of fried lobster with some fries. Pass on this and get something else on the menu that's more worth it.

Lobster Me was awesome! The first time we came we got fish and chips and a lobster grilled cheese. I was unimpressed with both, but they totally redeemed themselves this time with the Lobster rolls! So yummy! My husband and I got two lobster rolls and split them. (We were a little hungover so we couldn't eat that much anyway, haha) We got the Connecticut style and the Beltway. Both were good, but the Beltway was definitely my favorite! It just wasn't as plain as the Connecticut, although if you squeeze the lemon they give you on the Connecticut, it's a lot better. The Beltway had old bay seasoning, mayo and toasted breadcrumbs, and it was served warm. Delicious! The bun was toasted perfectly and there was plenty of lobster meat inside. We will definitely be back! Thanks Lobster Me

Excellent spot. I love lobster so I just had to check this place out. It is fast food style but wit delicious lobster dishes. I had the lobster roll, which was excellent. My husband had the lobster melt, which is like a grilled cheese sandwich with lobster meat in it, to die for.   I will definitely be back to try more things next time I'm in Vegas.

I wish they had a chain location In San Diego, I would probably gain 10 lbs just by going to it. I love this place. I love how it is conveniently located in the Venetian & it is perfectly hidden in a way. My husband & I got really drunk on our last vacation there and decided to get a late night snack and being from Southern California We usually get carne asada fries. & this meal we ordered was so much better. It was criss cut fries topped with this amazing creamy cheese sauce chives and crab meat! It was amazing. We should have ordered personals/ we decided to share. I would definitely go back here to get the same thing we ordered the next time we go back because it was just that good. & obviously going on vacation you don't have the ability to cook so you have to eat out which is the best part! So glad we stumbled upon this place.

We decided to try Lobster Me. Each had different dishes so we could share . First off the lobster roll was delicious!!! Sinful , the Texas toast , the mayo and Lobster excellent !! The garlic Cajun Fries!! Another winner , you will want seconds!! Lastly the waffle was just sweet enough and buttery!! The Lobsicle was decent but not my favorite . Service is kinda slow, but the staff is friendly and they apologize for the wait . I would go back !!

Stopped in and grabbed a surf & turf philly yesterday.  First, let me say that I got it to go, and took it back to my hotel (which is not where they are located).  By the time I got to it, it was about an hour later.  The sandwich was awesome.  The pickles were awesome.  The waffle fries were ok.  I imagine they're much better when not an hour old.  The only thing I wasn't a real fan of was the coleslaw.  All in all I would definitely eat here again and recommend it.  Looking forward to trying other things at some point.

I'm not a big lobster fan but this place was awesome. We got a Connecticut roll and the lobsicle and I was in heaven. I wasn't very hungry so I was just taking a couple bites from my partner's but ten we ended up getting another Connecticut roll. So much lobster, so much butter, so much goodness on my tongue. I'm glad my partner got sucked in looking at all the lobsicle ads everywhere cause it was definitely worth walking around the Venetian for 45 mins.

Lobster.... on a stick!!  Two please. Tastes great, costs much. Well at least I think so. $ 14 isnt alot to pay for a 4oz lobster  tail, especially in Vegas. However, one won't fill you up. Maybe not even two. The fish tacos are awesome as well. Service is friendly and they wernt too busy.
Ordered the "lobsticle", which was listed alongside other entrees. Laughably small (one tail). What is this, food for ANTS? Gave 2 stars because the 3 bites were in fact good.

If it sounds to good to be true....than it is!,  This writer bestowes the new name, "Lobster Me Not". Small portions and old looking lobster make it another Vegas ripoff.  A rule of thumb....if it is connected to a Vegas hotel or a mile of shops... run the other way. Same goes for the infamous Vegas Buffets. When Rent is too high, food quality and value go out the window. Im still trying to figure the bill, considering there wasnt any water ordered or consumed?????

Very pricey.  Small amount of lobster in all the dishes we tried.  Large portions of bread  to make up for it.  The food is tasty just no where near enough lobster.  Cute gimmick just won't satisfy your need for shellfish

What a treat finding this spot inside the Venetian food court! We were wandering along the I door river checking out shops and needed to grab a quick bite before the show when we stumbled on Lobster Me!   My friend had never even had a lobster roll, so it was our destiny this day. After checking out the menu, and other peoples plates of course, we decided to share both a lobster roll and the cheesy lobster crab waffle fries. The roll was super tasty, but the fries were really the star of the show for us. The fries came out absolutely covered in chunks of lobster and crab, this delicious cheese sauce and topped with lil bits of green onions. It was killah!! Absolutely indulgent and pretty much all I wanted to eat at that point. Don't get me wrong the lobster roll was great too, I'm just a freak for cheesy sauce and fries.   Certainly worth popping in to check this place out for a quick bite!

I couldn't resist the lobster chowder on the menu. I got a cup. The checkout and delivery was fast. The chowder was good but not the best I have had. Seemed to milky to me. I prefer it to be a thicker chowder but that's just me.

went and line was ok. the cashier was helpful. the food was received in about 10 minutes. i ordered 3 sodas. it states that these drinks are large for $3 each. the actual size is medium. i ordered 1 lobster bisque, 2 lobsters and chips, and 1 mac and cheese. the mac and cheese was reviewed by my 6 year old niece and the mac and cheese did not meet her expectations. dont order it. the lobster mac and cheese didnt have a lot of lobster as displayed on pic. the lobster bisque was watery and lacked flavor. the best thing to order would be the lobster and chips.

Well let me just say I love lobster but lobster me gave me food poisoning I was sick in Las Vegas for three days I would not recommend eating here in less you Want to lose 15 pounds they need to have a little more control on the product also it's very pricey sandwich starts at 17 dollars

Pricey but worth trying! Had the lobster tacos and wife had the warm Cajun roll and both were awesome! It's something to try and it's different then most eateries. Will be back to try more the next time I am back at Vegas.

If I could give negative rating, I would do that.  Maybe I was on a bad day or whatsoever, I couldnt understand why people were raving about this place. First of all, the only good thing about this place is the price. The price was about right. I didnt think it was expensive since its on strip. However, here comes to my horrible experience. I went shopping with my girl friend one day in PH and came across lobster me. I really wanted to try it awhile ago since i saw so many good reviews on yelp. Yelp never (Ehhh.. maybe seldom.. maybe sometimes) got me wrong, this was the first few times. So me and my friend shared a soup. We waited for about 5 minutes for the soup and I was excited for the whole time and the first thing we saw in the soup was - A HAIR. It was really gross but we got over that.
