We took it out and we tasted the soup. THE WROST SOUP EVER I HAVE TASTED IN MY 21 YEARS OF LIFE. I will never ever never ever come to this place again!

Lobstahhh!  The lobster roll is served with hunks of chilled buttered lobster tail meat tucked in the roll and whole claw meat atop the roll. The roll is toasted and also buttered but I prefer a more denser roll than the soft one served here. Overall, if you're willing to shell out some cash, hopefully you've been lucky at the casinos, the roll is definitely worth the money for pure lobster decadence. Fries are just mehhhhh, so maybe the tots are better.  If you're trying to take it easy on the pocket, there's also lobster mac-n-cheese, shrimp tacos, lobster grilled cheese sandwich, and ceviche.  Service is friendly and there's some seating right in front of the Lobster Me window/stand. A bonus that Fat Tuesday is literally 5 steps away from Lobster Me.
It's pricey but hey it's Vegas everything is pricey. You get real lobster and awesome fries. Enjoy!

Came here for a midnight snack after a show. Due to the prices being fairly high - $26 for a combo of a lobster roll, soda and chowder fries, we thought that this would be a decent fast food place.  Our food took almost half an hour to come out. Two other parties were served before us. It wasn't until we went up to the counter that they told us that the fries were being made. So although we are sitting 5 feet away no one bothered to tell us.  Once we got the food it was ok...maybe I would give the food 3 stars. The chowder on the fries was ok and the fries themselves were the best part. The Cajun lobster roll was dry and the bread had no flavor.  It's a fast food place so I guess you can't expect too much. But the fact that we waited so long for our food left a sour taste.

Another 5 star from Vegas. You can find this about halfway through the Miracle Mile shops. I tried the lobster tacos and the lobster grilled cheese and booth were so good im still thinking about them a week later! Only wish I had tried the lobster cheese fries too but one can only eat so much...yah know!  Some on here complained on the freshness well im here to say...Cmon now dont expect the freshest lobser you ever had at restaurant in the middle of the desert...a restaurant in the middle of the desert in the middle of a mall mind you =)  Next time im all over that lobster roll.  Another plus is the Fat Tuesday rite next door!
The chowder fries were the best fries I've ever had. But the priced where way to high for my budget. I payed 25.00 for a lobster roll, chowder fries and a drink.

Oh, sure enough, I had the lobster in my mind to order. What else could it be but that's it, is what is the main item served in this place! Lobster, lobster, l-o-b-s-t-e-r! The succulent mighty of crustaceans!  Browsing in the Miracle Mile Shops inside Planet Hollywood for the shopping adventure, this little eatery called "Lobster Me" got me intrigued to stop by and dine for my northeastern hunger for lobster, which is one seafood I favor. To lobster lovers, this may just be the place to dine ala fast food. A cozy group of tables and chairs are set up in front of this eatery, where I may add is a good place to just take a slow and easy time to eat and watch people, er shoppers, as they go passing by.   A variety of 'World's Best Lobster Rolls' to choose from ranging from spicy, cajun, BLT, lobster with seafood, or the southwestern shrimp roll. The Lobster choices range from 'Large' to 'XL' ( Extra Large). Dish out less than twenty dollars for the 'Large' roll size of more than a pound of lobster meat while dish out over twenty dollars for about two pounds of lobster meat in the 'XL'. The "Original ME Style Lobster Roll" is the traditional Maine, New England sandwich. It looked mighty enticing as seen as a sample roll displayed behind the glass-walled food cubicle and so, it beckoned for an order of it. It's about a large lobster claw meat and chunks of lobster meat dressed with a dollop of mayonnaise and lemon in a spicy mixture on a slightly crunchy bread roll. Tasty! hmm,soar to New England! Should try "The Diablo" for the spicier tasty roll. aaah, dream of dripping in warm sea water! For soup cravings, there's the "New England Clam Chowder" or the "Lobster Bisque" soup. Ha, could be listening to ocean waves in the distance. Glancing up to the menu, find a cocktail 'Lobster Shooter' or 'Lobster Shooter with Vodka' or opt for the beer. Okay, so get that little seasick effect. If you are a late morning riser, fret not, because a Breakfast Menu is served as well...lobster with eggs, with waffle, with MEmuffin, with tater tots. That is coool! eat breakfast any time. There's lobster grilled cheese, lobster mac and cheese, lobster and chips, and 'The Lobsicle', that is lobster tail on a stick. Feeling like caught a lobster by a stick spear. Oh, there's salads and, and, ice cream. Yes, ice cream, I scream for it (in my mind, only, as you should know it, can't scare diners away, so can't really scream out aloud), the Lobster Ice Cream is a light creamy, slighlty salty tasting lobster chunkiness swathed in finely iced, milky tasting ice cream. That's it? Must I say any more, what else? but lobster in ice cream!    As landlocked is Vegas, so it is as seafaring into deep waters for a lobster dish which was just served as fast food. It didn't take me to a breezy, oceany lobster trap...aah, at least just for that moment.

Me and my wife wanted some seafood and decided to try out Lobster Me.   We shared our meals and had the Lobster Roll, Lobster Grilled Cheese and Truffle fries. The Lobster grilled cheese was by far the best item. Perfect amount of cheese and lobster and the bread was toasted perfectly which let you hear that perfect crunch in each bite.  The only thing that prevented this from being a perfect rating was the service. The cashier who took our order seemed to have to be a little upset and had a slight attitude. Also, when I ordered a water, she asked if I wanted a bot or cold one. Who orders a hot water in the middle of the day during summer time when its 110 degrees outside? Other than this everything was great and I would recommend any Lobster love try this place outside.

Lobster me! After a 5 hour drive and being starving we were looking for something to eat!! I really love lobster rolls so I had to try this!!  I ordered the lobster salad, lobster roll, and chowder fries. Eh, it was super yummy because I was starving, but it wasn't anything special. I rather walk across the street and get Luke's Lobster.  I wasn't really feelin it.  Plus the employees didnt look like they were doing anything and the girl gave me a snooty look. Probably won't come back! And I don't recommend this to anyone

For a minute I had that.. "Oh did I just spend $25 on one sandwich meal" moment but once I got over that I was feeling pretty blissful. Casual, food court style dining located within the shopping area of the Grand Canal shops. You order up front, they give you a number, then deliver to your seat when the foods ready. I came here after seeing a show because I was hungry again. I'm like a hobbit, second dinner is always welcome in my mind.   I ordered the lobster roll combo with fountain drink, coleslaw, & fries. I'm a petite person so honestly by the halfway point I was already full. I liked that they did not skimp on the lobster. Really tasty, ton of flavor, & left me happily full afterwards. Not even stinky...sometimes lobster can be hit or miss for me. I would order the same thing again but I'm also looking to try some of their other menu items next time. I don't eat seafood often since I prefer my veggies but when I get that occasional craving I'd definitely come back!

Great food! My wife and I decided to eat here, since the Yardbird was closed by the time we made it to the area. She was feeling "Hangry", and the Fish and Chips she ordered calmed her soul. Do I need to mention she loved the food, especially the fries? I mistakenly ordered the Lobster Mac and cheese, thinking it was a sandwich. The lady that brought us our food was more than willing to switch out the food that I actually wanted. Service was also fairly quick. In short, the Lobster sandwich and fries were great and satisfying. They even gave me a military discount, which is always a plus in a restaurant. So if you're in the mood for seafood and walking around in the Venetian, stop by here!

Disgustingly overpriced, mediocre quality Lobster rolls.  Maybe Luke's Lobster has spoiled me in NY, but this place just offended me.  If you hate your money,  eat here.  Second star because, at least the lobster tasted fresh.
casual & quick.  the lobster salad was delicious & fresh.  I just wish the lettuce pieces weren't so big.

Lobster ME "NOT" I read some review and said "what the hay lets give it a try" The bread was soft buttery and nicely toasted. About the size of a large hot dog bun. It is stuffed with claw meat and knuckle meat as my server told me. There is no tail meat in there or anywhere to be found. Not in the soup, not in the Mac & Cheese, not in the ice cream nowhere. Where is it????? If you go let me know if you find any...   The servers were young and cute, they will try to sucker you into ordering a lot of food. Because, nothing comes with....  At $16.00 a pop (Small) $22.00 large this is not reasonable for a place that looks like a fast food joint. You can easily spend $55.00 for two. By then you'll need a shot....   Yeah the bread part was tasty, and yes there is some lobster. But, lets get down to brass taxes here. The lobster should be front and center. Sad to say, It was tasteless. No seasoning in the steaming pot, I'm sure. So sorry people, but where are your taste buds? You have none or you haven't been to Joe's Stone Crabs better yet, Maine for that matter. There was a bit of salt and pepper on top to tickle your maiden taste buds but for the mature, go elsewhere.....

Love this place. I love that they give you the choice between rolls Maine style or Connecticut style. Personally, I love lobster rolls Connecticut style (warm + butter). The rolls are not crazy expensive and have a decent amount of meat. For a place in a food court these are pretty good. Not like having them in Maine with fresh lobster but this is a solid effort with reasonable prices without seafood that is sketchy.

Should change the name to Lobster Mehhh. I felt like I was at the food court in the mall when i saw how this place was set up. It would have been better if it were since the mall has more seating. Had the lobster roll combo that came with fries and a drink. The Lobster roll was not a traditional one in my eyes. It was filled with plenty of lobster but was not tossed in the mayo/scallion mix a Maine lobster roll would have. It seemed to have a vinegar based medley that overwhelmed any on the natural flavors. The item that was the best was the fries, theses were actually very tasty. The lobster mac and cheese was so-so. A few lobster chunks on top but none throughout, not worth the $9.95. Definitely not returning!!

This place will satisfy the need if you're absolutely craving lobster, however for the price I can't justify the purchase or a return visit. It's 19 dollars for what seems like a 5 inch roll which is basically lobster in toasted bread.   Most people will want a combo which will tack on another $4 which includes a small drink and a side of vinegar fries. That brings the total to about $25.00 for a standard meal. Now I know this is lobster and the location is on the strip, but for the portion and amount of flavor you are getting your money is better spent at a sit down.  On our visit we sprung for the Connecticut roll which is supposed to be buttered version of the standard roll however I could hardly tell the difference. After what seemed like 3 bites we were finished with our rolls and still had an appetite which is quite disappointing so we shared a lobsicle ($15).   It may be because it was deep fried and piping hot but this is the one thing I would recommend if you HAVE to eat here. It has some flavor and the temperature keeps the meat soft. Again, the portion is small but I'm assuming the reason you're here is because you're craving lobster right?  The overall establishment is clean, very casual, the staff members were very polite. The seating area is pretty much like a food court so you're sharing seating with Fat Tuesday customers. We went on a Saturday and there was plenty of seating available so that shouldn't be an issue.
Underwhelming is the kindest word. Over priced, tepid, bland, and greasy are a few others. May have caught them on a bad day but that's no excuse.

3 & 1/2 stars.. I was so looking forward to eating here but were small kine disappointed. They did pack it with lobster but it really had that fishy fishy smell/taste ( you know the smell of seafood not being fresh ). The bun was Nice and the seasoning( celery salt ) was good but the taste and the fact that the lobster was really, really cold (almost frozen) which kinda threw us off. Service was good But we Could only eat here once
Lobster butter and a roll. An expensive lunch. But your in Vegas so just go with it.

I love lobster rolls, and my friend recommended the Cajun lobster roll at Lobster Me when I told him I was going to go to Las Vegas over the weekend.   While walking around the mall in Planet Hollywood, we decided to pop by Lobster Me and try out the Cajun lobster roll. We got a combo with French fries and a drink.   The lobster roll was only okay -- the bun was toasted, which was good, and there wasn't too much mayonnaise but there was a heavy dusting of some Cajun spices and scallions on top of the lobster roll. The meat went from very bland to overspiced from all the spices in two different bites. It was weird.   The fries were also only okay, but nothing to write home about.   The drink machine ran out of ice, which happens, but it didn't improve my impressions of this place, because we desperately needed something cool to drink after inhaling all the spices on our lobster roll.   I'm not sure if we'll have the Cajun roll again, but I wouldn't be averse to trying some other items on the menu.  TIP: Free samples of lobster ice cream?? I didn't get any, since they were closing up, but maybe...

Bad service. Bad food. A good lobster roll is hard to find & expensive. Which we lobster lovers know, & we will pay for a good lobster roll!  ..but add Vegas prices & you have yourself a waste of time here. The portion was extremely small. The taste was very average. You can pick up this mix of lobster at Whole Foods or similar. I was so disappointed smh. The service? The cashier was scrambling around looking so lost. Whew. It took forever to order!   Avoid this at all cost. It's not worth the high dollar. If you just HAVE to try.....at least stop by when they're offering a special.
Better than expected.  Excellent service by Christine. Good Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac n Cheese.  Would have given 5 stars but a little bit over priced.  Will definitely be back !!!

We had a wonderful lunch here yesterday. Started with the lobster Bloody Mary and it was excellent! We followed this up with two lobster rolls "Maine" style which were great and some battered fries which were awesome. The slaw that came with it was okay but not really needed. Also tried the lobster Mac and cheese which was the one weak point of the meal. The service was excellent and our cashier, drink maker, waiter Raul was terrific and made us feel like he really cared that we enjoyed the meal. So much better service than I ever expected at concept like this. We will return!

Delicious! My mom and I came for lunch and ordered the trio of lobster tacos and the lobster texmex salad. The tacos had large chunks of salad over a bed of cabbage with some sort of mayo based sauce. They were good. I didn't eat the corn tortillas but they looked like decent store bought tortillas. The salad was good! The salad had romaine lettuce, black beans, corn, jack cheese, bacon and avocado. It also came with a yummy green dressing that I also used on my tacos. I would definitely return.

Lobster me NOW!  This place is located in the mall of Planet Hollywood right next to Fat Tuesday's. I walked by this place a couple times during my stay at the Elara, and finally decided to give it a try. The menu was simple.  What I ordered: Cajun Lobster Roll - HOLY MOLY. This roll was worth the $20 (or maybe it was $17). They gives generous amounts of lobster and the spice is just fantastic. So much flavor bursting in my mouth, and it didn't overpower the lobster. Every bite was much too perfect with the buttery bun it comes on... wow. If you think $20 is too expensive for a roll, please keep in mind that IT IS LOBSTER... in a desert :P Lobster Salad - Nothing to special about this salad. I wanted something healthy, but still try the lobster here. I ended up eating just the lobster and a few bites of salad, ha. Nothing too special about this one.  Service was good and very friendly. A verity of beverages to choose from. Give it a try! You won't be disappointed :)

Lobster me is amazing and one of my favorite parts of the shops at planet Hollywood. It is expensive but that's to be expected when you are ordering lobster. (Or eating anything on the strip for that matter) all of the lobster rolls I've tried have been amazing. Just make sure that if you get the fries that you get them chowda style! Loaded with New England clam chowder. So delicious. It's expensive and there aren't a lot of places to sit but it is good quality food with large pieces of claw meat. They do offer a military discount. (Possibly a locals discount but I can't remember for sure) I will continue to eat here when I'm back in town!

This place caught my eye when I was walking through planet Hollywood. This place is right next to Fat Tuesday. Great quick place but fulfilling meal. Would recommend food to anyone that likes lobster or gourmet sandwhiches/fries.

the best deal in las vegas for food.  i brought my whole family to eat from here and it was a hit!!  We got the lobster sticks (whole lobster meat on a stick the size a full lobster tail covered perfectly with fried batter)! And its quality lobster meat. Usually that amount of lobster meat would cost $20 at a nice dinner restaurant where you eat the meat off a tail.   We also had the Connecticut (warm) Lobster Roll and doused it with the side of butter. this is the time i tell my self "hey, you only live once, butter it up!" Yummy and perfect with the Lobsicle lobster stick. i was so full!  Tip. make sure you save yourself a seat! if  no seats initially, sit at Fat Tuesday seats and get a drink from there! Good with lobster me food.
this is like a little chain.. fast food lobster roll place ;)... i thought it was pretty cool !  i love lobster rolls !

I'm just reviewing to let everyone know that I had great customer service by Dan. That kind of service is hard to find these days and needs to be noted. I would come back based on his kindness. I have yet to receive my food yet, but wanted to want this review asap. Thanks Dan!

While in Vegas, my seafood craving kicked in again and I had to get me some seafood. Nothing heavy because I still had more places to see and more shopping to do. I decided to hunt for this place called " lobster me" which is located in the grand canal shoppes at the Venetian. It was kinda hard to find but finally stumbled on it. I decided to try the lobster roll which came with some homemade chips. For the meal and a bottled water, we paid $25!! Kinda pricey I thought to myself. But.... It was really good! I was kinda hesitant in case I get some fake crab meat that was just " called" lobster for $25 ,but it was real lobster. On top of that, it was nice big, sweet chunks. The way they mixed it with celery and mayo and whatever else they put in there, was just wonderful!

This location is in the Miracle Mile shops in the Planet Hollywood so you can get your food to eat there or to go. There are a few tables where you can sit and they bring your order out to you.  Had a lobster roll from here previously and it was very good. This time I tried the lobstercicle which is basically a lobster tail on a stick. You can get it fried or grilled. We opted for fried. It was pretty good. Prepared fresh and hot out the fryer. Not too greasy but the side of butter was a bit much seeing that it was already fried but I'm sure the butter would be great with the grilled one. I plan   to try that next.

Ridiculous culinary experience at great prices.  The concept is just amazing.  I liken this to a food truck experience; gourmet but not formal.  Jumbo Lobster Sandwich:  A+ Fantastic value for the portion size.  Sauce was great, real HUGE chunks of lobster served over a toasted bun.  I will be back for this.  Granted its a bit pricey, but really its lobster.  Lobster Ice Cream:  A I'll give an A because it tasted great, had real chunks of lobster in it, and was incredibly innovative.  Lobster Mac & Cheese:  A- A little too cheesy; not as much lobster.  Fries:  C Mediocre at best.  Great filler  I'll be back here.  Also, its located right next to Fat Tuesday so you should grab one of those while you're at it.    PROTIP:  Great drunk food.

Get the hot dog, only thing worth the money on the menu. I love lobster rolls but the size of this one was sad. For $18 roll I expected more than 3 oz. of meat. Hold off and spend your money on somewhere else.

I wish I would have taken a picture of our food to show you how amazing it looked, but it tasted even better. You're in Vegas so everything is over priced, but we didn't think the prices were that bad! I got the shrimp tacos and my husband got the lobster bisque. We also got the lobster grilled cheese to share. Let's just say everything was so good we wished we had visited our first day because we would have went back everyday!! If you are a seafood lover, go here it will not disappoint! We always can't wait to go back to Vegas, but now we really want to go back to try other items on this menu.

Yummy...yummy... This is a counter service location, but they deliver the food to your table. The customer service was absolutely excellent. And the food was so fresh and good. The quality of their food product is great and the price is outstanding. We had a 20% off coupon, you can get the coupon booklet from the Miracle Mile Mall guest services. The Lobster rolls include a side of coleslaw. You can make it a combo with french fries and a drink  or  fries and a beer for an additional price.  I will definitely eat here again... And a again... And again.
Very disappointed. The lobster sandwich is much smaller than we expected. The taste was not bad though. The picture was misleading. I won't pay $19 for a meal like that. False advertising.

Grilled Lobster Tail:  - Flavor (4.5/5): The associate suggested grilled is the way too go and he was correct. The tail was cooked perfectly but it was pretty simple. It is served with a wedge of lime and some melted butter.   -Pricing (1/5): The pricing is kind of outrageous for the amount you receive. We paid $15-16 for a tiny tail that was smaller than my hand. I feel they should give you a heads up. When we complained to them about the portion size, their response was they continually receive the same complaint.

This is my favorite place for an awesome lobster sandwich!! I've had lobster sandwiches in many different places but nowhere compares. The sandwich is perfectly grilled with butter and filled with large chunks of lobster. I typically like the sauces on the side so I can control the amount I like, usually on the lighter side. This is a MUST stop every time I'm in Vegas!!

I cannot say enough great things about this place.  My husband and I ate here on a whim the last time we were in Vegas and the lobster roll was so stinkin' good.   We just visited Vegas again, and my entire plan consisted of drinking, gambling, laying out by the pool and eating at Lobster Me.  I stayed at a casino way too far away from my beloved Lobster roll (won't make that mistake again next time), so I literally took a cab just to go get it.  Then, I texted my husband a picture of my lobster roll as seen here, and the words "mmmmm.....Lobster Me".  To avoid a very bitter husband, I had to agree to deliver one to him at the poker table a few blocks away.  My only complaint is that we really really need one of these places in Colorado.
Had a long wait for a small meal. The food didn't really seam like it was worth the price. It was an extremely small portion with basic flavor.

I heard ravessss about this place. And yet I'm still trying to figure out what the hype was all about. Located in the Miracle mall, I had walked by this place a dozen times and finally was excited to try this place out!  I ordered the New England Signature Lobster Roll which costed a whooping $24 bucks.... I was actually surprised it came with fries so I guess that made it a bit more worth it. If it was just the roll alone..yeah that's pretty expensive. (I can go to slapfish and get a roll for 16 and it tastes better then this). I wasn't too impressed with the taste and I wouldn't say its worth what I paid for. I still can't find the hype in the roll. Maybe I should have ordered the lobster mac? Either way I can't justify paying that much again for anything on the menu here.  Yelp Review 2017 Challenge 68/100
The trio taco is awesome. All three are great! I'm very picky and this place was surprisingly very very good.

I stopped here for breakfast. I ordered the Connecticut lobster roll which cost $17. For it being a fast food restaurant, the lobster roll was better than I assumed it would be. The lobster meat is not as fresh as one you would eat at an upscale restaurant but neither is it not fresh. It was good enough to satisfy me. It had the perfect amount of butter and chives. It came with chips on the side and I enjoyed them. Usually, those kind of chips always taste very oily and flavorless but these were great. The price however does not match the quality of the food considering that at example The Optimist in Atlanta, Ga, the lobster roll goes for $18 & it's amazing or we can compare it to Cousin's Maine Lobster roll that costs $14.99 and it doesn't get more perfect than that... It's over priced but I understand that this is Las Vegas. Price aside, I was satisfied.

Great quick service fish/ lobster food. I ordered the fish and chips. Fish very good, crispy and moist. Loved the chips, had maybe old bay on them? Something similar. The tartar sauce was delicious. Next time I will get a lobster roll!!

Honesty do not know what to rate this place! It was absolutely delicious lobster and absolutely expensive! $17 and $21 with fries and a drink. I shared the Connecticut lobster roll with French fries imagining a much larger roll but it was the tiniest of sandwiches. Not sharable but we made do since it was too late. The roll was delicious and left me wanting more! The bread itself soaked in the butter from the very juicy and fresh lobster. I will come back if I'm in a spending mood for lobster!
Lobster was ok. Lobster Mac and cheese was cold. Very expensive for what you get. There are better fast food options inside Planet Hollywood.

The Original Lobster Roll was pretty good, however it definitely didn't have enough lobster in the roll. For the price that I paid for it I expected there to be more lobster in it. And on top of that the roll only really had claw meat and not any lobster body meat in it. The price that I paid for it I expected a little more out of it.
Small but very tender tasty grilled lobster tail on a stick!! Served with melted butter and a simple lemon wedge ...purely delicious
It was great We had the Lobster Rolls Maine style, they were delicious.

YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY YUMMYYYYY!! Haha The chowder fries were DEELICIOUS! I love how they added chowder on their fries. Considering I love chowder, this was a genius concoction!   I reallyyyy wish they had garlic tots again! Garlic anything would win me over any day so PLEASE BRING BACK THE GARLIC!! Thank youuu :)))   The lobster bisque was reallyyy good too. Probably one of the best lobster bisque I have ever had.   The BELTWAY LOBSTER ROLL was tasty. The lobsters inside were huge and fat! Just the way I like them. The roll could be more toasty. It was soft. The coleslaw and chips that came with it were good as well.  The people working here are nice too :) Did I mention this place is next to fat tuesday? haha

Today, my family and I wanted to try this place for a while, my mom had been really excited. But once we got to our hotel suite, I noticed our subs were extremely small and small amount of chips. Looked like the sub roll was just sandwich bread. Good amount of lobster though. My mom whispered to me at the end, this is the worst dinner I've ever had.

Ermagherd so delicious lobster mac and cheese and Cajun fries. Yes a bit pricey but hey you're in vegas. If you like that fishy taste, lobster, cheese, you're in the right place!  Portions are small so savor the bites :)

I saw this place walking around the Miracle Mile after getting a tuna melt over at Earl of Sandwich and I said to myself, "I need to try that place!'. I saw Lobster Mac N' Cheese on the menu and my heart jumped out of my chest. Ever since I saw/heard about lobster mac n' cheese on one of my favorite television shows Royal Pains, I've been wanting to have it. Honestly though, I had no idea it actually existed! It wasn't horribly priced for lobster I guess, but 10 bucks is still a little too much to drop for this dish, even though it was really good. The mac n' cheese was delicious. Made with what you could tell to be real cheese, flavorful, and the perfect texture (that mix of smooth and finely grated cheese). The lobster was only okay, which is why Lobster Me I don't think warrants any better than three stars for this dish. It was good, friendly service, but the food just didn't match up to my dreams and expectations of what it was going to be like. I don't regret trying it and if I'm ever back in Vegas someday soon I want to go back to try the lobster roll.

I got the The Original and it was just ok. A little heavy on the seasoning and mayo, and just overall nothing I'd jump for joy over. It wasn't bad, but considering the price I'd probably leave it at that... not bad. Unfortunately I also chomped down on a big piece of lobster shell, that was mixed in with the roll, and hurt my tooth. That made the overall experience nothing I'd return for.

Found this little gem while shopping inside The Miracle Mile shops. Seating is limited in front of the little restaurant but there is some large ottoman seating behind the tables if you're lucky. Ordered a lobsicle (lobster deep fried on a stick) and lobster Mac 'n' Cheese. The lobsicle is a pretty big portion than I was expecting. It is a little bit rubbery since it's deep fried. I do like that they give you liquid butter to dip it in. The lobster Mac 'n' Cheese is a better menu selection. There were small pieces of lobster that were more tender and I enjoyed the panko crumbs they added on top. I say this place is good for a quick bite while you're doing your shopping.

Try the lobster salad ! Yummy! It's pretty centrally located in the middle of all the shopping.  It is also beside Fat Tuesdays so you can have your margarita while eating your lobster meal.  I also tried the lobster and chips & it was pretty good.  The lobsicle looked a little small for the price do I didn't think it was worth it.

While at CES 2016, I stopped by for a early brunch. Decided upon the Maine Lobster Roll with the clam chowder. The roll itself was decent with a good amount of lobster meat. The flavor of the lobster roll was pretty good but the bun itself felt a bit cold for my taste. The clam chowder wasn't really anything special, and the clams were a bit too chewy.  Overall, a decent experience but the above notes and the high price kept LobsterMe from getting a higher score.

Do not come here ! The rolls are dry not even buttered and have a bunch of unnecessary ingredients and sauces. If you want a halfway decent roll go to Luke's Lobster by fashion show mall they are cheaper and tastier.

After going to Fat Tuesday...for about the 6th time in one day....we decided to have a snack at Lobster Me.   I ordered the Lobster Grilled cheese. Now. I'm not a huge fan of fish or lobster, but the thing about lobster is, it's not supposed to be fishy.   The lobster in the sandwich was really fishy and just didn't taste fresh. I had about 4 bites of the first half of the sandwich and my husband had the other 3 or 4 bites. When I offered him the other half...well...he declined LOL.  I gave the other half to my friend and she ate it...and seemed to moderately enjoy it I guess.  The wait was also SUPER LONG...like perhaps they had a nice lagoon in the back to actively catch the lobster...of course, they should have tasted fresher if that was the case.   I won't return.

Lobster Me's have been popping up throughout Vegas, and while it's not a dirt cheap quick service option like Earl of Sandwich, these rolls are filled with fucking lobster, man, so step up! I've paid up to $20 for a quality roll, and their Connecticut roll is right there with them. Fresh meat, good portion, didn't add the fries and didn't need to.

This place was pretty good although this is my first ever lobster roll...I think it was pretty good.  The lobster roll was @22 for the large and $16 for the regular. I got the large as I was sharing with the wife. The bread was nice and toasted and the lobster was great. I liked the lobster because it wasn't mayo based as people say alot of them are. it kept it light and from being too fatty and bloated.  There was plenty of meat in it to make it a meaty roll so with that I am pleased.  We also got the lobster bisque in the bread bowl $9..this was good but I had definitely had better bisque all over the east and west coast. It lacked....some serious flavor.  So final report...will I go again? maybe but definitely not going to hunt it down again.
A little stingy on the lobster for the price of $20, otherwise quick service and good sandwich

It wasn't terrible, but not great, especially for the price. My bread was not warm and toasty - it was actually a little soggy, and the meat was cold even though I ordered the Connecticut style roll. Waffle fries were good, but I wasn't trying to pay $24 for good fries.
Great idea for lobster. The prices are reasonable considering you are getting lobster. It's downplayed by being in the middle of a noisy mall. The good tasty food, I recommend trying.

Had to come get some before I drove back home. Ofcourse I got the Cajun lobster mac n cheese. They actually gave us alot of lobster but the spice wasn't there at all! :( However we did ask for the seasoning to add into our meal and that tasted wonderful. I love how creamy the cheese was and the meaty lobster.
had the lobster n chips it was okay....  really overpriced.  $14.05 for four pieces of nuggets n fries.  its jus tempura covered lobster n fries  nothing too fancy.

Close to our hotel, I had wanted to try this place before we even got to Vegas (who doesn't love lobster, right?!)   It was OK. I honestly was expecting more, but I really shouldn't have from what is basically mall food lol.  The lobsicle was kinda small and a little chewy and fishy. And SUPER greasy. Not worth the 14 bucks imo... (I wouldn't have been able to tell if it was a giant prawn honestly)   The classic lobster roll however was SO yummy, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. The roll was toasty and buttery, and it was heaping full with lobster (I had to pick some pieces out before i could even pick it up and eat it) However, I have never had a lobster roll before so I have nothing to really compare it to haha.   The green salad with lemon pepper vinaigrette was expensive and a waste of my money. 8 bucks for some lettuce a few cherry tomatoes and some oil to pour on top. Pass.  My sister said the fish and chips were delicious, but nothing like we get out here in California on the coast. She said it was Vegas-good (ha!)  It was yummy, but expensive. Almost 60 bucks for our meal. We will probably not go back.

First, let me say- the people complaining about the price are ABSURD! Show me a major city where you can get a lobster roll for less that $15, now remember what you are eating... LOBSTER!!!!!!!!! It's supposed to be expensive- duh. Also, a few extra bucks for being on the strip in LV and you have a completely reasonable price.  The chowder fries are incredible. Good lobster rolls and mac and cheese. Grilled cheese was eh

Great grub. This is walk up joint in the Venetian Shops area. Great food but as expected Vegas prices. They are very proud of their food, but they have a reason to be. It is very good. I asked the guy if I had to get one thing he said the Lobster Tacos. I was surprised he did not say a roll since this is their premier item.  I went with his call and man, these things were great. What I would also compliment them on is that they don't skimp on the meat and it is not a bunch of nasty claw tip. It is the sweet meat. I devoured these and then went up to grab a roll. They were great as well, but If I had one regret, I would have gotten the Lobsicle. It looks like a lobster corn dog. Still wishing I had tried that. All in all I was very happy with this place. The staff was friendly and the food was great.
Worst place ever!! Portions were so small it would barely fill my cavity especially for the prices they are charging. Was looking so forward to coming here too. 2 thumbs down!!

I got to Vegas really early in the day and barely any restaurants or food court was open before 10am. Decided to walk around the Venetian and see what we can find in there, and found a cute little lobster restaurant right across this italian restaurant. Their menu was truly dedicated to lobster. Tacos, burritos, salad and even the famous Lobster Roll. The prices were very steep for most of the food choices but what do you expect? Vegas prices... I opted for the lobster taco since they didnt have any fish that morning, which was fine. They were kind enough to hook it up with another lobster taco since the girl at the register had already charged my card for the total price of one lobster and fish taco but was later told by the cook in the back that their was no more fish. Kudos for being gracious enough to hook it up! Got my two tacos that appeared pretty small looking, almost the size of a street taco or corn tortillas. but the portion of lobster and garnishes was an ok size just not enough...I pretty much wolfed both them down in four bites, thats how small these were and im not a big guy. Overall, it was flavorful and tasty I just cant see myself to buy more at the prices they are asking. Ill definitely stop by again if im ever in the area, but it would only be a one time thing every visit to Sin City.

Large original lobster roll and Mac & cheese. One word: WELL DAMNIT IT TASTE SO GOOD! That was more than one word but it's so good. I really enjoyed both items and not stingy at all with the lobster. Great snack before boyz 2 men show later. Whoop!
Would've been a 4 star but my Lobster Tostada arrived with bacon!!  Isn't listed as an ingredient but it's there... Thankfully I'm not vegan, just don't care for bacon so I'll pick it off
FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! All you can eat lobsicle!NOPE all you can buy! Prices high for little. Hope  this saves you from the false advertisement

DIOS MIO LO ENORME DEL SANDWICH QUE ME COMÍ. Pedí el Lobster Roll "The Cajun" (que es langosta caliente con mayonesa de cajun y orégano) en un combo que vino con papas fritas y clam chowder (sopa cremosa de almejas con papas, panceta y apio).   APENAS PUDE RESPIRAR. Se puede comer ahí (ya que lo llevan a la mesa) o take out. Yo pedí takeout porque estaba con un grupo de personas que comían otras cosas.  La atención fue buenísima. De hecho se olvidaron de mis papas, fui a reclamarlas y me las dieron con trocitos de langosta como gratitud por olvidarse.  Claramente merecieron la gran propina que les dejé.  Muy limpio el lugar y muy organizado. Como todo restaurante gringo que tiene takeout o self service, te dan un control con un número que vibra al momento que tu pedido está listo (acá lo empezaron a usar hace poco, pero sumamente útil).   Recomiendo todo!!  Insisto: yo fui al de las vegas, no se cómo serán los otros locations.
Lobster mac and cheese and lobsters on a stick are delish! I see alot of reviews about the price, dont be surprised, you are eating LOBSTER?! Service was excellent.

I really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't make the cut.   First off, where do we eat?! Too many patrons, not enough tables! Second, the wait for the food was probably about 20-30 minutes. Kitchen seemed to be a bit unorganized, as I noticed like 10 or so tickets at the window! Now for the important part, the lobster... We ordered an original lobster roll, lobster mac and lobster grilled cheese. Unfortunately, we weren't really impressed! The lobster roll was inconsistent in flavor. Some bites were pretty good, others were eh. It was also pretty small! (should not be called "large"). The lobster mac was, sad to say... Bland and runny. Couldn't really taste the lobster and it looked like Mac and cheese, but the flavor of the cheese was almost nonexistent. Definitely would like it to be more creamy and rich. Finally, the lobster grilled cheese was actually the best of the three, but was far from phenomenal. The grilled bread was good but was mushy. It didn't have that crisp you expect from a grilled sammy. I told my girl, the best part of my meal was my beer.   I read an earlier post about this place... It stated "if you don't like your money, eat here." I wanted to find out for myself, but about $40+ poorer, I definitely should have taken that yelper's advice! Don't say we didn't warn you!
Food portions were somewhat small for what you pay. It was good but don't expect a big meal here

Yummy ass lobster roll, the bun is toasted perfectly and they give you a good amount of lobster. Only thing is the price, the lobster roll is actually more expensive than Gordon Ramsys lobster and shrimp burger at PH. But this is much more convenient and quicker.

I'd say for a quick and tasty lunch that doesn't break the bank in Vegas, come here! It's easy to find in the Caesar shops, and they have a lot of seating.  Their lobster rolls are really good, and they're priced pretty decently. I've had some lobster rolls that had barely any meat in them, and these were pretty stuffed. Their lobster mac & cheese is also delicious, though we would have liked it if the lobster was mixed in to the pasta and not just dumped on top. Their tator tots are bomb as well...super crispy! I'd def come here again for a quick and easy bite to eat

I ordered 1 lobster roll with butter and chives and upgraded lobster bisque, 2 shrimp tacos, a new england clam chowder in bread bowl, and 2 modelos on tap. It was Taco Tuesday so the shrimp tacos were only $3.50 which was a steal for how big the shrimp was. It didn't say that they were on the spicy side, so beware if you're sensitive. I ordered this for kids and they weren't able to get them down. So I had to switch with the $24 lobster roll that I got. The bread bowl was soft and there was sufficient amount of soup. I hate it when there's not a lot of soup in those bread bowls.  The lobster roll was great as well. Soft sweet roll type of bread and a lot of lobster. However, not worth the price tag. Probably more like an $18 cost would've been better. I paid an extra $2 to upgrade to the lobster bisque. It was good. The broth was not thick, more of a lighter texture. Big chunks of lobster was a bonus.   The beers on tap were not really cold. I think I would've taken the cans if I had to order again. They charge $0.54 for tap water cups. But she gave us 2 for free. The food came out fairly quickly. We were in a rush to get something in our bellies before a show. And managed to order, eat and get out within 25 minutes. That was with a small line.   The tables are like mall food tables. So they're not the cleanest. But it's fast food, so you get a few extra napkins and have to wipe it down yourself.   Overall food was tasty and it served it's purpose. I'd definitely eat again.

If you enjoy seafood then Lobster ME should be the first place you go after getting off the plane, and the last place you visit before you leave. There's a good variety of crab- and lobster-themed menu items to choose from, so repeat visits are a must.   The staff is very friendly. Jeff (the general manager) checked in everyone's orders and made sure everything was perfect. Which it was.   Utterly delicious.   (And they also have the "good ice" lol)   Prices are reasonable--for Vegas--with most of the entrees+side costing $12-$18. Which is less expensive than Red Lobster and infinitely more tasty.   Tl;dr: Food good. Eat much.

I wanted to go to the Earl of Sandwich but the line was too long, just like it was last summer. So we settled for this place because it looked good. The clam chowder bowl was pretty good. My boyfriend said the shrimp tacos were okay. I got the lobster and waffles. DON'T get this. First of all, the waffle turned out to be a pancake. Then the lobster pieces were covered in so much batter. The batter tasted like grease and the lobster was chewy. This was a very disappointing and expensive meal.

Lobsicle... a lobster tail on a skewer!  Sounds good and looks great, right?  For the price, I was a bit disappointed. The lobster tail was on the salty side and I finished it in about four bites!  However, it was fresh and I didn't have to peel it.  I chose the grilled lobsicle over the fried version.  It was a novelty item and I'm glad that I satisfied my curiosity.  (It was served on a bed of shredded lettuce, with a lemon wedge and a small container of melted butter.)  Next time we're at the Miracle Mile Shops, I might get a Lobster Roll. I had the lobster mac and cheese in the past and it wasn't bad.    I realize that this is a shopping mall with possibly higher prices.  That's why I really appreciate the free parking!
I had the crab fries, husband had the lobster mac n cheese balls. Food was very good. Service was terrible. Felt very unwelcome. It was around 2:00 on a Monday. Not at all busy or crowded.

The cajun lobster sandwich was tasty, a bit on the pricey side for the $17 portion (but then again, don't expect to get value anywhere in a Vegas hotel based establishment).  HOWEVER, my major issue was sanitation training.  Shortly after receiving my order,  which granted is the not so busy time of day at 3pm. The back kitchen preparer came out front and started tossing around some plastic thing, and dropping it several times on the floor, and his hands with food prep gloves subsequently touched the floor,  he also touched his face and back of head a few times, while going back and then preparing someone elses order.  I think management needs to retrain the employees here on food handling & sanitation safety.

One of the most expensive "fast food" meals, especially in Vegas. But.... the lobster looks so good in the pictures!  Okay, reality is - the lobster is good, but you just don't expect to pay the $$ price for somewhere so casual. They don't really give you that much lobster either, but it is pretty tasty for the few bites you get out of it.  Connecticut style is the one I tasted and it was simple and good. Make it a combo to at least get some small bang for your bucks. Lobster bisque is decent and for drinks, you can try any of their different lemonades instead of a typical soft drink.

Not impressed- $17 for a "worlds best lobster roll" & it was seriously the size of a child's sandwich.  Also, it was overcooked.  Really??  They could do better I don't care how expensive lobster is!!  Go somewhere else and save your money.

Don't waste your time. Overpriced, under seasoned, undersized. The Mac n cheese was runny. The lobster roll was done in three bites. I know, I know. It's Vegas. I should have known better for a tourist trap.

I want to give them 5 stars but it's just not there yet..... Need to add some pizazz  It's good but not A-mazing Maybe a bit more dressing, sprinkle some green onions in there, some salt n peppa Something..... ? Overall good, but world's best? Bold statement, as I have had the best in cali at the lobster shack, redwood city to be exact.  But I'd say for vegas, do try it.  I sampled the bisque which was tasty, the chowda was good, better than your average. I had a lobsta shooter, bloody Mary mix, celery, onions, cilantro, it was tasty! U can add vodka too!  Next time gonna try the seafood cocktail and the lobsta grilled cheese!!!!!  C ya

If your up around the morning time and your wondering what to eat check out Lobster ME they open at 9 am! Came here around that time and it was my first time trying this place out.   Ordered a lobster roll and some type of drink. The lady at the front was pretty polite and very nice. He food came out quickly and the lobster meat inside was pretty warm and tasty with the butter roll bread.   I thought the amount of meat was enough and the size was pretty good. I wanted to eat something sort of light so I shared it. For me I want to try all the places in Vegas and I'm glad I stopped by here to check this place out.   You might be thinking why would I get lobster in a dessert, but it's worth a shot to try it out! Any things possible in life, just enjoy the moment.

Definitely hit the spot, if you like lobsters as much as I do. This is the place to go to end your lobster craving!  Between my cousin and I, we ordered Lobster & Chips, Lobster Roll, Lobsicle, Lobster Bloody Mary and Lobster Waffle. Yes, we went all out and pig out!  Definitely filling, better come with an empty stomach!!

Being a Lobster fanatic, i just had to try this place during a quick trip to Vegas. I was a bit surprised and disappointed to see that this is more of a fast food type set up. I was expecting and would have preferred a sit down place with actual plates and silverware.  However, this place is definitely a must-try for all lobster lovers! Is the lobster the best quality around? No. However, it's still good and where else can you get lobster waffles, lobster grilled cheese, lobster ice cream, lobster on a stick (list goes on and on...) for a reasonable price?   This is certainly not a nice dinner place - but for a unique and delicious breakfast and/or lunch and/or late night treat in Vegas, LobsterMe is a GREAT choice! I will be back the next time im in/around Planet  Hollywood.
Got the lobster bisque and tator tots. The tots were outstanding and even though I'm not really a lobster fan the bisque was quite tasty. Good value for the price.
While the food was great there's no place to sit. Very limited seats and tables. Makes it difficult to give more than 2 stars
Lobster Tacos...hands down amazing; it comes with 2 and I had to get a second helping of it because it was that good! Try it!

Well it's a lobster roll. Bread and lobster. Toasted bread with juicy lobster. I don't like the price but it is lobster and it is Vegas. Ordered the lobster roll, lobster melt and chowder. Very good stuff.
My boyfriend and I wanted to experience Lobster Me and I was good. Our sandwiches were stuff with tons of lobster and they didn't hold back. Yummy!

I went here about a month and a half ago and I thought the food was good but a bit too heavy for me. Pricing was on the expensive beside but it is lobster meat....big chunks too! My friends and I shared a large lobster roll, fries and lobster mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was one of the best I've ever had! Must try that. I would go back if I'm in the mood for heavy comfort food :)

The place was a real treat. They had so many interesting choices on the menu. I had the Cajun roll. Lobster was well cooked and the bread was tasty as well. The lady was even nice to offer another refill on my lemonade when she saw mine was all finished.

Try the el diablo. It was amazing. The coleslaw served with the food is also very good with some siracha. I would have given this review a 5 if my girlfriends "Conneticut Roll" wasn't so bland. However great service even after coming 20 minutes before closing and my food was awesome.

I only came here because the line for Earl's sandwich was out of this world.   I am glad I was able to try this place. We got the lobster mac and cheese which was pretty good. The cheese was not overwhelming and had a good decent about of lobster meat in it.  We also got the Lobster roll which was also pretty good but I felt it was lacking in the sauce.  PS. try the apple beer if you like apple juice! It tasted just like apple juice except you get buzzed!!
the food is delicious but it kinda of pricey for the little amount you get. I mean this Vegas for the amount of money you're paying you can get so much more other places for great quality of food.

Awesome place to stop and have a lobster roll and some bisque for lunch. Food was good and bisque was hot. A little on the pricey side, but it's lobster. I hope one day that Lobster Me is a common as crappy Subway.

Wow! For a counter service mall type venue, I was delighted to find such a tasty lobster mac n cheese.  The prices are indicative of it being a lobster dish, but when you want something fast I am so glad to find alternatives to the traditional fast food joints.    This is definitely convenient to Miracle Mile shoppers or to Planet Hollywood guests who don't want to walk too far or drive.  Sometime this week I will hit them up for breakfast to try the Lobster and Waffles.  DT

Was down at the grand canal shops last night and stumbled upon this place and my girl and I tried the grilled cheese with crab fries.  And OMG this stuff was bomb and totally worth my time and money. It does seem pricey at first but I mean it's lobster and lots of it.   We will be back next time to try something else.

The Cajun Lobster Roll is tasty. It's kind of small but they do pack a nice amount of lobster in it. I got a L Cajun Roll while BF got a XL Original. The cajun had a nice kick to it but I dont like the fact that it comes out cold. I know its a lobster roll and it doesnt need to be hot but it shouldnt feel like it came straight out of the fridge either. BF said his roll was okay, nothing extraordinary, but the size was disappointing for a XL. He said he'd probably need two or three to be full. I think i'd need a XL next time to be somewhat full.  They should really post up the sizes og the rolls so people know how much to order.  I was also disappointed that they didn't have the Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche. I really wanted to try that but the worker just said, "we don't have that today." If you don't have it everyday maybe you should specify that on the menu! Just sayin...

Great lobster treat inside Planet Hollywood's mall. The grilled lobsicle and lobster roll was our favorite. The lobster mac was decent, but it pales in comparison to their roll and Lobsicle. Staff is friendly and service is quick. Nice stop for a quick treat when you're mid-strip.

Lobster roll extra meat, lobster Bloody Mary with claw $40.00.  It was enjoyable but a bit pricey for Vegas if you ask me .  I will return, I always do! Fun fast food place with Lobster, how can you go wrong !

We can all agree that lobster rolls are always on the pricy side. There are at least 15 bucks for a small roll. If we are lucky and sweet enough, the staff stack the warm roll with a lot of huge chunks of claw meat. Lobster Me was perfect lunch portion for someone that is not super hungry, but I-should-eat-before-I-go-to-dayclub-because I-woke-up-late-for-lunch/I-am -hung-over/I-cannot-not-do a-buffet-because-I-will-not-make-my-moneys-worth. That totally describes someone I don't know at all.   The sandwich was on a warm toast, with room temperature lobster... which is a good thing. I didn't want it chilled. I got the original which was topped off with curry seasoning. I wished the cut their lemons a different way so that more juice comes out. The lemon makes a difference! It makes the sandwich a little lighter since of course the bun us smothered in butter.   The roll came with a side of cole slaw and home-made chips, which were also yummy with a squeeze of lemon. Ask for two wedges!

There aren't too many places that you'll find a decent meal for a decent price in Vegas.  Fortunately Lobster ME has food that tastes great and the price won't break the bank.  This place is located inside the Miracle Mile Shops, in Planet Hollywood.  I didn't opt for the lobster roll like mainly everyone was doing, but instead got the crab cake burger, and was glad I did because it's a bigger portion than the roll, for about $14 and it comes these seasoned waffle fries which made for a perfectly delicious and filling dinner under $20 bucks.

We had to visit the Venetian Casino and stores JUST to return visit LobsterMe. It had been two years since our first visit, but we didn't forget that yummy grilled lobster on a stick- lobstycle! Outstanding! And get a great lobster Bloody Mary to go with it

Yum, yum, yum, yum, yummmm.   But that's just for the lobster roll.  Yummmmmm.  But seriously just get the lobster roll.  It's the bomb.  Everything else is meh.  The boyfriend has tried the fish chips and he spent the entire time trying to steal my lobster roll.  The fries weren't bad just not good and fish itself was like frozen filet quality.  We tried the lobster mac and cheese last time and it was a testament to how if you add lobster to anything it's passable.  The mac itself was pretty cafeteria style, it's been baked and left in a pan forever.  But then they top it was a heaping handful of lobster so you almost forgive them.  Almost.   However, the lobster roll is out of this world, perfectly buttered toasted parker roll piled high with a ridiculous amount of huge chunks o' lobster meat that just lightly tossed in lemon and some spices.  If you like a creamy lobster salad with smaller pieces this is not for you but for the lobster-vores out there, you gotta try it.

I walked up to look at the menu and the cashier is scratching her armpit. She turned to grab food and stopped to scratch between her boobs. Then she grabbed the order and took it to the customer. No gloves no hand washing. There is no way I will be eating here. Such a shame- the good looks great.

Don't waste your time!  My first visit was shortly after they opened.  The service was very slow, but they were very busy.  The lobster??? on the lobster roll was very stingy, and unidentifiable as lobster as opposed to shrimp or crawfish or even sirimi, in some cases.  It was mostly bread. I just tried them again, and after twenty minutes (with three other customers...so they were SLOW), my lobster mac n cheese came out cool.  Not cold, but not even room temperature.  And this was after they stressed how hot it was.  I took one taste of a noodle (very metallic flavour) and took it back to them, stating it was cool.  15 minutes later the "night shift supervisor" came out and informed me that it still wasn't ready.  Did I want to purchase something else?  Were they nuts?  Over 35 minutes wasted waiting on food that never appeared.  They claim that they voided the sale, but I can see the charge on my credit card; we'll see if it goes away. Do yourself a favour, don't bother with this place!!!!!

First of all I'm from Chicago. You'll understand later. The Lobster log is excellent. But the same sandwich in Chicago cost about $5 less and is twice the size. Here in Vagas I had to keep telling myself I'm on vacation. The low rating is only due to the size of the sandwich.

The Lobster roll was fresh and oh so buttery. It was oozing with chopped up lobster meat, just stuffed. The chips were good. I dont eat cold slaw, so no review on that. Best kept secret in Vegas. This dish was amazing.

This place is not a sit down restaurant. You place your order and sit to eat at a choice of four tables about eight feet away. The bar seats about four people and can get cramped really quick. Service was o.k., but nothing special. Saw the lobster roll and was surprised because it was small. Looks a lot bigger in the pictures. The lobster Mac n cheese was good with a great creamy cheese flavor. The lobster however was dry and void of flavor. Lobster should be the best thing here since it is called, LOBSTER ME!

After coming here on out last trip, we really enjoyed the lobster rolls so we decided to come here again.  My bf ordered the Connecticut roll which is warm lobster and I ordered the Cajun lobster roll which is chilled lobster.  The lobster rolls were packed with lobster.  Both were delicious just as we remembered.  We also ordered the lobster mac n cheese and it was alright.  I think the rolls are way more worth it.  After ordering and paying for your food up at the counter, they give you a stick with your order number on it and when the food is done, they'll bring it out to your table.

Giving this place a one star. Ordered lobster bisque it was awesome went back to get more they said sorry no more! It's 1030pm I asked what time they close they said 1100pm. Sitting here several people have came up to order food they are turning them away saying they are out of food. If you close at 1100pm keep the food comming until then or close early. A lot of pissed off people leaving!

I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Mac and cheese is my favorite, along with lobster and crab.  So of course I had their mac and cheese. I got the combo so I could have an iced tea, and my friends could share my fries. I knew $18 was a bit steep for me, but it's Vegas - and lobster!  The portions were bigger than I expected! Except.... for the lobster. But whatever. It was still delicious and fresh. Fries were good. Medium cut with semi-light cajun seasonings. Iced tea was unsweetened as promised - nothing special.  Employee working there looked very alternative, and was super friendly and helpful. I want to try one of their lobster rolls in the future. Hopefully there will be a little more lobster next time around.

I could go 3.5 stars but you only get one choice. The lobster bisque hardly had one bit of lobster in it. the bread bowl was about the normal size but without any lobster in it, it was just plain soup, heavy on the butter taste. The Lobster Mac and Cheese was exceptional and had a plentiful amount of lobster in it and it was not overwhelmed with cheese. Perhaps it could have used a bit more cheese, but overall the taste was really good. Why three stars? Mainly it comes down to price. You can get the same things at other establishments for perhaps $2 or more less per item. It seemed you are paying for the name.   There are very little places to sit as they have these leather chairs that make it really difficult to eat there unless you hold your food. the shop next door has two tiny tables but they do the trick if they don't harrass you for not buying a drink. Simply adding some tables would help but I think they intend everyone to just leave. That is not so easy with a breadbowl of soup.   The location is not too difficult to find in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. Make sure you stop by the thunderstorm pond nearby. The staff was fine and seemed friendly.

Lobster Me is a great place for lunch or a snack. The place is located in the Miracle Mile mall in the Planet Hollywood hotel next the Fat Tuesday. For a small place inside the mall they do make a damn pretty good lobster roll. I usually getting The Maine lobster roll it full of lobster meat no filling. Very tasty. Highly recommend place.

Yay, I finally get to cross "Lobster Me" off my list of spots to try on the strip!    It's located conveniently next door to Fat Tuesdays, so this could be a good place to grab a bite before those icey dranks.  The Seafarer Lobster Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lobster-me-las-vegas?select=k8BD5TlnoDu7V5nB5-ra5A#cV_H97p1lnoZOclyl1LJ1g) caught my eye because it had some veggies mixed in with the lobster.  (Lobster and seafood salad with mayo, cucumber, celery and green onion).  I like how the roll is buttered and toasted, but I wish there was more lobster in the roll! I was expecting big chunks of lobster but instead got minced pieces of lobster.  I'll definitely get a bigger roll next and share a few items with some friends.   Altogether, it was alright-- not sure if i will ever be craving this though.
WAYYYYY OVER PRICED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 17$ for a fried lobster tail!!!!!!! On a fast food place!

Let's give this another try. The first time I had Lobster ME, I was not impressed. I tried the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was horrible!  No flavor and it didn't even taste like Mac and Cheese. I only came back here because Gordon Ramsay Burger was too busy to take carry out orders and I was in a rush to get back to the hotel.   Lobster ME is located inside of Miracle Shops Mall in the little food area next to Fat Tuesday's. I stood in line for a good 15 minutes before my order was taken and there were nothing but about 4-5 people ahead of me. That is ridiculous! Then I waited another 10 minutes for my food to arrive. So not worth the wait. One star knocked off.   Instead of the Mac and Cheese, I got a lobster roll which wasn't bad. It was seasoned well and they used big pieces of meat. The problem? The roll was 80% bread and 20% lobster. Lobster rolls are already small, but they cut the tiniest slit into the bread and pretty much just plopped a little lobster on top. Every time I picked it up, all the lobster fell out. Another star gone.   I would come back here as a last resort if I couldn't get to Luke's Lobster on the other side of the strip outside of Fashion Mall. WAY BETTER service and quality.

This was my 4th time stopping at Lobster ME to see if they had any lobster ice cream and to my complete amazement, they did have some.  They were not out as they were the last three times.  I am persistent if nothing else.  Since the place opened, I've been intrigued by the idea of lobster ice cream so I had to give it a try.  There is one serving size, a dish with vanilla ice cream with mixed in lobster pieces and a larger frozen piece of lobster as a topper.  The ice cream was not very creamy.  It had a crumbly texture.  The lobster flavor was not evident until it warmed a bit--they opened a new 5 gallon container--so it was quite frozen.  Now and then, you get a piece of lobster that has a salty taste.    In the end, I rate this as just OK.  It's certainly worth a try once.  The prices here are high with the lobster ice cream being just under $10 including tax.  That's a lot of froyo at other places around town.  Considering that the cheapest lobster sandwich is $17, this is the least expensive lobster treat at this place.  There are some round tables and I was able to people watch--one of my favorite hobbies on a Saturday night in Las Vegas.  The number of people buying their frozen yard and 1/2 yard drinks was funny.  I'm sure I won't be back.  This was a one time try.  I'm just glad I was there once when they weren't out.
Got the lobsicle. Paid 15 bucks and its smaller than my hand (im 5 feet and asian so thats saying something). Taste was horrible too. So disappointed!

I was hungry and a lobster roll sounded good.  It was pretty good, but not great.  Chips are good too.  I also had the Lobster Bloody Mary for $13, and was super disappointed.  The vodka was cheap and the mix was even cheaper.  you pay for the lobster claw that comes with the drink.  Next time, I'll get the sandwich and a coke.
Be careful. They will hit you with extra charges and act like it was an accident. Ordered the lobster Roll and they charged me for avacados which I didn't ordered. Look at ur receipt
I really enjoyed my food at Lobster Me. The only complaint is you will be hungry after you eat the small lobster roll uhg!

If you're expecting top-end Lobster Rolls and enough to fill you up, this is probably not your stop. If you're just crazing a decent lobster roll, that's what you'll get here. The best item I had here was the crab-covered fries.  For the price, I would look elsewhere if you value quality.

so when I first heard about this place I was actually expecting a sit down restaurant by the sounds of it. Well surprise surprise, it was a quick little place in the mall. Of course it looked awesome. So I ultimately had the lobster fries and both kinds of rolls. Now before you think I had them at once, I actually went to have them on 3 separate occasions while I was on my trip!!!!!  Do I need to say more if it was that worthy?! Anywho, the lobster fries were out of this world especially after I squeezed some lemon on those puppies. And the lobster rolls with some mayo packets was TO DIE FOR ... Sadly this post has only left me craving it all over again and I'm a few thousand miles away...*sigh*

The food was good.  However, the portion sizes are extremely small.  I was expecting a real roll but was given a miniature 3.5" roll for $19.  Do not waste your money making it a combo either.  It wasn't worth the money!!!!

I've always wanted to try a lobster roll. Lobster Me has different flavors and gives you the option to warm the lobster meat. I ordered the Cajun Lobster Roll (Warm), the lobster bisque, and a couple lobster shooters w/vodka. All around delicious! They weren't heavy on the mayo at all! My sandwich was simply spicy lobster meat amazingness. I would have loved to try the Lobster Mac n Cheese, but I was so stuffed. If this place didn't have Vegas prices, I'd give it a 5.

I walked past this place a few times before trying it and I really regret it.  I thought it was going to be frozen lobster, cooked to hell and not worth the price which is a bit more than what lobster rolls go for in the Northeast.  Yes, I was wrong.  I tried the lobster roll with a drink for a late breakfast on my last day in Vegas.  Man, it was perfect.  Overflowing with claw meat, the buttery goodness from the roll, I instantly regretted not going a size up!  I've been craving another one ever since and this will definitely be on my "go to" list every time I hit Sin City!

They have lobster rolls, crab rolls, crab fries, they have great service and they have a great location, you need to try it. We were at the Venetain for several nights and the Canal Shoppes have some of the best food and you will not wait an hour to get in and you won't walk away poor. Lobster ME is just great. The service is fast and very nice. All the items we had were great. You will love it and you should try it. Have fun in Las Vegas.

This one is located in the food court of the Venetian.  For lunch we ordered Lobster taco and chowder fries. Excellente!  We came back for lobster rolls--Maine and Connecticut. They were a little plain.  The Maine one needed a little more mayo. The service is friendly and the food overall pretty good. I would definitely come back.

Love the lobster! Super flavorful and delicious in every bite.  So my cousin and I ordered the lobster roll and the lobster Mac and cheese. As mentioned, it tasted awesome! The only bad part is its portion. It's not filling at all. When my cousin received the Mac and cheese, he was really disappointed to see the small container that he paid $15 for. I had the similar experience when I opened the box to the $19 lobster roll. I guess lobster is that expensive and more of a luxury treat.   I would probably come back if I had extra to spend and needed a bite.

As many times as I have gone to planet Hollywood, this is the first time I have ever stopped at the spot. I was there on a girls trip, for the weekend, and decided to get something to eat. I got a simple order of fried shrimp and french fries. It was really good and I believe I paid $14. Even though the day was super busy, I did not wait long for my order. I think maybe a total of five or six minutes, so not bad. Just be cautious that the area gets pretty crowded when it is on a Saturday. So you may have to take your food to go (or sit elsewhere) if you cannot find a small table.

Definitely more upscale and better than most other food court options at the Venetian, but still pretty expensive for what you get, and I was still hungry after spending about $20. After a long day of day-drinking, I wanted some more substance but wanted to try this place out. I'm used to paying between $14-17 for a lobster roll at other places, but if you want it with fries & a drink, be prepared to throw down another $4.  But like most things in Vegas go, take normal prices for something and tack on 25-50% more.  I got the lobster roll Connecticut style which was good - the bread was fluffy, soft, and buttered, and there was a decent amount of lobster. I've gotten lobster rolls on hot-dog like buns, but this bread was actually pretty good/ I ate the sandwich pretty quickly, and thought it was tasty, but nothing I'd be writing home about or go out of my way for on my next trip to Vegas. The fries were hot and fresh, but for the amount of fries that you get - there were so few that you could count them - (maybe around 15 fries), you're better off just getting a lobster roll and getting fries at any other food-court establishment. The coleslaw was not memorable and was about 3 bites worth in a container that you normally get to hold ketchup.  They basically have all iterations for lobster things on the menu: sandwiches (cold with mayo, warm Connecticut style, Cajun, sliders), lobster fries, lobster mac & cheese, lobster grilled cheese, lobster tacos, and lobster salad. Basically multiple permutations of white carbs, cheese / butter, and lobster.  All in all, if you're looking for a quick bite to eat at the food court that is not pizza or burgers, this is a good choice. But for the price ($21 for fries + lobster roll), it's expensive and you can probably get something more filling at Grand Lux cafe or elsewhere at the Venetian or Palazzo. Save the lobster rolls for East Coast visits, and get something that is going to cure those hangovers or prepare you properly for a night out.

Most Lobster rolls are served cold, being that it was warm was a bit disappointing.  It was fresh, but lacked a bit of flavor. The waffle fries were absolutely perfect.  It is quite expensive, wouldn't go out of my way for it again

This was nice. I dined here twice last week.   I had the fried  Lobsicle. The service is variable. It depends on who is working there. (This is not good!).  My first time, they did not offer me the free refills.  The next day, I was offered fries and free refills at no extra charge. So, the food is good but the service is questionable.  I recommend dining at lunchtime not in the evening.

Made a quick stop after seeing huge signs of lobster!  The chowder was piping hot and creamy.I added the huge chunks of lobster for additional cost. Also ordered the lemonade which was average. There wasnt much seating due to it being New Years day, and the restaraunt being next to frozen alcohol place.. Nice quick pick me up for cold days on the strip.

This place was delicious!! We always walk past it and never stop. Today we decided to try it out!! There are no words for how delicious our lobster Cajun roll and fries was!! We were so impressed we are coming back again tomorrow!! The fries were delicious as well crispy and full of flavor!! I you want a good lobster snack this is the place to be!!

Oh man. I should've gotten the all you can eat but instead I chose the lobster and chips.   It was kinda sad when I got the meal because there was barely anything. But what can I say? It IS lobster.  The lobster kind of had an overlooked feel to it because it felt a little rubbery. All in all, it wasn't too bad but I wouldn't get it again.   The person taking my order was awesome, nice, and welcoming.   This was definitely a nice experience on my trip.

3.5 stars.  Pros: 1. The Beltway! $17 Warm Maine lobster tossed with Old Bay spice, shallots & chives, served in a toasted brioche bun, topped with butter-toasted panko crumbs.  2. Each sandwich roll comes with a side of homemade potato chips and cole slaw. Not bad for $17.  3. Big chunks of lobster meat.  Cons: 1 The Connecticut. $17 Warm lobster meat tossed in melted butter. - No FLAVOR!  Had to ask for a side of drawn butter to liven it up! 2. Lightly burnt the bun on the Connecticut. Poor form! Boo!!!!  Verdict:  I'd return again to try the Cajun!

Staying at a hotel near the Miracle Mile shops-and eating at Lobster Me at least twice during our stay-has always been tradition for me and my friends! Lobster rolls became an addiction for me and it all started at this joint that's always jam packed with a line of people trying to fulfill their drunchies or simply trying to start their day after a long night of unce unce unce-ing.  I have to have a lobster roll (the Conneticut; steamed lobster) with fries and a Coke. It's a little pricey but worth every bite, especially when you have a few drinks in you. I love the toasted bun and the generous serving of lobster you can taste in each bite. There are several options but I enjoy the plain ol' Connecticut lobster roll here so much that I refuse to try anything else. They offer promotions here and there, and during my last stay it was buy a lobster roll, get chowder fries for the free. Best day ever!? Chowder fries.. Just yes. They're melt in your mouth good and they don't skimp out on the chunky goodness.  The service is fast and friendly. Which makes the lines go by quickly. Definitely one of the better options within Miracle Mile if you're ever hunting down something filling.
Delicious-ness!!! Love when lobster isn't served very "fancy" but still has its own flavor.. The other ingredients its paired definitely compliment the lobster in every different roll.

Whyyyyyyyy did you change the way the lobster grilled cheese is made!???  The 1 star is from the disappointment of fiending for something.. getting to Vegas.. buying it.. catching the drool before you bite it only to say WTF!!! When you do.  I didn't even finish it.

Let's start with location..located inside the Miracle Mile Shops in PH.  Been to Miracle Mile a bunch of times and never noticed this place.  Got word from Yelp that this was a must try, so I came to try.  Tested and Approved: -Lobster Roll Original:  Had the XL Lobster Original Roll.  Delicious, but expensive for what you get. But what are you to expect for lobster?  Thick pieces of lobster inside a buttery roll.  Perfect lobster claw to top it off.  This is a must try if it's your first time here.  -Lobster Mac N Cheese:  I actually liked this better than their lobster roll.  Not too cheesy with a perfect blend of lobster pieces.   -Tator Tots:  Mixes well with the Lobster Mac N Cheese.   -Lobster Ice Cream:  To be honest, doesn't sound pleasing at all.  But not too bad, I just didn't taste any lobster since the pices are frozen.    I plan on trying other items on their menu.  Once I do, I'm sure to update my review.   Cons: -It can be a hassle to come here.  I don't see myself going out of my way to eat here.  But if I'm in Planet Hollywood, Paris, or the Miracle Mile Shops, then it's on.   -Seating: Tables are litterally the size of the serving trays.    -Price:  Lobster Roll, Lobster Mac, and Tator Tots.
