Bill came to over $40.    Pros: -Lobster!!!    You have to try at least once then determine if it's for you or not.

It was eh..I only tried this place kuz working in planet Hollywood I got the employee discount Had the Cajun roll And honestly for what I paid id thought it be better. Tried the lobster Mac and cheese barely any lobster.. So I tried the clam chowder on two seperate occasions first time delicious went back and the clam chowder tasted so watered down disgusting. Haven't been back since Fries were great tho that I cannot complain
Rip off if you get the lobsicle! Literally smaller than a hot dog. Everything else seems super duper tiny too. Lame!
The food was small for the price. A decent lobster roll but a far fetch from the real thing.

Awesome!  Authentic East Coast down to the apple cider and whoopie pies!  Open space just off Venetian Grand Canal food court, just walk up and order.   Casual, easy, welcoming.   I have been told the lobster roll options are more expansive than the options at Planet Hollywood location.  We had been told what were the personal favorites of the person behind the counter: the Original Maine Lobster Roll and the Cajun Lobster Roll.  We split these rolls and they did not disappoint.  FRESH, quality lobster served on a toasted bread like bun.  The roll comes in a Large for $17 or an XL for $23.  The Cajun was not incredibly spicy, but enough to make it interesting.   I would recommend for a casual specific food option for great quality lobster rolls while on Las Vegas Blvd.
these people that work here are so slow. literally waiting for one hour because they are taking forever for just one order. not worth it time at all~~
Maine lobster + butter = awesome. I had the beltway AND the Connecticut, with fresh squeezed lemonade. Yum.

I was sort of disappointed by my visit to Lobsterme. I ordered the lobsticle, and I was really excited because I'm from Miami and I've been looking for places to try ALL WEEK while I was in Vegas , the food looked sooooo good through the pictures and the reviews were really good . When my food came I was shocked at how small my grilled lobster on a stick was . I could have eaten 3 of them little things . I asked the lady if that was how big they normally were and she said yes they shrink when they get cooked .  I was mad and still hungry . The fries of wedges were really really good and so was the lobster , it was just too small .

Uhmmm, they are just ok. I dont know if it applies to all their locations though. Had the lobster roll and lobster mac and cheese. The lobster roll would have been better with bigger chunks of lobster meat instead of small chunks/minced size, although the flavor was good.  The mac n cheese was a little runny for my taste since i prefer the sauce to be on the thicker side. I'll definitely try them again since they are good for a quick snack even if it's a little pricey.

When in Vegas, I make it a point to stop by Lobster Me. Located inside the mall at Planet Hollywood. My bros and I needed a quick bite to continue are Christmas shopping. I ordered the 50/50 lobster roll. It came with fries and small coleslaw. Only downfall, the portion size of lobster roll is a joke. Tottaly disappointed, but the quality of the food is good and that keeps us coming. All in all, we will be back the next time we are in town.

Have to say, this was a surprise find.  Located inside the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood...   Counter service concept with all things lobster...  wasn't sure it would deliver - but I have to say the lobster roll I split today with a co-worker (yes, it's easy enough to hit up for lunch if you work at UNLV) was absolutely terrific.  Buttery toasted bun, fresh lobster, lots of claw meat, celery salt.    It's a winnah.
This was better than Red Hook lobster at NYC!  (I got the Diavolo)

What can I say for Vegas food court it was very good.  I'm a New England boy born n raised so I wasn't expecting much.  The presentation was very authentic all they way down to the New England grilled hit song bun slit topside.  Chowder was also great the lobster roll was good but I'm a bit jaded over the years I have had the absolute best the country has to offer.  Boston native and seafood expert price and quality was above average claw and Nicole meat no tail meat but I wasn't expecting that for under $20.  I would recommend it and also be back for the lobsterpopsicle  cute and original plating

Went to this place due to high reviews.. Ordered a original lobster roll & lobster salad  Taste of lobster is really brought out in the roll, these comes really good when served hot.. Though the size and meat amount is much smaller portion than I expected (the roll length is just a bit short compared to my hand, and I'm 5'3), so $17 is pretty expensive for what's served.. (As in the photo)  The salad, on the other hand, don't recommend these.. Due to sour & salty seasonings, can't really taste the lobster.. In any way, it doesn't worth $14..

First time ordering a lobster roll and it was delicious!! A whole pound of lobster in every roll and you can tell! I split a Connecticut roll with my boyfriend and we were very happy with it. It is slightly pricey and didn't really fill us up but the quality was great. A decadent way to tie us over to dinner.

2.5 Stars.  I would round up to 3, but can bring myself to do it even though the bartender was cool and kept wanting to make sure everything was fine.  Its so hard reading 4-5 Star reviews for anything because it just hypes up your own expectations.  When I read high reviews, I also read the low ones.  And unfortunately, I side with the low reviews here.  Main reason for the 2.5 Stars, just overpriced.  The food was not bad, but just not matching the price whatsoever. Many of the low reviews state the small portions, and yes, the rolls are small.  Not tiny small, just small.  I don't mind small portions for high prices at all, it just needs to be high quality if its going to be a small portion if you know what I mean.  The lobster is not high quality.  I want to be clear, it is not low quality, it's just not worth $19 for a roll.  If you've had good lobster, you will know it once you bite into the lobster here.    Where would I value this roll at?  $12.  But you know what, more power to them, go get your money LobsterME.  If people are willing to pay it, then you do you.  I applaud you.  The Chowder fries were not bad.  I agree the fries here are good, nice and crispy with good potato taste.  But $7 to add on the chowder fries and a drink to make the whole meal $26???  Hell to the NAW.

I was looking forward to this place, the fries were cold, the losbter meat was not tender, it was expensive and set up like a fast food place, the losbter Mac and cheese came in a very small and  came in very small container, not wroth the money

Lobster ME has beckoned me to visit every single time I've walked past it en route to Earl of Sandwich from the Planet Hollywood parking garage. Today, I finally answered the call.  Back in December, I was fortunate enough to win a $10 credit for Lobster ME at a Yelp event (see Yelp Helps: NPO-Yeah! for more info). This made any expenditure at this place a much more tolerable option, although I still anticipated having to shell out something for a Strip location that happened to serve the arguably already overpriced treat known as lobster.  I pretty much went straight to the Original "Maine Style" lobster roll. I limited myself to the medium size at $17, rather than go for the large size at $23, the difference being $7 vs. $13 out of pocket for me. This is described as Maine lobster with a touch of mayo, lemon, and a secret spice blend. I didn't taste too much mayo and I am reasonably sure that there's turmeric in the spice mix, but I can't be too sure beyond that.  This roll is pretty good! I definitely enjoyed the buttery, soft roll that still had a nice crunch, the ample chunks of lobster meat and claw, and the aforementioned mayo and spices. I probably would have given them four stars on the spot, but during the drive home I realized that it just didn't strike a memorable enough chord with me. Flavor aside, I'm pretty sure I'm barely over half full from that "medium' roll, if that.  Overall, I can see this being a convenient luxury food option for somebody with money to burn or for a tourist who feels trapped in Planet Hollywood / the Miracle Mile Shops, but I just wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends. There's just so many great places around Vegas that aren't so pricey.

Overpriced for what it was, the counter service both times were really friendly but my boyfriends lobster Mac and cheese came out cold, not like it was sitting for a while, but cold like it came out of the refrigerator and wasn't microwaved long enough. They apologized and gave a full refund but it was a little disappointing.  My lobster roll was very meaty but definitely not worth the $$.  I'm sure this place will do fine either way though due to the uniqueness/ concept and the location.  I usually try to avoid the strip restaurants for the exact reason of being overpriced for mediocre food but its so convenient if your at the MM shops or PH.  If I'm on property again I'll probably go to Earl of Sandwich instead.

This spot has the best sandwiches!!! They cost you though. It's honestly the best 25.00 dollar sandwich and worth the money. Yard bird costs just as much but doesn't taste nearly as good. I love this place when I have family in town I recommend this place to family. Like I say it is expensive but it is really good the lobster tastes  fresh and the people are friendly. This lobster is always fresh. I can't say that enough. This place goes hard

Phenomenal lobster roll and lobster mac and cheese. I ordered the 19$ lobster roll expecting a  small portion of so-so quality lobster in my roll. This place is technically fast food so I didn't  expect to get a lobster roll that actually looked like it had any distinguishable lobster in it.  I was dead wrong. For the first time in my life, the food actually looked like the picture on the menu. The taste was even better- full of lobster and flavor and juice and sauce, but not overly salty or drenched in sauce.  The roll itself is sort of too small to be a filling meal for a hungry grown adult, but it's perfect for someone who wants a satisfying meal without feeling full to the brim.  Only problem is that there isn't enough seating.   Overall great experience, would definitely come again and again.

Ordered a lobster grilled cheese is was ok... lobster mac & cheese with overly cooked (& probably rinsed) pasta with no cheese. Cole slaw was drier than ever tasted like it was just cabbage  never again waste of money

Every time I'm at the Venetian I stop by LobsterMe! Best Lobster Mac n cheese ever! The original Maine lobster roll is a staple and absolutely delicious.   My favorite stop. Casual seating. Nice atmosphere out in the open courtyard. Walk up type street vendor feel with barstool and bench seating. Great for one to a huge party of peeps!

Best ever! Who needs to go to Maine when the lobster is right here in Vegas! Lobster roll. Lobster Mac n cheese. Lobster Bloody Mary. Well rounded off meal! Fabulous and great atmosphere and friendly staff!

Get the Connecticut Roll. It's the only thing really worth having. The Truffle Roll is lobster salad with a lot of filler. The lobster Mac is bland and skimpy on the meat.  The chips and slaw that come with the roll are a good side, but a cup of chowder makes it all a good meal.

It was a mistake coming to this joint in the miracle mile. The menu looked good, it was a little bit on the pricey side, but I figure it's lobster...   Ordered the clam chowder soup, felt like it was can soup....  Ordered the lobster sub from the menu, but it's very disappointing... it was overpriced for it's small size... with the abundant choices in las vegas, I made the terrible mistake on choosing probably one of the worst "pricey" joint. the food is definitely not worth the price. will not return.. :(

I've only been here once, but wow $18 for a lobster roll.. That's Vegas for ya!  I had the El Diablo Lobster Roll which was tasty, but the portion was very small. The bread was a bit soggy from the sauce, and there wasn't much substance beyond that. I did enjoy the side of cole slaw that they served, but again not something that I would consider ordering again unless I was desperately craving lobster.  I still link lobster is a bit overrated, but my friend enjoyed it so at least we were content.

Warning up front, if you haven't had a real lobster roll in Maine, you will NOT understand the value of these rolls.  You will probably think they are too expensive and not filling.   Now for those of us who have pulled our cars over in Maine and ordered a lobster roll from the many roadside eateries, we will understand how WONDERFUL it is to find one that is so spot on and in Western US.  Let alone in the desert.  LOL  The first and foremost thing you need for one of these rolls is the bread.  I promise you, you will not find it out here.  You have to bring it in from the East Coast.  Then you need Maine lobster and Lobster ME has it ALL.  If only I could smell the Atlantic I would have been transported back to beautiful Maine and all the lovely ways they know to prepare lobster.  I have had the traditional roll and the bacon lobster roll, both were excellent.  To be honest I was not crazy about the lobster mac n cheese, but as I have said in other reviews, I make THE best lobster mac n cheese so I am biased.  Having said that, no lobster mac n cheese was left in the dish.  Lobster ME will also give you the option of having your lobster heated up before being placed on your roll.  I prefer mine cold, but if you do not like cold protein go ahead and have them heat it up for you.  Now grab a beer and savor your sandwich.  I know I will every time I'm in Vegas.  NOTE:  There is free valet parking in the garage, all you have to do is tip them.  So getting in and out of here is a breeze and won't cost you much.

So... I was at the Venetian Towers for the recent Consumer Electronics Show and ended up eating at Lobster ME every day (as did my colleagues) after I had my first Lobster roll there. In all, I had the lobster roll (4x), the lobster melt (the French with Brie), the fries, the chips, the very yummy blueberry lemonade, the slaw (ate every bit of it) and the Lobster Bisque.  Lobster Me gets a solid four stars from me. The food was consistently good even though the place was slammed because of the show. The fries and chips were crisp, the bread nicely toasted, and the bisque surprisingly good for a place that's essentially Fast Food.  The Roll at $18 seemed a little expensive and looked small, but it was overflowing with the claw meat and it comes with chips made in the store (not ripples out of a bag) and a condiment sized bit of coleslaw - just enough. Upgrading it to a combo substituting chips for fries and a Drink ($4) is a no-brainer as the drink itself is $4.  The Melt uses tail meat but seemed a bit skimp but at $10, value isn't bad... and comes with the same chips and coleslaw.   The Lobster Bisque was surprisingly tasty (again, for a fast food joint), and the lemonades were also tasty and not too sweet - the blueberry flavored lemonade was really quite yummy.  Service was excellent. I did not think I could "combo" a Melt and the register clerk informed me it was the better deal when I wanted both fries and a drink with it. They also honored the long (LONG!) expired coupon that was linked to their Yelp profile when I "checked in." Given the crowd and the noise, it was no surprise that they got an order or two mixed up, but they were cheerfully corrected.  I hope it is still there in the Venetian Towers next year!

This review is for the Lobster Me truck.  The truck has a short menu, with each item priced $12. Lobsicle, Maine roll, cajun roll, lobster mac & cheese, lobster & chips, and a couple others I don't recall. (Clam strips were on the board, crossed out.)  I had a lobsicle and lobster & chips. The dishes are very similar--both come with fries. Lobster & chips has lobster nuggets, while the lobsicle is a solid piece of meat on a skewer (a small whole tail?). The amount of meat is about the same in each dish.  The nuggets were a bit chewy but tasted good. The lobsicle was the clear winner, and came with a tub of melted butter.  I enjoyed the fries--nice crisp outside and fluffy interior, with skin on.  I'd call the portion and price reasonable for lobster. I'd eat there again.  Just wish they had salad on the truck.

I finally had the chance to stop by and check out this location of Lobster ME after hearing such good word of mouth from fellow foodies in Las Vegas.   I have to say the aroma had me excited to check out the menu items available.   We decided to try the traditional Lobster roll, Fish & Chips, Chowder fries, lobster mac & cheese and this delicious item "knuckle sandwich" omg it was so good!  We were super impressed by the flavor, everything was super tasty hot and FRESH. The staff was cool, I was not sure what to order that night and the LobsterME employee had some Awesome suggestions.   We will be back to enjoy this local location. I have visited the location in Frisco, I was hoping the consistency would be there and it was.   I am a Fan!
Oh my god. I loooove this place.  The food is to die for! My favorite is the lobsticle. So Yummy. A bit pricey but I guess it's worth it.

Quick and delicious!  The lobster roll comes with so much lobster ! Would recommend getting the mac & cheese add on. Come with a lot of mac & cheese and its great for a late night snack if you have left overs!!
The lobster tacos were a quick midday treat. Definitely better than average. The sauce, toppings, and lobster all tasted fresh and the flavor combo was great. I would eat here again for sure.

I miss the Tater tots, they need to bring that back, and lower the cost for lemonade $8 is too much.  The employees need to help with the menu instead of rushing you.    The lobster on the stick is still amazing though love it yay!

Ahhh the lobsicle !! I spotted this awesome place bc I was staying at the planet Hollywood and thank heavens I was blessed to spot this place ! I was so confused to choose from all the lobster menu but I ended up w the deep fried lobsicle and added the fries and drink for an extra $3.  They also offer free sample of lobster ice cream which I cannot resist. the ice cream wasn't too bad but when I spotted a big chunk of lobster meat in my ice cream I was kind of freaked out lol. so none the less, I threw out the ice cream. my lobsicle was absolutely delicious comes w a slice of lemon and sauce it was heavenly sent. Next time, I wanted to try the lobster spring roll and probably the whole menu! ;)

Don't be shellfish come and try this place. Even though it's a lobster place, the prices aren't too clawful, it just boils down to how much you order!  It was a gem to stumble upon on our day drunken roaming adventures in The Venetian. I get mad drunchies so when I smelled this place and saw a sign for lobster I had to stop by.  It's clean, the decor is pretty regular, but open to The Venetian's walk way. It seems like a poppin' spot, 'cause who doesn't like peasant food? (Lobsters used to be peasant food, the more you know) So seating can be kind of difficult to snag.  The employees are friendly, our cashier person hurt his leg so he was on crutches, but he that didn't stop him from being quick and smoothly maneuvering around.  We got the lobster chowder and the chowder fries. The chowder is delicious. Hot and flavorful with small bits of lobster, and a nice helping of potatoes and whatever the other ingredients were. Chowder fries were just fries drenched in their chowder, so really just order either one. I'd pick the soup.  It was a nice place to get a quick bite and just order a little, the cost wont be so bad.

Had the $6 Mac and cheese sans lobster and it was amazing. Service is quick and employees are nice. No hassle when we asked them to refill our (non-alcoholic) drinks before we left.   Friend raves about the lobsicle.   Definitely give it a try if you're at the Miracle Mile!
Lobster mac n cheese was over cooked .. but.. the maine n the Cajun including the lobsicle.. WAS ALL BOMB. . I ENJOYED IT TO THE FULLEST. .
Really nice little place in the middle of Venetian shops. We had lobster roll, lobster grilled cheese and lobstickle. Everything was delicious and fresh!

Grabbed a quick bite just before the next show....don't want to be too full so I suggested that we choose the lobster taco. The lobster claw piece that I tasted was very fresh and delicious! It came with some coleslaw which wasn't dripping with sauce so that's good! The chips were freshly made and not oily. Fast service and we could go!

Lobster me is located inside of planet Hollywood next to Fat Tuesday. I've always liked coming here whenever I'm in vegas. I always order a lobster bisque in a bread bowl with Cajun fries. I came back recently and the food wasn't as good as how it used to be. Prices are ridiculously over priced in my opinion for such a small amount. I ordered crab fries to munch on, and they came out cold... that threw me off because it's supposed to come out hot. No one likes their food warm/cold. And those fries were $10 too!! Ugh so frustrating. Oh yeah, seating is very very limited. There's not that much space and tables get taken up pretty quickly. I used to really love this place, I don't know what happened

Food: Lobster meat was a bit cold and heavily seasoned. Overpriced for small portion. Definitely more of a lunch or snack spot than dinner.   Physical location: dark lighting, limited seating, super casual environment - reminds me of a mall food court.

Got the Connecticut style lobster roll (warm lobster with butter), $17  The lobster still had a bit of that fishy smell to it so it probably isn't super fresh. They are very generous with the lobster meat but I don't think it was actually "one pound in every roll" as advertised.   However, the taste and amount you get for the price is actually quite decent. A touch of lemon juice is just what it needs and the bread is delicious and really wraps the flavors altogether nicely.  The cole slaw that comes with it is delicious and made me wish I could order more of it as a side. The chips are meh. Bumped up to 4 stars for quick and friendly service. Despite the giant lines from CES they were able to handle it and get people's orders out in a reasonable amount of time.

So disappointed in the lobster mac and cheese :c  The shells were literally tasteless. No flavor at all. No cheesey flavor.  The texture felt like is was reheated leftovers and the shells were mushy and easily broken.  The lobster is claw meat and didn't taste fresh. Don't recommend. I feel ripped off. I look at other peoples pictures of the same food, and mine looked nothing like it.

I had been craving a lobster roll, so I came here  for my birthday meal. It was amazing! Everything was so fresh and tasty. I had the lobster roll with waffle fries, and I really enjoyed it. The portion wasn't very large, but it was enough to fill me up.

it is a high price fast food place. i got the lobster roll for 16 bucks and add 4 dollars for a drink and lobster bisque. the lobster roll was crisp bun and warm which is how i like it. they used one whole lobster for this lobster roll. the diablo habenero sauce in this roll really kicked it up and the slaw inside gave the whole roll witha different texture in each bite. i do recommend  this place.   the lobster tacos which i got for 16 bucks was not good. the tortilla was cold and was not hot.it was kinda dry too. although  the ingredients inside the lobster tacos were very fresh light crisp good with the squeezed of lime wedge. and the salsa picante.   i did spend like 42 bucks  for 2 lobster tacos and one lobster roll and one lobster bisque and a soda for 2 and it wasnt too filling where we couldnt move. its a light dinner but good experience  to try if you never tried this place. most likely i wont come back for it.

Oh Lobsta, Lobsta, Lobsta!    I do luv all things crustacean so you didn't have to drag me here for a lobster roll.  I've actually had some off the food trucks in Cali and really enjoyed them.  So I was eager to try the one's here.   Combo Lobster roll with Garlic Tater Tots ~ http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lobster-me-las-vegas#2Lng3Y1DRRiTZgwO36aW_A  They offer 2 sizes medium or large.  I went with a medium and I have to say it had a decent amount of lobster meat in it.  The roll was buttered and grilled up on both sides.  It was perfect meat to bread ratio.  I went with the original flavor with a touch of mayo and lemon.  The menu only listed garlic fries but I like tots so I asked for switch-a-roo and asked for my tots to be married with garlic.  Here is my close up of the lobster seconds before it was consumed http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lobster-me-las-vegas#yWfRR2jZGPrkV1wMVUNebQ  Ladies there is no pretty way of eating these so just shove it in your mouth and enjoy!  Worry about the mess later LOL!  It can get pretty pricey depending on what you order.  In the end it is lobster meat that your getting.   Eyes ~ Oh Lobster Meeeeeee! Nose ~ I smell a hint of garlic from my tots!. Ear ~ Peeps walking by. Mouth ~ So very very good!. Tummy ~ Satisfied!

So this lobster shack/counter is located in a part of Miracle Mile Mall. This little gem is full of magical goodness for your mouth. The fried lobsicle is a fried lobster tail on a stick, served with a side of drawn butter. When you pour the butter over the tail it melts in your mouth. I had to eat and run the first night, but it was so delicious that we had to come back on our last night. I ordered the crab loaded fries, which come with waffle fries, crab meat, lobster meat, green onions, and drizzled with ranch. Smh. I can't describe how great these combinations of flavors made my heart sing!! Aaaaaahhhhhhh. We were a party of 11 and everyone ordered different things on the menu. EVERYTHING was great. I wish they would open a location in NYC!!! (Hint, hint)! The staff is amazing and very hospitable. Keep up the great work!
Best bang for you buck! Lobster grill cheese, and get your fries changed to loaded lobster fries and your food to go!

I came here at a prime time for dinner at 7:30 PM to order the popular Mac n Cheese and was told they were sold out! I wanted to give this place a chance so I ordered their other popular item, the Lobster Roll. I'm a seafood lover and I could not taste what was so special about the lobster roll. I doubt I will pay $17 for one single item at a fast food counter again. I would rather spend that kind of money on an entree at a full-service restaurant.

I went to Lobster Me last night.  My only complaint was the wait in line was pretty long but it was not the registers fault!  I think it was just a popular place!  I ordered the Maine lobster roll and paid three dollars extra for fries and a drink.  The cashier was super friendly!  He gave me a number and I put it on my table.  He immediately brought out my diet pepsi.  I felt badly I left without it but he didn't complain at all.  He was friendly to everyone!  After a bit my lobster roll came out.  It had some spices on top of the lobster, a smidgen of mayonnaise at the bottom of the roll, and the roll was exactly what I'd want in a roll- toasty with a little texture and still spongey.  I did wish the mayonnaise was spread out on the roll instead of all sitting in a glob in the bottom.  I ended up picking off parts of the mayonnaise globs since it was just all in the bottom it looked gross and I figured why eat it?  Then I had fries.  lol.  The fries seemed beer battered and I loved them.  I do not usually eat fries but I was treating myself.  A little bonus was my meal came with a touch of cole slaw.  The cole slaw was not too creamy or heavy- it was crisp and seemed very fresh.  The mayonnaise truly would be my only complaint about this place.  Service really was excellent and stood out at this place.  Just what I expect at the Venetian!

Having never been to Maine, this is THE best lobster roll I've ever had. My friends and I go here every time...and I mean EVERY time...we are in Vegas. Sometimes more than once in a week. I've tried the butter, the mayo and the diablo. The straight lobster and butter is my fave. They'll even warm it up if you ask.  I've tried some of there other menu items but nothing is as good as that lobster roll. It also gets bonus points for being right next to Fat Tuesday. You really can't lose with this one.

The food was great. I had a lobster salad. The lobster tasted fresh. My husband had a lobster roll and really enjoyed it. I also tried the lobster mary. I wasn't too fond of it, but everything else was great!

Love their garlic fries and cajun seasoning. They use actual garlic and peppers instead of something out of a shakers. My dining companions loved the deep fried lobster. Great place to try out while shopping

Decent food with high prices (even high for Vegas).  Lobster Me was known for their lobster ice cream.  They don't have it anymore.  They are also known for their lobster rolls.  The lobster was a decent portion but it wasn't sweet nor was it very tasty.  There is almost no seating and the little seating there is, you have to battle the "Bro's" that are at Fat Tuesday.    I'd give it more stars if it weren't so darn expensive.  I mean it wasn't BAD, it just wasn't really good and worth the price.

Pretty good spot! I like this is a bit better than the one in Planet Hollywood! I got the Cajon lobster roll, expensive at $19 dollars + you can add fries and a drink so $4 bucks more so $25 dollars for a complete meal with cold slaw.  This one also had the lobster melt which i don't believe the PH location has. You do get a good amount of meat. I would visit again when i'm in town! Good stuff here..

I thought it was pretty good! I have the Cajon lobster roll with fires and cold slaw! It had a lot of lobster meat inside and seasoned nicely! I would for sure go back again! I want to try the Connecticut one next! It is pretty expensive, I think a roll, fries, cold slaw and soda came out to $25 bucks but hey, I haven't had one in 6 months! There is also one in the venetian while this is in planet Hollywood!
Cajun lobster roll was just okay for me, didn't seemed like I ate a whole lobster. Although it was served on a sweet bun which brought out the flavor. For about $20, probably pass.
I'm keeping this review short and sweet because it'll mirror the size of their lobster roll.   Tasted good.  Small roll.  Tease.  It was an $18 snack.

Not even One stat deserves this place !  i'm so annoyed for the fact they changed the size of the sandwich here ! Spend $23 for a lobster meal with literally 10 pieces of cajun fries that were like $4 plus a TWO FUCKING INCE LITERALLY LOBSTER SANDwich! I remember 2 years ago they use to be about 6 inches !   DON't WASTE YOUR TIME AT THIS EXPENSIVE, HYPED OUT, PLACE! They rob you for your money.   Never will i go again! I even recommended my friends for the fact last time we went it was good now its just shit

The food was decent, had better lobster stuff elsewhere for the same price honestly.  Had the Lobster and Chips... They should consider using actual English type chips (steak fries) instead of french fries.  Also had the lobster mac n cheese; kind of bland honestly.  They gave me a free tasting of the lobster ice cream and that was interesting, but probably would never order a full scoop.  All in all it's decent food, but for the same amount of money I rather eat elsewhere...

I wanted to dine here on my previous trips as this restaurant is right next door to Fat Tuesday. However, for some reason or the other I never did. Oh well, turns out I was not missing anything.   So, I ordered 2 different Lobster sandwich's.  Total with tax came to ~ $21  Pros: None.  Cons: Forgettable meal. I did not even taste much Lobster in the sandwich(-1) 2 Sandwich's were not enough. Not filling at all (-1) Expensive. Probably $2.00-$3.00 more than what I would pay for, even at Vegas. (-1) Employee yelled my name, and I proceeded to the counter for pick up. At that point, she was too busy counting her tips for the night instead of turning around and handing me the packaged order. Not good. (-1)

The fish and chips are horrible. Like other reviewers the order is 3 small pieces. tartar sauce is provided in a packet like ketchup.     The chips or fries were the only saving grace. Crispy and hot. Had clam chowder with the meal watery not that great. Didn't try the lobster roll maybe should've but figured fish/seafood would've been in their roundhouse. Seating was comfortable but this place pass

I've been drooling over Lobster ME posts that I've seen on Instagram for awhile now and finally got a chance to eat here when I stayed at the Venetian for a girls trip. Unfortunately my ass was slightly hungover so I couldn't even finish what I ordered, but all the items were delicious! I started with the lobster bisque which came with chunks of lobster. I really enjoyed the flavor and it definitely made me feel better. I also got the chowder fries to share with everyone and those were tasty. Crisscut fries are always appreciated and the presentation was definitely IG worthy. I'm hella mad I couldn't finish it! I'm also mad that I didn't have the appetite for one of the lobster rolls or grilled cheese sandwiches. Now I have to go back!
Lobster was so fresh! One of the most delicious sandwiches I've ever had! I'd recommend the lobster roll and lobster bisque. Lobster ice cream was so creamy with lobster bits. I'd definitely go back.
The main lobster roll with butter and chives was amazing! The waffle fries were seasoned with a spice that was good. I would recommend it to anyone.
The lobster melt was great and surprisingly cheap! If you are in the area I recommend their lobster roll as well.

OMG!!! THIS IS THE BEST "FAST FOOD" TYPE LOBSTER BAR EVER!  There are so many choices that include lobster! Lobster mac and cheese, lobster grilled cheese, lobster rolls, lobster bisque, lobster tail on a stick!, etc... I was in heaven.   It was a tiny bit pricey but honestly what isn't overpriced in Vegas?   WORTH EVERY PENNY!

Lobster Me is a fast casual joint with mediocre lobster rolls and McDonalds level service. We had two types of rolls with fries and bottled water to drink and spent about $45 for lunch. Both rolls were small, the warm one with butter had a fake butter flavor and the cold one was over peppered. We were not impressed, which was disappointing as we likely would have eaten here several more times during our 4 day stay.
Great lobster roll. It reminded me of New England. Closer and easier to get another one.

I got the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was pretty good. The pieces of lobster were on the top and the cheese was very thick. It was somewhat of a small portion size alone but you can make it a combo to get fries or soup.  I got my order to go and on a Sunday afternoon for lunch the wait was about 5 minutes to get my food.  Good lobster but I probably wouldn't get the Mac and cheese again if I go back.
XL lobster roll 23 bucks! It didnt taste fresh ( Frozen), and had to much Mayo.   Although I really did like the Hot dog roll that was drenched in Butter and toasted to Perfection!

The lobstericle was $15 and it was good, nice size piece on lobster tail. I had to wait 20 mins for it because they ran out, the cashier came to me and said they were cracking fresh tails in the back. Besides the wait at least it was fresh. They gave me complimentary soda and salt n vinegar fries which were good as well.
Tried the Lobster Mac & Cheese and it was very good.  Not a lot of seating here and bottled water was $5, eek!

My lobster was a little overcooked, prices are a little high, and the side of coleslaw was pathetically small. But the food was good (I had a beltway), and it was a nice treat to have a fat lobster roll, so far from maine.

When I saw this place, I got excited. I live in SoCal and the only time I can get my hands on lobster rolls is when the Cousins Maine Lobster Truck or the Lobsta Truck are in my city.  I ended up buying a lobster roll with a soup, and it came out to $28. By being that pricey, I thought it better be good (especially since lobster rolls from the lobster trucks are $12-$13). So I finally take a bite and I was surprisingly disappointed. I love me my lobster rolls, but this just didn't meet my expectations.  Sorry, but if this were a food truck, I wouldn't follow.

Pretty good lobster Cajun rolls. The roll was pretty small. More like a snack to me. It comes with potato chips and cole slaw. The lobster bisque bowl was big and good but lacking lobster pieces! Not sure I will come back as its pricy.

LOBSTER ICECREAM!!!  is the reason i bookmarked this place. i was excited cuz i was staying at planet hollywood. as i did research, reviews were lukewarm. I tried the lobster icecream and it was ok. I'd rather spend my $ at Earls. if ur a lobster freak, it's worth a looksie as they have many items like lobster grilled cheese, with waffles, lobster rolls- which are $22 for the large ones.  vibe of this place is food court
Lobster Mary was disappointing. Smallest stick of celery over ever seen, not a bloody Mary. Keep walking not worth the novelty.
What an excellent restaurant !   Incredible service and exceptional food!  I would highly recommend and kudos to Kevin Findlay as manager

After passing by this spot numerous times while getting a Fat Tuesday, I finally gave it a shot.   I ordered the Connecticut. Total came to nearly $18! (But then again it's Vegas) For that price my expectations were somewhat high.  I encountered a pretty long waiting time for ordering and getting my food. The roll was really good! Not salty and doused in butter like I expected and the toasted bread was perfect. The size disappointed me, wasn't even the size of a 6 inch subway sandwich.  Worth my money?   Not quite. Not enough to fill you up, not mouth-watering enough to make you feel like your money was worth it. With Earl of Sandwich just around the corner I'd rather go there and get an entire meal for less than one sandwich at this spot.  Definitely not a bang for buck spot but if money is not an issue I would come back.  If I do come back I want to try the Mac N Cheese and lobster on a stick.
Ordered signature lobster roll, I dun like it as it is very dry.

This will go down as one of the best splurges ever in our many years of food exploits. I was so curious about trying the lobster roll ever since we noticed this place opening last year (never had one! seen them on the food channel on DDD though, so was familiar). Enter last friday when I was entertaining the idea of places to check out this weekend. I had my mind set on this place. I kept talking to my husband about it and we had a nice build up. I was hoping to have it yesterday, except we had spent some time on the east side with my in-laws (translation: we were out all day), that we decided it would be today. Yes, finally, today. Can you feel my anticipation?   Lunch was relatively empty for a sunday though there were lots of characters passing by (the people watching). There are about 16 tables about five feet away from the restaurant. You order and pay at the window. Ok, a short feeling of sticker shock, over $50 for two combos, the XL Lobster Roll, fries, and a drink. I inquired about the Lobster Ice Cream and the cashier gave us each a sample. Nice surprise, because we didn't ask, but that was nice of her. It was different (not that bad, actually, though my husband made a face suggesting he didn't like it), and now we can say we've tried it! A short wait later, another nice lady delivers the food to us, and what a picture! The nice server brought us lots of ketchup, napkins, and plastic utensils. She also cleaned up when we were leaving.    The lobster meat (claws and knuckles) on both sandwiches was very generous, and the mayo was light and the seasonings were just right. The bread was lightly buttered and was toasted enough for a light amount of crustiness. (I hate when the bread is soft and gets squashed up.) Also, the bread was not heavy, making the lobster the main attraction (as it should be!). It was the perfect balance. The lobster meat was sweet and fresh tasting (no smelly fish smells here), there wasn't a whole lot of mayo (hate when it's mayo overload, gross), it was delicious!!! Usually, I eat pretty fast, but I went really slow, because I wanted to savor it. In fact, my husband finished his sandwich before I did. I got a few small pieces of shell, but it really wasn't a big deal. The fries were skin-on, thinly sliced steak fries, seasoned, and crisp. The fries were flavorful, but the portion was very generous, so I didn't finish it. Drinks are free refills until 11 pm.   We both really enjoyed it. It's such a nice thing when a place lives up to your expectations. Yes, it's not cheap, but it's lobster from Maine, people! And yes, people passing by will stop and stare at your food, but who cares, I was so into the food, I wasn't even noticing them. I was so happy to have finally had a Lobster Roll, it was food bliss. It is worth the $$$. Take a to-go menu (no prices) and plan the next meal here. Afterward, some walking around the mall was in order, as we were both satisfied, and fully nourished.

I was so excited to try this place after seeing all the photos. The reviews were mixed so I wasn't sure how I would like it. But if it has to do with lobster, I will definitely try it.   Its located in the middle of the Miracle Mile Shops. The staff was friendly and helpful. The prices were high to me, in relation to how you could pay the same amount and go to a buffet with tons of seafood.   I must say I was disappointed with my meal. I chose a large original lobster roll with fries and a drink which was $21.62.   I love fries but not these.  The fries tasted more like fried batter than anything else. I opted for the original Maine style lobster roll  which is lobster served with a touch of mayo, lemon and secret spice blend on a 6 in New England style split top bun. The lobster was tasteless to me. I couldn't taste any flavor, not even the mayo. It just tasted like lumps of cold lobster and to me, lobster has to have some sauce or of course butter to enhance the flavor.   Maybe I just didn't try the right dish, who knows. Unfortunately for this place, service doesn't keep me going back to a place (it does help of course) but the product itself does.   I satisfied my curiosity but not my tummy.
Taste buds dancin' after a savory Connecticut style lobster roll. Generous portion, delicious flavor, reasonable price. Couldn't ask for more than that!
I had the original lobster roll, my husband had the lobster grilled cheese, both delicious. Great option if you are in Vegas and looking for a quick bite for lunch.

Not for the faint of heart. If you plan to make this your meal get ready to pony up. Because in a pinpanpun your order gets over $30. I order two plates w soda and got lucky $42 but it is not like I lunch and dine at place everyday and I HAD to experience it :)  If you want to taste lobster by all means get the lobsicle see picture. Small grilled or battered small lobster tail that tastes great and fresh.  The lobster mini tacos were great tasting too but I could taste the lobster if I looked for that bite. So it is a good plate but doesn't scream lobster flavor.  Service was quick and friendly. Place is inside miracle mile shopping plaza next to Fat Tuesday drinks. For sure it is enjoyable place good food people watching afterwards and then stroll window shopping. Nice to get off the Vegas Sun and heat.

Lobster!! Who doesn't love lobster?! This is my second time coming here!   I have tried the Cajun, old bay, and Maine style. They were all really good! It comes on a toast-like bread. Its super buttery and flavorful. I wish it came on a bigger bread because I felt like I was eating 2 bites of lobster and 1 bite of sandwich. I need that balance....They definitely don't skimp on the lobster since you're paying $19 for each lobster roll. But when you have that lobster craving...$19 is totally worth it! Each lobster roll comes with some cole slaw and some chips. I have also had the fries and clam chowder. I think the lobster roll is good already. The fries and the clam chowder was just a side dish that isn't all that great.  Next time I will definitely try the lobsticle (fried lobster on a stick)

Ok it wasn't great but it wasn't all bad either. I had the Connecticut roll with Cajun fries. The roll itself I have definitely had better, it was lacking that warm buttery flavor. The good thing is that it was stuffed with plenty of lobster. The Cajun fries were pretty good. Customer service was great, nice and friendly and very helpful. I might give them another chance and maybe try Mac and cheese or grilled cheese next time I'm in Vegas, maybe they can redeem themselves.

This place is delicious. We got the XL original lobster roll. big enough to share. LOTS of lobster meat with 2 huge claws piled on top. The lobster is fresh and delicious.  Lobster bisque is delicious too in a sourdough bread bowl.  Oh and the lobster mac n cheese is to die for...!  Everything is fresh and delicious! Yes, a little pricey, but the quality is worth it. Good portions too

Worth trying! Short lines and good service.   The chowder fries $7 and lobster melt $10 were really tasty.   Lobster roll $18 (beltway) was okay, the lobster had no flavor. The lobster bisque was bad, it tasted like it had been sitting all day and too sweet.
Great food . Great customer service . I will be back ! My favorite part was the crushed ice and the speedy service ! I will be back when I am in town !

I'm writing a review after a second visit to this location.   My first visit to this spot was quite some time ago and I absolutely fell in love with the MAINE roll. Soft rolls and a heaping serving of shredded lobster and a large chunk of a whole single claw I believe. I also ordered the lobster bisque which was to-die-for. Creamy and warm and not too spicy.  My last visit to this spot was just the other day to meet a family member. So I ordered the Maine Roll once again. My boyfriend ordered the Lobster and Chips. We got our order and were SO DISAPPOINTED! I'd received a sad little sandwich. The meat was at least filling. BUT, I advise my average meals are child-size servings, so this was okay for ME but definitely not for the average person. The food was good but I honestly was still starving. My boyfriend Lobster and Chips WERE PATHETIC. I'd never seen a serving of fries look this sad. It looked like they threw 10 fries into the box and maybe 4 SMALL pieces of lobster tots. SUCH a waste of money. I've seen tapas plates more plentiful than this.  Overall, I will NEVER re-order again. The food was good but I spent $32 on 2 items and was not satisfied. I am always willing to spend on quality over quantity, but these items did not make rank.
Freaking awesome.  We went 3 days in a row and everything we tried was delicious,  the manager she is short and blond was so nice and genuine.  5 stars  for me

My friend told me about this place, so as we were staying in Planet Hollywood, I had to try it out! I had the Beltway lobster roll and it was delicious!  The brioche bun was toasted perfectly and the lobster topped with butter-toasted panko crumbs really hit the spot.  The lobster roll doesn't seem that big when it comes out, but it's more than enough to fill up one person, especially if you order fries as well.  My friend ordered the lobster fries and I have to say that was disappointing.  The sauce was ok and overall the fries were just soggy and not that great.  Stick to the lobster rolls if you try out this place.  Also, it's right next to a Fat Tuesday, so there's that!

Great little place to stop for lunch or a quick/casual dinner. Lobster rolls have about 5-6oz of tail and claw meat and the lobster was fresh. My son had the fish and chips, fish was cod and fries were fresh. I had the lobster/ shrimp cheveche it was okay but they mix it with mango and it made it a little to fruity. Overall the meals was good but a little pricy for a food court type meal. Good lunch spot or quick snack!
The lobster is good. Everything  else is just okay and the portions are pretty small. You'll still be hungry afterwards and it isn't cheap. I expected more for the money.
Really delicious food. How'd of thunk that you can get some great lobster from a 'fast food' joint. Wish they had one in the Chicago area.

Inside the Planet Hollywood!  Lobster on a stick...what could be better? However i am not a fried food lover...also it looked more like larger shrimp than a lobster tail. $14.95 for one piece...i can do without =/

Had the Lobster Mac & Cheese. They should have called it Mac & Cheese with some Lobster. Although it was nice and cheesy, it took away from the little pieces of Lobster.  Was expecting better. Should have tried the Lobstercicle or Lobster roll instead.

Hubby was very excited to find out Lobster Me had opened but he didn't stay happy long. The original Maine roll at 17.00 was about the going rate he said but nowhere near the quality of a Fords Fish Shack. Fords would have never served overcooked lobster! I got fish and chips and at 12.00 it has to be the biggest ripoff on the menu. I got a vat of fries and 3 rectangles of fish that were about the size of the Trident brand fish sticks in the grocery frozen section, I got mine with ranch instead of tartar sauce but their ranch was not good. I was happy to try something new but I liked this spot better when the coffee bean and tea leaf was still there. We most definitely won't be returning.

Went back to Lobster Me today and had the Maine style and the Old Bay. This experience did not disappoint. Both rolls were just as I had remembered as the Lobster really popped and was prepared wonderfully this time. The Maine style had  celery, chives and a small  amount of mayo on a wonderful soft roll. Very generous portion of lobster. The Old Bay roll had shallots, chives , mayo, and seasoning with buttery Panko bread crumbs, again with a generous portion of lobster.   My favorite was the Old Bay, and the mixture of the panko, butter, and shallots really made this roll for me. Absolute purists should try the Original Maine Style if it it their first time, and then branch out to try the others. Washed it down with a refreshing blueberry lemonade, although there were several beer selections if you chose to partake.  A shout out to the staff and very helpful manager, Jessica at this location for guiding us thru the menu and providing friendly and helpful service.
Lecker Lobster. Kleine Portionen, große Preise. War es das wert? Ja. Wieder hin? Vielleicht.

A heavenly experience. Lobster Me is a true gem tucked away amongst the shops of the Venetian--a must try when in Vegas!  The steep prices here (given that it's a food court-style place) is the only downside, but trust me, you'll be happy you paid the $17 for your roll!  Would recommend:  1. Connecticut lobster roll (the only warm sandwich on the menu) which is stuffed with a generous serving of delicious lobster on a soft, buttery bun.   2. Lobster mac and cheese   3. Cajun fries
Got one of the lobster roll here. Comes with Cole slaw and chips. It was delicious. Definitely would come back to try their lobster Bloody Mary. My cousin got the lobsicle it looked good!

Fast food lobster...only in America.  When I saw this and also realized I would be staying at the Venetian on my recent trip to Vegas, I knew I had to try it.  So random for it to be hidden away in this food court...almost too hidden. And while it's supposed to be fast food, the prices said "Vegas"; $32 for a lunch for 2! And that is without alcohol!  I had the lobster tacos...they were decent and flavourful. My friend had the lobster and chips - in fairness, the server did warn that there were only 4 chunks of lobster - but seriously? For $13?   Overall I am happy to have tried it! But I'm the next trip to Vegas it is likely not worth a repeat.

If you like Lobster, you will like this spot. Very unique foods all with lobster twists. Sort of pricey, but hey its lobster. Definitely worth a try. Had the lobster sandwich and it was pretty good. Next time I will try the other dishes.

Why the less than subpar reviews?   I loved everything I got! We got the lobster mac and cheese, lobster shooter and the lobster roll ($20). All of this totaled up to be around 40 bucks, but we were so pleased when the meal came to our table. They serve hunky chunks of lobster in each order, but my favorite had to be the roll because of the mountain of savory lobster inserted into two buttery toast buns! Get's me so excited!   Great shopping area and quality food in a to-go setting. I'm a fan!

I see why this place has mostly 3 stars. I ordered the Connecticut roll. It was a small sandwich with a lot of meat. But it was just lobster on bread. Not the buttery taste that I was looking for. I also feel like the price is Steep for what you get. I also tried the lobster chowder which was very watery. The Cajun roll was spicy but ok. Definitely not somewhere that I have to come back to.

Always like stopping in here especially when staying at Hilton Elara as it's so convenient. Nice selection of lobster-based and fresh seafood choices. Tasty drinks, great spot for people-watching in middle of Miracle Mile Shops. A little pricey but hey it's Vegas !

It was okay, but I've been spoiled by the overabundance of really good lobster in all forms in Maine. This place pales in comparison to even 3 Buoys, the least good lobster I've ever had in all of Maine. It scratched an itch for lobster when we weren't able to get rezos for the Sterling Buffet, but from now on I'll stick to Red Lobster when I'm not in the northeast.  The Connecticut lobster roll isn't on the board anymore but they took our order for it without batting an eyelash. The online menu says the lobsicle is tempura'd, but it's just lightly battered and fried. The lobsicle was better than the roll, but as the county fair will teach you, anything is tastier deep fried on a stick. Made me think of the Will It Deep Fry? series on YouTube.

We love Lobster, what can I say?  I mean our room is literally only less than 5 minutes away and walking past this place often.....I mean we were bound for a visit sometime!    So finally, we came to visit during the breakfast hour and ordered the crab loaded fries!! Say with me, "awesome." Say with me again, "awesome" but this time rub your tummy!  We really enjoyed this dish!  It was actually a morning snack for us but we shared it and it was great!  What I loved most about this is the hot crunchiness of the waffle fries bathing in the lobster cream sauce.  The chunks of lobster with scallions and bacon just adds an extra special something.  Keeping the sauce on the bottom of this dish was a very smart choice; it keeps the fries crunchy!  We will definitely come back for another visit; wait a minute, we did come back for a second visit!  We even ordered the same dish!  You will definitely need to visit sometime!

Holy LOBSTER!!! Could it be i'm falling in love!!bive never been so excited about food!  Lobster ME is located in the Food Court. We couldn't find it at first....The Venetian is Huge!! I order the Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac & Cheese with a water. Yes!! Total Fat Kid! There's NO Way I was going to pass up this opportunity! I payed about $38 bucks for everything.   The Lobster Roll wasn't huge, but it's packed with meat. The roll is toasted with a butter flavor, Comes with kettle chips---which I didn't care for. My lobster Mac & Cheese was amazing! I love, love, love this place!!!   I went to TAO beach club with Lobster Gutt!!! No shame folks, no shame!! I wish I would've visited Lobster ME before leaving town. I shall return next summer! I may order a sandwich ToGo.... I also heard the Grill cheese is good.

Good place for a quick Lobster craving fix! I ordered the sliders which had lobster on one and shrimp on the other, both good and it was mixed with their cole slaw which is soo yummy and refreshing. There steak fries are also delicious and crispy.  My sliders didn't have that much lobster or shrimp but if you order the original lobster roll they stuff that sandwich with lobsters. One of the girls ordered the Mac and cheese lobster sandwich and she said it was tasty!   Good place for a quick delish bite. They have alcohol and a Bloody Mary special that they put a lobster claw meat in there as well.

I had the Connecticut style lobster roll with the chips and coleslaw. I couldn't believe how much lobster was on the roll and the taste was very fresh. I'm still dreaming of the fresh lobster in butter on the toasted bun. The coleslaw and chips were my last concern, but also very good. The price seemed fair for the amount of lobster on the roll.

Took the family out to check this place out after a good review in a local magazine. I have to say without a doubt this is now one of two reasons for me to hit the strip. The service we got from the staff was pleasant and they answered all of our questions. The wife had the grilled cheese and our soon had the Mac and cheese. As mentioned in previous reviews the Mac and cheese isn't out of a box. It was fresh, hot, and they didn't skimp on the lobster. The grilled cheese was warm and plenty gooey with plenty of lobster as well. I went with the regular size lobster roll combo that included fries and a drink. I most say I was a little surprised at the size of the roll for the price, but the amount of lobster in the salad and the claw meat on top more than made up for it. It was so good that I ordered a second roll.   For me the only negatives is that you share a common area with the bar next door selling those touristy size drinks in those goofy cups. The music that they had on in that bar wasn't something I wanted to listen to. Also the restrooms are a far away and the distance is off putting for us dining with a younger child who needed to use it.

Every time I've been to Vegas, I have always wanted to try this place. I am a huge seafood fan especially lobster and seeing their poster "Lobster Ice Cream" definitely enticed me. NOT because of the lobster flavored ice cream but the idea that they were serving everything-lobster.   We were so desperate to figure out something to eat really quickly that wasn't fast food so this place was going to do the job. EH. Honestly BIG BIG waste of money! I got a Lobster Salad which was $15...I expected something bomb. When the salad came out it was literally the size of a fast food salad you can get from like Carl's Jr or something. The only good thing about it was, yes, their big pieces of lobster. Other than that this was not worth it!   The people working were nice though. Their lobster rolls sounded good but after looking at the photos....all they do is drench mayo all over the lobster? gross.   Never eating here again! Not worth it.

Came here to visit Sin City with Hubster last month and wandered around aimlessly at the Miracle Mile shops on our first day trying to find something different for lunch, and came across this place.  We shared a lobster roll and it was worth the $23, except that they need to drizzle some hot drawn butter because it was a bit on the dry side.  If you're feeling a bit bold, feel free to try their lobster ice cream!  I really wished that I had the chance to try their lobster bisque in a bread bowl.  Highly recommend this place whenever you happen to be in town!

I love myself a good lobster roll and Lobster Me have been a place I wanna check out for sometime now. We order the 2 combos one Cajun Lobster Roll Combo with Clam Chowder and fish taco combo with a side of chowder fries.   For $18 a combo it's pretty pricey which I wouldn't mind if the food was good. At best it was decent.   Nothing special about the lobster roll I had or the water down clam chowder. Fish taco was suppose to be fried but it didn't taste crunchy at all. I was very disappointed with our lunch.   It was said to be the best Lobster Roll in U.S   Not true, this is the worst Lobster Roll and clam chowder I have ever had. Even chowder in a can taste 10 times better then their water down chowder they serve.   The only reason why they got 2 stars was because the server was very friendly and they give you free refill drink.    Btw, if you yelp, hashtag, or Facebook they'll give you a free drink!

It was nice to see a place within the Venetian where I can get a quick bite without having to be waited on and still be able to enjoy good seafood.   Tried the Cajun lobster roll and it was loaded with lobster meat and a Cajun aioli sauce which was not at all spicy. Also ordered a cup of NE clam chowder and an apple cider. The clam chowder was just okay - not as creamy as I would have liked it and a bit lacking in clams and potatoes in the chowder. However, the refreshing apple cider helped to end the meal in a more or less positive note.

Did a pit stop here while in Vegas as we wandered around and "got lost", and got distracted by this "LOBSTER ME" sign on our way to Earls...  Came back after purchasing three sandwiches at Earls, and pondered over what we wanted to get. We decided to settle for the lobster mac n cheese, which came out to almost double digits! Holy ish, as a broke ass college student, I definitely was NOT liking the way this little side was coming out to be so far.... that's EXPENSIVE. You better give me a pound of this lobster mac n cheese, or have a shat-ton of lobster in this mac n cheese if you're charging $9 for this. And then I start dreaming.... and I think of the time I had some BOMBDIGGYDANGDIGGYDANGDEDANGDIGGY lobster mac n cheese at Capitol Grille at South Coast Plaza in Costa Mesa, CA... and how their $15 lobster mac and cheese side was SO WORTH EVERY DAMN PENNY after eating it... and that was litterally what I was expecting, but hopefully, better.  What came to us, however, was a little lacking. We found very few lobster pieces, the serving was puny at best (as with everything else on Vegas' strip, super expensive!), and it was dunked in oil, oil, and uh, more oil. I kid you not. Now, don't get me wrong, the flavoring of the mac n cheese, I felt that it was pretty good... in fact, I probably would have given them 3 stars in my review since I loved the sharpness of the cheddar and how it cut into the well cooked, super soft macaroni... however... the price of what we paid vs what we got + the next day, when I heated this up, the amount of GREASE that came out (OMG, artery clogging!) + the pathetic amount of lobsters in this serving of lobster mac n cheese? Not the best impression.  For me, personally, Lobster Me became a place that I would try just to say I've eaten there before, but if I were to do some real grubbing? Ehhhh, not so much.

Other than the price being ridiculous, this place is pretty good.   The lobsicle which I got battered and fried was very juicy and succulent. Would only suggest that they use a different type of breading if possible.   Also got the truffle lobster roll. Again was really good and flavors were on point.   Good service from the cashiers on multiple requests.
food was very good, very fresh, very tasty, however the portions are very small for the price.  you may want to ask to see the role size to see if the portion will be big enough for your meal.

A great lobster roll, even though it's served warm, not cold. So damned good we almost went back there a second time, even with all the culinary choices we had in all of Las Vegas. If you love lobster, this is a must stop.

Stayed at the Elara. Saw this the last time I visited Vegas but was pregnant so couldn't have lobster. So when I came back after baby, I went stir crazy buying lobstericle, lobster sandwich, and lobster mac and cheese, about $45. All of it was great with the right amount of lobster. The sandwhich was like a 4 inch, so kinda small, but really tasty. Was in Vegas for 7 days and only went once. Was a case of been there, done that. Recommend at least once. 4 stars for uniqueness, tasty food, and location. Missing 1 star because pricey for what you get.

This place is located at the Miracle Mile Shop in Planet Hollywood.  I came here cause my friend recommended.  Everything with lobster? COOL!  My coworkers and I almost ordered the entire menu.  Sadly, to say the everything was OKAY.  Nothing stood out to be spectacular. It was expensive too (lobster of course).    Think the decent thing to eat here is the Lobster Roll ($20 for large combo, fries and a drink).    The Mac n Cheese lobster took 20 minutes to make and it wasn't that great at all. It was simply just mac n cheese and they put lobster on top.  Lobster was cold and didn't seem fresh at all.  Lobster Bisque- (soup) was okay.  Lobster salad - I can make this dish better at home.  Pass on this one. Just salad and topped of with lobster. Nothing crazy.  Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche - The only thing that was decent (along with the Lobster roll), it was fresh and tasty, but TINY.  Lobsicle (battered lobster on a stick) - Tiny and nothing great.   All this was around $100.... expensive. Expected way more... I'll just go to Earls of Sandwich instead (cheap and in the same area!)

The lobster roll(real small) was amazing the cajun way. Waffle fries fried way to hard. I barely touched them. Lobster mac n cheese was under whelming..needed more flavor but okay $45 spent with water. Value was not there and in vegas thats a good buffet price.

At the Miracle Mile Mall near Fat Tuesday. This spot is soooo over rated if you ask me. And very pricey for the small portions. I guess cause it's "lobster" the prices are escalated.   I had Lobester fries with cheese... $14. This meal looked like something you get at a ball park, except with chopped up lobster on it. Fries were soggy towards the bottom...smh. Not a fan of this place.

I liked the food, but as others pointed out I really didn't get the lobster taste I was looking for. I really was going for hefty chunks of lobster in my sandwich melt. I would say it was a very good grilled cheese sandwich! It's located in the middle of the Miracle Mile Shops and is more of a food court type of establishment. The service was good but what really kind of confused me is that all the condiments are kept behind the counter. I was like, can I have some ketchup, can I have a napkin, and can you refill my water? I got up like 5 times for my requests. When I finished my sandwich I wasn't sure what to do with my trash. Do I bring back or put it in the little trash can? They eventually came and picked it up for me. I sought this place out and with parking and the walk; I probably walked off the calories I ate. Lol.. Is it a fine dining experience?  No!  Good value for what you get? Pretty close. Would I come again? I suppose if happened to be walking by. Definitely not worth the hunting I did to seek them out, so I'm going with a mid-grade review. Thanks for taking the time to read this.

The food was amazing and for lobster a very reasonable price. I am not huge on seafood but this is some seafood I can get behind and enjoy. Servers were very pleasant and great at recommending some food options. Got the surf and turf and grilled cheese with lobster to split. Great experience overall.
The lobster mac and cheese was terrible. I also tried the lobster ice cream which was another terrible idea. Won't come back for anything else. Located inside the Planet Hollywood.

If I were basing this review on food alone it would be a four.  Unfortunately because of the service I have to give it only two stars. While yes,  the food is very expensive it is well worth it. This is the first place that I run to the moment I hit my hotel room I throw my bags on the floor and run to get my lobster on.  I have always had nothing but a great experience here until last weekend. The employees should really wear name tags so we know who it is that was rude. They were clearly understaffed and overwhelmed. And the young girl with the dark hair just could not handle it.  While I think she tried her best to be nice she was frustrated and it came off very rude. Two people in line walked away and I heard the woman say with these prices I don't need to put up with that.  It definitely added a sour note to otherwise wonderful food

After spending a couple hours at a nearby pool, it was time for lunch, and for some reason I was thinking LOBSTA. Yes, just like that with the Boston accent.  On our way to getting Fat Tuesdays, we checked out Lobster ME (for Maine duh); I had passed by this spot countless of times but it's mostly been closed. For the weekend we went, we separated our team into two lines: one for the booze, and one for the seafood.  Lobster ME offers plenty of great wholesome foods infused with lobster meat. They've got it all from classic Lobster Rolls to more creative fare such as the Lobster Mac N' Cheese, Crab Nachos, and Lobster Fries. Our group grabbed a bunch of these starchy goodness and everything was pretty good. The mac n' cheese was by far my favorite.  As for me, I ordered the Mexican Cobb Salad ($16) which was topped with lobster meat, black beans, and corn. It was my attempt at being a bit healthy during the weekend, and I felt I succeeded very well in that department. The salad was refreshing and the bits of lobster meat sprinkled on top added a lot to the dish.  However good the salad was, I probably would go for the fries or mac n' cheese as my favorite of the dishes we tried. The spot is definitely worth a visit so grab a bite and sip on some Fat Tuesdays to enjoy your Vegas trip.

I am so disappointed! A few months ago, my friend and I saw this place and promised the next time we come, we'll order as much as we can from here because we love lobster! When we came, we ended up just ordering 3 things: lobster mac & cheese, lobster grilled cheese and lobster & chips. Right when took our first bite of the lobster mac & cheese, we were SO sad! The cheese had no flavor and there was very few chunks of lobster. Then we tried the lobster grilled cheese and it tasted so plain. The lobster & chips had only ONE piece of lobster but the few bites we took from that piece was good. We've tried many lobster meals and this was honestly one of the worst experiences we've had. We thought maybe we didn't experience the true "Lobster Me" experience because we didn't order a roll but we agreed we wouldn't even try any because we already spent $40+ on a meal that made us full but not satisfied.

This place ROCKS! I normally only get lobster if I'm out for a fancy meal. This was such a treat  to just get to eat fresh, delicious lobster in a fast casual setting. I've eaten here twice now. First time I had Lobster Grilled Cheese,this was very rich oof! But good of course. Chowder fries were OUT OF THIS WORLD good! 2nd time I had the Lobsticle and lobster cheese fries. I dont know which one was better. Melt in your mouth!!! Of course, this place is not cheap because this is REAL lobster but who cares. DELICIOUS!!!

Lobster grilled cheese was decent because it barely had any lobster.    Lobster Mac N' Cheese on the other hand had enough lobster and tasted awesome, each bite was heavenly.  I'd order this again in a heartbeat.

I passed by this place while walking through the Miracle Mile and felt my stomach start to growl.  Then I saw it, the "Lobsicle".  I had to try it, even for $14 - heck, that's less than the cost of one hand of Blackjack and seemed like a sure bet to me.  I had to wait a few minutes - a good sign they were cooking it up fresh - and then they called my name and I picked it up.  So it's a small lobster tail, lightly battered, fried, and served on a stick.  4 bites in all, but super delicious, nicely cooked, tender and juicy.   Next time I might have to double down on that one.

Decided to have this as a late meal.  I ordered the Fish and Shrimp combo and a Lobster Bisque.  I gave this place a 4 star because the food was actually quite good.  However, the Lobster Bisque was a let down.  The lobster bisque, although had a sufficient amount of meat, it was more on the saltier side.  As for the pricing, it is definitely a couple bucks for the same food.  The food though, was very filling.  I just wish they had more sauces, unless I missed it, then never mind.
Lobster Me.. Lobster Me That! Please don't buy that!  I had the Lobster Grill Cheese it was very expensive and had no lobster mostly crab .
I got the classic lobster roll and it was really good! Maybe not $17 good, but it's vegas and lobster so pricing makes sense. Definitely recommend if you're craving some good lobster or crab!

The lobsicle is great and the rolls are also very good. The fries need something to dip in (ranch or some other sauce). It is also a bit pricey for a fast food style place but it is lobster. Overall pretty darn good

Lobster Me, please!  I go here every time I'm in Vegas, which is once or twice a year. I can never decide between  the lobster grilled cheese (yum) and my fave - lobster mac&cheese (deeeeelish!), but the mac&cheese always prevails. I've had a sampling of their lobster ice cream and lobster bisque, which I wasn't feeling. Next time, I'd like to try their lobster roll (but for $22 - yikes!). Definitely a great place for lobstah lovers.
Had a wonderful, delicious experience. Shout out to Cameron, who was professional, helpful, and hilarious. Thanks for your superb service!

What kind of lobster joint doesn't have lobster bisque. I used to work in the miracle mile and had that back when this place had that soup, I no longer work in the miracle mile anymore so I went out of my way as a local to go back to have it and it wasn't on the menu anymore so I got the lobster Mac n cheese and it was disgusting. I'm disappointed and will never eat there again. 10/10 would not recommend.

We had the lobster bun. It was heaven stuffed in a bun! I was a little disappointed that spending that much money, we had coleslaw and some mediocre fries as sides. For the price, I will try something else next time but at least I can say o had one! There was a lot of lobster meat, so I'll give it that.
My first lobstah roll evah!  The staff were really nice and they were quick.   They were good at remembering who ordered what.  Clean, fast and good.  In the Venetian Shops.

The Best place to eat on the Strip. Totally worth it!   For the Main Lobster sandwich, they make sure you will taste the lobster with each and every bite.  The Lobster Bisque taste soothing with its exquisite balance of Creme Sherry, and really hit the spot during windy and cold Las Vegas weather.  Review based on Maine Lobster & Lobster Bisque

Caveat, this is no boston lobster roll. But it's also been at least three years since I've had some boston lawbsta (neptune oyster im coming for you this summer).   The lobster roll was relatively small but still filling. Be warned that if you get any of the combos you will NOT get chips. Also don't ask the cashier if you can get the soup/drink combo w/o the drink for any cheaper because she'll tell you "yeah, I can charge you 9 dollars (normal soup price) for the soup." Ok lady, you could just give a courteous "no." We're all just tryna get by ok.   The truffle lobster roll my friend got was probably the most flavorful but INTENSELY truffly. If that's what you're into though I would recommend that one.   All in all a pricy and meh kinda meal. Service didn't make that any better either.

I ate there yesterday before heading to the airport.   Words cannot describe how good the Connecticut sandwich was.   I am a huge food fan and a huge lobster fan and this place is a home run.    A day latter I am in Chicago at the office and I am still thinking about that sandwich.    So much so that I am actually writing my first restaurant review ever...    Advice to management.....Open one up in Chicago!

In the Miracle Mike Shops next to Fat Tuesday! Yum! Good seafood in the middle of the strip. Nice menu selection but some items are pricey (it is lobster). Lobster was very buttery and fresh. I would come back. I had the Surf n Turf Philly.

For this type of venue, food court restaurant, WOW! Service was quick, food was fantastic. We both had Connecticut lobster rolls, so so yummy. I wish we has one where we live. A little pricey but worth every penny. Don't miss it if you are shopping the Miracle Mile.

Last night,  I had a craving for lobster. I came here and the ordered the Connecticut,  lobster bisque and lobster mac n cheese. The bill came up to $35. This is as comparable at to calling McDonald's a steak house. Save your money and craving for a real lobster dinner.

Within a month, I go to Vegas twice. And within these two times, I go to Lobster Me every time. It's like the place to go for a quick lobster fix. For the price, you get your lobster's worth!   First time I went with my bf and a couple friends. My bf orders the Lobsticle (Fried whole lobster tail). It was GOOD. Like, straight up lobster. Especially with the butter, oh man... As for myself, I order the Lobster and chips. It's basically similar to the Lobsticle except smaller pieces. One thing I really enjoyed with both the order was the batter. It was really fresh and wasn't too greasy.   My second experience was my 3rd day before EDC. I order the Lobster salad because I was craving something fresh and light. I think I made an excellent choice. The lobster and salad worked really well together. On the other hand, my bf orders the Lobster Grilled Cheese. Although I did not take a bite out of his, according to him, he was full after the first half of the sandwich. He was also pretty sick of the taste (too cheesy especially with lobster together). My other friend orders the Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche. The ceviche was pretty small, but for the chips they gave a lot ...   In conclusion: I really like this place. I was not expecting an actual lobster place in the mall of Planet Hollywood. The price isn't bad considering it's Vegas. The amount of lobster they gave you is enough to compensate for the price. Also, props for this place being right next to Fat Tuesday. I will come here again and again every time I'm at Vegas :) ***Sunday special: Bloody Mary $2 for any Lobster purchase. Bf says it was one of the best Bloody Mary he's had.

This is another new addition to the Venetian food court.  I got the El Diablo roll as a combo that includes seasoned steak fries, small Coleslaw, and a medium drink.  A large El Diablo roll is $18, add $2 for the combo.  You get the equivalent of meat from a 1lb lobster placed in what looks like a grilled Texas toast roll. The El Diablo is served warm a small amount of marinara sauce that is spicy hot. On a scale of 1-10 , with 10 being hotest, mine was a 7.5. I personally would have add some Tabasco sauce, but I wanted to try it the way they made it The lobster was fresh by Las Vegas standards. The roll, coleslaw, and fries were also fresh.  Service was very good, everyone was friendly.  I really liked it, and next time I'll try the warm roll with butter.  For dessert, they have a variety of Moon pies that I didn't try this time, but definitely will next visit.
