So one of my buddies from Hawaii went to Vegas and I got permission from the hottie to spend a gambling weekend with him.  Since we hit the tables non stop the entire weekend, food was just a secondary thought.  However, I did want to try this joint the last time I was in Vegas so we went there for an afternoon snack.  Be prepared to spend about $20 for a lobster roll and if you have a big appetite the lobster roll will not fill you up.  But you do get a pretty generous portion of lobster on your roll and it is quite tasty.  Since this was my first time there, I went with the original lobster roll but my friend got the cajun lobster roll.  He said it was very good.    Next time I think I'll try the lobster mac and cheese..... hhhhmmmmm......cheeeeeesseeee.
The lobster was fresh and cooked well. Tasty place for lunch. Try the lobster mac balls. Tastiest balls I've ever put in my mouth

While in Vegas you can order a Maine Lobster Claw Bloody Mary with Old Bay rim and a Lobsicle.  That's a deep fried Main Lobster on a stick. Unique snack to have in a unique town. They have lobster rolls and other items.  I just wanted the Yelp community to know about the lobster bloody Mary and lobsicle because its different.

Great little place in Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops! The original Maine style lobster roll is heavenly. Lots of lobster and not smothered in mayonnaise. The coleslaw and house made potato chips are very good too. Glad I tried them.

We ordered the Maine style and Cajun Lobster rolls. The sandwich rolls are $19 each so it's no your typical fast food place. The lobster rolls were  mouth watering delicious. I would definitely recommend this place.

After an Elite event at Koi hubby and I were hungry so we stopped by lobster me for a bite. We ordered a large Maine lobster roll and some lobster bisque. Both were delicious. The lobster was tender and meaty and tasted really fresh! The sourdough bread bowl full of bisque was awesome. Scraping the sides with each bite made me happy. Pro tip: if you're a local you get 20% off!!! I was almost going to get their special. It was chowder fries. French fries topped with cheese sauce, bacon, clam chowder, and parsley. It sounded great, maybe next time :) the lobsicle looked delish too!! Think corn dog but with a lobster tail and thinner batter. We sat at the little bar top and enjoyed every bite of our meal. We will for sure return!!!!!

5 stars for food, 4 stars for price (since it looks like fast food type place with no walls, in the middle of canal shoppe) 4 stars for ambience.  I've ordered main lobster, cajun style (menus says warm style) . It contained all real lobster. I might have order cold style, but didn't because the cashier told me it is mixture of lobster & crab. I got the sandwich combo which includes fries & drink for 5 dollars more, really worth it! Also ordered lobster bisque, this also contained huge lobster pieces.   Price, all of this came out to be over $44! I wouldn't mind paying this at a full-service lobster restaurant, but not at a hole in the wall type of joint with open spaces where everyone walking by my table is just transient saying the name of the joint loudly like a chant, and they are not even customers. Like I said the place has no wall! Look like a food court joint in the middle of canal shoppe, next to the Gondola Ride. Although staffs are super friendly.  I will go back at least for the lobstercicle!

This place is very expensive. I loved the Connecticut lobster roll and appreciated the big pieces of lobster in the roll. Definitely not skimpy.   The only negative besides the price is how greasy the food is. About 30 minutes after eating the roll and fries my stomach felt a little sick.

Came here because it was right beside Fat Tuesday's in Planet Hollywood. I was getting pretty buzzed from my drink and LobsterME seemed to be a fantastic place to get some grub.  I know it's lobster, but it was a little pricey for how much you really get.... food was good but small   Service was pretty good. Friendly people and they were really friendly in helping me choose what to get.

Lobster ME is located in the Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood.  It looks like a very casual eatery like something you would find in the food court.  You order at the counter and pay.  The seating is very limited and at the time, it was very crowded but luckily we got a table.    I decided on the lobster roll which comes with fries, coleslaw and a drink.  I also ordered a lobster Bloody Mary cause I could not resist that it came with a lobster in the drink plus I love Bloody Mary's! My bf ordered the lobster mac & cheese and a beer.  Our total came out to I think about $60 or maybe it was more, I can't remember.  But all I know is I thought that it was ridiculously overpriced yes even though it was lobster.  For that price, I could of eaten a nice meal at a fancy pantsy restaurant.    The food itself was good but nothing that made me say wow. The lobster mac & cheese almost tasted like they just mixed in lobster to Velveeta mac & cheese. I did enjoy sipping on my lobster Bloody Mary and loved that I could walk around the mall with it!  The perks of Vegas!    Like someone said, the portions seemed a bit small for the price you pay.  Would I go back here? Probably not.  But at least I fulfilled my lobster cravings.

Mehhh. I do like that they were generous with the lobster portions but the dressing in the salad was way too bitter. I think there might've been too much lemon. It ruined the glory of the lobster! The lobster roll tasted good but you can't lose with hella butter & toasted bread. A big star deduction is due to the long ass wait. There wasn't even anyone in line before us!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! As a local, it's great to go here for lunch.  It's cheap, fast and most importantly YUMMY! My personal favorites are the lobster grilled cheese sandwich and the chowder bread bowl.  The staff is always very friendly and welcoming too.

We were very disappointed, #1 for the prices that didn't match what you were getting in food.  The lobster rolls were dry and not tasting very good.  The fries were just okay.  The cole slaw was dry as hay.  Horrible as our bill was as high or more than a good sit down restaurant.  Never going back.  It is a total rip off!
Overpriced, salty, small-portioned joke of a shack. Wouldn't recommend at all. Chowder fries were decent.
I had the lobster roll , crab roll, and lobster mac and cheese. It was very good and very satisfying.

I live and die by Yelp, and when I see that a place has less than 4 stars I wont eat there.  "Lobster Me" has changed my mind! How is this place only 3.5 stars?! It deserves much better!  I ordered the main lobster roll with fries and a drink. It was very tasty. The lobster was warm, the bread was fresh and the fries were spicy and crisp.   The service is great as well, i'm sure they get many first timers coming to eat here. The staff helped me decide what to order, they were great!   * The meal could be slightly larger, if you are really hungry I would suggest to order an additional side.   Ill definitely be back!

The staff at this location are awesome and provide excellent service.  Pricing seems a bit high for the ambiance but the food and drinks deliver.  Locals can get a 20 percent discount.  The Lobster Mary was very flavorful and the full lobster claw was beautiful.  The bread on the lobster roll was toasted perfectly and the lobster was fresh and tasty but a little overseasoned.  They also have the best french fries.

Ahhhh Vegas.  I had a Connecticut roll with chips & a soda & water which was almost $40 FOR LUNCH but that was also my choice to stay b/c I seriously love lobster rolls and don't get to eat them often.  The food was actually pretty good, with HUGE chunks of lobster, not skimped on either for the sandwhich.  The CT roll was lacking a little on flavor as if maybe it didn't have much butter, (thanks for looking after my health) so I just got alittle extra mayo to add and it was fine.  It came with a small side of chips and a half full paper ramekin of coleslaw.  Even with the tasty sandwich, I don't think this was a fair price, but the staff was nice and food was quick so an extra star for what I feel should a 3-3.5 rating.

If you aren't coming here after an awesome night and hung over you are NOT doing Vegas right. My wife and I love the lobster rolls here. It's super delicious and it goes great with a cold beer. It's a little pricey, but this is Vegas, what do you expect?

Needed a late snack and friend recommend this place, I'm not a huge fan of lobster but we decided to give it a try. We had an order of lobster Mac & cheese and a lobster roll. The Mac & cheese was great but the lobster roll....oh that lobster roll. Perfection, toasted roll, great lobster a little mayo and seasoning, that's it.  Now my mouth is watering and I won't be back until Oct.

One word to describe with place "Delicious" I was on a get-a-way to Las Vegas this week and I wanted to check out Lobster ME. I was very happy with my lobster roll I ordered the Cajun Style which was a good choice! The staff was very friendly and attentive to there customers I would highly recommend eating at Lobster ME I plan to go back next time I visit Vegas!

Lobster everything! I really enjoyed this place. Cute little restaurant, just order and take a seat and they'll bring your food to your table.  I noticed they don't serve the lobster ice cream here? I got the Connecticut roll, about $17 and comes with a small side of coleslaw and house-made chips, which was good. It was nice, warm, buttery and the bread was nicely toasted.  They said there's at least a pound of lobster in each roll.  They had 4 other rolls on the menu that all sounded so delicious but I just got the one that was the most popular based on Yelp.  I had the lobster mac and cheese at the one in PH before and it was tasty as well and not bad for the price.  I had a bite of the clam chowder fries from my friend and they were good, just not for the price.  I did have quite a wait for my food because I saw them give my food to another customer. I was quite upset, since me and my friend ordered the same time and hers came out first and then mines was next but they handed it off to somebody else.  Maybe I was just hungry and cranky from gambling but I came up to the front counter after waiting 10 minutes after my friend got her food and told them I haven't got my order yet and they put in my order again and it came out about 10 minutes later to my table. Problem solved, the workers were really nice but the waiting game just threw me off but I'm sure I will be back when I'm craving a lobster roll.

Lobster me was a great discovery for me! I love lobster and shell fish and am working my way through everything on the menu! They staff was polite, helpful, and made great suggestions. They made a suggestion for the lobster bisque as a side with my 50/50 lobster roll and I loved it! I'm a big fan of the lobster mac and cheese and the lobster grilled cheese. If you couldnt tell I will be back!

Not sure what happened to this place - 3 years ago, we felt everything we ordered was really good.  Our recent experience was completely the opposite - - the lobster rolls we had were below average.  The lobster mac and cheese was just dreadful.  Hopefully things can return to our prior experience.
OMG! The lobster mac and cheese is so good! The lobster tacos were delicious! I stuffed my face here! The lobster bisc was ok not the best but still good!  Order the tacos and thank me later!

I wasn't hungry.  Not at all.  I had just eaten at a buffet.  But I had to have a lobster roll... at all costs.  I stood in line and waited to order.  It's right next to the place that serves up the obnoxiously large purple plastic yard glass of alcohol slushy.  You know the drink I'm talking about?  You have to have a lanyard around your neck to hold it because it's too big and they drink out of a fat plastic straw that is never the same color as the plastic yard glass.  Well, we had to stand next to that lot of half-drunk, half-hopped-up on a sugar-high crowd.  I ordered The Cajun lobster roll and I sat down to wait some more.  By the time I got my food, I was hungry again.  The lobster roll was good, but there's some kind of optical illusion going on where there's not as much lobster goodness as it looks. The lobster roll is mostly the bun that is split open at the top, but isn't open enough for the lobster goodness to be inside the bun.  So the lobster goodness just sits on top of the bun.  So you think you have this deep bun full of lobster goodness, when really you better watch how you're holding that bun otherwise your lobster goodness is going to fall on the floor.  As I had seen some on the floor already.  The seating could be nicer.  They need to send someone out from around the counter every once in a while to clean up the tables and the floor.  Someone's gonna slip on some lobster goodness.

this place is yummy!  I've been craving a lobster roll ever since moving west from the east coast and the lobster roll here is delicious!  Their lobster mac n cheese is also VERY good. Their cajun garlic fries are soooo good and just the right amount of crispy.  Relatively expensive, but then again, it's Vegas and it's lobster.

My husband and I passed by this place after watching a show at planet Hollywood. We had seen pictures of the lobsicle all over the strip and were intrigued so we stopped in for a late night snack. We also notice the sign saying best lobster roll in the US so us being huge lobster roll fans, we had to test the validity of that statement. First off prices were very high.. But it's lobster so I guess that's normal. The lobsicle, which we ordered fried, was very good but super tiny. I did not like the lobster roll at all. Luke's in nyc is much better. The seasoning was weird and there wasn't a lot of lobster.

Free soda refills until 11pm!  Great spot when you get tired of the endless celebrity steak houses and cheesy buffets. Good lobster roll which has more smaller chunks as opposed to those huge ones you can find in Boston. Great lightly salted butter on the toasted roll. And the free soda refills are awesome. They come by your table to check on you periodically and offer to refill your cup. Good service and attitude, reasonable prices, and the lobster roll hits the spot. I'd go again.

Best lobster roll,  lobster Mac n cheese, crab cake burger ever had. Their waffle fries are delicious and so is their salad. I suggest you try all. I mean right from the presentation of the food to the freshness and taste they have it all under check. It's 5 star quality food served at a stall or a food court.

After hanging out in Vegas for a week and seeing Lobsicle advertisements all over, I decided to give this place a try. I got the fish and chips to play it safe and it was decent. You don't get that many pieces of lobster for the price but the basket was full of fries which was nice. For having special seasonings for their food offerings, I was a little surprised that their tartar sauce was in generic packets. Probably won't be back, but the food was decent so I have no real complaints about that.
I'd come back for the grilled cheese and lobster bisque. You can also sample the lobster ice cream which surprisingly works.

My wife and I grew up on the East Coast and have eaten lobster and lobster rolls all our  lives. My wife and I had the Connecticut roll. Worse lobster roll I've ever eaten. Lobster meat was minced, it looks nothing like their advertisement. It tasted and looked like the meat you get from the little legs and flippers. No claw meat. For $17, it's a rip off in my opinion. Lobster bisque was a bit of a thick consistency, with little lobster meat to speak of and a very bland taste. We will not return.

So maybe the girl behind the counter flirted with me a little but the food was "DA BOMB" my maine lobster was so good I had to go back and take one to go. even if I have Gout that pain was worth every bite.

First time at this location, usually we visit the one at the Miracle Mile shops. I had The Cajun with coleslaw, fries and a coke. My gf had The Original with homemade chips and coleslaw.  Our rolls were loaded with tasty, juicy lobster meat!! Well worth the price! The bread was perfectly toasted.
Came back on a trip in Oct 2013. Got the six incher as promised. Yummy! Free refill on soda too!

When come to Elara Hilton Grand resorts you will a visit the fabulous mile shops. A favorite this location. Lobster rolls with at generous portion of lobster meat in roumalade, or Siracusa or creole, within a "pretzel" 6 inch roll, side order of waffle fries and small portion of cold slaw.  Other order include "lobiscle".  A good choice of bottled drinks. Cost per person about 26 dollars
this is not real Maine lobster. after on girl told us it was, another said "sometimes they get a Maine lobster in a shipment..." Lol not good for the price or for what you get.

Wow, I expected so much more from this place......but it was very disappointing.  Let's just say everything that's not lobster there is good. I'm giving this place 2 stars because of their clam chowder. Everything else with lobster doesn't taste right. It's overpriced too!

I'll give myself one more day to chuckle at the idea of lobster ice-cream. Who said only the Japanese were innovative with their desserts? (e.g. shrimp/tofu ice-cream) My mom and I happened to be walking along the Miracle Mile Shops when she saw a big sign that said 'Lobster ice-cream, free samples' so I went up to the cashier and asked for some to which she handed me a spoonful. Not bad, I say. I was expecting something bland and downright icky but surprisingly, it was pretty flavorful. The ice-cream could've passed off as vanilla, then there were the strings of lobster meat that came with it. Was a fun try. If only an order wasn't fixed to $8 and they had sizes, it would've been great company for a walk under the sun.

Given the few options to eat a lobster roll in town, I'd say if you're absolutely craving one and would do just about almost anything to get our hands on a juicy succulent tasty lobster roll come to this place.  I tried out the lobster roll, lobster and chips and lobster mac n cheese.  The roll itself was freakin perfect, bread was toasted just right and they gave a decent amount of lobster with it.  The lobster and chips were pretty good and I recommend it if you want something fried and greasy.  My least favorite had to be the mac n cheese.  Maybe I'm biased since I'm not a big mac n cheese fan but they didn't load it up with lobster at all.  After about 2 bites I was basically just eating plain mac n cheese from the kraft box.  Overall, if you're a foodie, YOU WILL COME HERE.  If not i guess you can skip out if you don't feel like spending a pretty penny.

I'll echo what someone previously mentioned: Underwhelming flavor and definitely overpriced for the quality, even by Vegas standards. To make things worse, I waited 45 minutes for my order--even those who were in line behind me received their food before me. This Lobster ME branch is located inside Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops.  $19 for a Cajun Lobster Roll. Here's my issue: Most of the lobster meat was dry, and tasted as if it was merely re-hydrated. Second, it's underwhelming because the "cajun" flavor was nothing more than an excessive amount of cayenne, paprika, and/or pepper. There's nothing that stands out. The bun was okay, and the house-made salt and vinegar chips were crispy.  The employees, who were probably a bit flustered from the longer than expected line, ended up giving my order to someone named "Sarah," yet continued to call her name out for her actual order until I finally walked up and told them that I still didn't have mine after 30 minutes. Oh, yeah--I waited another 15 minutes for them to re-make my sandwich. In the end, the cashier apologized, and offered to throw in an extra lobster roll for free, but I kindly declined. It wasn't his fault, but my advice to them is to double-check the orders. My lobster roll sucked, but hopefully those of you reading this have a better experience than I did.

3.5 stars   I got the extra large lobster roll for $22 and shared it with some friends. We thought it was rather pricey so we shared it just so we can at least try it. The lobster roll had nice big chunks of lobster meat which we all liked and enjoyed. Good tasting and worth trying out but pricey for a quick bite. I don't think the extra large would have filled me up if I had ate all myself, lol.
This was my first Lobster Roll. And it was DELICIOUS. The lobster was warm and the bun perfectly toasted. Definitely a must try in Vegas!

Honestly died and went to heaven when I ate here. I am a frequent visitor to Vegas and was surprised to find this new place in the Venetian canals.  Lobster rolls are one of those items that I'm constantly in search of the ultimate experience. Quite often I am disappointed Due to having generally high expectations.  However this time I was not disappointed at all. The Service is fast and easy you order at the counter and take a number back to your table and once the meal is ready they bring it out.  There are number of items to choose from several variations of the lobster roll and several additional side items such as lobster and macaroni cheese and a lobster cheese melts and also lobster bisque and clam chowder.  I ordered the lobster roll with truffle butter and coriander and the fries with the clam chowder topping and bacon. It also came with a small coleslaw on the side.  The lobster roll includes a full pound of lobster. It was fresh it was tasty and it was delicious. The truffle butter was succulent and rich but amazingly what made it great was the bun which was slightly toasted and the perfect consistency.   The fries with the clam chowder and bacon are a whole different world of pleasure I can't  recommend them enough. Absolutely mouthwateringly delicious.  The food came out promptly and the portion was ample. The price was aligned with expectation given the location and the fact that you're eating lobster. My meal for the upgraded lobster roll and the upgraded fries along with a soda was $26 with tax.  If you're in Las Vegas stop what you doing and going to eat here now.
Had the lobsicle and lobster mary.  All were great.  Of course the price was steep considering the location and product but as a novelty it was worth it.

Little food stall by the food court in the grand canal shops.  They specialize in Lobster.    Serving sizes are small, but I guess the food is priced okay considering you are getting lobster.   We ordered the Beltway Roll and Lobster Mac and Cheese. Total cost: $31.25.  The aroma of the lobster is great. The flavor is very good.   With the lobster roll you get home made potato chips (not fries) and some cole slaw.  Overall a good choice but order a side because the serving sizes are small.   4 out of 5 stars.

Lobster Me is quality, juicy, succulent lobster in a convenient, mall food court setting. Mouthwatering lobster rolls? You got it. (5 different ways!) my recommendation? Maine. My friends also enjoyed Cajun (not too spicy at all) and Connecticut.   Excellent service. Perfect niche with a few quality options for lobster lovers, like lobster Mac and cheese and lobster on a stick. Prices a little higher, but it is Vegas, and the quality is worth it. Major cravings for lobster rolls are a regular thing now.

Unexpected to see a lobster place in Las Vegas.   I never thought I would actually want soup in the ridiculous heat but with the help of casino air conditioning.... Soup seems the most logical choice.  I loved their lobster bisque and the sourdough roll was so excellent because it was toasted!  I still don't know why the wait for lobster bisque is forever though.   Also got their lobster mac and cheese and the meat is so sweet and good.   I probably should add... I never really had lobster before. Either that, or I have it so infrequently that I forget the taste, but I thought this was pretty good.

This is a pretty concept but a weak execution. Everything we had was bland. The prices were also ridiculous for what you get. Skip this gimmick and get some seafood from a real restaurant not a kiosk.

Of course when in Vegas, always want to try something new.   This location is inside planet Hollywood right next to Fat Tuesday.    I got to try the Maine Lobster Roll. Overall it wasn't a bad roll yet I understand why it was priced around $20. It comes with cole slaw and some fried chips.   Only con was seating. Other than that, it's worth a good bite.

We tried the original Maine style roll and the chowder fries and they were amazing!!  Was craving for it the very next day!!  The grill cheese and bisque was also super tasty.  Definitely going to be a regular stop when I go to Vegas.

I never really ate lobster until I came here and ate the lobster roll. It was really good. I would have prefered it warm but it was served cold but still good. The garlic fries were out of this world.  There aren't too many seats here, especially because a family of what seemed like 100 pulled all the chairs together. But this experience made me really enjoy lobster- plus I was tipsy and tired of eating rice from Panda Express. I haven't had lobster since because I only want the roll from here.

Stubbled upon this place and since returning from Boston I've been craving lobster.  Husband and I ordered the Connecticut roll which is a basic lobster roll  but served warm and lobster is cooked in butter.   Thoroughly loved it and great people watching. A little spendy but great.  We split the roll which came with a side of coleslaw, also great... And Heineken, came to 26.38 FYI.   Yum.

Holy Lobster! I lived at this place when I was in Vegas.  It was about 200 yards from my room at the Palazzo.  I had the Original and the Beltway both with fries and a drink which came to about $28.00 each.  The bread was so soft, fresh and buttery and full of lobster tail and claw meat.  The fries where hot and  good and they offer vinegar (I love vinegar on my fries). A must eatery while in Vegas.

All I can say is tasteless, nasty and expensive..don't waste your time. Lobster has no flavor which I assume is due to being farm raised and frozen. The bread is stale and bland...Chowder on chowder fries tasted like watered down 7-11 cheese sauce...to top it off our order came out wrong, they took the wrong sandwich back to sub for the right one  & just added butter to the top of the one sent back and pretended like it was the new re-made sandwich!! All this for a whopping $46.30 per person!! Such a waste!!!!

So, if I was going to die tomorrow...a few of their Lobsicles would be part of my last meal.  It's a fried lobster orgasm, plain and simple.  The idea is so simple:  a small (4 oz, maybe) lobster tail, shelled, impaled on a skewer and either beer-batter dipped and lightly deep fried, or grilled, and served with lemon and butter.  I think they must brine their lobster tails, since the flavor was outstanding and they were very juicy.  They don't overcook them at all; cooked absolutely perfectly.  I only tried the deep-fried version, but I had a total of 8 of them over the course of my six day stay.  A must-try...I'm hungry just thinking about it.
My second time visit here. Love everything, the lobster roll, bread bowl with clam chowder, fries. Awesome. Will come back again!

Exploring Vegas and craving some lobster and we stumbled on this joint. .   We orders the trio taco lobster roll and Mac and cheese balls. Loved everything that we ordered!   Freshly made and generous servings of meat and sauce. The lobster taco was my highlight out of all the deliciousness along with the lobster roll.   Definitely will be back for more next time we're in Vegas!!

Lobster ME, more like Lobster No Me! We used to love this place, pricey but we'll worth it. Not anymore. Small lobster roll, 3 tiny pieces of dried out fish, an oceans worth of salt on the chips and tasteless watery clam chowder. All for $45. Never again!

DISCLAIMER: The photos are deceiving! The rolls are at least 1/3 smaller and the large generous pieces of lobster meat are non-existent. To add insult, the prices have increased.  It's really a shame. If you look at photos posted just a year ago, the rolls are stuffed with a heaping of lobster meat, even full pieces of claw meat, and looks absolutely tantalizing. The roll we got was small (think a thick slice of bread - like Texas Toast folded in half) and it was barely filled with chopped up lobster meat. So, what happened? I want to know where were my lobster claws and why was I robbed of lobster??  Original Maine Style Lobster Roll ($17): Chilled lobster meat mixed with mayo and spices and served on a toasted, buttered brioche. Accompanied by a side of lightly dressed cole slaw. The bread was soft and flavorful and the lobster meat seemed good. It was nice with the freshly-squeezed lemon. Again, I would have really enjoyed it if there was enough lobster meat. There was too much bread to the amount of lobster and we actually had a couple bites with NO lobster! This was really disappointing for the price.  We opted for the Fries + Drink combo (+$3) and went for Cajun Fries (+$1). The beer-battered fries were crispy and delicious. The Cajun version was well-seasoned and I loved the addition of chopped scallions. FYI: If you choose a fountain drink, it has unlimited refills.  Lobster Mac & Cheese ($12): This was just okay. The pasta was dry with not nearly enough sauce and the lobster meat was, again, skimpy. There was nothing special about this dish as it wasn't flavorful and there wasn't enough lobster to taste it within the dish.  The Lobsicle ($14): Lobster tail on a stick and it's available grilled or fried. I went with fried which has a light coating of their beer batter and it's served with melted butter and lemon wedge. This was absolutely delightful. The lobster was cooked nicely and the batter was crispy. I loved the fresh lemon juice and butter for dipping.   I really did enjoy the food, however, I don't like feeling cheated, so I can't say I'll return or recommend the "World's Best Lobster Roll" (meh).  Note: They offer a locals discount of 20%! Just show the cashier your Nevada ID.
Gave this place another chance and they came thru. Had ct style lobster roll. Still have fantastic split rolls but this time the lobster meat was much better.

Eh. I don't see what the fuss is about. It was $22 for a combo--drink, lobster roll, and soup. Lobster bisque was ok, kinda salty. Lobster roll was just a tiny sandwich and had no mayo or any flavor or anything, just lobster. The proportion of meat was good but it did not justify the price and flavor. Wish I'd tried something heartier.

It's a little pricey, but you get so much lobster. I like that they let the lobster do the talking and it's not too heavily seasoned or globbed with mayo. The bread was perfect, too. All-in-all, I really enjoyed it and have no idea what people are griping about. Fries were excellent, as well!
This was a great meal for the price. Surprisingly it was a light meal at the same time filling. Quality of the lobster was great. The Mac and cheese was very good also.
Waited 30 minutes for our food.  People were irate.  Manager was in over his head.  Lady there was trying to hold it all together by herself. One star because food was good but never again.

WAY, WAY OVERPRICED!!  $17 for just a lobster roll? i.e. A hot dog bun with a little chopped up lobster in it? If you want a decent hearty amount of meat like you should get in the first place, you have to pay extra. Fries or anything else costs extra too! AND it's served on a paper plate with plastic utensils? AND it's in a fast food setting!  I had the lobster mac and cheese. It wasn't bad. But it was quite spicy, peppery.   Mac and cheese is normally supposed to have a mellow cheesy flavor, but all I could taste was hot pepper. And there was only a small amount of lobster in it, all chopped and ground up. Not to mention it was served in a flimsy cardboard bowl and a plastic fork like you'd get at a carnival.  Yeah, lobster tastes good and all, But I consider this place a ripoff. They need to cut their prices in half in order for it to be a fair value.

Got the crab with sriracha roll $14 and Maine lobster roll $23 combos. They were both so good! The crab was more favorite probably because they gave a lot of crab. And the lobster was in chunks but overall both were pretty good! Won't be disappointed

So..after many months with the same menu, they FINALLY bring back tacos !! Had the trio..libster, shrimp,and fish tacos. As you see..put together sloppily, and served not so hot. Taste wise..VERY GOOD ! Really busy today..more counter help needed, especially during busy times. Prices are really high considering the amount of product that is actually given.
Lobster mac n cheese worth the cost to me, just get a drink. Something a little spicy builds up as you eat. Worth the walk, yum!!

Lame lame lame lame lame. The photos are way too misleading!!! The lobsicle is tiny as heck, and the lobster roll are even more ridiculous. The picture looks way too big than the actual ones. C'mon seriously? $19 for this little meat? Especially it is not even the tail meat. It's from the claws which is cheaper. I'm just so disappointed. Definitely not satisfy with the quality and quantity, but service was great. Nice people.

I got the cajun lobster roll as recommended by the cashier and it was soooooo good. Plenty of lobster!!! It was even better than lobster rolls I have had at fancy seafood restaurants. And at 18 dollars for a lobster roll + cole slaw + chips, this is a steal -- especially for Las Vegas where I expect everything to be overpriced!! I've never paid under $16 for a lobster roll anywhere!  The next day I ate at Bacchanal buffet at Caesar's .. But not going to lie, I would rather have just bought two lobster rolls instead! I would return again and again and again .......

Lobster ME was a total surprise and I'm glad I was taken here since I was so hungry in Las Vegas!  I told my friend, "I'm hungry." (This is a common scenario...) He said, "There's Lobster!"  I said, "WHAT?!!#!@$#@! Take me there now!"  We show up and I'm staring at the menu trying to figure out what to do with my life and what to feed my life with.   FOOD - 3.5 Stars: With much anticipation, I ended up choosing a lobster roll and lobsicle.  Lobster Roll - I was really excited to get this, but kind of let down. Don't get me wrong, it was still delicious. However, I was had higher expectations. The bread was toasted really well and buttery. The lobster was good, but instead of having pieces of lobsters, it had what I would call shredded lobster. There was plenty of meat, but shredded meat. *sad face*  Lobsicle - This was a surprising item. You have a choice of getting the Lobsicle either grilled or fried in a tempura batter. I decided to get it fried like the healthy person that I am. When I first got it, I was a bit underwhelmed because 4 ounces of lobster looks relatively small. After the first bite, I was like WHOA! It was so damn good and full of flavor! it was crispy on the outside and meaty on the inside. No shredded lobster pieces here. ;) LOL. I'd definitely get this again. Maybe next time I'll get one grilled and one fried so I can enjoy the goodness of both!  SERVICE - 4 Stars: The staff was very friendly and answered all my questions. Yes, I asked a bunch of questions because I wasn't quite sure what to get. I was finally able to narrow it down and place my order. I grabbed a number and waited for my food to be delivered to our table. The worker even brought us some Tabasco when we asked for some. Overall, really great service.  ATMOSPHERE - 3.5 Stars: There's not really enough seating. It's right next to a Fat Tuesday's, which always has a long line. There's only a few tables unless you want to sit at the counter at Lobster ME. So, it's hard to really enjoy your food. My group was lucky enough to swoop in and grab a table.  RECOMMENDATION: Lobster ME was a surprising find here in Las Vegas. I guess I shouldn't be surprised since it is Las Vegas. I will come back and try other items on the menu. I'd think twice about the Lobster Roll though... I'm hooked on the Lobsicle though... like madly in love. So, check them out!
First time here, and it was good with the people being very nice and helpful. The rolls are stuffed! They also have some interesting drinks. Would come here again. Had the Cajun !!
Just ate the lobster mac n cheese, DELICIOUS!!! Generous portion for a generous price. Definitely would come back for more!

One of my favorite places in Vegas. It's a must come to spot for me Everytime I come. Yes it may be a little expensive but it's lobster. Want a cheap meal mcDonalds is close by. Get the Connecticut and some lobsticles.  Only suggestion would be that we really wish they sold shirts. We would buy a couple in a heartbeat. Rock on

Very good, but very pricey.  Heaps of delicious lobster meat, but on a 4in roll for $17...it would be more justifiable if it was a 6in. Chowder fries were awesome, lobster Mac and cheese was okay...not worth it. Yes I would visit again.

Surprisingly good for a fast food type of place in the mall. Ordered the clam chowder and lobster roll, both were great! The roll that they use for the lobster roll was buttery which made it even better. I felt like they put a good amount of lobster in it. They had a bunch of different things on the menu that I saw after I had already ordered so the next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely be back to try more things on the menu.

$15 lobsicle tasted burnt (maybe dirty grill)? Is the butter real? Crab loaded fries with "lobster cheese" that is funny no lobster flavor at all. Crab i see it but no taste. Asked for tarter sauce and they had to ask a manager. Waited 15 minutes. Really wished i had just put the $27 in a slot machine.
This was our 1st time eating there and for 2 rolls and their taco trio 3 sodas $94. And some change.  They were good, not delish.  A little over priced but hey.....

We ordered the lobster roll. It was delicious. The toasted bread is flavorful. Cole slaw was meh, not good or bad. I am not a slaw eater so can't tell either way. It wasn't soggy or overwhelming. The fries were delicious. I didn't even use ketchup. It's fried golden crisp and had a nice flavor of salt and other ingredients. There are chunks of lobster in there. The sandwich is kind of small for what they are charging. Maybe they can make he roll bigger and add some other filler in it like zucchini or something. It's $21 for the sandwich so it's not cheap when Chipotle is $7.50 for their bowl. Soda will run you a couple bucks but they have free refills. They are busy so you have to wait for them.  I think they should just place it in the front counter and let customers help themselves.  Service is friendly. They bring the food and drink to you even. It's 5 foot away so we could just as well do it ourselves really. The better half was waiting for their food truck last year and they never came. Unfortunately, I was with her that time and we ended up ordering some other trucks meh sandwich.  I managed to snap some pics of the menu if you want to see pricing. There's a locals discount too btw. But I would not come back just to eat here again. The strip is busy and it's a bit pricey.

I like this place a lot.  It's almost identical to Luke's Lobster except for the fact that they give you a lot more lobster in the roll.   I was surprised to see how packed it was in the roll.   This location does cost a few dollars more but they offer several styles of lobster roll instead of trying to trick you into getting a combo dish of shrimp and crab rolls.   Both spots are tasty but LobsterMe is more satisfying.   It's pricey but it's better than the alternative

If you're looking for a tasty lobster fix on the Las Vegas strip without paying outrageous prices you'll likely find in most Vegas strip restaurants LobsterME is the perfect place to go. Their lobster rolls are the best I've ever tasted, with soft yet crispy warm bread and more lobster meat than I expected! As soon as I finished the first one I had to try a second one!

Had the lobster roll combo with a cup of lobster bisque. The Cajun style lobster roll was amazing. I don't really know how it stacks up to their other rolls or lobster rolls in general as this was my first one. But it was great. The bisque wasn't very good though. Wish I had gotten fries instead. But all things considered I liked the place and will definitely be back, especially if I'm staying at PH.

I had the signature roll. I had high expectations for this roll since the lobster came from Maine and I paid a steep amount for it. Well, it's not bad. But it just did not justified the $25 USD I paid for it.

Went here with my parents and boyfriend and paid about $85 for 4 tiny lobster rolls. The lobster didn't taste that great either and the seating area is so small 3 of us sat down on some uncomfortable barstools and my dad had to stand.

I ordered the Cajun style lobster roll, the meat was tender and cold. The mixture of mayo and Cajun seasoning was good. The bun was crispy and seared on both sides split down the middle to hold the lobster. My order came with a side of chips, dusted with a salty, ranch flavor. Overall, the roll was good but not as advertised. Online on there webpage, says each roll has 1 pound of lobster meat, that's the reason why we would pay $17 for an order. The sandwich did not come with 1 pound of lobster meat. The McDonald's lobster roll taste better than lobsterME and that's less than $10.

Lobster Me is a delicious spot to eat. They have delicious Mac and Lobster. Their Lobster sandwiches are mouthwatering leaving you wanting more. They have increased their prices due to the high demand at this location. It will cost you 23.00 for a warm Lobster sandwich and 17.00 for a cold one. The food is really good just not the prices. Seating is limited so you may need to find another seat in different area.

I came to Lobster ME for a quick bite after landing and waiting to check in to the hotel.  I ordered the Lobster Grilled Cheese, Cajun Fries, and Blueberry Lemonade.  The Grilled Cheese & Cajun Fries were tasty and hit the spot and the Lemonade was refreshing!
Not bad but kind of pricey for a lobster roll, lets face it though, it's Vegas
I walked pass here so many times. I'm so disappointed by the quality of food. My clam chowder had so much salt in it that I had to throw away most of it

We found this location of Lobster ME accidentally when we were looking for Fat Tuesday inside Miracle Mile Shops on the Strip. Coincidentally it was literally right next to Fat Tuesday and they share tables with them in a mini food court area. They had a decent amount of customers and the food looked good from afar. Customer service here is friendly and they bring out orders in a timely manner.   Nadine C ordered a Lobsicle for $16. It's a lobster tail on a skewer. The tail was very small and we felt that it was rather expensive for what it was. She gave me a taste of it and it was SALTY! Maybe if you dunk it in the butter, it'll help with the saltiness but it shouldn't be that salty. I think I'll pass on Lobster ME in the future. Thanks for sharing and for the experience Nadine!

Really good. My boyfriend has been wanting to go here for awhile now and every time he's in town we run out of time, glad we finally made it because the food is delicious. I had the Connecticut combo and fries, worth the wait.

Came here on my last night in Vegas for a quick bite to eat before I had to head over to the airport. The food was decent albeit slightly expensive (but it is Vegas I suppose) and service was okay.   For food, I tried: - The Beltway lobster roll (lobster, shallots, chives, panko bread crumbs), 4/5: at first I was sad by how small it was compared to the picture on the menu board but it actually ended up being quite filling/rich. Decent amount of lobster but needed slightly more seasoning. Side chips and coleslaw were meh.  - Chowder fries (fries covered with clam chowder, cheese sauce, and bacon), 3/5: FYI this was not advertised as having bacon in it, so my vegetarian friend ordered it but then wasn't able to eat it because there were bacon bits mixed in everywhere. Tasted good but nothing extraordinary, although adding Cajun seasoning (you can ask for some) did enhance the flavor. - Lobster grilled cheese, 3/5: mostly a grilled cheese with tiny-small amount of lobster. As far as grilled cheese goes, it was quite delicious but then again, I wouldn't pay $10 for just a normal grilled cheese.   Overall, the lobster roll is probably the best thing to try here but it is rather small and $17. Not sure I would come back again.
Not that great. and EXPENSIVE for the little pieces you get. It's OK considering your in top dollar tourist trap alley.

SOOOOOOO GOOD. I can't recommend this more! Being from the east coast you know good seafood & this was just like being at home! For the price you get a HUGE sandwich & fries! The Mac n Cheese was so filling in such a little cup (in a good way). So creamy & great! I'd go again and again!

Lobster was definitely fresh as I actually got a small piece of shell in my roll. The Connecticut (warm lobster with butter) was very good. The roll however was haphazardly made and the filling was already spilling out of the bun when I got it. The portions are very small for the price (almost $20 with tax) - possibly the smallest lobster roll I've gotten. Yes size does matter in this case. The chips were ok - not very fresh and too crunchy  Overall ok place to grab a quick bite if you're really craving an overpriced lobster roll
If you're s fan of lobster, this is the place to be! Located in the Venetian Hotel, this $11 sandwich is nothing short of delicious. I highly recommend stopping by for a quick meal!

totally the worst lobster ever. i saw the ad where you can get a lobster sandwich combo for $20, so i went to try it out.   when i ordered and was waiting for my food (which i spent like $50$), the employee there (who took my order) was giving out coupons (i think) to everyone except me and another customer. i spent more money than all the customer there, and i dont get one.   well i know some you just wants to know about the food. so here goes.  when i got my food, the lobster was so cold, it was like they froze the lobster before serving it. the fries over was ok, nothing special. the bisque was good and cremy, but need the lobster piece to be bigger.   if you're a lobster restaurant, you got to impress me with big pieces of lobster
I love this place!  Nice snack and not very expensive. My favorite is the main style lobster roll and I really love the Lobster Mary.

Once again you find me at Lobster Me. I couldn't come to Vegas without stopping at one of the best and cheapest places to get my lobster fix. This is only a small place in the Venetion. You must wait in line to pick out what you would like to eat. They give you a big number to put on your table and bring it out to you as it's ready. I could eat here every day and have been known to do just that. I'm suggesting that if you want a nice meal for a decent price, this should be a place you must consider.  The Lobster is flown in fresh and everything tastes absolutely like it was from the east coast. I had lobster chowder and a lobster roll and my husband had a crab roll.

Came on a Monday for lunch! There was 1 couple in line in front me , not busy at all. The cashier was super friendly, I had a couple of questions and he didn't hesitate to answer - well no one was behind me in line. Last night, I searched Yelp for a good lunch spot here at Planet Hollywood and I swear I went to bed craving their Bloody Mary, Lobster Mac n Cheese and of course their famous Maine Lobster Roll ! Bloody Mary isn't on the menu but you just gotta ask , I got it a tiny bit spicy and it's perfect! Currently grubbing right now - and everything is amazing ! I wish I had gotten their Lobster Bisque to dip my roll in, but it's hot outside and I'm about to layout poolside . There are a bunch of mixed reviews about this place, and I don't get it. Unfortunately, there aren't any Tater Tots anymore. The quality of the lobster is great! I'm getting full off the Lobster Mac N Cheese, it's really delicious. The Lobster on the roll isn't frozen at all, kinda warm, but I like my seafood a bit on the colder side anyway. Kinda still hungover from this weekend , but that doesn't take away from the fact that this place is bomb! sober or not! Next time I come , I'm gonna have their Chowder Fries and Lobster Bisque with my Crab Roll. I love crab more than lobster - but I'd rather spend that money on a dinner buffet and get endless legs! I love seafood, and I had high expectations coming here for lunch - and they were all met! Delicious food! And extremely delicious Bloody Mary, which I'm saving and bringing with me to the pool! I paid $50.83 for these 3 items , but what do u expect to pay in Vegas for seafood?!

This was just alright. I lived in ME so I ordered the Maine lobster roll and it wasn't the same. I don't believe the lobster was fresh either. The coleslaw  was bland and the chips were under seasoned.

My wife and I were in Las Vegas recently, and I found Lobster Me at the Milennium Shops attached to Planet Hollywood by googling "Best Lobster Roll Las Vegas."  My wife is allergic to lobster, so I don't get a lot of lobster rolls at home.  Not that I could anyway - we live in San Diego, where good lobster rolls are hard to come by.  That's why I googled away - I had some time, and, having spent some time in Northern New England, I love a good lobster roll.    I tried "The Original 'Maine Style" lobster roll, which the menu describes as "Maine Lobster served with a touch of mayo and lemon and topped with our secret spice blend."  Additionally, the menu notes that "all rolls [are] served on our toasted, New England-style, split-top bun."   Big chilled chunks of lobster meat, perfect claw pieces on top, the mayo, the aroma of butter, the bun itself - it was great and it really hit the spot.  Was this the best lobster roll I'd ever had?  No, but I'm in Las Vegas a lot more often that I'm in Maine, and this roll was exactly what I wanted.  This roll was also powers of ten better than what I can find in my home city.  I'm already looking forward to going back again the next time I'm in town.  Other items on the Lobster Me menu sounded great, including the other varieties of lobster rolls and especially the breakfast options, but I will probably get the classic Maine Style roll next time too.

Your one and only main ingredient is a premium ingredient that would taste amazing even if it were prepared just by boiling it. How do you screw it up so badly???   I ordered the lobster bisque for $10 and the lobster Mac and cheese for $14 or so. Both were incredibly disappointing. The bisque was floury and salty and lacking in any lobster flavor. The pre-cooked lobster bisque from Costco tastes ten times better than this sorry excuse for a lobster bisque.   The Mac and cheese tasted like something that was heated up in the microwave with a few small pieces of boiled lobster tossed carelessly on top along with some fried onions from a box.   This place is expensive, but the food is so tasteless and poorly conceived. Totally do not recommend.

Chowder fries pretty good for 7 bucks. I am from Canada so we have a best poutine ;) so this wasn't bad. Friends got the mac and cheese for 6 and they said it was awesome (although it was just regular mac and cheese with lobster on top). Serving size is only ok and price is decent.

Nothing beats Lobster on a Stick!!  There is nothing special about the location. You sit in the mall and it feels like a fast food restaurant. But none of that matters after you get your food! AMAZING!!! Forget Hot Dog on a Stick. Can anything beat deep fried Lobster on a Stick served with drawn Butter? The Lobster Rolls were also very good! In a town where you can pay $75 for Lobster, I found it to be very reasonably priced as well if you understand what you are getting.

Lobster in a food court? Paint me red and call me skeptical.  That's what I first said when I noticed the Lobster ME counter in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. But I don't mind being proven wrong, as the missus (who is always right) will attest.  Lobster ME serves what they bill as the "world's best" lobster roll, and having eaten my way through New England with a single-minded focus on that region's delectable seafood, I would say they're pretty darn close.  Their Original Maine Style roll is served on a toasted brioche-style split-top bun packed full of delicious crustacean that is seasoned with just a hint of mayo and lemon, and their mix of spices. The missus had the Cajun version that was seasoned with a blend of Cajun spices and spicy butter. Both made the perfect lunch and were rife with savory but sweet lobster meat, with mammoth claws topping each sandwich.  We elected for the combo that cost just under $20 each and was served with tater tots (or fries) and a soft drink. The tater tots were not spectacular, and were akin to what you might buy in a bag in your grocer's freezer aisle, but they were crisped to crunchy perfection.  I would have tried the lobster ice cream that was also on the menu, but they were unfortunately out of it. I will, however, definitely stop by in the future when I am in need of a quick bite in this area: I would like to sample their lobster mac and cheese, and am somewhat tempted by the "lobsicle" (a fried lobster tail on a stick), but their breakfast menu and a promise of lobster and waffles really intrigues me.  Lobster ME is located down the corridor from the Halo Bar towards the mall's south entrance, or just head straight down the south entrance past Earl of Sandwich and the PBR Rock Bar & Grill.  They also offer free wi-fi: just ask them for the password, which they will print out for you on a register receipt.

First time having Lobster Me was in April of 2016 while staying at PH. Indulged in the Lobster Bloody Mary two days in a row. Sure it's a little pricey but it was worth it. They were strong (they use Smirnoff, though) and tasty and the woman working there gave us both large claws each time.   Was just there with a bigger group that I dragged along. We wanted the Bloody Mary's (obviously) and figured we would give the food a try. In total we ordered the lobster mac and cheese, lobster roll, and chicken fingers and fries (I know but I wasn't in a Lobster mood). The mac and cheese was tasty but a small portion for the price and the lobster roll same thing. The chicken fingers were gross but the fries were good. I asked for ranch when I ordered but they didn't give it to me so I asked again for it and she told me it was a $1.50! Ok..... so she brings it to me and my change (they charge tax so it was $1.63) and it was a tiny cup of bland ranch. Really??? Seems stupid but that totally turned me off.   Also, I guess they are told to make the bloody Mary's weak now because we watched her pour less than a shot in it. If I wrote this in April I would have given 4/5 stars but the ranch and the weak expensive Bloody Mary annoyed me.
Food was a tad pricey but what on the strip isnt anymore my Maine style lobster roll was full of flavor and the fries were hot fresh my wife enjoyed the old bsy and liked that as well.

Decided to grab a snack with my buddy after a walk down the Vegas strip. Sat down and shared a lobster mac and cheese. Holy lobster it was amazing. The lobster tasted very fresh, the cheese was very creamy and it also got a slight hint of spiciness which gave the lobster a sweet kick in flavour. Made the whole dish so much more exciting! Highly recommended for lobster lovers!

If you are looking for any lobster dishes in Vegas, Lobster ME is the place.  My recommendations are lobsicle and chowder. In addition, every time when I go there, Yvonne always takes care of me.  She is very friendly and knows how to take care the customers.  I don't need to worry about my order when she is there.

Not a bad place if your craving for some lobster. Comparable to other similar restaurant with this concept. We had the lobster roll and all it was good. A bit on the small size. Not the best in town but not bad. The lobster Mac was really bad. The macaroni was over cooked to the point it was mushy and sticky. The flavor was not very good. The lobster and chowder was good. Chowder has good flavor but it's small for the price you pay after adding he lobster charge to it. Fish and chips were good. We also had the shrimp cocktail which was more like the frozen shrimp from Costco tossed in some seasoning. Can't say I would want to go back anytime soon but it's not a bad place.

I thought this 24 hour restuarant was a pretty good idea to have here considering there is nothing else like it here on the strip that i can think of...  its located in the shopping mall of Planet Hollywood right next to the place where you get those big tall drinks and on the way to Earl of Sandwich! lol So you can get this as an appetizer on the way there like we did! lolol  I ordered the small lobster roll for 16.00. I thought it was a little expensive but then soon realized that we were in the middle of the dessert which is why its a few more dollars. The roll was warm, and lightly toasted. What kind of puzzled me was that the lobster was cold. I automatically assumed it was going to be warm and drenched with butter. i was not dissappointed just a little surprised by the combination of the warm roll and cold lobster. Nonetheless, it was good especially if you are a seafood lover like me.  Big chunks of lobster cold or warm will always make me happy!!!

This place is right next to Fat Tuesday at Planet Hollywood. My boyfriend and I ordered the grilled cheese so I can only give a review on this one order. Based on this grilled cheese, I would love to try out everything else on their menu! I was skeptical as to how much lobster there really is in the grilled cheese but surprisingly, our sandwich had a lot of lobster! The sisters that work there are the funniest people too! They were so positive and they gave us recommendations. They cleaned up the tables pretty fast so other people can have a seat as they eat and they were all very accommodating which I very much appreciate.
Would have taken a photo but i ate it!!!!the Connecticut is delicious!!! Really good sandwich!!!
Food is decent, not the best I've had. Not worth the price though. For a place that claims they exist for the love of lobster, they're pretty stingy, but I guess vegas is stingy in general.

Lobster me at Miracle Mile Shops was my favorite place. Tonight changed my mind. Did you know that the prices at this location and the Venetian location are different? Neither did I!   Tonight I bought a Connecticut Lobster Roll, no sides, and it was $27!!! At the Lobster Me at the Venetian, I got the same Connecticut Lobster Roll and it was $19! I said that was a huge price difference and they agreed. Psssst, come on son!   From now on, I will go the the one in the Venetian Shops.   Food is good though.
Cathy is amazing! So sweet and kind. Lobster roll and drinks were on point! Will definitely be back before our vacay ends.
We got the chowder fries and beltway. Good food. We just expected portions to be bigger.

My girlfriend and I both had the so called "best lobster roll ever". I must admit it was pretty good & better than I thought it would be (I was expecting a tourist trap).  The garlic bread was delish, toasted to perfection. There was a good amount of lobster to go around, so that was satisfying as well. My issues were with the seasoning/sauce (there was barely any of either one) & the price (still a bit overpriced for a food court style dining experience).  If you happen to be in Planet Hollywood & you're craving a Lobster Roll ... all hope isn't lost ... i'd still go to Lobster ME given some of those issues.

we wanted a snack since linner really was enough for lunch and dinner...heheh.  while walking through PH, we finally found Lobster ME.    the lobster is caught in Maine and flown to Canada for deshelling/freezing, then flown to vegas twice a week.  there is currently only one location; however, they will begin to franchise soon.  Lobster ME is due to open in Santa Monica sometime.  i had a discount from the miracle mile coupon book.  buy one large lobster roll and get a 16 oz draft beer free.  the lobster roll that was in the window was an extra large.  it didn't look that big.  so we tried the large lobster roll thinking that we would only get one bite since hubby and i were sharing.   we were wrong.  there are actually big pieces of lobster tail in the sandwich.  the buttered bread was slightly toasted; lobster was added afterwards.  the lobster was actually not one piece but more like two layers lightly salted and spiced.  you get roughly 1/3 lb of lobster in your large roll.  we enjoyed it very much.   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6Vyp-9i1jzwK_bvisuPJpQ?select=GAo7jQGmJkSkVBQyGX72tA  it was pricey but worth the try.  $16 + tax = 1 large lobster roll + draft beer(which is $4)  also sampled lobster ice cream which i disliked.  tasted like heavy, sweet vanilla ice cream with pieces of lobster mixed in.  i was disappointed that they didn't try to incorporate the lobster taste into the actual ice cream.  felt like they could have tried to infuse flavors.

Had the Original Maine lobster roll combo w/ lobster me seasoned fries and it was delicious! Kids had the kids MAC n cheese and grilled cheese sandwich. Place is very family friendly, service was quick. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

All those pictures of huge chunks of lobster had me dying to try this roll. Unfortunately after i paid my $23 for my sandwich, fries, and soda all i got was a tasty buttered bun with scraps of lobster that didnt even reach the top of the bun. I'm wondering if the fact that mine came in a togo box had anything to do with my quality. What was there tasted fine, but like i said, there was hardly anything in the bun and my last two bites were only bun. Stick with Todd English Pub's lobster rolls. They may seem small but there is 3 of them.

I try to make it a mission to eat here everytime I come to Vegas, and I come a lot every year.   The key is to get the lobster sandwiches WARM. That is when they are the most delicious. The employees don't always suggest cold or hot sandwiches so make sure to get warm.   All the sandwiches are good but I prefer the Cajun. They have lobster on sticks and everything lobster. If you are a lobster fan, make sure to eat here.

no idea how the food tastes, cuz i paid and waited 30 min and got nothing. watching the cashiers/servers argue with the kitchen in back is like dinner and a show. after i was repeatedly told "your order is next" and watching other boxes get filled, i went to the cashier to ask for a refund. The 16 y.o. manager just re-printed a receipt for me, the receipt didnt show anything about money going back to the card. 14 days later....nothing on my statement. if you get screwed like me, dont leave until they comp you something.  edit: it's been a week since I emailed the manager/owner that left the comment below. shockingly - no response.
Amazing lobster roll and Lobster Bloody Mary. Expensive but definitely worth it. The space is set up so you order, pay, sit and then your food is brought to you. They also offer a military discount.
butter me, yummy. Sweet butter bread excellence, lobster precooked a bit dry. Still delicious
The lobsicle was very tasty but at $14 a piece is a little pricey. Wanted to try it once. For that price they should give you two or bigger. Give it a try !

So I was shopping at Planet Hollywood for some booty shorts and decided I needed a tasty treat for lunch . I ate at Lobster Me. It was the bomb! Then I went to the Grand CAnal Shops at the Venetian and what was there ? Another Lobster Me that's what. So BOOM! my chunky butt ate two of these rolls in one day and I'm not gonna lie. I loved them both!! Run don't walk here. Best lunch in town

I LOVE Lobster rolls and these are THE BEST in town . Blows Luke's out of the water . You really get a lot of meaty lobster perfectly cooked and seasoned . For me it's a great deal and an equally great lunch!!

I love lobster! I crave lobster rolls and lobster bisque soup, often. This place, just didn't impress me, my taste buds, or my overall expectations. It's located in the Miracle Mile shops, which is a great place to shop, eat/drink off the strip, or just people watch.  The manager, was very nice I'll add, and offered my man and I, a sampling of the New England Clam Chowder and Lobster Bisque Soups. The NYCC, was OVER salty. My gosh. A tad too overpowering, for the basic taste that soup can offer. The Lobster Bisque was good, but not comparable to seafood restaurant quality of course. Both were at the right temperature.  We decided to split a sandwich and chowder fries. The sandwich had about 5 large pieces of lobster chunks on it and the bread was toasted and seasoned. It just didn't have enough sauce, the lobster could have had some flavoring or be butter-dipped and the fries were just okay, with the sauce/dip kind of thrown atop, but mainly coating just a few of them on top.  We left somewhat bummed, especially at the price and despite the long line, but I did hear the Lobsicle and Lobster Grilled Cheese Melt, are pretty tasty.  I just don't foresee returning, at this point.

My sister and I both agree that Lobster Me was just ok, and was pretty pricey. Even though we had gotten there shortly after 10, we received food that seemed like it had been sitting out (i.e. it wasn't piping hot). I chose the lobster roll, which had a good amount of lobster but tasted just ok. My sister had the lobster mac and cheese- and she's had better. She said that the lobster was sprinkled on top instead of baked together, so the flavors didn't meld together.   We also shared a clam chowder, which was a bit liquid-y and slightly sour. Not a huge fan.   Overall, just 3/5.

I got the Connecticut lobster roll.  It came with house made chips and coleslaw.  The roll was tasty.  It was everything I was expecting.  The chips were great too.  They were crisp and fresh.  I did not really care for the slaw.  This was definitely great to have tried a roll here, but $17 is quite pricey.  I would rather eat at a nice sit down restaurant and pay a little more, than eat here again.    I will not be back.
So many items on the menu! Hard to choose just one. Had the 50/50 Dawg with side of the sriracha aioli sauce, amazing! And the waffle fries! So delicious!
Shared the lobster roll combo  and it was very delicious. Good amount of lobster. Nice staff. Total price was 24.90

This is the best lobster roll place I've ever been to. And the price is fair. They have multiple flavors of lobster rolls. The Maine is the original flavor. Cajun is spicy and special. I like them both. Clam chowder is usually very tasty in this kind of places. No disappointment this time either. The Lobster Bisque is light and good!

Okay, it wasn't too bad, but when I pay for Lobster Mac & Cheese, I expect somewhat fresh lobster.  Maybe not right out of the the ocean, but at least within a day.  The mac & cheese was good, but the lobster tasted like it was cooked a few days before.  It probably doesn't help that I had fresh lobster the night before.   The seating area was fairly clean and the young lady at the counter was very friendly. I will probably hold off from eating here the next time I'm in Vegas and stick to the fresh lobster and homemade mac & cheese.
Try their lobster roll and bloody Mary, it is ok nothing special, kind of overpriced, but it is expected inside a strip casino.....so its like try it one time and it is done....

After whole day of shopping we stopped at Venetian and decided to try Lobster ME since we heard about it so much on yelp and 702 on the local tv. We tried lobster roll with classic English topping. Well..... sandwich was dry and portion was really small even for me. Better go and get lobster at some real restaurant. Criss cut fries was not impressive at all. This place has a great idea to bring lobster to kind of fast food but they need to improve their menu, quality and quantity because it doesn't match the price you pay for it.

What a killer concept for a girl that dies for some lobster. We had an early dinner snack with some lobsicles and they were delicious. I got mine grilled while hubby got his battered and fried. They are clearly making a killing because who doesn't love lobster, but holy crap for two tails almost $30! The only thing I can complain about is the cost, so it wouldn't stop me from another or trying something else there.
Other than clogging arteries,  this place was fantastic for a mall food court. I got the lobster roll and chowder fries. $24 is expensive for mall food, but this is Vegas.

I used to frequent this place often, stopping by at least once a week.  As the months passed by, the menu kept changing.  I have nothing against a change in selection, but the food quality drops with each change.  The seafood is very bland.  I have tried both shrimp (sliders) and lobster (tacos, fries, mac n' cheese, rolls).  The rolls all come seasoned so those are normally okay.  The same can't be said for the rest.  The clam chowder is the only dish that has remained the same, which I will continue to purchase.  If the clam chowder has an off day, a little salt and pepper will fix that easily!  In the end, if you pass on trying this place I wouldn't blame you.

Interesting food creations, using lobster in sandwiches, salad, fried food, and ice cream!  However, the foods in fact tasted just A-OK and prices were sorta steep.  $23 for a 6" lobster roll was pricey, I think.  The lobster salad came with lots of small chunks of lobster meat and was good for the price.  Lobster bisque was just standard.  Lobster-n-chips was cool though! Beer-battered and fried lobster huh? Yummmmm~  Last but not least, the lobster ice cream that sounded out of the ordinary was actually vanilla ice cream with itsy-bitsy lobster meat.  The ice cream tasted alright but was worth a try!  Just ask for a free sample before you buy, so as to make sure that you would like some savory ice cream that tastes like seafood. *wink*

Lobster ME is a decent mall choice for lunch or dinner, but expect to pay for it.  That being said, it is lobster, which is not a cheap ingredient, and it is the Las Vegas strip, which has fewer and fewer bargains these days.  On my last trip to Lobster ME, I had the Cajun lobster roll with tater tots.  It's a decent size roll (the large) with the requisite buttery split top crust.  But, the lobster was overcooked, it wasn't tough, but it was getting close.  It certainly wasn't succulent, which properly prepared lobster is.  I liked the spice on the roll, and it's stuff full, so the amount is not an issue.  The tater tots are okay, better than say, Sonic, but just okay.  The entire meal is $27, which again, I don't think it's worth.  However, as noted above, I understand that lobster is not cheap and I don't expect to find value in a mall on the Las Vegas strip.  You can certainly do a lot worse if you are looking for a quick meal on the strip, but don't expect to be blown away at Lobster ME.

This was a tasty treat while walking the Miracle Mike shops with the Mrs. The food was awesome, as the Lobster Roll was perfectly prepared. The lobster bisque was delicious, and both washed done nicely with fresh lemonade.  Kevin, the GM was great, as he gave us some background on the establishment along with some great suggestions while in town on vacation.   If we ever make it back to Vegas, we will definitely be hitting his place up.

Stopped here before Britney Spears show and had the lobster Mac and cheese and the Maine lobster roll.  The Mac and cheese is phenomenol.   The roll had a few mealy pieces of lobster but overall very good and generous portion.  We are excited they are opening a spot in San Francisco!

Soooo about Lobster me..I tried The 50/50 roll dog, in which had lobster & crab...and styled it up Cali style...and an order of the 3 taco plate...(fish, shrimp, lobster) which I should of gotten for myself because it was very delicious...Honestly the roll was not that good...it didn't have any flavor...maybe I should of gotten one of the other rolls..it felt very dry..ate it anyways because I was hungry :(...the tacos on the other hand were full of flavor..I also tried the lobster Mary...it was really bad..I wanted to Like it but the flavor was nasty! (Not to mention pricey..take your money else where)

It's over priced for what you get. The lobster mac and cheese says the lobsters blended in but what you get is cold lobster thrown on top of Mac & Cheese.   The only thing worth the money is the lobster bisque in a bread bowl.    If you have money to spare you could eat here or save your money and eat at a sit down restaurant.

I just added Lobster Me to my list of must visit places everytime I visit Vegas. The lobsicle was the bomb. $14 for a skewer of deep fried lobster meat. Super awesome. Can't wait to try the grilled one next time I visit!

came here for a quick lunch during the GameStop expo and it didn't disappoint! It's delicious and really meaty. It's a pretty good sized roll. My husband tried the Cajun roll and loved it! I had the Maine lobster and was very happy with it as well. I had the chips and my husband got the chowder fries. I wish the chowder fries had a bit more chowder. The Asian kid who took our order was really nice and was more than happy to refill our drinks (we sat at the bar.) really yummy place and I didn't think the price was too bad for the size and how much lobster the roll had.
Lobster ME Signature Roll Cajun style was delicious!  Add the Cajun fries and it's pure delight.
Lobster bisque bread bowl=amazing and if you order something that comes with a side of fries I HIGHLY recommend getting their cheese to dip them in! So yum!
Good food... although it doesn't look as you're getting a whole pound of lobster as they heavily advertise... but really delicious. The freaking lobsicle is really good - although tiny...

Stumbled upon this place inside Planet Hollywood's miracle mile shopping center. Little joint next to this popular drink place that everyone goes to, Fat Tuesday. It's a small location with just sitting tables outside the restaurant. Nice people servicing you. They have good recommendations.  Now for the food, I needed up with their main food item the lobster roll. Definitely pricey for the amount of food. Don't really know if the lobster really comes from Maine either. The fries, unlike other posts, tasted ok to me. My roll ended being the Cajun style. I gotta say, it was, one... pretty salty, and two... not that well stacked. Half of my sandwich was mainly bread. Taste wise, it's decent but definitely not worth the $24 that I paid for it. There was a lobster roll I got in Newport Beach, CA that was about 17-18 and that seemed still a little high, but quality was a bit better.   Overall I'd give this place a 3/5 stars as the food is way overpriced. Service is ok, the sides are fairly typical but the main seller isn't that great that I'd pay 24 again for a simple sandwich. For you to try at your own risk, I was hungry and thought lobster sounded like a good idea but it turned out to be ok at best. So for you to try and let us know. Cheers.

Located in the Canal Shops of Palazzo/Venetian, and quick easy place to grap anything Lobster.  We tried the Grilled Cheese Lobster sandwich and the Lobster Roll.  Both were good, but would suggest if really want the flavor of the Loster, go with the Roll, as it is full of lobster meat and a light dressing, so the the flavor is really about the lobster on a nicely toasted roll.  The grilled cheese has a small amount of Loster, but a  lot of cheese, which makes a very nice grilled cheese sandwhich, with a hint of lobster.  This place is pricey for what you get, but it is in the midst of one of Vegas' premiere Hotel, Palazzo and Venetian.  Try it out, it worth a quick visit.

Me and wife popped in on a Friday after work. I got the Old Bay and my wife got the Cajun. Both were really good! The lobster was fresh and we'll seasoned, I was totally shocked cuz in Vegas seafood can be risky. But I would totally recommend this spot to anyone!

I come here for one thing the clam chowder. I'm not a big fan of anything else cause my favorite rolls are from slapfish and the lobster bisque is a bit too weird cheesey for me. However, the clam chowder omg idk why it's so good. It has such amazing flavors! And when it's nice and thick and creamy on better days..yess

Have been craving lobster rolls for such a long time; finally came here today with a friend :) And it was so worth the 30+ minutes drive. My friend got the original; I got the El Diablo rolls with fries, and they were both amazing. The bread was great because it was almost like a garlic toast, and it just made the lobster roll that much better.   A bit on the pricey side, but considering that it's on the strip, it's actually not too bad.   And locals get a 20% off!! :D I deducted one star because even though my friend's also from Vegas, she didn't get the discount... we think the cashier might be new.

This is a great place when you want to grab a quick bite. The grilled lobster tail on a stick is genius and it was cook perfectly. I'll be dreaming about the lobster bisque till my next visit to Las Vegas.  They also have a decent beer selection and you can see all the games on TV from the bar next door.

Was always skeptical about this place, but I have to admit this place was .com! I always had my orders to go so never had an issue. Bread is nice and soft, lobster is weighed for the perfect amount of meat each time. And come on, it's lobster!! So good!
Walk in to lobster me not s seat down restaurant great food and service ordered the lobster bisque clam chowder soup Lobster ME sandwich it's to die for highly recommended

The lobster roll is only ok and is definitely overpriced compared to what is available elsewhere (not in Vegas, mind you).  I don't know if decent, reasonably-priced lobster rolls are that hard to find  in Vegas but the Lobster Me roll has less than 1/2 of  the lobster that Boston's Neputune Oyster's does but costs 80% as much.  Not such a good deal.  The lobster in the roll was kind of half way between the  Maine mayo style and the  Connecticut hot butter style.  Not a good compromise,  IMO.

"High prices, even high for Vegas."  This couldn't be more on point.  The sandwiches we ordered, The Beltway and the Connecticut, were both roughly $20 each.  Yup, each.  While this isn't totally unheard of (this is a lobster roll right) you usually get a decently sized sammie.  This was more like half a sandwich.  It was tiny! Did it taste good? It was decent.  Toasted bread, lobster and butter, just appetizer sized portions.    What was even worse were the stupid chips served with the roll.  They were completely stale.
