Some tough, some were soggy, but all were downright wrong.  Just give me a freaking bag of Lays already.  At least those would be crispy.    Service was also a big downer.  The guy at the register was polite, but he kept getting corrected by the rude gal behind him.  The food took forever to come out, even though this was pretty much a pick up, fast food type counter.  There is a decent amount of food court type seating also serving Fat Tuesday, but if it's all taken, you're SOL.  You better be prepared to walk and eat, but then again, the sandwich is so small, you'll be done in about 2 bites anyway.    Yeah, we won't be back.

I'm from Maine.   Got Lobster ME roll New England Style. Lobster was 4.5oz and average tasting. The roll was cooked well. Butter on grill. The lobster was a bit underwhelming.  I'm not sure they add anything to it.   The Taco trio. These where great. Lime zing to em.   Fries were cold so I asked for fresh ones.   NO TARTAR SAUCE! They really can't call themselves a Maine lobster place without it.   It was good but I probably would go back for the roll. But I would get the tacos.

Wow...My husband doesn't even like fish and is a picky eater, and he tried my Connecticut Lobster roll and Chowder fries and said he loved it.  I wish there was a franchise near me.  You can tell this is high quality food, prepared well.

Wow amazing! A little expensive but what in Vegas worth its salt isn't? Whole lobster claw served in the chowder, I'd have liked it shredded or what not but this way there isn't any room for arguing about the completeness of your lobster. I also got a claw in my bloody marry and she got the Mac with whole claw. Delicious bread crumbs on the top of that cheesy delight. This place is from Maine (ME) and all America.

Having grown up in New England, I know a good lobster roll when I bite into one.  This one harkened me back to Boothbay harbor with a side of mac 'n cheese and a cold brewski.    At $ 17 for the 4" lobster roll and $ 23 for the 6" roll, this place isn't cheap but it is comfort food at it's near best.  Only thing that could improve is the setting.  You are literally sitting at a table just off the main aisle of the often noisy Miracle Mile Mall that encircles the Planet Hollywood Casino.  Trust me, this is not a picnic table on the coast of Maine.  The rolls are filled generously with only lobster meat - non of those celery or breading fillers...just a touch of butter and mayo to add to the flavor.  You always get the meat from two claws on top every 4" roll and three or more on the 6".  The roll is classic New England - cut on the sides unlike a standard hot dog bun and toasty warm from the grill.  It contrasts nicely with the cold lobster meat.  When in Vegas, Lobster Me will definitely fill the bill and put a smile on your face.

So.....I'd say more like 2.5, as I'd give it a second try, but there were some issues. First off, though, my fiancee enjoyed the lobster bisque, and I agree.....it was good.  Now, onto my lobster grilled cheese sandwich. Ample amount of lobster, which is always a plus. Usually. It was just kinda.....bland. It was just there. Couldn't taste the cheese, and the lobster/crab was woefully underseasoned. The fries weren't cooked the best, and contrary to the sandwich, was oversalted.  Overall, not a good first impression.  Generous enough with portion and freshness, but seasoning/flavor could use some retooling.

I recommend this restaurant 100%! The crabmeat and lobster were delicious. The bread was literally melting in my mouth. Overall pure yammy! I suggest the Cajun sauce though. I tried both Sriracha and Cajun sauces and found that Sriracha is creamy and not that spicy. But that's more of a preference.

What a fun eatery! And I heard it's a chain, how I wish they'd expand over! It was fun discovering all the creative lobster items and although we only settled for classics (lobster roll and lobster salad), they were both good! I especially enjoyed the homemade chips accompanying the sandwich.   The only turn-off was the fact that they'd charge for water! And be prepared to wait a little for your food. The place looks like a fast food counter but everything seems to be made to order. With patience comes good food!

A fast-food experience for sit-down restaurant prices.  Ordered the lobster Mac and cheese.   Lobster is good bc nature made a bug stuffed with delicious meat, which makes it even more egregious that it couldn't save the sad, soupy Mac and cheese it topped. An insult to the lobster that gave its life for this!  Maybe it was an off day but the sauce was thin and gritty bc the cheese wasn't fully incorporated into the sauce, nor was there adequate roux, if at all, to start the sauce.   The result was a mass of bland noodles with the occasional sad speck of coagulated cheese stuff, topped with crunchies and lobster meat. All the flavor ended up in the soup at the bottom of the container.   For $16, you can do better elsewhere.  Service isn't the greatest, either. It seems like the staff was too busy with what they were doing to be personable or upbeat.
3 words OH MY GOD! This was the best place we went to the entire time in Vegas! The lobster Mac and cheese was amazing!! I wanted it the entire time!! This is a must go in Vegas

Ambiance: 2 - Definitely the worser of the two Lobster Me that exist in Las Vegas, this location is definitely not as good as the PH. However, this one does have a cute, almost private eating lounge that I really like. The restaurant is basically a fast food, take-out Lobster Shack, and looks accordingly with what it represents.   Service: 2 - Service was good, but slow. I feel like if they took a shorter time preparing their sandwiches, they would get a little better reviews on the service side.   Food: 1 - Taste at this location = not so good!! I ordered the Connecticut and I remember the sandwich at the PH being bigger, and also less dry. My lobster was so dry, it took away from the taste. Dryness of lobster usually results from overcooking and/or the amount of time spent preparing the sandwich. They might want to spend time correcting this! I would have liked to see a helping of buttery sauce with my sandwich.  The dryness was just so overpowering that eating fries and coleslaw didn't help--it actually made it worse. For spending such a hefty price on a very small sandwich that didn't even have a ton of lobster, I would have liked it to be prepared much better. Disappointed! =/
The only way to get fresher lobster is to fly to Maine charter a boat have him catch it cook it on the boat and eat it it's that fresh in that good

Tried several dishes:  Mac and cheese: disappointing. Lack of cheese. Lack of lobster. Just Mac. Overpriced.  Grilled cheese with lobster : spectacular. The best thing on the menu.   Lobster roll: expensive. Ok for a roll not memorable.   Lobster bisque: better than average. Still not memorable.   Would of gone to a buffet at a major hotel for what I paid.
Lobsicle!!! I wasn't really into the tempura part but the tail with butter and lemon is still pretty tasty.

THIS PLACE IS SO DANK! I just finished my Cajun lobster roll and I'm so sad it's gone. Totally worth 18$. Lobster fries was delicious as was the lobster mac and cheese. They don't cheat you out of lobster either!!
This was average. Not a lot of lobster and mostly bread and sauce. Because of the mismatch, it is just ok.
The place is over priced and mediocre at best. I could make better lobster mac and cheese with kraft products.

The "Lobsicle" is ridiculously delicious!  I stumbled across this place while walking through the Shops at Planet Hollywood... A lobster tail on a stick... GENIUS!  I wish I lived closer :)  Very friendly staff and quick service! Can't wait to go back!

Had the lobster grilled cheese and lobster Mac and Cheese. Lobster mac and Cheese is decent creamy but had better for $14 with a tiny scoop of lobster it was ok.  Grilled lobster and cheese was in ok. For $14 not really worth the price rice. U get tiny bits and pieces of lobster ... Over priced for the amount they give u and it's almost like fast food place.

Not a fan. I got the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was pretty disappointing. There were chunks of lobster which was awesome but it wasn't that tasty the Mac and Cheese was pretty subpar as well and was very heavy. It's enough to to put me off this place.

I ordered the clam chowder today and thought that it was ok. The soup itself was good, however, the clams were way overdone...very tough. Prices are super high...nice thing about my chowder was it came in a sourdough bread bowl. Having been spoiled by the food truck in Austin called Garbo's which has the most amazing lobster rolls, I was hesitant to ruin my pure image of a true lobster roll. So, I refrained from ordering one. Nonetheless, I did get the chowder...because who can ruin a clam chowder? Well, the clams had been cooking too long. But you be the judge. After all, it's Vegas. Plenty of dining options to be had here.

I ran into this place in April 2017 and fell in love.  I returned during Pole Expo 2017 weekend and well, JUST YES!! They changed the menu and added a few delicious items like avocado and bacon. ABSOLUTELY!!   No lengthy review here. JUST GO! GO HERE with patience. The seating is minimal so you may have to take your food elsewhere within the mall. Be happy and enjoy because that's how good this food is - worth walking away to look for seating.

One of the many quick spots to eat on the strip, that is overpriced and underwhelming.  The lobster roll was supposed to be the star, but was not memorable.  Portion size was okay, but everything was dry and not fresh.  The lobster mac and cheese was not special either. There are plenty of other places around town that can replicate this dish.  If I am at Planet Hollywood, I would stick with Earl of Sandwich for a quick meal instead. If on the strip there is a place down the street serving up fresh tasting, heaping portions of a Maine lobster roll, with better ambience.   *****Yelp 2016 100 challenge***** 11/100

Lobster roll my girlfriend ordered was delicious. A little pricey but you get a fair amount of lobster meat. I had the fish and chips and wish I had ordered a roll myself.   The french fries are decent, but nothing special and the fish I was told was atlantic cod but the texture was all wrong. The batter was ok but uninspiring. It tasted like the ff and the fish had both been deep fried in the same oil. After eating two of the triangle fish nuggets I gave up and stared at my girlfriends roll. -1 star  Next time I will stick with what they do best  The boards were easy to read above the walk up and order counter but they have limited seating. If you stick to just ordering a roll you can forgo a table and sit on nearby benches.   Overall pretty good, I will be back and can recommend this as a good spot to fix a lobster roll craving in a hurry!

Came here with my wife for a small dinner and we had the lobster Mac and cheese which was great! Could have used a bit more lobster in it but it was delicious. The main thing we came for though was the Lobster Mary--bloody mary. We love Bloody Mary drinks and get one wherever we go so we have an idea of what we like. This Bloody Mary was ok and we personally did not think there was anything special about it. There was a small lobster tail in, but it made no difference. It sucked up the alcohol and turned out to be a tiny shot. Mainly alcohol, minimal taste of tomato juice, and only the salt rim was spicy. Wouldn't go crazy for it. Food was great though.
worth it. good taste and enough lobster, and very cheesey

Omg so Cathy was such a sweetheart and doll! . She was so helpful and informative on the menu, helped us pick out our perfect meal! She even gave us a free the Lobster Bisque offer with purchase of a Melt!  #HappyPride!   The food here is AMAZZZING!! Def a GREAT value! Plenty of lobster, very delicious and worth the money. I'm happy that this company is growing. She said that they are opening a new location and already have 2-3 others.

As we were passing through the Venetian food court, Lobster Me, caught my eye. Anything with lobster or crab in the name will catch my eye. They're my favorite foods. They must be known for their lobster rolls because they had a whole menu board dedicated to it. They had the Original Maine Style, Connecticut, The Cajun, The Beltway, and the Miso Sesame.   I went with the Connecticut, which was warm lobster meat tossed in melted butter. It came with house made chips and cole slaw. I also ordered a cup of lobster bisque, and salt and vinegar fries.   The lobster roll was so delicious. I could taste the fresh, sweet lobster meat in every bite. It was worth the $18. The lobster bisque was also yummy. It had the right amount of cream and sherry in it. There were bits of lobster in every spoonful of soup. I didn't care for the salt and vinegar fries. It was sprinkled on top of the fries and not my thing. My husband loved it though.  I prefer good old ketchup. I would definitely go back for the lobster roll. I'm drooling as I'm thinking about it.
Good Maine Lobster roll.. not great. But good.   Fries were just ok.   Good alternative to the other fast food joints near by.
Lobster is very exquisite. The flavor of Mac and cheese is amazing. A bit expensive but well worth it.

Delicious! That's all I can say. I got the Connecticut lobster roll and it was delish! The bread was buttery and perfectly toasted. Thick slice and reminds me of Texas toast. The lobster was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. Comes with home made chips and slaw. Eh to those but I didn't pay for those. I paid for the sandwich lol. Service was quick and friendly. And, if it makes a difference, Fat Tuesday is right next to it :) I'll be back tomorrow. They have a lobster melt which is basically a lobster grilled cheese I'm dying to try! And yelp has a coupon offer when you check in to get a free lobster bisque with a melt. Sold! Highly recommend. But remember I'm a Texas gal and not from the East Coast so this is a southern review ;)

Dudes. What are you doing over there?? Seriously?   I used to love this place and always looked forward to going here when I was on the strip. This is no more.   This place has progressively gotten worse each time, unfortunately.   First, they kept changing the sizes of their lobster rolls, then they changed the bread, the seasoning and now the whole thing is just not good.   There is less lobster and the bread is stale and small. They used to serve awesome lobster claws on top, this is no more. Everything about this roll is screaming "What did you do to me!!?!?!?". And I know why it's screaming that.   Also, their lobster mac and cheese is always super cold. They should mention this to the clients if this is their intention. Even the clam chowder tastes more like it's been preserved and not fresh, also served in a stale bread bowl. I feel bad for talking this place up and sending people here.  The service is good, and the cleanliness is fine.   I've been in denial for too long. My love affair in the last year with this place has dissipated.  This is  no longer my favorite place to go on the strip. :(  It's way overpriced for what they're offering now. When they started, it was worth the price.   Please, consider going back to your old ways. And please inform me when you do. Until then, it was a pleasure knowing you.

Meh.  I dunno, it wasn't all that.   Located in the Miracle Mile Shops in planet Hollywood, and open all day.  Claim to have "the worlds best lobster roll".  I have to disagree, and this is based on taste, type of meat, and possibly luck.    Maybe I was unlucky to get an off-night lobster roll.  It was filled with claw meat, didn't get too much tail in my roll.  It's very lightly dressed, and while that may be a ploy to say,"we're not going to hide our fresh lobster taste!" what it ended up doing was make it painfully obvious that the roll was drenched in butter.  Lobster rolls I'm used to are more like lobster salad on bread.  And when I said filled, I didn't mean filled like bursting at the seams, I just meant that's what thye filled my sandwich with.  The bread to lobster meat ratio was something like 3:1, and it was tourist priced as heck, actually everything is here.  My wife got the lobsicle and the lobster ice cream.  I would describe the lobsicle as a split lobster tail tempura skewered and fried.  And the lobster ice cream was just a mild vanilla-ish ice cream with lobster meat.  It was ridiculous, like $5 for a small.  Don't get me wrong, I like weird Filipino ice cream, with corn and with cheese, but this just wasn't for me.    I'll eat here again maybe, but I probably won't get the lobster roll.  I'd probably just get the lobster and chips, but more likely, I'd save my appetite and my skrilla for Boiling Crab or Hot n Juicy.
great lobster mac n cheese! for a mall setting.  but the mall is in vegas.  and i was able to drink a beer in the mall with my mac n cheese.  check it out!

Original Maine Style = Cold.   Not just in tradition, but based on every review here.   Mine was served warm. When I asked the girl working, she told me all of the rolls are served warm.   I don't understand, why do 20+ reviews reference a cold roll when in fact none should be.   Either way, roll was decent (as decent as a warm lobster roll can be), albeit pricey.   I just wanted a cold roll :( I wonder what went wrong.

Executive Summary: Cute quick service restaurant in the Venetian Hotel/Mall that serves lobster on top of classic American favourites.  Value (Price/Quality): Poor. The price of this place easily tops over $20 when ordering a combo for a quick service-fast food type of restaurant. You're really paying to get chunks of lobster however at this price point you can easily go to other places in the mall or strip to have a better meal.  Customer Service: Good - no complaints. Friendly and will answer your touristy questions.  You'll like this place if: If you just want chunks of lobster on top of American favourites.  Don't go here if: If you're expecting gourmet style food or creative lobster menu dishes or don't like lobster!  Transportation: Free parkade attached to the hotel and bus stop outside on the strip.  Yelp Customer Bottom Line: If you like Lobster, try the Lobster Mac & Cheese. It's a big portion so feel free to share it with a friend.  Business Opportunity: Try Lobster Poutine (Canadian style)!

Honestly, all we wanted was to get a piece of lobster that wouldn't cost us an arm and a leg and that didn't require us to dress up .... that's how we like to roll sometimes.  Lobster ME seemed like a place that would fit our need and requirements perfectly, and I must say, after having experienced it. that it certainly did.  It's an odd concept, to have a Fast Food lobster place.  Fast food and lobster doesn't seem like it should be in the same sentence, but these guys made it work.  After peeking around at the menu and at other people's choice of foods, I decided to try the Lobsicle (lobster tail on a stick) and my husband went for the Lobster Mac and Cheese.  We also ordered a side of cajun garlic fries, just because they sounded exciting .... :)   The price was somewhere around $12 for each lobster dish and $4 for the fries.  Slightly above average when you consider the fact that it's fast food, BUT .... there's lobster involved, so even though it's cheaper than going to a lobster type restaurant, it will still be pricier than your average hot dog stand.  The food came out quickly.  My lobster tail on a stick was battered and deep fried and was served with a cup of butter,  The batter was very tasty, on the sweet side and it complimented the lobster very well.   The lobster mac and cheese was DA BOMB! I never knew lobster and mac and cheese belonged together in the same bowl, but obviously I'm terribly mistaken because it was a pairing made in heaven!  The sweet lobster, the macaroni and the creamy cheese sauce ..... It was just a very, very good idea!  The cajun garlic fries were tasty BUT ... do not eat if you're looking for a date or looking to score at some point that same day.  Just a word of fair warning.  The cajun spices provided a welcome kick, so we both enjoyed this side dish.    We'll definitely be back here for more lobster in the future.  It's a convenient and quick lobster fix that can fit in to anybody's budget, and so for what it is, I think it's a great idea and a great place to stop for food.  We didn't get to try the lobster ice cream, but it's on the agenda for next time ;-)

Change this places name to ROBster ME instead of Lobster Me.  18 bucks=4 inch piece of kings Hawaiin type slice of sandwich bread stuffed with 1/2 cup of so called lobster.  IF it were tasty it may even be worth it...but it tasted like the fake Japanese imitation Crab stuffed with mayo and butter in a 4 inch slice of bread.  FOR near frieaking 20 BUCKS!!!!  NO way in HELL returning to this piece of CRAP RIP OFF.  If you want to THROW $$$ away, gamble it at crap table...your odds of getting a return are better than at this joke of a LOBSTER  place.

Best Maine style lobster rolls in Vegas! The staff was friendly, everything was clean and the lobster rolls were amazing. This was my first time at this location as I had previously gone to the one at Planet Hollywood.
Well worth it! got the Cajun roll and lobster melt it was bomb diggity...girl even took my wet money with a smile

Read some reviews before you go, I would maybe give it 3 stars, but not much more than that. If your going to pay $25 for a lobster roll, it just needs to be better. Think strip mall lobster roll. Not enough butter on the roll (although it was good), lobster meat looked a little sad and not too much flavor. Fries half cold and a little pickle. Your better off finding a food truck that has legit lobster rolls and passion behind their product. This is a chain with all the chain flaws.

Gotta love Vegas. So much things to see & do that aren't available back home. Options are limitless really. So I just HAD to treat myself to a lobster roll. At $18.38 for a large it's pricey indeed. But they do give a lot of lobster so I guess the price is justified. Would I eat here again? Probably not, unless someone else is paying. But glad I got to try it out.  If your going to make a meal out of this I'd suggest you get it with fries to fill you up. I only ordered the lobster roll & was hungry in two hours.  Do wish they would put more tables out.

A fast food style Lobster Roll restaurant hiding in PH Miracle Mile Shops!  So I presume you are coming here for Lobster right??  How do the rolls compare to the ones I've tried in Boston/Maine recently?  Here's what I ordered : "Maine Style" Lobster Roll ($17): Touch of Mayo, Lemon, and Secret Spice Blend. This is very good! More seasoned than the ones I've had on the East Coast, but very flavorful with sweet and tender Lobster!   The others I have tried are all pretty simple and plain...just butter and maybe a touch of mayo.  You don't need much more than this to have a great roll!  But Lob ME does a nice spice/rub on their lobster, that adds a great taste to it, without being too distracting.    I saw they also have a cajun rub, which might be good...gives me a reason to come back and try it!  It might feel a little expensive at first, but these are actually cheaper than most places on the coast (avg was $20-25), even during lobster season!!  The fact that it is located in the center of the strip as well, makes the price seem very fair IMO!  Check it out and see for yourself :)  Pic :

It was pretty delicious I must admit. I bought the Maine roll w/ the lobster meat heated up. Omg, the sandwich was so on point. The lobster meat was so moist and juicy. I got it with the house chips and and the coleslaw. I love the chips, they had a slight salt and vinegar taste to me. I didn't even touch the coleslaw because it really didn't fit with the meal to me. My only complaint was that everything is so expensive compared to what you're getting. I know it's lobster, but I expect a lot paying 18.00 dollars for a sandwich with no drink.
The salad is a bit weird, but the lobster grilled cheese and Mac and cheese is amaaaaazing. It is a must have.

Tried the signature lobster roll (Cajun style), Lobster tacos, and the lobster on a stick(forgot the name).  Lobster roll was very well done but didn't really like the filler waffle fries.  The lobster tacos were 3  per order and mildly spicy. The loser of the   3 was the lobster tail on a stick which was little tough but not horrible.  Best to stay with the signature items like the rolls.
Yummy! For the love of Lobster! Fresh & Quick Lobster Salad! The grilled cheese lobster looks amazing!
Food is great I had the clam chowder soup and the lobster sliders and it was wonderful  Def recommending this place

Excellent lobster for a reasonable price!  We ordered the lobsicle (fried lobster in a tempura batter), lobster mac and cheese, and fries...worth every bite!  One star off for being in a location next to Fat Tuesday, a little hard to eat in their dining area with a long line for margaritas next to you.  Also, the lobsicle would have been great if there was more meat on it or perhaps 2 skewers, looked kinda small in my to go box.  However you like it, lobster you and Lobster ME!
Criss cut fries cold coleslaw sucked lobster was cooked well and A little on the dry side when I pay 25$ for a lo lobster roll the fries better be hot

4.5 stars! I'd been craving a deliciously buttered lobster roll for quite some time and when I turned the corner in the Miracle Mile mall I nearly lost it! So happy this place was as good as I had hoped it was.  I ordered their traditional roll, New England style and the hubby ordered loaded crab fries with lite cheese sauce. We both truly enjoyed it and I'm sure I'll be back before we leave! Only downsides-very limited seating and there was a bit of lobster shell in my meat :(but a little is typically expected) As for price, lobster rolls in my experience have always been a bit pricey, throw in the fact that you're eating in Vegas and the hefty price tag makes sense to me.

I'm a loyal Lobster Me fan. This is my 5th trip to Vegas this year and We manage to eat a lobster roll from here everyday of our trip. I could eat this everyday if I had the opportunity too. I've been to this location 3 times on my last visit and the third time was a memorable experience. Great customer service from the owner, manager, and staff. I would highly recommend Lobster Me over any of the other places. Really wish there was one in Chicago but I'll be back in August for more.

Came here on Wednesday... The portion and just the way the roll looked... was AMAZE balls.. But today which is Sat. ... The meat..  Small n the srevice kinda sucked. I guess if u wanna come here.. It's a hit or miss... Sadly to say.. Today a major miss.

The lobster grilled cheese was too cheesy and not enough lobster and the fries were not soft, but the lobster rolls are meaty and yummy. Good taste and good portion sizes. I wish swaying was a little better and employees had just a tad bit of a sense of urgency.

Meh! So so so disappointed!  I had expected some sort of luscious lobster claws in between some amazing buttery toasted roll but sadly this was not an option.  Having looked at other yelp reviews and pictures I decided it was time to give this place a shot.  Boy oh boy was this a disappointment!  I didn't eat all day in anticipation for this killer meal we had been salivating over for months.    Again, having seen the pictures posted on yelp I was under the impression that there would be multiple warm/hot lobster rolls.  Apparently they have changed their menu and now there is only one warm option with the lobster rolls.  They used to have 2 sizes of lobster rolls and now they have one.  There is a sign that reads "one pound of lobster in each roll". That was far from the truth!  My husband ordered the lobster roll and it was SO tiny!  I was shocked how small the roll was considering what we paid.  The bread was smaller than a home bought hot dog bun.  I opted for the lobster grilled cheese and upgraded to the chowder fries and a bottle of water for an additional $6.  My sandwich was $11 plus the $6.  The sandwich was tasty but not worth $11!  I liked the cheese on the sandwich but it wasn't oozing as one would hope when ordering a grilled cheese.  There was a small amount of lobster spread in between the 2 slices of what appeared to be Texas toast.  The chowder fries were so salty I really did not enjoy them and ended up throwing them away.  The chowder seemed like it was good but the cheese sauce was the salty issue!  In my opinion this restaurant is way overrated.    You can gain easy access to this place by parking in the Venetian parking garage and veering right as soon as you see the signs for the food court.  I find it very crappy that this fast food joint gives you the option to tip when you pay with a credit card.  Fast food is exactly that, fast food.  The tipping option for fast food is an insult.  This is counter service not traditional sit down table service.  You stand in line to order for goodness sake!  There are a few tables to sit at but mostly counter seating or an option to sit along their long high top table.  This seating option would force you to sit with strangers.  Being that this is Vegas, remember what happens here stays here o.o  We paid over $40 for what seemed like more of a snack and not our dinner.

The lobster cheese fries are exceptionally savory and flavorful. They are doused in a lobster-sherry-cheddar cheese mixture and topped with large nuggets of fresh lobster meat.   The lobster mac 'n' cheese was also very tasty; a simple shell pasta with a white-cheddar cheese base, covered in chunks of lobster.

This place is pretty awful. The food is horrendous. There was no flavoring in 5 of the 6 dishes I tried. The grilled cheese had a lot of sauce, but it was gross and extremely soggy. We pretty much threw everything away. Worse $100 spent. :(  Please don't come here. Save your money and go to Earl's Sandwich.

Highly over rated, nothing to talk about to your friends. The lobster roll were small for Vegas, the lobster bisque was thick and disgusting, the meat on the roll tasted like imitation lobster. Highly over priced, I can say that I will not be visiting Lobster me any time soon. The service was good enough, average.

Tried the lobscicle and lobster ice cream. Do you want the good news or the bad news first?  Okay bad news it is. The lobster ice cream I would never get AGAIN. The ice cream was great and fluffy and had large pieces of lobster in the ice cream. However, the actual lobster pieces did not taste great at all. The lobster pieces where very bland and too chewy and had to chew it for a while.  On to the good news. $14 + tax for a lobster tail, that's awesome. Comes out and it's smaller than I expected (but my expectations were too large for a lobster on a stick. come on bro. LOBSTER ON A STICK smh) The lobster on a tail was awesome. Great for a quick bite and an unique idea.   Try the LOBSCICLE !
Lobster here lobster there all i see is lobster.  This place is good but pricey but well worth it.  Get the lobster roll and mac and cheese they are amazing and you won't get disappointed

I ordered a lobsicle, chowder and old bay lobster roll. The food is not bad, and the lobster taste fresh. The lobsicle is worth a try, as you bite into it there's a nice crunch with good chunk of meat.

We got the Connecticut lobster roll and lobster grilled cheese. The roll is very small not worth the money but the lobster grill cheese was awesome and worth the price. We came back the next day and bought 2 orders for the road. Definitely would recommend making a stop here anytime your in the Miracle Shops or Planet Hollywood and need a simple quick meal.

I've had Lobster ME on my bookmarks list for ages.   I don't go to the strip often, and when I do, its usually to eat somewhere else.    Saturday, I was at the Miracle Mile shops doing some shopping for my wedding, and was STARVING by the time I'd found what I needed.    We had walked by Lobster ME on the way to the store, and I decided that I wanted to eat here.   I was a little overwhelmed with the choices...Lobster rolls, Lobster Mac n cheese, Lobster bisque, Grilled cheese with lobster...Its not a huge menu, but all of the options looked great!  I decided to go with the Original Maine Lobster Roll with soup and a drink.   The clam chowder was delicious.  Thick, hearty, and seasoned well.    I'd never had a lobster roll before, but this was really good.  The bread was like a Texas toast consistency, with a little bit of mayo and a HUGE helping of cold lobster meat, seasoned with Old Bay.    De.Licious.   The lobster was amazing, and flavorful. There was a ton of it, too!  The bread had a great consistency.    I'd gladly come back here the next time I'm on the strip.  It was really great.

I have been to Las Vegas very often. Passed by this place numerous times. I just couldn't find myself to try this. I know that they serve Lobster, but for 14 dollars for a small Lobsical stick, I passed. Today was different. I got to the palazzo real early and no other place was open, so I gave this place a try. Long story short, the food taste great, but not worth the money you paid for. I probably come back from time to time, but I wouldn't say that I love it.

Pretty much everything here has lobster, so of course it appealed to me. It was difficult for me to choose what to eat, but I decided on a lobster roll and the lobster bisque. Both were extremely good and filling. The one thing I was bummed about is that they served chips instead of french fries or tator tots.   That would be my recommendation to this place: make some dish with lobster and fries or tots!

The customer service here was awful. The cashier was beyond rude. If you don't like your job, or don't want to be at work then don't show up. I ordered the lobster roll, "Cajun" style, and all I got was dry lobster topped with green onions. No flavor what so ever. I don't even think they added the butter, and they for sure forgot the aioli. This was the worst $25 spent.

I ordered the soup and sandwich combo. I asked for the Connecticut (warmed meat) and the bisque. The lobster meat was like warm at best while the bisque had scant pieces of meat. The broth had a very "floury" taste while still being thin.   After reading the reviews, I found I could have gotten a locals discount. I was never asked if I had a Nevada ID or not. I returned to the register after I had finished, with my receipt and was given a refund for the local discount.   All in all it was "meh" at best. I wouldn't bother spending $25 on a Luke warm lobster sandwich with pasty tasting lobsterless bisque with a lemonade to drink. I ended up deconstructing the sandwich, adding the lobster to the bisque, to warm it up, and dunking the bread in the broth.  I'm just glad I didn't have my kids with me or I would have spent more to be disappointed.
Loved it!! Lobster mac and cheese was delightful and the lobster roll had chunks of lobster instead of sparse bits.

My friends and I split up looking for a snack. I found lobster me in the mall. It's a cute little shop that does lobster rolls, lobster fish and chips and varietys of other lobster things. I chose the lobster fish and chips with Cajun fries that comes with a complimentary coleslaw. YUMMY IN MY TUMMY. My friends were eating their chilli dogs and watching  me with envy. I devoured my meal. The lobster was tender not overcooked, the fries lightly seasoned to perfection and the coleslaw was sweet and cream just the way I liked it. My only complaint if the portion size was small. I know lobster is expensive but they could give your more fries and more slaw bump it up from 13 to 15. I was still a bit hungry afterwards. I regret not trying their lobster rolls they have hot and cold ones. They look like the real deal and Ronnie told me it's a full lobster in every roll.

I wanted to grab something quick and simple without having to walk so far (since I was staying in the Venetian), so I decided to try the Lobster Grilled Cheese sandwich.  I liked it, but don't know if I'd choose to order this again on my next visit.  I think I would rather stick to one of the lobster rolls.

I love lobster, so I thought the menu was fun. They have a variety of lobster food items, which you don't really see around much at a other places.  I tried the Cajun Lobster Roll, and although I expected it to be a little better, it was still good.  It was the first lobster roll I've ever tried and the most expensive sandwich I've ever tried, priced at about $19...but it is Vegas...

Giving this place a 2 star because the portions were ridiculously small for the price were ordered fish & chips and it was one piece of over cooked fish chopped into 3 pieces !! And fries I would not recommend this dish at all. Save your money. We also tried the main lobster roll and it tasted OK not amazing and if your gonna to pay close to 20$ for a sandwich the portions should be healthy and worth it !

Lobster was tasty, but the sandwich was "extra small".  Considering what you pay for, lobster sandwich combo, it leaves you feeling like you only had apps instead of a full meal.  Thank goodness for the "hidden pizza" joint at Cos.  =)

The only reason this place is surviving its because its vegas. Main reason for the bad review - the quantity. For $27+tax the size of the lobster roll was unacceptable. The lobsicle is a joke at $14+tax. The cajun fries were burnt and dripping with oil. The seating area is also like a food court. Food quality was okay. Better spend your money at Red Lobster or Crab corner in vegas - if you want seafood that is priced accordingly.

When in Vegas, must stop by Lobster Me which is located inside Planet Hollywood. I've tried the lobster roll sandwich at many locations but this is by far the best place. Try the original lobster roll with Cajun fries. This roll comes with chilled lobster meat with mayo and spice added. Since it's "lobster" price can be a bit higher than a normal sandwich. Still worth the bang for your buck!

The hubby and I were staying at the Elara so we were always passing by this place whenever we went anywhere. I LOVE lobster so we HAD to stop and give it a try.  We got the Connecticut style lobster roll + a cup of clam chowder and a drink for $21+tax.   The lobster roll was nice and buttery and the bread was nice and toasty, but still soft. I was surprised at the tenderness of the lobster and the subtle sweetness it had. The clam chowder was just aiet. I used to live on the East coast so no clam chowder compares, but it was nice and warm, which really hit the spot.  Yeah, it's a bit pricey for the amount of food you get, but what do you expect? It's lobster!
We had the lobster grilled cheese. It wasn't 100% lobster and the guy was honest when we ordered it. They filled it with crab also. But it was still delicious with the bacon inside. I'd go again.
Lobster rolls were amazingly delicious!  However the lobster mary was not impressive at all.  If you like a twisted tomato drink-- you might like it

For what it's worth, Lobster Me is a decent fast-casual place to eat. I've had the experience of having fresh seafood on the East Coast, and nothing on the West will ever compare to what you get in cities like Boston. But, I believe Lobster Me tries hard to make their seafood tasty, and what they do with their seafood works for them.   Conveniently located in Miracle Mile, I was able to walk here from my hotel room in about 5 minutes. Lobster Me is an order and pay at the counter type place, which worked for me!  All three people in my party who ate here ordered the Original Lobster Roll. This was their no frills roll -- filled only with lobster, a couple of their "house" spices and stuffed in a delicious piece of bread. Each roll was $24. Pricey, but you're in Vegas!  Our food came out in about 5 minutes. I really enjoyed my Lobster Roll and thought the lobster was fresh for Western standards and very tasty with all the spices they threw on the meat. But, the two other people that were eating with me were born and raised on the East Coast, and both of them said the lobster was only "ok". One of them didn't like the spices that they put on the lobster and she even picked some of the lobster pieces off and didn't eat them. We all agreed that the bread was delicious though.  We also ordered a side of fries and we all really liked the fries as well.  Overall, just your average seafood place. Nothing special, but nothing horrible either. Check it out when you're in Vegas since it's worth at least one visit!  Cheers!
I got the Beltway and it was delicious! Portions may be small for some people though, because I can't eat a whole lot in one sitting and I finished the whole thing.

Originally opened at The Grand Canal Shoppes in 2014, the location inside Miracle Mile dating back some three years prior, it was just past noon that a seat was taken at Lobster ME on Saturday, the Venetian Food Court even more packed than usual with several conventioneers and the Restaurant understaffed due to a manager being stuck behind a traffic incident on the I-15.  Embracing the quick-casual concept of places like Panera or Chipotle but said to offer only the best Lobsters out of Maine and Crab from Maryland, a bold claim for a food court counter in the middle of a city known for World Class Dining, Lobster ME is located just steps from the Grand Canal en route from the Parking Garage to the rest of the Resort and with hard to miss signage including a luminous Menu there is little to dislike about the layout featuring both reclaimed wood and buoys familiar to any who've been fortunate enough to dine at an actual Northeastern Lobster or Oyster Shack.  Greeted by a young man named AJ, he and another young woman doing their best to keep up with a heavy lunch surge including a couple who felt the need to ask at least three questions clearly explained on the menu overhead, it was after listening to him answer patiently for what felt like five minutes that the line finally advanced, a total of four items plus a bottle of water requested at a total charge of just over $50 including tax.  Giving each guest a number, seating at both the counter and nearby chairs occupied by visitors not necessarily eating Lobster ME's food, it was after less than ten minutes wait that AJ presented with the first of two handfuls of cardboard baskets, a first look at the 50/50 Lobster and Crab Roll showing it to be every bit as large as those in Connecticut or Maine and similar in price, the fresh Meat lightly tossed in Mayonnaise clean and sweet while the split, buttered and toasted Roll rivaled any found from Portland to Kittery and on down.  Doing an admirable job covering a lot of choices despite minimal space, the menu recently renovated and doing away with Desserts plus the "Deep Fried Clam Chowder" in favor of several new choices featuring Crab, it was most of the Roll gone that lunch moved on to Lobster ME's crispy Waffle Fries topped in Cheese, Crab Meat, Bacon, Green Onion and Ranch 'drizzle,' the last item completely unnecessary as it distracted from the quality of the Meat while the areas spared from it were entirely delicious.  Criticized for its value by some, the laid-back environment likely leading many to make false assumptions as not one item on the menu is more expensive than one would expect to pay on either coast, it was with three Tacos charged at about $6 each that taste buds were once again treated to fresh ingredients including Battered Shrimp and Fish that both overflowed their Shells beneath housemade spicy Aioli before finally finishing up with three "Fried Lobster Mac n' Cheese Balls," the golden orbs each nearly twice the size of a Golf ball and absolutely packed with picked Meat alongside tender pasta in Lobster Cheese Sauce with more on the side for dipping.  **** Recently upgrading the menu and presentation but doing away with Desserts, a decision likely made due to slow sales but nevertheless misguided as every Seafood Shack from Connecticut to Maine offers at least Soft Serve and Whoopie Pies, Lobster ME does an otherwise excellent job of replicating their signature item while also offering several additional novelties intended to appeal to diverse tastes.

First time at this place and food was delicious.  Husband and I shared The Connecticut and chowder fries. We paid about $26 and our meal came with a drink. Sandwich is a bit smaller than we expected but very good, stuffed with lots of tasty crab.If you are craving seafood this will definitely satisfy. Will be returning for more lobster!

Did not enjoy my lobster roll at all. I got it New England style and the meat was tasteless and had a texture like it came out of a can. This was a total waste of $24 and space in my stomach. The bread was fresh, but had no butter on it nor was it toasted or put on a grill. Tasted like someone opened a bag of bread and just placed a handful of canned lobster meat in it with a sprinkle of chives. Blah!

I've worked for a fish market with chefs that prepare fresh lobster in a variety of awesome ways and this place was ok.  for the price it wasn't anything special as far as taste or value.  most of the lobster seemed to be overcooked so I feel like their times for cooking things were off.  The lobster mac and cheese was a very cheesy dish where you could barely distinguish the lobster on top because the cheese sauce was so sharp.    the lobster and chips had deep fried lobster pieces that were completely dry and chewy from being overcooked.  I did not try their lobster roll but based on the "specialties" I can't imagine it being anything special.  according to my car mates the lobster grilled cheese was pretty good and their fries were alright.  For lobster the prices were ok so I guess this is what happens when you try to take a high end food ingredient to the fast food arena where precision and expert preparation are hard to achieve.

Read the reviews on here & was excited to try this place out..... But was completely disappointed. Food was over priced to begin with, but it was really bad when I took a bit of my sandwich & it tasted like the lobster had been soaked in kitchen cleaner. It made me instantly sick. I would never eat here again.

I love lobster and this place was so disappointing. I got the lobster Mac and cheese and it was sooo watery. Plus the portion was very small for the price. It did have enough lobster but it wasn't great. I would not recommend this place.

For fast food joint that serves lobster exclusively in the middle of the desert, this place is pretty good.   On a mission to have a quick snack and proceed to get our drunk on, Lobster Me was conveniently situated by Fat Tuesday and looked extremely intriguing. I mean, if you love lobster, can you really turn this place down?  We had a lobsicle which was well breaded, was cooked well and tasted delish!  This was a great place to stumble upon. It's a great hidden gem on the Strip!

3 friends and I stopped by after shopping until we dropped. Seating is not the easiest unless you're alone, My friend and I ordered the Truffle roll [$19] and after being seated we were told they didn't have any more truffle. . . which was disappointing because it was the only roll that was appealing to me. Recina, offered to change our roll so we both ordered the Maine. Which does not look like the framed post on the restaurant wall BTW. Although the Maine roll was 17$, a little cheaper [i know 2$] we were not reimbursed or anything. nbd.  Each roll came with chips or fries and coleslaw. i had the Maine Roll with warm meat is quite bland, I'm a big fan of all things Lobster, i didn't squeeze the lemon on it until i was about half way. . .big mistake the lemon is a definite necessity!  The lemon makes it perf! I tasted each condiment on the table with my roll. Ketchup was ok, Sriracha was funky but good with the Lobster, and Vinegar was alright if you like that kind of thing.

so this is only for the lobsticle!  I saw the sign outside and thought it was pretty creative so i decided to give it a try (i love lobster)  the lobster on a stick (lobsticle) was around 15 bucks plus the taxes, which i think is pretty high but its vegas i guess,   it took about 10 minutes to get ready and they bring it to your table  it was reallly hot and juicy. It wasnt too chewy or anything and it was fried. fried makes everything taste better....but its lobster, its going to be good regardless, dip it in the butter and add some lemon juice and your going to love it!

I was smitten when I had my first lobster grilled cheese at Planet Hollywood. Although that wasn't on the menu this trip, the lobster melt was an upgrade. The amount of lobster was great. It tasted fresh and succulent. The mac and cheese was to die for. It was creamy and full of flavor. I had some of my friend's chips, and they were tasty too. My whole party enjoyed it so much, they came back the next day before they left Vegas. The water they had tasted good and filtered, and that gets a star as well.

My friend really wanted to do and try this place because she heard many great things about it. For the price you pay, the amount given is a bit shady. I ordered the lobster mac & chz & my friend ordered one of their lobster rolls. We took it Togo because we were tired from walking around all day and wanted to relax.   The Mac & chz was kind of bland to me with a strong lobster flavor. The more I ate it, the more I got kind of grossed out because the lobster taste overpowered everything. The mac & chz itself wasn't all that great either. It tastes like the premed Bob Evans mac & chz you buy at the grocery store that you just pop in the microwave.  My friend got the lobster roll, I forgot which one It was. The roll was literally like 3 inches long. & about 2 oz of lobster chunks. It also came with a side of chips & coleslaw (which she never received).  Overall, this place is not worth it. Save your money and go elsewhere!

Lobster + Fast Food = Lobster Me!  I stumbled upon Lobster Me while walking through the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood and was craving an open faced lobster sandwich, so I thought why the heck not! The employees taking your order are very friendly, patient, and are very informative about their products. I ordered their large Lobster Roll, my sister ordered the Lobster Mac & Cheese, my other sister ordered a Shrimp Sandwich and my mom ordered the Lobster Ceviche. The total was $70 + which is quite expensive, but I guess that the price you have to pay for lobster!   Lobster Roll on an open faced toasted bun - Good, but definitely not like the ones we have in the Bay Area! The lobster didn't seem as fresh and to be honest, I thought it was sort of dry. I wouldn't skip it and would definitely give it a try if you're craving lobster.  Lobster Mac & Cheese - OMG so good! The dish was perfectly creamy and I was surprised to find a ton of lobster pieces, which was really nice for the price you pay! I could seriously eat this all day.  Shrimp Sandwich - I thought it was going to be fried shrimp, but I was very wrong. The shrimp on an opened faced sandwich was quite disappointing as I found the shrimp to taste frozen and definitely not fresh. Don't quote me on the frozen shrimp, but the shrimp was nowhere near fresh!  I didn't get to try the Lobster Ceviche, but my mom said she hated it. $70 for fast food lobster is no bueno, but it was nice to see a fast food seafood option in the Miracle Mile Shops! I'll probably skip Lobster Me the next time and look for a better option on the Strip.
Very good nice place food is very delicious  Really  recommend this to if you came In to Las Vegas

I was in Las Vegas to visit my daughter on 12/17/17 and really really really wanted to try Lobster Me. First problem is location, you guys should let customer know that this restaurant is located inside the mall. I drove around for an entire hour looking for a building not a spot in the mall. my second issue was my lobster roll, the lobster had no taste at all, not buttery, no salt just meat on a roll. the Lobster Popsicle was great. mac and cheese balls didn't have a lobster crumb in them. Thanks for the experience. I might try them again if they open a store outside the mall.

Loved every bite of it. This was my first time and despite the negative reviews I truly enjoyed the lobster roll. I ordered Cajun while my hubby wanted to stick to the traditional one and we must say...we finished it in about 5 mins. The fries are okay and the service was great. The cashier Cathy was friendly and attentive even after we received our order. The location is located inside the miracle mile mall next to Fat Tuesday. There's not really an exclusive eating area but we were in and out for a quick bite within 10-15 mins. Looking forward to trying their lobster bisque and lobster mac and cheese. Definitely will be coming again.
The roll is like a Texas toast it's not very big. There is not a lot of lobster for the price you pay.

If you've been to lobster shacks in New England, you'll understand how they keep it casual. You pay about $17-19 for a lobster roll and good luck finding a spot to sit. This is why I like Lobster ME - it's all that but with shorter lines.  You get a 20% discount if you're a local. Sorry, tourists, go to a buffet instead.  Original Maine Lobster Roll: Cold lobster in mayo and spices. The mayo they put is very light. Buttery roll. 4/5  Connecticut Lobster Roll: Warm lobster with butter. Buttery roll. Simple but delicious. 4/5  Truffle Lobster Roll: Chilled lobster with truffle aioli, celery, carrots and arugula. Probably the "healthiest" roll on their menu. Hint of truffle and not overly dressed. 4/5

So now that I've been to New England, I'm writing a more fair review. I've more respect and appreciation for Lobster ME. They've changed many things since the last time I've been here. New menu items! The freezer in front where they house their lobster ice cream is now in the back. That ice cream was the reason I fell out of love for this place.  Price-wise, it's inexpensive for the amount and quality of lobster you get on their lobster rolls...and you're saving money for not having to take a trip to New England! They'll charge you the same price for a lobster roll in New England anyway. $17 for a regular Maine-style lobster roll or $23 for large. But wait, if you're local, you get 20% off!   The bun on the lobster roll is buttery and toasted. Generous amounts of lobster with large claws on top. From their new menu, I tried garlic fries. It was very garlicky, yum!   And now the Benadryl is kicking in...can't write anymore. Zzz...

I'm a big lobster lover, so I was really excited when I came across this place at the Miracle Mile Mall. I ordered the Old Bay Lobster Roll, which came with fries. I also ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese cause I was curious to see how it tasted.  The lobster roll was good, not great. Kinda small for the price. The Mac and Cheese was also good, but not great. They use the shells for the mac and cheese. But consider the food I got and the price I paid, NOT worth it.  Far too expensive.

GREAT lobster roll which lots of chunks of lobster. The one thing that was a huge disappointment was the lobster mac and cheese. I love the type of pasta they used for this, but the cheese and sauce was not good. It made the mac and cheese super heavy and unable to finish it.

My friend and I went here during our trip to Las Vegas. Price was $43 for the lobster roll and crab roll (Cajun style) with a side of fries. Bread was good which is why I'm giving it a two stars.   Otherwise, the lobster was over cooked and the Cajun style was way too salty. Will not be returning.

Looking for a fast and tasty lobster roll full of tasty lobster meat? Look no more Lobster ME serves up tasty lobster rolls on buttery rolls and lobster meat cooked to perfection. Service is friendly and service is fast (or it was on the day I went). Would recommend this place to anyone who is in the Mile Shops and craving some tasty lobster.
Pretty weak, had lobster roll and lobster bisque...no real meat in soup to speak of.... Shrimp tacos were god lobster roll ok ...ho hum..
Overpriced over hyped!! Average lobster roll for twice the cost!!! Don't waste your money!! Also they charge you $1 for tap water.

BEST ever LOBSTER ROLL! I've had Lobster Rolls in San Diego, Santa Monica and now at this Lobster ME location in Las Vegas (Planet Hollywood) and THIS LOBSTER ROLL IS THE BEST! The meat is succulent, juicy, flavorful and fresh. If you're going to spend $18 on a sandwich, know that for a Lobster Roll, this one is worth it. It also comes with Kettle chips and cole slaw. Ok, the cole slaw is more like a tasting (size wise) that you'd get at Costco but it's not what I came here for so not a big deal. Back to the Lobster Roll...you MUST try it if you like seafood and Lobster in particular.   Seating wise...it is off of the strip and we came in on a Saturday evening (10pm-ish) so it was quite packed which is why we took ours to go. It's more counter service than a sit down place unless you can find an open seat that seems to cater to both Lobster Me and Fat Tuesday which is literally next door -it's a food court so you take your chances on seating, other than that, the food was worth standing in line and waiting. Give it a try!
Excellent and friendly staff. You can't go wrong with a delicious Connecticut Roll. Located in the Miracle Mile shops in Planet Hollywood.

YES! Lobster without having to visit one of the Vegas buffets! I came here with a friend after shopping around the Miracle Mile. Located right next to Fat Tuesdays...I ordered the original "Maine style" lobster roll with chowder fries ($26). While the meal was a little pricey, I think it was worth it. I did not feel the glutoney of eating at a seafood buffet and still had some leftover.   The roll was buttered and the lobster was adequately seasoned. Despite being a little soggy, the chowder fries were good. My friend ordered the lobster grilled cheese and the lobster bisque. The grilled cheese did not look as pictured, but the lobster bisque was amazing.    Want a lobster roll? Go here.   P.S. Check-in on Yelp to get a free lemonade when you order a lobster roll =)
Next to fat tuesday. We only ordered cajun garlic fries, OVERLY tossed in garlic. all of us liked it though, but wow, it was a kick. no long wait, it came out fast.

Yum!  I'm glad my husband and I gave this place a shot. It's in the miracle mile at planet Hollywood.  Their is limited seating but you do have the option of eating in or take out.   Obviously their specialty is lobster and the lobster rolls looked delicious but pricey. They also have something called a lobscicle which was featured on some channel like a&e.   We ended up getting a lobster grilled cheese  sandwich and the clam chowder fries. The sandwich was delicious!  The right amount of lobster and the bread was crisp. And the clam chowder fries were sooo good!  The portion is small though.   I'm definitely coming back the next time in Vegas. Apparently they have one at the Venetian/ Palazzo too. I might get the clam chowder soup by itself and I would like to try the lobscicle.
It's pricey but very good and flavorful. Must stop when I am in Vegas. Finally took the Wife here and she loved it. Will come back here next month

Enjoyable spot for a quick bite and well, let me acknowledge the fact that they are serving Maine lobster rolls which aren't available many places outside of Maine. However, the experience was lackluster. The lobster was good however not great. The description stated that it would be served warm however it was room temperature. The coleslaw and pickle were both crisp and delicious, the perfect accompaniments. As busy as it was, obviously a lot of folks may rate it more favorably nevertheless I'm sticking to 3 stars. I'll need to fly to Maine to try Bite of Maine lobster rolls which are rated 4.8 stars and probably cost less than $23 plus tax & tip. Then there's airfare...okay, I'll try Lobster Me again to sample the crab and shrimp choices because it's accessible, good and offers unique menu items.

I had the lobster grilled cheese sandwich. It was pretty good, but it would be better if they spread the cheese and lobster out to the edges of the sandwich too. Towards the center of the sandwich it felt too cheesy. Even it out please! Clam chowder fries were delicious! Yum!

What a rip off! I can't say that strongly enough! You pay 19 dollars expecting more than a piece of toasted Texas toast folded in half with maybe a couple ounces of lobster in it. What a joke! If I would have known how small it was for 19 DOLLARS, there is no way in hell I would have paid that. Very misleading.

Just don't do it...unless you love bland food then this is right up your alley.  Order the Maine Lobster roll and the lobster mac.  It looks amazing when you get it, wanted to sink my teeth in it immediately.  So I did and then began the stream of disappointment.  First neither had any flavor and only got it after I drenched it with Sriracha....your best friend here.  The way the lobster sit in the roll, which it actually sits basically on top of the roll.  They need to figure a way pack it better then my $24 sandwich meat wouldn't fall off the roll and land on the table.  I thought about the 3 second rule and then decided against it and left that lil guy there.  Its funny how I'm sitting here thinking how my subway sandwich last night was so much better than this meal.
$30.00 cold frys all bread chopped in fine pieces just crap very overpriced don't waste your time here go to Luke's at fashion show mall

Yummy Cajun lobster roll and chips. My friend got the lobster salad and lobster bisque. Both were really good and hit the spot. It is a bit pricey but so good. When I come back in February I will bring my husband here. The food is really good and the service is good.

Actually came across this place by accident and was so grateful. The food here was amazing. I had the Cajan Roll and the Lobster Mac n Cheese. So delicious. Next time I'm back in Vegas, I'm getting me a Lobster Roll.
This was okay for a lobster roll. It was a little bland for me. I Ordered the Cajun roll. And it was the best out of the rest.
Nice, quick bite to eat while out and about.  Good flavor and inexpensive. $8 for 12 ounces of lobster chowder.

Very tasty lobster tacos and fish ceviche. Especially for a takeaway counter in a food court. Good size portions not shy of lobster. Only weird thing - there was a piece of a stick in one of my tacos. Looks like a broken piece from a lobster pop? Still, I would def go back.

The food was pretty good, I expected more lobster for the price we paid but it's Las Vegas so what do you expect. The location was good because we walked by and immediately wanted to try it, but seating was pretty much nonexistent. If you don't mind taking the food Togo, that would be your best option.

In my boyhood days I spend a lot of time in New England, specially Maine. The Lobstaa (Lobsters) are just one of a kind. But since past 27 years I live in West, Southwest and in mostly desert, I miss Maine Lobstaa Rolls. I was only so happy to find this place in Las Vegas, where they really fly in Maine Lobsters everyday and make the best Lobster rolls both ME and CT style. It pairs well with cocktails they have and my favorite is Casco Bay. Try out for lunch, a lobster roll and a drink with set you back around $30. But trust me folks that's the best money you will spend in a long time. I highly recommend this place.  Just don't take your selfie stick, because other customers will hate you.

I absolutely love this place! I feel like a kid in a candy store here, but in this case, a Lobster store. Portions are a bit on the small side but the food tastes great! I highly recommend the Lobster Cheese fries as they are absolutely delicious!  The shrimp and lobster tacos are also very tasty and both are served on soft corn tortillas.  If you like soup, their lobster bisque is out of this world. Creamy and rich this soup will have you rolling your eyes in the back of your head.  Lobsicles are really good, both breaded and naked but you might need two of them as they are on the smaller side.
Food was great. Will be back soon. Service was great. Love the lobster corn  and the lobster roll

Kind of expensive for a quick lunch in Vegas, but it's lobster and it's Vegas, so the prices really shouldn't be much of a surprise. Unfortunately, the food itself wasn't super impressive and it's hard to justify spending spending $15-$20 here when you can get a sandwich at Earl's for $7 without having to leave Planet Hollywood.  I ended up getting the lobster grilled cheese since I didn't really want to shell out $17 for a small lobster roll and shared an order of chowder fries.   -LOBSTER GRILLED CHEESE ($11) - 3.5/5 Contrary to some other Yelpers, I thought there was a reasonable amount of lobster in my grilled cheese. And there were actual chunks of lobster instead of just all shredded. The bread was buttery but lacked the crispness from perfectly toasted bread. The cheese was warm and melted for the most part, but the texture was a lot creamier than I expected (like mayo or cream cheese) rather than gooey.  -CHOWDER FRIES ($7) - 4/5 Thick fries with a generous topping of chowder, tomato, bacon, cheese and parsley. Fork needed though because the fries get kind of soggy and aren't sturdy enough to hold up the chowder and toppings.

If you like lobster, this is the place to come! The lobster roll rocks! I would be giving this place 5 stars, but they changed their menu lately and only have small lobster rolls now. Bring back the big one!   Also, I think the bread changed too. It's not as tasty as it used to be. Still an awesome roll, but compared to before, it dropped a star.

Ordered the Cajun lobster roll, came out quick and had a good buttery flavor, very little heat/spice so don't let that scare you away. It was pretty good but not sure if it was $20 good. Nice view, watching people stand in line at Fat Tuesdays waiting to get hammered!

this is inside the Planet Hollywood shops-towards the bend.  if you like lobster then you will enjoy earing a sandwhich from here. nothing fancy, just lotsa lobster seasoned in butter and chives and drenched with cheese and the smashed inside a roll. combe with fries and a drink will cost you 25 bucks ...taste hella bomm tho!
Mario was amazing super friendly nice and clean restaurant perfect for quick stop or just to hang out drink a beer and chat!!
This is so good! I get one every time I'm in Vegas! Although, I wish the lobster were a bit warmer if I'm ordering a hot sandwich.

Stopped for a quick lunch, had a coupon in the AAAmiracle mile book for 20% off . We got the lobster grilled cheese with fries, a grilled fish taco and the Mac and cheese lobster balls. It was all good but the grilled lobster grilled cheese was more like mashed mystery seafood in a piece of cheese between Texas toast. Is not get that again but try something else. Price was about average for the meal but the discount made it more palatable . We will go again - the lobster Bloody Mary is on my list ! It does look fantastic

Soooo, at my favorite quick lobster spot here in Vegas, and they recently changed their menu. By the time I figured it out I had this saucy lobster roll. The manager, Kevin came  out and started talking to me asking how everything was and we started talking about the changes in the past few months. He brought me a new lobster roll after I ate most of the other, at no charge! They are so awesome here. The original goodness in dry rub, chives and plain old Lobster! I love it! Check out his spot. I've been coming since 2013! You will not be disappointed. Thanks Kevin! Excellent customer service, you rock!

I am a HUGE seafood lover and I was so happy to have stumbled across this while wandering the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. My friend and I split the XLarge Lobster roll combo @ $25 (we substituted the fries for tots) and the Lobster Mac and Cheese @ $9. I was afraid they would be skimpy with the lobster, but there was plenty of it on the two dishes. Yes it can be pricey but it was well worth it. They have a lot of other things on the menu that I would love to try next time I'm in town: Lobster & Waffles, Lobsticle (lol) and maybe even the lobster ice cream! :D Definitely yummy food. I'm a fan!

Lobster everything, lobster rolls, lobster mac and cheese, even a fried lobster on a stck they call a lobsicle!  This place, inside the mircle mile shops, has a small but strong menu with a really good lobster roll.   I tried the lobster blt, applewood smoke bacon stips, lobster, mayo, lettuce and tomato. Very good!  My husband got the original lobster roll with secret spice blend, both came on toasted split top bun.  We also got a bowl of clam chowder, served in sourdough bread bowl, yummy, a large amount of clams, small chunks potato, very good.   Limited table sitting, very busy area, free refills but gotta ask and very good food, just a little pricey!

I ordered the Lobster grilled cheese which came with waffle fries.  It was ok, the bread to lobster was way off in my opinion and lacked flavor.  I wouldn't order it again. My least favorite dining experience during my trip to Las Vegas.  On the plus side, the service was good - very quick with delivering your food to you.
Omg!!! This place is addictive. Im from Louisville ky and im visiting and this is my second visit in 4 days....I wiah we had this at home

I'm a huge fan of lobster and lobster rolls. Ordered a lobsicle and lobster roll looking for something amazing. Unfortunately, lobsicle ($16) was pretty small for the price and lobster roll ($24) had a way higher bread to lobster ratio than desired. For a place that makes just lobster rolls, I really expected more esp for the cost. Luke's Lobsters, and even chains like Legal Seafood, do a better job. That said service was great. But I'd rather my money go to more lobster.

Late night, I was craving something to eat and this place caught my eye - after moving from Boston, I just love getting lobster rolls when I can because I miss them so much. I ordered a lobster roll that came with fries and coleslaw. Service was pretty slow considering there was one other table of two sitting there waiting. The fries were just ok, coleslaw wasn't very good, and the lobster roll was very bland. Looking back, the guy taking the order asked what sauce I wanted on it and I said I'd just do the butter sauce to keep it traditional and let the lobster shine. Maybe this place's specialty is the fun sauce they top the rolls with because I felt like the roll was lacking in flavor. The lobster tasted fresh, but it really needed the squeeze of lemon to make me want to bother to eat it. Later both my boyfriend and I didn't feel so hot and this was the only thing we ate....so I'm left to assume it was this lobster roll.
is a ok,  expect to pay 40$ for two.  The food is good but the portion is small it dont feel like a pound of lobster on the roll like the ad say.

If you are looking for a lobster fix, but not looking for something fancy, this is it.  The traditional roll is just as I remember it from growing up in New England.  Not much mayo  (Good thing).  The lobster flavor comes through.  Best to get the meal deal for just $3.00 more you get the fries and a drink.  The fries are nicely seasoned.    This is not an everyday place as it is about $20 per person, but good.
I love this place. It is such a creative way of eat lobster. And it tasted great. I put a picture in here so u can see they weren't cheap with lobster. .I just wish they had more of a menu. .
Overpriced? Yeah...but it was good and most of Vegas is overpriced.   Recommend  Bucket of import beers Cajun season fries

'Cheap' lobster?! Only in Vegas I suppose.  You get what you pay for. The lobster isn't the freshest, but it's not bad at all, and it's a good value for what you pay for.  I didn't opt for the lobster roll, but it looked pretty good.  RANDOM but this place showed the best customer service I had in Vegas this time around. The 2 cashiers we came across were nice and chatty (not invasive and awkward at all!) They must like working here :) =======  We got: Lobster bisque ($9) - comes in a sourdoughbread bowl and serves 2. Comes piping hot. Wish there was more lobster flavor, but hey, can't complain for the price. It was a'ight.  Lobster tacos ($14) - meh. I was trying to be a taaaaaaad healthier but regretted it right away. The lobster was kinda dry (I mean, I wasn't expecting it to be fresh.. but still - again, fair for the price) and the tortilla/salsa was pretty whatever. The salsa came in a small serving cup and was probably canned. It comes with chips so it makes it seem like it's a better deal, I didn't have any though. The portion was pretty satisfying.  Chowder fries ($7) - THIS WAS MY FAVORITE THING! It's just chunky fries with cheese and clam chowder, simple but oh, so good (not good FOR you of course..). The fries were big and seemed double-fried so it held up to the chowda and cheese. The flavor was spot-on. I would return just for this.. and MAYBE to try the lobster roll.

I liked it! I got a lobster roll, it was kinda expensive, but the quality of the lobster and amount of lobster exceeded my expectations.  My other friend got the lobster mac 'n cheese, it was a little bland, it definitely needs a dimensional characteristic whether it's heat or truffle or something.  We tried Tabasco and ketchup ...sort of did the trick.  My other friend got the lobster grilled cheese which reminded me of a tuna melt.  He wolfed it down and we didn't even get offered bites, so my guess is it was good :).  Servers were very friendly & fast!

I love trying weird foods.  The very mention of such an opportunity will make me pop up like a meerkat, alertly demanding to know the "Whats" and "Wheres" of such a possibility.  Mind you, I'm not going to eat anything like sour cream and onion flavored crickets (which are quite horrifyingly real, and I saw a pack of some this week), but I'm pretty open.  Cue Lobster Me.  I love seafood quite a bit, and have been wanting to try this for months, but I started normally with their lobster bisque.  Served in a bread bowl, and chock full of yummy lobster meat, I devoured it, and quickly.  It was quite good.  Then came the "weird".  Lobster ice cream.  I know.  Fish and ice cream.  It doesn't sound like it would be a good combo.  But it was actually very sweet with just a hint of a salty aftertaste.  And there are decently sized chunks of lobster in the ice cream, but they aren't "fishy" or overwhelming in flavor.  Meal selections seem to be about $8-10 an item, so select a choice or two and go (sharing works, too).  I want to try their lobster mac 'n' cheese next, and a few other menu choices.  Not a regular dining selection, but a returnable venue for me.  The concept may not work for everyone, but I had fun trying something that made more than a few friends raise their eyebrows at me.

"Lobster Me" was a smash hit for me. Although there were many passer byes as you ate, I didn't even notice because the lobster roll had all of my attention. It was a little pricey but nevertheless worth the cost. In fact, I took one for the road.

I had dinner here while on a business trip to Vegas. I picked it because I love lobster and a fast casual lobster restaurant sounded perfect after a long day.  I ordered their classic lobster roll, which was $17 including chips and cole slaw. Expensive by New England standards, but hey, it's Vegas and lobsters don't exactly grow on trees around here. :-)  The sandwich was very tasty, albeit a bit on the small side, again by New England standards, but it was adequate for a meal. The lobster was sweet and tender, and there was quite a lot of meat and just the right amount of seasoning. The chips tasted home made, as did the slaw. Service was fast.  I didn't try the lobsicle, which is one of their featured items (think lobster tail on a stick that you dip in butter) but some people sitting next to me ordered one and it looked yummy. Be aware, however, that it's a really little lobster tail...like 2 or 3 ounces tops.   All in all, Lobster ME delivered a very tasty, above average fast casual meal. Definitely give it a try if you're hankering for lobster and don't want to spend $50++ for it at a fine dining establishment.

Lobster Me is lobster heaven! I know this is considered fast food, but it is really good.  My bf and I both got a fried lobstercicle. It was a nice sized tempura battered fried lobster skewer with a side of drawn butter. The lobster tasted fresh and was sweet and yummy. We had an order of Cajun fries,  mainly because it came with our entree. We also got an order of lobster Mac and cheese. It had quite a bit of lobster in it and the pasta was nicely flavored. We planned to go back the next day to try more items, but didn't make it. The food wasn't expensive and was pretty quick. The only draw back was that it was a bit crowded and there were limited seats. Since it is sort of food court like, when we did find a seat,  we had to clean it off ourselves.

Bought a 12 oz lobster bisque soup, stated with chunks of lobster? I could hardly found even one teaspoonful of finely chopped in that small container, it's deceiving! Definitely not worth for $10.00!
Pretty damn good flavor but could stand to be a lot larger and a whole lot less expensive. But what the hell, it's Vegas!

I came to Las Vegas with my husband, who is here for business, so I'm on my own during the day.  I was walking around the Miracle Mile Shops and was looking for something for lunch.  I saw Lobster Me and decided to get the Original Maine Lobster Roll Combo.  It was delicious and loaded with lobster !!!  I agree that it's pricey, but it is lobster, and I've had more expensive lobster rolls that were not as good as this was !!   All the workers there were extremely nice, so that just topped it off for me.  I'll be back for another lobster roll, with my husband, this week before we leave Vegas.

I think all the different lobster sandwiches are about the same with different toppings. My friend said they give more lobster meat then other places. It was tasty and when you need that lobster fix it was just the thing. The French fries were more salty then I would have liked them. The coleslaw was boring and bland. The lemonade was good and of course sweet which means lots of sugar.

Great place if you like lobster.  It is in a mall with a few tables next to a bar, so not sit down and be served type of place.  The food was really good and I will eat there again.  only negative was the long island ice tea wasn't that great, should have gotten that from the bar next door.  Hope they bring one of these restaurants to Hawaii.

Egh! Probably wont be coming back. At least not for lobster rolls. So before I used to pay about $22 for a lobster roll incl. Soda + fries. Now all of that is $30.31. Lol I'm not picky with money but I'm not gonna over pay. Thanks for taking out the salt in those fries to a moderate amount. Technically the food was good but a bit too much.
