A few changes to the restaurant. Which it does look nice btw. But the price... Youch! Lol  The guy at the counter was a little rude for a short guy. Lol i can get passed that.   The Cajun lobster roll was good. The change to the fries is very nice. And as always the pickle is great to have along with coleslaw. But $30.31 for it. Well I'd rather give that in tips not for one sandwich.   The shrimp roll was fried battered inside but very little amount of it for $18. The person I was with had it. Though I'm sure it was good.  I cant give 4 stars its pricey now and the counter guy kept staring at us.   But it was great being a customer.

Lobster on a stick! Yum!!!  Their lobster grilled cheese should be called Only Grilled Cheese. No Lobster what so ever, and for $11 I was expecting some lobster at least at one point in my sandwich.  3 stars just for being ok.

My wife and I found this place wandering through the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood.  We ordered the Fish and Chips plus a Lobster Roll.  Since I checked in on Yelp they also gave me a free beer!  The service was a little slow as there was only one Waitress/Cashier/Expediter but she was doing her best and served us with a smile.  The food itself was very good as the lobster tasted fresh and not covered in mayo.  The bun was buttered lightly just enough to give his a nice crust and taste but not too much to make it soggy.  The fish and chips were not soggy and did not have any oily residue.    Overall for a quick bite to eat and looking for a seafood option this is the place to go!

I was very disappointed went there Saturday May 21 at 2 pm sat at the bar for 5-7 minutes while the staff stood around, never coming to take our order or even acknowledge that we were there. We had to walk around the counter to another area to order  We ordered classic lobster roll and a Garden Salad with lobster the cost was over $35.00. I never write reviews and always give restaurants the benefit of the doubt. But you only sell 1 product it should be good and plenteous, the lobster was flavorless and sparse on both the roll and the the salad didn't have more than an once of some shredded lobster. Way over priced.
Good dining -- actual lobster rolls! Good quality, even when compared to CT and ME. And real lobster bisque! Blueberry lemonade was amazing, to top it off.
Connecticut Lobster Roll is amazing! My favorite fast food ever! The chips that come with it are very yummy too!
AJ (I think) at the counter is really nice and treats customers great! Food was pretty good!

$33 (double meat) for a lobster roll with fries and coleslaw and a drink. The fries and slaw were fine but the lobster seemed a bit whack. Not a lot of flavor happening. If I would have paid $6 for the meal then we'd be talking maybe 4 stars. Even without the ridiculous price, I was thoroughly underwhelmed with this meal.
Had the original style maine style lobster roll, chowder fries, and lobster mac and cheese. The lobster roll was good. Chowder fries not bad. Lobster mac n cheese was awesome!
I think the place is great, the cashier recommended the lobster fries and the 50/50 Lobster crab roll. Food was really good, but not great. I think if you love lobster you will enjoy this place.
The lobster roll was really phenomenal. That being said, it was $19 and the lobster bisque wasn't all that good.
Lobster Roll on fire!!'  I secretly wanted to go back and order another roll to stuff in my purse for later, but I didnt want anyone to to judge me ;-/

Stopped here for a quick bite before getting on a plane and leaving Sin City.  Had the lobster and chips which were very crispy and flavorful, and a nice cold Blue Moon.  Oh and how could I forget the lobster ice cream...that's right, they have ice cream with chunks of lobster in it.  You HAVE to try just so that you can tell people that you've had it!

Being from the Midwest, I've had my fair share of fried things on a stick. I also love lobster when done right. When we passed "Lobster Me" in the Miracle Mile, we actually joked about the billboard advertising the "lobsicle". A lobster tail on a stick battered and deep fried sounded strange and intriguing all at once. On our way back through I decided to go for it adding a new tally to my fried food on a stick resume. Let me tell you how happy this experience made me. I know I know. It's just food but OH MY!!!!! The food gods have showered us with an amazing concept that has blown me away.        The "lobsicle" is the perfect size lobster tail speared on a wooden stick, battered and fried to perfection. It's served with a lemon wedge and cup of melted butter. My lobsicle was cooked perfectly and so tender. I couldn't believe the frying process didn't turn it to unedible rubber. The only negative I can come up with is that Lobster Me closes at 11pm and I can't go get more RIGHT NOW!!!      If you're looking for a quick, affordable and sinfully delicious new treat give this a try.
Sooooooooooo freakin delicious!! One star away from 5 bc of the price. Pretty expensive. But it is Vegas and it is lobster. So I say it's absolutely worth it!   P.S. I was sober eating this. :)

My son loves lobster. So when a friend of mine told me about this place; I took my son there.   There was no line when we arrived , so we took our time to look at the menu. A blond hair Asian cashier stood behind the counter right by the register. She seem very impatient, instead of offering to explain the menu; she rushed us to order, and asked us twice "are you guys ready to order?" When there is no one behind us.   She took our order, did not explain there is no drinks with the combo; so I had to walked up to the counter the second time to get drinks.. and that was not the end of the story. When our order arrived, my bread bowl turned out to be a cup of soup; when I asked the lady who delivered our food; she said well you only order a cup of soup; I did not want to argue, so I just accepted the order.   As I turned around, another two ladies were arguing with the Blond Asian cashier about their orders; I guess she did not only screw my order, but someone else's too...   Food was middle-core; but for the Eyes Rolling thing and bad attitude that we have received from the cashier? Thank you, but no thank you! We will never return to this place.

Best and most creative Lobster I've ever had and the primary reason my wife and I are considering going back to Vegas. We have searched for other places with similar Lobster Sandwich in Seattle every since, to no avail. Its spoiled all other lobster for us...

LOVE this place! The lobster was bomb dot com! I had the Connecticut which was amazing; my kids had a lobsicle and the Cajun. The Connecticut and the Cajun is a lobster sandwich which we found tasty. The Cajun was seasoned but not spicy. Definitely a different take on lobster fast food lol Now my hubby  did NOT like his fish and chips. He said it was more like fish strips cause it was chewy, tough and not what you think of as fish n chips. Def not worth the $16. Upon our leaving, the cashier asked him how he liked his food, he was honest and she gave us our money back for his food. The rest of us LOVED our food!

My girlfriends and I had just arrived in Vegas after a 5+ hours drive and we were starving! We wanted a quick, casual place to grab a bite to eat, and in that moment the giant "Lobester Me"  sign popped up; we decided to give it a try. I am a huge seafood fan so I was excited to try their roll. I went with the Cajun roll. It was a little on the spicy side, with the spicy mayo dressing and it was a little too sour/tart for my taste, due to the lemon dressing on top. I got their combo, which came with seasoned fries and a drink. Their fries were AMAZING! I will for sure be back here again, but will probably go with the original lobster roll.

RECENTLY I GOT LOCKED OUT OF MY OLD ACCOUNT. SO I CREATED THIS NEW ONE. WITH THE SAME NAME. PREVIOUSLY FROM MILILANI,HI.  Las Vegas, NV  So I had to work out side of Vegas for two weeks. I did not know what I wanted to eat. A Lobster roll sounded great, so instead I ordered the Lobster sandwich. My daughter is in college, so you can image I have had my fair share of Lobster. Hate to say this. This was so bad tasting. It had a creme, cheese sauce on it. Also their was chives In the sandwich. It tasted very bitter. I  also sampled the  Mac , and Cheese. Shucks, It tasted like Velveeta Cheese. I did not get that because, I'm into a traditional southern Mac, and Cheese style.  I'm really  hoping the roll tastes great, and other people leave better reviews.  Pye E.

I'll never know how I had gone a full 31 years without having ever tried a lobster roll! I was down by the strip for a week-long convention, and a friend with me dragged me along through the Sands Expo Center, through the Venetian, to Lobster Me. First instinct was, "sounds yummy, but HOW MUCH FOR A LOBSTER ROLL?!" I'll save you a long tale and let you know that I basically tried to make it back there every day for the rest of that week!   Lobster Me is a casual food court venue within the Venetian, adjacent to many other eateries. During convention lunch hours, the line can be long but catch them outside of these windows and you're golden! Their menu has a variety of rolls (lobster, crab, 50/50 (half crab and half lobster), but keep in mind that the lobster roll is the only one served warm. The 50/50 was good, but I had my heart set on a warm sandwich. The lobster roll can be topped with certain add ons, like avocado, chipotle aioli, etc, but I decided to be a purist for my first lobster roll - it did not disappoint!   A friend got an appetizer called a lobscicle, which is exactly what it sounds like - a cooked lobster tail on a stick, served with butter, ready to be devoured! It looked amazing, but also pricey. On another day I tried the lobster Mac and cheese: great cheesy noodles, but I wish there was more lobster to noodles ratio, but I understand that would've probably driven up the price more. As for sides, I opted for a side of clam chowder (instead of the default fries), which in my mind rivaled the likes of Boudin's clam chowder on Pier 39 in San Francisco. The oyster crackers really make that soup dish!   Definitely worth a try to see what the hype is about; I was glad I did! Try them here or at one of their other strip locations; none off-strip, as far as I know, but worth the price and worth the drive!

As much as I love lobster, I really think this place is overpriced. I was really excited to try their lobster ice cream, but when you think about it - it's really just bits and pieces of lobster with vanilla ice cream. There's just nothing really "spectacular" about that.  The lobster bisque was all right. It came with a bread bowl - but it just didn't impress me that much. As for the lobster on a stick - the lobster is deep fried but not that big.   The staff was nice and friendly, however just be aware of the fact that you're paying more than necessary.

I liked it!  I have eaten Lobster rolls from a truck and this place charged a bit more but this sandwich was waay bigger.  I got the one for $17.  Not cheap.  So if you are a cheap bastard this place is not for you.  It was a good snack for me though.  I am not the expert with lobster rolls, but this one made me happy.  It tasted fresh, and lots of flavor.  It is perfect to snack on before your show so that you can get your occasional nourishment between your alcohol binging.
Had to have been the best lobster me and my bf have had. It was amazing. Customer service was amazing my favorite was the lobster roll and their french fries were amazing.
While in Vegas I visited this spot for lunch and got the lobster Mac & Cheese. Oh my God was it good. Cheese but light. Hit the spot perfectly. Delicious!!

Lobser ME is a Godsend if you're hungover and craving comfort food to soak up all the bad decisions you drank the night before while out on the town in Vegas.  I came across this place on my last Vegas trip after my friends and I had just finished eating at Earl's. The lobster ice cream sample sort of lured us in, but they didn't have any at the time, so we figured we'd try it next time we were here. So on my most recent Vegas trip this past weekend, my best friend's boyfriend suggested we try this place out.  Lobster ME is located right next to the Fat Tuesday place, so a bit towards the middle of Miracle Mile. There are tables located in front of it, but keep in mind, this area can get packed so be prepared to fight for a table.   While looking at the menu, I was pretty much drooling - lobster mac and cheese, lobster grilled cheese, lobsticle, different kinds of lobster rolls, and more. No joke, the lobster mac and cheese was pretty much calling out my name and saying "eat me nowwwwwww." Couldn't pass that up. I ended up ordering that, along with a side order of tater tots (if you've read my other reviews, you'd know that I loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee tater tots) and a drink. My total came out to be $17.   My meal came out about 10 minutes or so later, freshly made, steaming with goodness. The bowl of mac and cheese itself doesn't look like much, since you pay the price of $10, but seeing that it is made with lobster, it's somewhat understandable. The mac and cheese was a bit bland in my opinion - like they should have added more milk or something to it since it tasted a bit watered down. The lobster was good though! No doubt about it. And since I was pretty much starving, I didn't really mind TOO much that it was a bit bland. Tater tots were awesomeeee. Crispy and hot - just the way I like them.   Service was okay I guess. I mean, you just order and they call you up when your order is ready. Prices are a bit much, but it IS lobster. I was already expecting the prices to be around that much anyways. Overall, I'd give this place 3.5 stars. I probably would come back and try something else. I honestly would have ordered a lot, but I was saving my money for more debauchery.

My new must go-to next time or everytime I'm in Vegas. Came here twice during the same trip.  This is one of the better lobster rolls I've had. I'd almost compare it to the lobster roll I had at Connie & Ted's, but this one is better because it's the same size, but better price.  The lobster roll has a delicious buttery bread roll and the lobster is plentiful. Both chips and/or fries with the roll are really good (surprisingly since most of the time, you expect paired chips or fries to be a filler that isn't that tasty, and just serve as a plate filler). The chips and fries taste hand made and have good flavor.  Ordered and really enjoyed both: - Maine style lobster roll (mayo-y, creamy and good) - Conneticut lobster roll (buttery and warm and delicious) - Clam chowder (decent soup)  Would love to try the other items on the menu next time. Wish there was a Lobster Me in LA.
Our first trip to Vegas, my cousin recommend Lobster Me. Never thought the food would be so so amazing. Good lobster rolls in an unexpected location while strolling through the mall.

A few of my friends recommended this place when I was in Vegas last week, and even though we live in Boston where there's AMPLE SEAFOOD everywhere, we decided to give it a try! They have a lot of different things on their menu you can't find in Boston!  They have a few different styles of lobster rolls, but since I've had a few of those already, I went for the lobster mac and cheese, and Pearl T. got the lobster on a stick grilllled.   We were a little disappointed at the size of the lobster on a stick. Pretty small for ~$14 but I think it tasted good?  Lobster mac n cheeze is huuge for $12. A little too cheezy for me, but I liked the amount of lobster on top. Just couldn't finish it with all the oil and cheese at the bottom. I think this is a pretty good deal for the amount of food you get. I'd LOVE to try the lobster & waffles, but I didn't see it on the menu when we were there!   We also forgot to try the lobster ice cream, so there must be a next time! Overall, it was an a-ok experience! I'd come back if other people want to try it, but read the reviews and be selective about your choices!

Loved the Lobster on a stick.  Had it grilled, it was amzing. Looking forward to the next time:)  We had a big group there and everyone had something different, and loved it all.  If your in Vegas this is a must eat lunch or snack at!!

I had the chance to try their lobster mac and cheese+ tator tots. I was not impressed, i found myself not wanting more after a few bites..The lobster left me with a bad after taste and the it wasn't cheesy enough. I didn't enjoy the combination together, definitely not coming back.

QUICK AND TASTY SEAFOOD   I like how it's a "fast-food" seafood joint. Here's the goods and bads:  Lobster grilled cheese was bomb. Totally worth the price it was cheaper than lobster roll.   Lobster Roll Connecticut style: really good! The lobster meat was chunky and abundant. Heads up this roll is pretty small. Much smaller than the pictures but it's still filling. But if you're a big dude order two.   Difference between Maine and Connecticut is the Maine is cold lobster and Cont. is warm lobster in butter sauce.  Lobster Mac and Cheese: thick shell pasta, cheesy and delicious! A good amount of lobster meat.   PASS:  Lobster Bisque: more like Lobster WATER!!! Bisque is usually thicker and have chunks of lobster and veggies but this one here was the opposite. It was straight watery lobster soup. Skip it.  Blueberry lemonade was sweet and yummy!  Tip: if you add a combo you can substitute the drink for a beer for $2 more!  PS. As you can see by  my picture the lobster rolls are pretty small.  But what I'm confused about is why our rolls didn't come with the huge claw meat on top like all the other pictures show???  Manager should be alerted that this place isn't consistent.

Got the original Maine lobster roll combo, it was good just wish the portions were bigger. It doesn't really have big chunks of meat like it does in the other pictures. Also there's celery in it, heads up to those who don't like vegetables. Lol this combo came out as $19.81 with local discount
Saw the sign for a lobster sickle. Couldn't resist. $14didnt buy a very big lobster tail. Flavor was good it size was lacking

Hubby & I went tonight which was our 2nd go round having been here back in August for a convention.  The first time we were there....we got the Lobster Roll Connecticut Style....lobster was plentiful and tasty...I suspect because they'd just opened not that long prior to our coming is why the meat was plentiful.  This time around...Lobster not so plentiful.  This time I ordered the Maine original and if there was a 1/4 pd of Lobster...that was a lot!!!  The servers tried to explain to me that they used a pound sized lobster and got a 1/4 pd of meat from it...do I look like I live under a rock??  Hubby & I buy our Lobsters at Gelsons (A local gourmet supermarket in Los Angeles County)....bring them home & steam them ourselves.  We get a pound and a half each.  I know what a pound of lobster meat looks like...these were not a pounds worth of lobster meat in either Lobster Roll.....  I am more than willing to pay for a fair market rate...but I too expect what I pay for......Disappointed.....
Fast, fresh, delicious.  The lobster roll is chunky goodness and the old bay fried are a quality side and you get a lot for your money.

Been a regular at Earl of Sandwich everytime I stay at Planet Hollywood but wanted to venture out to see what else was around. Lobster Me is close by, next to Fat Tuesday. Their menu is amazing, everything lobster in all kinds of variations! I wanted to try everything, but I just got a lobster roll cajun style. Boy is it spicy, but very good. Quite expensive for a sandwich/roll, $25, but that's what you can expect with lobster. I'll definitely be back to try other items on the menu that caught my eye, like the lobster mac n cheese and lobster bisque.

I would have to say for 4 pieces of small lobster meat this was very overpriced. Mine didn't look like the pictures posted or the menu. I got it to go so I didn't look at it till I got back to my room. It was ok tasting but prob not that good to go back again. I have had much better on the east coast for less in price and much more quantity.
Ordered: Lobster and eggs.  Middle school tater-tots Didn't taste the lobster in the eggs  Wasn't worth my $10 :/

Me and my friend walk up to the counter and the cashier, "Rosa" (although on our receipt it's says "Carolina") is having a conversation with Carolina. She does not acknowledge us at all and carries on with her conversation. She comes and stands in front of us and does not say a word. We wait.... she walks off and from us and finishes her conversation with Carolina. She (Rosa) has yet to acknowledge us. I lean against the counter and Carolina finally asks "Can I help you?" Rosa comes up and takes our order but is not at all friendly! She never said hello, I never got a thank you. She never made eye contact with me.... This is utterly ridiculous.... This type of employee should not work at this establishment... I waited for my order and watched her interact with 2 other couples behind me in the exact same manner. This is a bad depiction of your company.  Good food, HORRIBLE SERVICE !!!!

Found this gem w/ some co-workers (yes, companies do hold corporate events out in Vegas!) back in April and loved it! So for another Vegas trip a few weeks ago being that we were staying in the Venetian I was able to hit this place up 2 times!!  Loved it! I think the Lobster & Chips is my favorite. One night I tried a sandwich, but I still prefer the Lobster & Chips. (The portions to price may seem small compared to the price needed... but it's probably portioned out appropriately anyways.)  They do have a few alcoholic drinks.. a few taps and a few mixed drinks. I think I may have had a blueberry margarita (or mojito) or something. That was good!  For me to go two days in a row to a place in Vegas... that's saying something. :)
Haven't a true Connecticut lobster since I moved away from CT. Their Connecticut lobster roll is the real deal. Delicious. Service was good.

I guess I should have walked away when it seemed that everyghing I wanted to oreder was gone, but I decided to take a chance and ask the cashier what he would recommend. He directed me to the Lobster Roll, and albeit it being ok, It was sooo tiny I could not even enjoy it, an for $17 I would not recommend it to anybody
Enjoy waiting forever. It's been over 45 min since I ordered and there's no sign of food.   Avoid this place you dumdum.
Nice lobster grilled cheese for just $10. Great for a quick bite. I should try their rolls & sandwich next time.
Some of the most quality food I've had in Vegas or otherwise! Every dish here is prime dining with excellent quality and amount of lobster meat! I dream of the day I come back.

The lobster roll was pretty good, but the portion side for the price was a real drag. For two meals: lobster roll, fries and a drink the total was close to $50!! That was shocking! All in all I'm glad I tried it, and I may go back for the lobster grilled cheese.
Very good lobster roll. Great coleslaw. Awesome chips! Very excellent for mall food. Delicious in fact!

I was SUPER excited to try out Lobster Me after my friend had Instagrammed pictures of his lobster rolls while in Vegas. It just so happened to be right next to the Fat Tuesday line so my girlfriend and I had to give it a try.   We ordered the Cajun roll after asking the register girl's opinion and it came out to ~$25... Most expensive sandwich I've ever purchased. But my girlfriend reasoned that it WAS lobster so I bit the bullet and waited it out.   MAJOR disappointment! First off, the large size is only 6 inches. 6 INCHES. I could buy 5 Subway foot-longs with the money I spent on this dinky roll! To be fair, it was absolutely stuffed with lobster meat and 3 claws on top but the meat was COLD. I was appalled. Probably my fault that I didn't ask the waitress if it was going to be a hot or cold sandwich but I didn't know that cold lobster sandwiches were a thing.   If I were to come here again, I would order a non-roll item like the tater tots or the mac and cheese because the roll was WAY underwhelming and WAY too much for my wallet.   Side note: A guy fainted face first on the tile floor and banged up his chin while waiting in line behind me. Not sure if it was from the sky-high prices or heat exhaustion and dehydration from his Fat Tuesday. Either way, be sure to mentally prepare yourself for these menu prices!

Cute place for a quick bite located in the Venetian. I had the lobster grilled cheese and the lobster Mac and cheese. It wasn't the best or freshest lobster I've had but they were both delicious. The price is a bit steep but it is lobster and we are in Vegas. Quick tip, free refills on sodas!

I wanted to try this place because I wanted to try my first lobster roll. I wanted to go it so I can enjoy alone with my Pina Colada. The prices are definitely expensive, and I personally didn't think it was worth it. When I got the bag, the box was sideways. So the sauces and the roll was a mess. I was pretty irritated but ate it. It was alright, nothing to rave about. Would definitely suggest to eat it there, if the prices don't phase you.

Convenient location in the Miracle Mile shops, we stayed at Planet Hollywood, the two buildings are connected. They're setup like a food court, to-go window only.   The cashier was friendly and they have plenty of options. However, considering that it is Vegas, they have a huge price tag for their menu items. Something that cost me $12 here in Austin cost roughly $23 and change at this location. Depending on what kind of budget you head to Vegas with should really answer if you'll be eating here or not.   The food was great but for the price, you could find a decent sit down restaurant with dedicated seating somewhere else. I'll probably visit again if I'm in Vegas again but that's only because I love lobster and theirs did taste pretty great - the real reason anyone chooses to eat at any restaurant.

This place has been here for awhile, but I never actually wanted to try it until this past trip! Ordered the deep fried lobsicle and the Conneticut lobster roll, and it came out pretty quickly. However, it was super pricey for what you get- $13 for a single lobster stick, and $17 for a lobster roll.  The lobsicle was good; but not worth the price. I wish I had gotten the grilled lobsicle instead. The lobster roll with the melted butter was yummy, and the chips and coleslaw was a good combination. I thought everything was pretty good, but nothing special. I guess the price does make sense as it is Vegas, but definitely will not go out of my way to eat here again!

I was walking around the mall in Las Vegas and notice a restaurant that caught my eyes. The lobsters were calling out to me to eat. I felt like in the mood for some lobster chowder, hoping it will be tasty to eat. I was pretty disappointed with it. The chowder wasn't thick and creamy. I didn't feel like I got the taste of lobster. It was pretty average. Service was pretty fast. I think I will stick to clam chowder instead.
Our favorite "Cheat Meal!" Lobster Me is the ultimate in decadent "junk food". It's worth every single delicious calorie. We have also always had great service.

3 words: Lobster Mac N Cheese. Jesus H. heaven in a bowl for sure. It's a little pricey but it's lobster and it's vegas. A great easy place to get a snack, meal and a drink (where CAN'T you get a drink in vegas?)  It's in the middle of Planet Hollywood Mall so it's a convenient location for where I usually stay (cosmo)

If you are looking for some All American casual Seafood this is definitely the place to go to. Knuckle sandwich is unbelievable! We also had the lobster fries and my wife fell in love with those. Make sure you asked for the fried clam chowder , it is one of the most delicious Chowder's I've ever had ! Will definitely be stopping by next time we're at the Venetian.

I was expected more from this place. We had seen signs all over Vegas for the Lobsicle (fried lobster tail in a stick), and finally decided to try it out when we were in the Miracle Miles shops. Ordered a Lobsicle, Lobster Bisque, and Cajun fries. Fries were good, as was the bisque (not a whole lots of flavor though), Lobsicle was meh.... For $14 you get about 2-3 bites. Not much seating here - they do have about 4 spots along the bar, and food court style seating nearby.

I would say that our experience at Lobster ME was (fair), not super fantastic but ok. Ordered the Maine style Lobster sandwich with coleslaw and fries and a chowder to split.  Not much seating in the Miracle Mile location, just a few tables that seem to be shared with the Fat Tuesday next door. Service was fine (not super friendly, but not rude either). $19 is pretty much what I would expect to pay for a lobster roll, enough meat, not the "best" pieces of lobster, but enough to fill me up. Flavor was fine, butter roll was tastier than the lobster. Chowder was also ok.  As you can tell from this review, everything was (ok), but not the (best). So you have to decide how hungry you are to try Lobster ME or not.

Ordered the lobster mac and cheese and was very disappointed. The pasta was tasteless and starchy, and the lobster part was a joke. They included a few sad pieces of the very tip of a lobster claw, the part you usually don't eat when you get a whole lobster. On top of that the portion was small.  Waste of money.
Overpriced, expensive, horrible food. Lesson learn: do not have seafood at the desert.
Really?  Don't.   Connecticut was cold. Lobster Mac n cheese was not cheesey or flavorful. Bisque was very watered down. Save your money for Red Lobster.....

Lobster ME is a fast casual restaurant in the Grand Canal Shoppes at the Venetian where you can get an honest to goodness lobster roll in the Las Vegas desert.  Because you're Vegas, expect some added trickery.  Purist may turn away, but it is a good location to grab a relatively cheap meal.  My Overall Rating - 3 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)  Atmosphere - It's located in the food court of the Grand Canal shops, and like many malls in Vegas, it's indoors so you can escape the heat.  You do have to venture in pretty deep to find it, and like many places in Vegas you'll feel like you're in a maze.  It has limited seating though, and you'll find many people waiting around for a table when it gets busy.   1/2 Star.  Service - Typical fast casual service here.  You line up, place your order, grab a number, and grab a seat (if one is free).  The staff was fast and friendly.  I didn't notice any dedicated staff members clearing tables, but in a busy food court with shared seating it is sorely needed.   1/2 Star.  Food - I can't believe I want to admit this but I really enjoyed my lobster roll.  I went with a traditional roll which came with plenty of chunky lobster and a fantastic butter/toasted bun.  I also ordered a side of chowder fries which I highly recommend.  You'll get big chunky fries covered with a chowder sauce.  It's like eating potato soup (the fries are the potato).  Now, this is Vegas, so while you can get a traditional roll like I did, the menu as has items like a Cajun or San Francisco (with miso sauce).  If you're into that, you'll like it.  Otherwise I recommend you stick to the traditional rolls. 1 Star.  Will I Return? - Yes.  At the end of the day, my quality lobster roll with fries and drink was about $15.  Not too bad for Las Vegas.  Now, seating can be limited during lunch/dinner time, but it's a nice stop if you're shopping in the Venetian.  1 Star.  My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts): 1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm. 1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point. 2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food. 1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return.   Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score.

First off, I am by no means no lobster connoisseur. Having only had a few rolls mostly in Boston finding on that compares to the east coast or real thing is hard to find this far away from the New England area. I was craving a lobster roll so I sought out this place as I had seen it before on a previous trip to LV. This place is over priced and yes yes....I know it's Vegas. The lobster roll comes in four different variations: Maine "original" - naked w/ butter and served chilled Connecticut - naked w/ butter served warm Cajun - just with cajun spice El Diablo - with a spicy tomato based sauce All rolls were $17 except the El Diablo ($18) one. The roll was definitely not worth the price.  They state that you will get lobster meat from a 1lb lobster. They do not look like the picture nor what you get on the east coast (large pieces of lobster). The lobster meat is diced so much that it's almost lobster "tuna fish"  One can also order fries and a drink for an additional $3, or a cup of chowder or lobster bisque and a drink for an additional $4 or chowder fries and a drink for an additional $6. I opted for the drink and a cup of lobster bisque with a side of cajun fries. See picture below. It was what you would expect from a "fast-foodish" lobster joint in Vegas. Nothing to brag about.  For the none roll types, there were also a few other lobster options that sounded good but probably that is as far as it goes.   - Lobsicle $14 a deep fried or grilled lobster tail on a stick. - Lobster Mac and Cheese - Lobster tacos - Lobster grilled cheese  Overall, I'll have to continue sticking to the real deal over on the east coast when it comes to lobster rolls.

I loved lobster me before the menu change.  I have no issue paying $23-$27 for a large lobster roll, but I won't pay $17 for what amounts to a lobster slider.  The quality of the meat and bread is great, but the size available now is great if you're a child or over 85 and don't eat like an adult.  Last visit...too bad.

This used to be our favorite lobster roll place, but they just recently changed the menu. It may be a little expensive but for it's price of $19 the roll already comes with coleslaw and chips, but this was before. Now the menu still has the same price of $19 but this time no chips, only lobster roll and coleslaw - for the same price of $19. Really? It did said on the menu board though that the roll is served with pickle and coleslaw, but when we got our order there was no pickle - only the roll and coleslaw. But even with the pickle replacing the chips, it's still not worth it's price anymore. BRING BACK THE CHIPS!!!

I wish I could rate this place higher. I think that I just went on a bad day at the wrong time. I have to be honest in saying that I went on May 5th due to a co-worker speaking so highly of it.   I went with three other people. Of all food ordered:  Lobster chunks with fries Fish tacos 2 orders of the lobster roll    First off, our "roll" was so greasy that you couldn't even taste the lobster. The two Of us felt so sick after a few bites.   My friends lobster and fries looked like a kids meal. I actually felt bad for asking to go here for my birthday. The fish tacos looked good and my friend said that they were alright but it was less tacos and more fries.   It was so bad that I will never go back. I hope they work out the kinks and maybe they have by now. I work in the hotel and eat out everyday. This was by far, the worst!
I've eaten a lot of Lobster Rolls, but I have to say this is The Absolute Worse One Ever and they are rude to top it off.   It was dry dry dry dry omg $26 sandwich yuck

Loved this place! I am a big lobster lover so when I go out for lobster, it has to be practically perfect. This quick stop I must say had the taste of a five star restaurant. I ordered the Connecticut roll along with the Cajun fries and was in heaven with the first bite. The buttery lobster was so good as was the buttery toasted bread it was placed in. The fries had really good flavor and seasoned very well. It was a little pricy or being a food court mall stop, but worth the trip.

After hearing such high reviews from friends and the employee who took my order, I have to say I was really disappointed with the food. I expected a smaller portion after being warned but was assured that $19 for a lobster roll,  chips, and slaw was worth it. I added the $4 to make it a meal which includes fries and a drink. The fries were the best part of the meal. I ordered the Cape Cod and I was expecting the lobster to be sweet, juicy, and buttery, but instead tasted just like heated artificial crab. The garlic roll was good but the lobster lacked flavor and was rubbery. The saving grace of our meal were the fries, and the lobster Mac & cheese which was reasonably priced. Overall, spent nearly $40 on a lackluster meal. Would never recommend this joint to someone. Save your money and eat somewhere else. :(

My free gift card made the price even more reasonable.  "El Diablo" was mildly spicy and full of flavor.  I was warned of how spicy it was and usually laugh when people warn me about spiciness.  I may have a white face but my stomach and mouth must be Thai.    The lobster portions were generous even for the "medium" size.   The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.    Overall a very pleasant experience, especially for mall food.
Tried the lobster bisque, lobster roll & lobster mac & cheese.  Think the bill came to $44. I thought everything was pretty good although the portions aren't the biggest. Would check it out again.

As someone who goes to Vegas way too many times a year, walking around the same casinos can get a little monotonous (need to take a break from gambling, somehow and somewhere) That's why if there's anything new and food-related that pops up, I'm immediately curious and will want to try -- even if my stomach is full. Hey, I'll make room.  So, walking around Planet Hollywood shops, we stumbled upon Lobster ME (as in abbreviation for Maine), adjacent to a Fat Tuesday. If I recall correctly, this space was previously a Godiva. Front and center, they immediately claimed to have the world's best lobster roll. Oh really. I needed to find out for myself.  They have some other unique items, like lobster and eggs, lobster and waffles, lobster grilled cheese, lobster mac 'n cheese, and the lobsicle (gasp, another lobster-on-a-stick version, similar from the truck I just tried back home in OC). Plus, they have... wait for it... lobster ice cream. But I'll talk about that a bit later.  So with a belly stuffed with Earl of Sandwiches, I managed to make enough room to try their lobster roll for $16 (plus I split with several people). That's for the regular size. If you want a bigger size, it's $22. The lobster roll is pretty decent. I've had my fair share from the East coast, fancy versions from LA restaurants, and plus from an LA-based food truck. So all kinds of lobster rolls.  This lobster roll had a nice and toasty, buttered roll, with a slight crisp. Inside, it was stuffed with plenty of lobster meat from the tail. On the outside, they put the claw meat. This lobster roll isn't mayo-based, but with butter -- just enough so that it's not overpowering the meat. Flavor-wise, I thought it was fine. No need to over-salt, fancy seasonings or sauces.  We tried a small sample of the lobster ice cream. It was pretty disgusting. It was like tasting a mouthful of butter ice cream with little pieces of frozen lobster chunks inside. Intriguing, but just not a good combo -- but it gets people talking about it though.  So 3 stars strictly just for the lobster roll. Everything else on the menu? Eh, not so sure if it's worth trying. But hey, I'm a purist when it comes to lobster. Simplicity is everything. Lobster should be consumed steamed with a subtle touch of butter. You want to taste the meat. All these other dishes incorporated with lobster seem to be just a gimmick.

This place should be called Lobster Meh.  My friend and I were shopping at the mall and decided to try this place.  She is a lobster bisque connoisseur, but trying it was a disappointment.  It tasted of roux with a little lobster base. What it did have going for it was a lot of cryovac lobster pieces in it.  The lobster mac and cheese was alright, but void of any real lobster meat, although it was garnished here and there with some of the same lobster pieces they used in the bisque.     I ordered a long island iced tea and the cashier kept trying to push this fishbowl vessel on me.  I'm a local and I will not be seen walking around holding and drinking out of a fishbowl.  The drink was mostly sweet and sour mix  anyway.    Save your money and dine elsewhere as this place is highly overrated and overpriced.

Lobster Mac and Cheese was very good and large portions. The Bloody Mary very tasty and again large portion. Yes, it is expensive, $30 for Mac&Cheese and a Bloody Mary, but what's not expensive in Las Vegas. Enjoyed everything!!
Who doesn't like a Connecticut lobster roll with a side of lobster mac and cheese. DUH!  Can it ever be bad! Good stuff. Go there.

We had to go back for more!  Lobster roll and lobcicle were awesome!!  Bisque was meh.  Grilled cheese was okay.   But the roll and lobster tail on a stick were definitely what to order!  We only tried the Connecticut roll.

Lobster Me was just OK for us.  I still think the lobster roll in Ogunquit, Maine is still the best and the freshest-tasting.    We had a problem with the lobster bisque and Cajun fries arriving at our table.  The lady offered us a free lemonade.  That was nice!  Note:  The lobster bisque takes a while to prepare as it's soup in a bread bowl.  I'm not sure why it was taking so long.  Then, they forgot the Cajun Fries.    Note:  You cannot charge the restaurant meal to your room at the Palazzo / Venetian.  That's too bad!  Another Note:  Go early for your meals 'cos they only have a few tables and chairs at their little restaurant space in the Grand Canal Shoppes.

After reading my Yelp buddies - Yolanda R. & Angel H.'s review about "Lobster Me"..........I quickly booked marked this place, as I knew the next time I was in Las Vegas, I really wanted to try a lobster sandwich roll.  Yeah, I know.........the sandwich has mayonnaise, and for you folks that know me..........I am a totally mayonnaise hater! But hey, we are talkin' about lobster here, and not a tuna sandwich! But wait........I do like tuna sandwiches......yeah, I'm kinda weird.......I know! Go figure?  So after landing in Las Vegas, I tell my homies - "'Eh, lets go to this place called "Lobster Me" for a lobster sandwich........I'm buying!"   So off we went to the Venetian Hotel, and headed straight to the Grand Canal Shoppes where I quickly found this little food stand.  Lobster Me is located by a small food court within the Grand Canal Shoppes, the restaurant is basically a fast food lobster sandwich joint. You walk up to the counter, order your food & pay. They will give you a ticket number, then you will need to find an open table to sit down.  When your food is ready, someone will bring it to your table.  What did we order here? . One of my friends & I ordered - The "Original Main Style" lobster roll which consisted of - Maine lobster meat with celery, chives and mayo. ($18.00 per combo).  And my other friend ordered - The "Beltway" lobster roll which consisted of - Warm Maine lobster tossed with Old Bay and shallot-chive mayo. Topped with butter-toasted panko crumbs. ($18.00)  My friends also ordered an Old Fashion Lemonade ($4.00) & a Blueberry Lemonade ($8.00).  What can I say about the grub?  I must say my lobster roll was DELICIOUS! Lot of chunks of lobster, and the seasonings with the lobster made it buttery good!   But if I could properly critique this meal, what I was really disappointed of.......... was the very small portions of food that they served, in comparison to what they charged you.  The lobster sandwich was delicious, but all so small. Funny when I see the picture on the wall menu, they make it look so big, then when you get your sandwich.............I'm thinking - "Where's the rest of my lobster sandwich!" Lol!   As for the sides - (potato) chips & coleslaw..........the chips, I can pass on. I'm not sure if it was freshly cut & fried, but it was definitely not light tasting at all.........kinda soggy, if anything. The coleslaw serving was ridiculously small........it was just a pinch of coleslaw, about the size of a nut...........but of course, we are not here for the sides. We are here for the lobster roll!  Drinks were kind of on the expensive side...........$8 bucks for a blueberry lemonade? I'd rather drink a beer! Lol!  Overall, a neat little shop...........the lobster roll I'd give it a very strong "4", but I had to knock off a point for the puny portions that they served here.  For $71.35 - I got 3 lobster roll sandwiches, and 2 drinks.......worth it? I'm not so sure.......
Awesome lobster rolls and bisque!  Fast and convenient if you're staying at Planet Hollywood.

Make sure you check your order because they messed mine up. And because of that our plans for the night didn't happen because we had to wait for our food. Thanks a lot to the wonderful people of this establishment to ruin the only night we had in Vegas that was planned out ahead of time.

I rarely guve low reviews... but the pictures are deceiving.... servings are super small and food over priced. The rolls are decent but gone in two bites.... everything else we ordered (fish n chips, calm chowder) was not very good to be honest...

Wayy too overprice for the portion you get! Some of my friends had more lobster meat than others. Not fair lol. Plus service looked a bit confused even with our numbers at our table.   I wouldn't come back to eat here.
I have been trying to get to this place my last three trips to Vegas. I finally made it but I only had time to try the lobsicle. It was delicious - cooked perfect and served with warm butter.

Meh, more like 2.5/5 stars.  Nothing is special about this joint and I understand it's vegas but it's too overpriced for what it is.    After eating earl's for the previous 5 meals, i decided to venture out and order something else. Lol...  I know, I'm a creature of habit.  Conveniently, this place is located right next to fat Tuesdays in the Miracle Mile.    Ended up getting the lobster roll and the lobster bisque.  I've had some legit lobster rolls in Boston, and lobster me doesn't even hold a candle to it.  This is a pretty sad excuse for a lobster roll.  It's just pieces of lobster on a butter roll for about $17 bucks.  And as for the soup, the consistency is a bit runny.  I doubt lobster bisque is supposed to taste like that.    There are a few seats located right in front of the shop, but if you come during rush hour, you might not be able to sit down.  The saving grace about this place is that the people working here are friendly.  You're better off taking your money and finding something else to eat.

We had the bread bowl of lobster bisque. $15  The bread as so good, loved dipping the bread in the soup to eat. The LB was perfect. Creamy and loved the hints I think of sherry, and a nice portion of lobster.   It's quite expensive for the rolls and we just wanted to grab a quick snack so I didn't feel like paying almost $30 for a lobster roll. From reviews, I hear they are good so maybe next time.

GREAT! i Loved the cajun roll! i go there alot they have THE BEST chowder fries, the best lobster grilled cheese, the best clam chowder! its just all great! if you want lobster this is the place to go! they even have a very delicious Lobster bloody mary!

Awesome place!   After a few hours of shopping,  I felt I needed a nice cool drink and passed by this place caught my attention!   I really liked the name and the great display picture of the Bloody Mary Lobster Claw!  I sat at the counter and a nice friendly girl came over,  so I told her I would like to order the drink advertised.  She made it quickly and first taste was great!!!  Very nice tomato flavor with a good amount of spices,  I ate the claw, plus it has a fresh lemon and celery stick!  Best part was the crushed ice, it really does make a big difference in drinks compared to ice cubes.  Overall very refreshing drink and I enjoyed my break, as my legs have been walking all day ...
The bread used for the lobster roll so soft and light! Allows for the full taste of the lobster. Wait staff recommended the crab waffle fries which were to die for. Lobster Me anytime!

My  friends and I overall enjoyed the food at Lobster ME in the Venetian, but it was nothing to write home about. I got the grilled Lobsicle. It was small, only about 5 bites start to finish, but the taste was incredible and super buttery. The salt and vinegar fries, however, fell short. I like flavor and was hoping the salt and vinegar would be strong, but they were hardly detectable at all. I guess if you like subtlety in flavors, you'd enjoy it.   Later in the week I got the lobster tacos, which were quite good. They were decently packed with cilantro and cabbage and came with a small side of tortilla chips. My brother got the Maine Lobster Roll. He found it pretty okay but too expensive for the quality of food, and his side of coleslaw was tasteless. My boyfriend got the Lobster Mac & Cheese and absolutely loved it, though.  If you're in a hurry, don't stop by Lobster ME. There wasn't much of a line either time I went, but it took quite a while for our food to be ready. And everything but the fries was overpriced.

I had the Connecticut version, just lobster meat and butter. Very good but for $18 it was a very small roll, maybe 6 bites. Served with small amount of coleslaw and chips. Service was friendly and quick.

Having a lobster obsession for a bit, I was delighted to find an only lobster restaurant. The restaurant is located at the Venetian next to the canal. The price is great.   I had the Maine lobster roll and it was divine. It wasn't enough food though so I got a lobsicle after. I wish there a Lobster Me in Los Angeles so I can go every weekend.

A lot of what I liked about this place was the name.  So, well done.  The food varied a fair amount:  - The Diablo - Lobster roll with marinara sauce.  This was pretty good.  The sauce had some kick and it had big, meaty chunks of lobster.  It's very buttery and basically is a sandwich made with garlic bread.  - Lobster Mac n Cheese.  This was okay.  There wasn't much lobster on it, and it was a little bland.  - Lobster Ceviche.  I'm sorry, I thought this was terrible.  The ceviche had no flavor at all; it was thoroughly bland.  I literally tried one little piece and then didn't touch it the rest of the meal.  In the end, it's kind of a fun idea, and is conveniently located by Fat Tuesday's, so it's an easy place to stop for a snack and a frosty beverage if you're wandering through the mall.  But, I would not seek it out on my own.

***Take the money you're saving on these bland, overpriced rolls and spend it on a cab to Luke's Lobster's in the Fashion Show Mall.**  After working a convention inside Planet Hollywood, my boss offered to buy me lunch and chose Lobster ME inside the Miracle Mile Shops. I was skeptical, because my previous experience with Lobster Rolls was with Luke's Lobster Rolls down the street (see my review) and LOVED IT. But my boss and his coworker were convinced this place was delicious and worth it..and who would say no to free lobster? ...well, let's just say I wish I had.   I ordered their New England Lobster Roll. I tend to be rather traditional when it comes to lobster and I'm not much for spicy, I like to taste the meat! But the roll was behind disappointing, I felt nauseous after eating it and immediately regretted my decision. This roll was little more than lobster stuffed on hot dog bun. The bun was not buttered or toasted and the meat was not seasoned. It was all just so bland and the price was higher than Luke's (although coleslaw and fries are included, whereas with Luke's they are additional) for a fraction of the quality.   I did like that you had options for you roll "style" (Cajun, The Connecticut, The Beltway etc) should you feel like getting creative and you can swap regular waffle fries for crab fries (which I did.) They weren't bad, but the sauce and the meat makes them soggy almost immediately.   Again, save your money and go to Luke's, you can thank me later. I swear to you the extra travel time is worth it!!

One word:  SLOOOOW!   I really like their menu and food, but I just cannot give a restaurant with good food and consistently slow service anything better than a 2-star.  I wanted to give this place more stars because I like their menu and their food was good, but it just took too long all three times I have eaten at its various locations.  During my last trip, I ordered their basic lobster roll and soup because I was in a hurry and I figured that by ordering their main items would be quicker.  Nevertheless, that didn't help.  I waited for probably 20 minutes for the food.  They could have brought the soup over early to make the wait seem shorter, but they waited and brought both items over together.  What really got me though was that the single runner they had working was busy eating his own food while about 3 other groups and I were waiting on our food.    Don't get me wrong, the food is good!  The 2 star is simply because they are 0 for 3 when it comes to service.

A okay if you want lobster, but the lobster rolls are just a okay.  Big chunks of lobster but I just wish it was 1) a little big bigger  2) the bread was okay but not the best  Lobster mac and cheese was nothing special but it the lobster was good just mac and cheese probably could have used better cheese.
Everyone the goes to vegas, should try Lobster Me at least once. My favorites are the lobster bisque and mac n'cheese. My friend got a sandwich last time, and it was really small for the price.

Lobster Lovers Rejoice!  I stopped to refuel here while shopping at the Miracle Mile Shops. I was drawn in by the allure of the "lobsicle", a piece of deep fried lobster on a stick. I sampled the Manhattan lobster roll - a toasted bun heaped with top quality lobster and butter. This is now officially the best sandwich I have had in my life. The lobscile was good as a novelty. There is little seating. This place was so tasty it would warrant an entire restaurant location. We also tried the "wicked lemonade" which was a grown up lemonade cocktail with a scoop of frozen lemonade in it. It was like a hard lemonade float. What happens in Vegas...right!?
Amazing Bloody Mary! Hard to find but worth it! Not exactly cheap but totally worth what you get. Phenomenal good!!!

Not halfway bad rolls, tucked inside the back of the Venetian. Surely they can't compare to the real thing in Boston, but their original takes on lobster sandwiches and sides were appreciated. I tried their Maine-style lobster roll and chowder fries. The roll was decent, and had a good amount of lobster, but a lack of seasoning and mayo held the dish back. The chowder fries were solid, but also needed a little salt. Regrettably, I probably won't be back anytime soon. It's basically an overpriced walk up and order food court restaurant boasting big eats with little follow through. On the plus side, the service was friendly, and the place was clean.

I have never tried a lobster roll sandwich before so my husband and I just happen to walk by it and say keys give a try! Now we went up and looked at the menu on dashboard and whoa! It was pricy but hey it's Vegas! So we tried! The sandwich comes with cold slaw and waffle fries. The total price was $26 I believe plus tax. It wasn't a big meal to feed two people but the lobster flavors was disappointing. My husband was like "this is it? Taste like fish poop" which kinda true but wish they had thrown in stronger flavors to get rid of the fishy taste. It was an one time experience as well. Not really worth the money.

This place was recommended by my boyfriend, and it was the first time that I've been here as well. He order the Cajun style lobster roll, and I got the original lobster roll. The lobster rolls came with a side of coleslaw and house-made chips. For drinks, we ordered a lemonade from here.  I was just want to say the Cajun style is a lot more flavorful than the original. The original was a tad bland. The Coleslaw was really good, I'm not a big fan of coleslaw but this didn't even taste like coleslaw! It just tasted like a regular salad with dressing. Lemonade was really good, you can never really go wrong wth lemonade.  The pricing is pretty expensive for the portion you are given, which was really small in my opinion.

I've been wanting to try this spot and I finally did. We ordered the Beltway lobster roll with clam chowder fries for around $22. When we were given our food we were pretty disappointed in the size of the lobster roll and the presentation of the fries for the price. But.... Both tasted was amazing! The bread was toasted and buttery plus the lobster and its fixings were flavorful. The fries were crispy and a perfectly smothered in clam chowder, bacon, and diced tomatoes. I gave it 4 stars because of the portion size and the lack of presentation with the fries but I would definitely spend the money for it again.

I originally glanced over this place because of the 3.5 star ratings, but I'm glad we stopped by. After eating Luke's Lobster's lobster roll, we came here. Decided not to try their lobster roll since we just had one for lunch, so I can't compare how those were.   Got the Lobster Mac and Cheese. A larger portion than I expected. Pretty good mac and cheese, and had huge pieces of lobster (and a lot of it) on top. It was cheaper than a lobster roll, and I feel like the amount of lobster was the same, maybe even more. Totally worth it and would get this again! This was one of my favorite meals in Las Vegas.  Tried the Lobster Tacos as well. If I stopped at the mac and cheese, I'd probably give this place 5 stars, but the tacos definitely brought it down a star. It came with two tiny tacos and a side of chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were pretty good (better than the tacos in my opinion). The tacos were a bit too small and the taste of the tortilla was too strong.

Nice location right in the Miracle Mile Shops near Planet Hollywood. Honestly, I was expected mall food court type food, but the lobster roll was quite delicious and succulent. I was surprised. The bread was toasty and the roll had healthy chunks of lobster. The sauce was light, yet creamy enough to bring it home. Great place to take a break from shopping or for an afternoon snack. Yummy!

Absolutely loved the Cajun lobster roll. Not sure what the other bad reviews were about.   We were walking around the food court and I was hankering for some seafood. A lobster place with bad reviews was kind of a dicey choice. But then I took a chance and loved the spice in the Cajun roll. A pretty decent amount of lobster meat and lots of flavor. However, it will only serve as a snack and not an entree. So if you are looking for dinner, skip the place

Ok so I figure I better catch up on my reviews since I was on vacation going back and forth from Frisco to Vegas (home).   LM is the only thing on my brain when I am over at Miracle Miles shops area at Planet Hollywood.   Mmmm yum yes! Lobster Roll me up baby!  This is the location I frequent the most here in Las Vegas, ok so I was out with a group for dinner and a show, there were five of us at the time. The Staff had no issues getting our big ass order together. (Dan was super cool and patient with us)  We ordered a lot, no holds barred this night.  Lobster Roll Fish and Chips Lobster mac and cheese Lobster grilled cheese sandwich something, it was Amazing!!!  Chowder bread bowl Big basket of crunchy fried chips/fries Slaw   This visit was crazy but fun, I wish I could eat here every day but I know is not practical. I don't think I could ever get tired of their menu seriously.  I highly encourage ordering my three favorite items, lobster mac and cheese, fish and chips and lobster roll/sandwich.  In my opinion the prices are standard, I mean you get what you pay for, I think the quality is high and worth what you get. This is a specialty meal menu, you can't find Maine style lobster rolls or lobster mac and cheese on every corner.

Such a hidden gem! The last bite was mostly all bread for me, other than the uneven spreading out of the lobster through out the bun.. It was delicious! And worth the $. There's also a deal to make it a meal (fries and a drink) for $4 more.. It was yummy

Ok so I figure I better catch up on my reviews since I was on vacation going back and forth from Frisco to Vegas (home).   LM is the only thing on my brain when I am over at Miracle Mile shops area at Planet Hollywood.   Mmmm yum yes! Lobster Roll me up baby!  This is the location I frequent the most here in Las Vegas, ok so I was out with a group for dinner and a show, there were five of us at the time. The Staff had no issues getting our big ass order together. (Dan was super cool and patient with us)  We ordered a lot, no holds barred this night.  Lobster Roll Fish and Chips Lobster mac and cheese Lobster grilled cheese sandwich something, it was Amazing!!!  Chowder bread bowl Big basket of crunchy fried chips/fries Slaw   This visit was crazy but fun, I wish I could eat here every day but I know is not practical. I don't think I could ever get tired of their menu seriously.  I highly encourage ordering my three favorite items, lobster mac and cheese, fish and chips and lobster roll/sandwich.  In my opinion the prices are standard, I mean you get what you pay for, I think the quality is high and worth what you get. This is a specialty meal menu, you can't find Maine style lobster rolls or lobster mac and cheese on every corner.

I walked past this place on my way to dinner and thought, I could sure use a lobster snack later instead of ordering room service when I got back from a night out in "Vegas baby." I ordered the cajun lobster roll and carried it around after dinner for about an hour or so until I placed it in my fridge and then went out. When I cam back and broke that high-end munchie open... threw the roll in the microwave for a few seconds and put all the ingredients together as instructed. Yes, I had my roll deconstructed so as not to ruin the late night snack attack experience. It was perfectly spiced and the lobster was meaty as well as a really good amount for the price. I would make the journey back when in Vegas without question.

Always gotta get a roll or two here when in Vegas.  It was delicious and scrumptious!  I like the new twist they have with different styles.  I ordered the Siraracha lobster roll while my husband ordered the classic New England roll.  Fries were good too.  Didn't care much for the slaw.

Very solid lobster roll.  Prices are reasonable, at $17 for a lobster roll with a couple chips.  The service was great, friendly staff and they deliver the food to you despite the food court setup.  Might have liked to try the Lobster Mac & Cheese, but only had one dish to get.  I suppose my only comment would be that they claim that there is a pound of lobster per roll, which seemed like a stretch.  All-in-all good stuff being served at Lobster ME though.
We tried the lobster roll and chowder fries.  Chowder fries were really good- never had that combo before and I was pleasantly surprised.

I didn't really know how to rate this place. So let me give it a shot!!!!!  Pros - The food was real good  Cons - The wait was crazy long. There wasn't anyone in front of me and it took way too long. I feel like the price was too high.   Done!!!!!
Oh my God.  The best lobster roll ever very delicious very fresh I will definitely try this again. Two thumbs up for lobster me in Las Vegas

Very close to 5 stars, but only been here once. I do enjoy some lobstah, and was eager to taste the delicacy in their lobster mac n cheese meal. It was yummy and had plenty of lobstah. There was even a kick to it, which was an awesome bonus. It's a pretty filling portion, and our party of 4 was very happy that we tried this place.  Seating is limited, but the nearby food court has lots of additional seating, we just ordered to go and hoofed it a short distance to a table at the food court.

This review might be a little unfair because I just had a fantastic lobster roll from the foodie fest event  that just rolled up here in Vegas from the Lobster Lady truck. But here it goes. LobsterMe's lobster roll was embarrassing bad. First it hardly had any lobster. I did only order the large but  the bread to meat ratio was about 3 parts bread 1 part meat, I would say less then 3 ounces of meat.  The roll was very dry, hard and a bit stale.  The menu did look pretty interesting and I was planning on going back and trying some other items,  but I don't think I'll be going back. Honestly I felt like i was ripped off.

What can I say? The 50/50 Dawg and the Lobster Roll we're busting with great flavor. The amount of the lobster meat was pretty good. There were chunks of lobster claw meat in our roll. The Texas roll was tender and buttery. The price is slight higher, but it's lobster! A great place to go to if you're craving for a lobster roll here in Vegas.

I wouldn't call this the best lobster roll I've ever had, but a) we're in Vegas, and b) we're in a damn food court!  So I would call this the best (and only) lobster roll I've ever had in a food court. We had the Connecticut and the Cajun lobster rolls.  My beef with lobster rolls (pardon the pun) across the board is one just isn't enough! They do pack a solid amount of lobster into these rolls. Lobster quality itself was good, but not melt in your mouth exquisite.   That being said, next time I'm in Vegas and craving a lobster roll, I'm all over it.

Came here for a late night snack.   Food was good, we substituted for clam chowder instead of fries. We order the lobster grilled cheese.   It was really good, with large chunks of lobster in every bite. The clam chowder was the best, every scoop has clams in it and just the right consistency.   It is a fast food experience. Would come back to try more items.

What happened to this place???? OMG what a waste of lunch and petro considering I drove ALL the way from Henderson. Wow I'm very disappointed.  I've eaten here several times and I rant and rave about the place but now I'm stuck with my foot in my mouth. Starting with this soft and soggy grilled cheese that smells like gross ocean, and tastes like a "old tuna sandwich" you better not unless you want to be sick. How could you treat your local resi like this.. :(  I kind of felt like I was sold the left overs!  The mac and cheese was horrific! Watery, no cheese, "fishy smelling" lobster. I was in shock that I was given this CRAP! The macaroni shells and cheese is different. Also there use to be a breaded crust like topping Lobster roll also had fishy smelling meat on it. In case anyone was wondering, sea food should NOT smell fishy! Weird, yes, but very true. Shame, Shame, SHAME Lobster me NOT! "LUCY, Some body got some splaning to do!"  Entire staff is starving now....   2 Stars because one should mean, "please, throw the whole business away!"  Never returning...

Okay, so first off I want to mention how much I enjoyed my Connecticut style lobster roll. It was nicely buttered on a toasted roll :) In my opinion, I enjoy the warm lobster rolls as opposed to the cold, Maine style ones.   Anyways, it was really good. I had it for my breakfast actually and the place got packed in less than half an hour after we left.   Definitely would come back for another bite.  One downside to this delicious roll is that it is a bit small for the price.

So I've been reading about this place and have wanted to try it next time I was going to be in Vegas. Finally got the opportunity to try the Lobster Roll and the Lobsicle. The flavor was delicious but the price tag was not. I totally believe in trying something once as long as it won't break you too much in the wallet. Now that I've experienced Lobster Me, I won't be trying it again. Maybe I'll go to the Outback Restaurant and get Steak and Lobster for less for my Lobster fix.
It's ok. The tables they have are awful but the food is decent avoid the $8 "garden salad" aka small $1 house salad. Lobster grilled cheese was tasty.

Looked delicious from the menu. Ordered a Connecticutt lobster roll combo and Lobster Mac and Cheese.  Lobster roll really was as delicious as it looked. Unfortunately they don't tell you they're bite sized- 2 bites actually. Mac and cheese tasted like it was from a dollar store box with lobster crumbs sprinkled in. They forgot the fries with my combo so I had to remind them. Heads up: check your order. Next time I'll stick to the rolls...but I'll eat somewhere else first.

Lobster rolls in Vegas, who would've thunk it?!?  I have actually been to this place 2x (I know 1 review for 2 visits = yelp suicide) but sorry it's been lost in my que for a while now..  I digress...  This place is one of the better quick dining options in the Miracle Mile. I hate to call this place fast food but it does Flt the category for a quick lunch.  I have done both the original an Cajun rolls here. My personal favorite is the Cajun. It is just the right amount of spice yin to the sweet lobster meats yang! The original is your basic lobster roll: chilled lobster meat tossed in secret sauce.   There is a third version on the menu that i am too much of a coward try; it goes by the name of diablo. Call me silly but I want to enjoy the lobster roll and not have it blowtorch my tongue while I'm eating it.   Lobster rolls are one of my favorite sandwiches but there are not many places in town that do them. So being that said I get my fix here..

At first, the service seemed slow and inefficient. Our drinks didn't even show up on the bartender's computer, so he couldn't make them. The packets of tartar sauce are impossible to get into even without butter all over my fingers. But the manager, Malcolm, saved the day. He's the best part of the joint and made things right.  At $17 a pop for entree and $9 per drink, I'd expect a some decent fresh tartar sauce and full paper cups of cole slaw. Skip the fish and chips, lobster and chips, and the fries. Try the lobsicle, el diablo roll, and lobster grilled cheese.

Extremely impressed with Lobster ME at the Shoppes in the Venetian!  Order at the counter, take a number and wait - great menu with fresh lobster, crab and other options.  The lobster mex salad is a large portion with fresh avocado and toppings and a heaping pile of lobster salad! The lobster salad is perfectly mixed - not too much mayo and fantastic seasoning.  The lobster crab roll is great, stuffed full of meat on a toasted roll. Definitely a good portion for a lobster roll with lots of crispy fries on the side.  The fried lobster Mac and cheese balls are unbelievable!! 3 large balls of lobster meat and creamy Mac and cheese with an amazing cheesy sauce on the side. Totally worth it.  Many sandwiches and roll choices, lots of sides and other options as well.  Prices are to be expected in Vegas, but in comparison to order at the counter in the area, this is a bit pricey - while you typically wouldn't choose lobster in Vegas, if you're having a craving, I highly recommend Lobster ME - I'm from Mass and was not disappointed!!

My new favorite middle-of-the-night craving (which is unfortunate considering I reside in L.A. and have no such place near me at any time of the day)!  Lobster roll, lobster bisque, shrimp tacos, shrimp salad... All delicious! Last time I was in Vegas I made one A.M. visits two days in a row... The greatest drunken sustenance EVER!   Only thing was the place wasn't incredibly clean but I'll chalk that up to being in the middle of the mall and at the whim of random passerbyers.  Also, the famed lobster roll was served  chilled.  Tasted slightly odd to me because of this, but I guess I'm no lobster roll connosieur...

Crazy fat sandwich stuffed with lobster.  I was drinking at the time so this review could be slightly off.  Also I am not a huge fan of lobster but the people I was with were cause I left for 3 minutes and 80% of my sandwich was gone!    $20+ for the sandwich so worth a try but since I am not a huge lobster fan, I doubt I will go back.  So many great places to eat in Vegas.

I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised. I'be never been a huge fan of lobster, but I thought what the heck? What not? My bf and I shared a large original Maine lobster sandwich. I think the size has to do with the the about of lobster, because the bun was small, but lobster was overflowing! It was a super delish sandwich. We also got a side of their Cajun garlic fries. They were a little spicy for me, but still good. Refills on soda until 11pm. The whole meal cost is 30 bucks. That seems to be the average for food here.

I'm used to getting their chowder fries but I'm convinced that I have to get the lobster cheese fries next time. I can easily eat everything on the menu but it's all about control I want to like this place still, so in order to do so, I just gotta limit myself. I really enjoy the chowder fries though, I did have the grilled cheese and that was yummy too. Texture and flavor for both is on point!

Decided to go to Lobster ME for a nice lobster roll lunch today. I've been here before but I don't have much memory of it, probably because I was hung over from a crazy bachelorette party last time I was here haha. Anyway, today, I ordered the Maine lobster roll cajun style (which is basically just adding aioli sauce and scallions for free) on top of your choice of butter and chives or mayo and celery -- I went with mayo and celery plus cajun style. Then it comes with coleslaw and waffle fries but I had the option of adding $2 to make my fries crab loaded or some other options... sure, why not load my fries?  Food came, lobster roll looked great. Huge chunks of lobster. I was excited! But once I took a bite, I was letdown immediately. Not much flavor to the lobster at all. It didn't taste like fresh seafood. And I could barely taste the mayo, and not even the aioli sauce. What gives?? Plus the thickness of the bread roll really takes away from the bites of lobster I put in my mouth. Then the crab loaded fries were so blah. The waffle fries were a bit too hard like they had been sitting out for a little while and it wasn't hot. Again, the crab didn't taste fresh either. I would pass on upgrading my regular fries next time. And onto the coleslaw, omg, worst coleslaw I have ever had. Had NO taste to it whatsoever. I felt like I was chewing grass... err.. I mean, cabbage. Ugh...   Anyway, that was my experience today. All in all, a little below average. If the lobsters are shipped from Maine, I can see why it doesn't taste fresh since it is most likely frozen. I would come here for a quick fix. But really, it doesn't hit the spot at all. Plus not to mention, they increased the price to $24 a roll now which is even more pricey than before. But hey, what can you do? It's Vegas, you're probably hung over,  hungry, and spending lots anyway. So spend, spend, spend away!
DISCLAIMER: REVIEW FOR LOBSICLE  -bomb -$14 -lobster on a stick -large -juicy -side of lemon -side of melted butter (mmm!) -fried in light tasty batter -try it

I had always wanted to try their lobster Mac and cheese and I really loved it. The lobster tails were melting in my mouth. The only reason I give this business 4 stars is because I think it's a little bit overpriced and it took them too long to prepare my dish. Everything else is perfect. I will come back!!
I ordered the classic lobster roll meal and it was delicious!   You can get it with soup, chowder or fries. I got mine with fries and the fries were good too!

So I was Super Excited to see Lobster Me in the Venetian.  It was easy and quick.  I look for lobster rolls wherever I go and I try them all.  We ordered 2 different rolls (they had 5). The 2 rolls were excellent but extremely similar. Fries didn't come w the rolls just a few chips and slaw, which wasn't good.  Price was a bit expensive and wasn't a combo.  18.00 up charge for fries and slaw, which was so tiny I had to send back for a little more and it wasn't even worth it.   However , service was good.

Nothing special considering this place's specialty is lobster.  I got the connecticut lobster roll ($17) since it's the only "warm" one while the other ones include chilled lobster. I also got the lobster grilled cheese. They were both pricey for the sizes but the lobster grilled cheese was actually worth $11 bucks. It was super flavorful and they packed it with all kinds of goodies. It was okay that there wasn't too much lobster inside because the grilled cheese as a whole was good. The lobster roll, meanwhile, was too bready and the lobster was meager.   The lobster bisque was pretty good but I wouldn't order it for a whole serving-it gets pretty fishy while there aren't much lobster chunks-so where does the taste come from?

I had the Connecticut Lobster Roll with Lobster Bisque, and my wife had the Prince of Wales Lobster Melt with Lobster Bisque, as well. I loved the big chunks of buttery lobster, and the melt was very flavorful. The bread on both the roll and melt tasted good too. We added a touch of Sriracha to our lobster bisque, and it was excellent! The staff was also really friendly and really took time to engage customers with small chat and provided drink refills. It was a really nice and relaxing time from shopping for us.

If you're a lobster lover do yourself a favor and get the maine lobster roll. OMG, to die for. It comes with their house made chips which are also good. I'd go back and get this again and again. It's that damn good!

I wish that the seating here was a little different but it was a food court so keep that in mind. I ordered the lobster Mac which was decent and my fiancé ordered a lobster roll with fries. He says the lobster roll was very well made and the fries could've been cooked a little longer. All in all for a quick bite, this place is okay. Prices are a little high.

Great hang over food and also good for a quick bite to keep you hanging until you're ready to go out to the big Vegas style restaurants at night! The food is great and the service was also good! The servers helped me choose some great options! I understand it is Vegas and everything is expensive but compared to the size of my sandwich, I think the prices are too high! My only suggestion would be to make the entrees a tad bit bigger if they want to continue charging as much as they do.
